00336:   ETYMOLOGY.
00337: 
00338: 
00339:   (Supplied by a Late Consumptive Usher to a Grammar School.)
00340: 
00341:   The pale Usher—threadbare in coat, heart, body, and brain; I see him
00342:   now. He was ever dusting his old lexicons and grammars, with a queer
00343:   handkerchief, mockingly embellished with all the gay flags of all the
00344:   known nations of the world. He loved to dust his old grammars; it
00345:   somehow mildly reminded him of his mortality.
00346: 
00347:   “While you take in hand to school others, and to teach them by what
00348:   name a whale-fish is to be called in our tongue, leaving out, through
00349:   ignorance, the letter H, which almost alone maketh up the
00350:   signification of the word, you deliver that which is not true.”
00351:   —_Hackluyt._
00352: 
00353:   “WHALE. * * * Sw. and Dan. _hval_. This animal is named from
00354:   roundness or rolling; for in Dan. _hvalt_ is arched or vaulted.”
00355:   —_Webster’s Dictionary._
00356: 
00357:   “WHALE. * * * It is more immediately from the Dut. and Ger. _Wallen_;
00358:   A.S. _Walw-ian_, to roll, to wallow.” —_Richardson’s Dictionary._
00359: 
00360: 
00361:   חו,                 _Hebrew_.
00362:   ϰητος,              _Greek_.
00363:   CETUS,              _Latin_.
00364:   WHŒL,               _Anglo-Saxon_.
00365:   HVALT,              _Danish_.
00366:   WAL,                _Dutch_.
00367:   HWAL,               _Swedish_.
00368:   WHALE,              _Icelandic_.
00369:   WHALE,              _English_.
00370:   BALLENA,            _Spanish_.
00371:   PEKEE-NUEE-NUEE,    _Fegee_.
00372:   PEHEE-NUEE-NUEE,    _Erromangoan_.

00374: 
00375: 
00376:   EXTRACTS. (Supplied by a Sub-Sub-Librarian).
00377: 
00378: 
00379: 
00380:   It will be seen that this mere painstaking burrower and grub-worm of
00381:   a poor devil of a Sub-Sub appears to have gone through the long
00382:   Vaticans and street-stalls of the earth, picking up whatever random
00383:   allusions to whales he could anyways find in any book whatsoever,
00384:   sacred or profane. Therefore you must not, in every case at least,
00385:   take the higgledy-piggledy whale statements, however authentic, in
00386:   these extracts, for veritable gospel cetology. Far from it. As
00387:   touching the ancient authors generally, as well as the poets here
00388:   appearing, these extracts are solely valuable or entertaining, as
00389:   affording a glancing bird’s eye view of what has been promiscuously
00390:   said, thought, fancied, and sung of Leviathan, by many nations and
00391:   generations, including our own.
00392: 
00393:   So fare thee well, poor devil of a Sub-Sub, whose commentator I am.
00394:   Thou belongest to that hopeless, sallow tribe which no wine of this
00395:   world will ever warm; and for whom even Pale Sherry would be too
00396:   rosy-strong; but with whom one sometimes loves to sit, and feel
00397:   poor-devilish, too; and grow convivial upon tears; and say to them
00398:   bluntly, with full eyes and empty glasses, and in not altogether
00399:   unpleasant sadness—Give it up, Sub-Subs! For by how much the more
00400:   pains ye take to please the world, by so much the more shall ye for
00401:   ever go thankless! Would that I could clear out Hampton Court and the
00402:   Tuileries for ye! But gulp down your tears and hie aloft to the
00403:   royal-mast with your hearts; for your friends who have gone before
00404:   are clearing out the seven-storied heavens, and making refugees of
00405:   long-pampered Gabriel, Michael, and Raphael, against your coming.
00406:   Here ye strike but splintered hearts together—there, ye shall strike
00407:   unsplinterable glasses!
00408: 
00409: EXTRACTS.
00410: 
00411:   “And God created great whales.” —_Genesis_.
00412: 
00413:   “Leviathan maketh a path to shine after him; One would think the deep
00414:   to be hoary.” —_Job_.
00415: 
00416:   “Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah.”
00417:   —_Jonah_.
00418: 
00419:   “There go the ships; there is that Leviathan whom thou hast made to
00420:   play therein.” —_Psalms_.
00421: 
00422:   “In that day, the Lord with his sore, and great, and strong sword,
00423:   shall punish Leviathan the piercing serpent, even Leviathan that
00424:   crooked serpent; and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.”
00425:   —_Isaiah_.
00426: 
00427:   “And what thing soever besides cometh within the chaos of this
00428:   monster’s mouth, be it beast, boat, or stone, down it goes all
00429:   incontinently that foul great swallow of his, and perisheth in the
00430:   bottomless gulf of his paunch.” —_Holland’s Plutarch’s Morals_.
00431: 
00432:   “The Indian Sea breedeth the most and the biggest fishes that are:
00433:   among which the Whales and Whirlpooles called Balaene, take up as
00434:   much in length as four acres or arpens of land.” —_Holland’s Pliny_.
00435: 
00436:   “Scarcely had we proceeded two days on the sea, when about sunrise a
00437:   great many Whales and other monsters of the sea, appeared. Among the
00438:   former, one was of a most monstrous size.... This came towards us,
00439:   open-mouthed, raising the waves on all sides, and beating the sea
00440:   before him into a foam.” —_Tooke’s Lucian_. “_The True History_.”
00441: 
00442: 
00443: 
00444: 
00445:   “He visited this country also with a view of catching horse-whales,
00446:   which had bones of very great value for their teeth, of which he
00447:   brought some to the king.... The best whales were catched in his own
00448:   country, of which some were forty-eight, some fifty yards long. He
00449:   said that he was one of six who had killed sixty in two days.”
00450:   —_Other or Other’s verbal narrative taken down from his mouth by King
00451:   Alfred, A.D._ 890.
00452: 
00453:   “And whereas all the other things, whether beast or vessel, that
00454:   enter into the dreadful gulf of this monster’s (whale’s) mouth, are
00455:   immediately lost and swallowed up, the sea-gudgeon retires into it in
00456:   great security, and there sleeps.” —MONTAIGNE. —_Apology for Raimond
00457:   Sebond_.
00458: 
00459:   “Let us fly, let us fly! Old Nick take me if it is not Leviathan
00460:   described by the noble prophet Moses in the life of patient Job.”
00461:   —_Rabelais_.
00462: 
00463:   “This whale’s liver was two cartloads.” —_Stowe’s Annals_.
00464: 
00465:   “The great Leviathan that maketh the seas to seethe like boiling
00466:   pan.” —_Lord Bacon’s Version of the Psalms_.
00467: 
00468:   “Touching that monstrous bulk of the whale or ork we have received
00469:   nothing certain. They grow exceeding fat, insomuch that an incredible
00470:   quantity of oil will be extracted out of one whale.” —_Ibid_.
00471:   “_History of Life and Death_.”
00472: 
00473: 
00474: 
00475: 
00476:   “The sovereignest thing on earth is parmacetti for an inward bruise.”
00477:   —_King Henry_.
00478: 
00479:   “Very like a whale.” —_Hamlet_.
00480: 
00481: 
00482:   “Which to secure, no skill of leach’s art Mote him availle, but to
00483:   returne againe To his wound’s worker, that with lowly dart, Dinting
00484:   his breast, had bred his restless paine, Like as the wounded whale to
00485:   shore flies thro’ the maine.” —_The Fairie Queen_.
00486: 
00487: 
00488: 
00489:   “Immense as whales, the motion of whose vast bodies can in a peaceful
00490:   calm trouble the ocean till it boil.” —_Sir William Davenant. Preface
00491:   to Gondibert_.
00492: 
00493:   “What spermacetti is, men might justly doubt, since the learned
00494:   Hosmannus in his work of thirty years, saith plainly, _Nescio quid
00495:   sit_.” —_Sir T. Browne. Of Sperma Ceti and the Sperma Ceti Whale.
00496:   Vide his V. E._
00497: 
00498: 
00499:   “Like Spencer’s Talus with his modern flail He threatens ruin with
00500:   his ponderous tail. ... Their fixed jav’lins in his side he wears,
00501:   And on his back a grove of pikes appears.” —_Waller’s Battle of the
00502:   Summer Islands_.
00503: 
00504: 
00505: 
00506:   “By art is created that great Leviathan, called a Commonwealth or
00507:   State—(in Latin, Civitas) which is but an artificial man.” —_Opening
00508:   sentence of Hobbes’s Leviathan_.
00509: 
00510:   “Silly Mansoul swallowed it without chewing, as if it had been a
00511:   sprat in the mouth of a whale.” —_Pilgrim’s Progress_.
00512: 
00513: 
00514:   “That sea beast Leviathan, which God of all his works Created hugest
00515:   that swim the ocean stream.” —_Paradise Lost_.
00516: 
00517:   —“There Leviathan, Hugest of living creatures, in the deep Stretched
00518:   like a promontory sleeps or swims, And seems a moving land; and at
00519:   his gills Draws in, and at his breath spouts out a sea.” —_Ibid_.
00520: 
00521: 
00522: 
00523:   “The mighty whales which swim in a sea of water, and have a sea of
00524:   oil swimming in them.” —_Fuller’s Profane and Holy State_.
00525: 
00526: 
00527:   “So close behind some promontory lie The huge Leviathan to attend
00528:   their prey, And give no chance, but swallow in the fry, Which through
00529:   their gaping jaws mistake the way.” —_Dryden’s Annus Mirabilis_.
00530: 
00531: 
00532: 
00533:   “While the whale is floating at the stern of the ship, they cut off
00534:   his head, and tow it with a boat as near the shore as it will come;
00535:   but it will be aground in twelve or thirteen feet water.” —_Thomas
00536:   Edge’s Ten Voyages to Spitzbergen, in Purchas_.
00537: 
00538:   “In their way they saw many whales sporting in the ocean, and in
00539:   wantonness fuzzing up the water through their pipes and vents, which
00540:   nature has placed on their shoulders.” —_Sir T. Herbert’s Voyages
00541:   into Asia and Africa. Harris Coll_.
00542: 
00543:   “Here they saw such huge troops of whales, that they were forced to
00544:   proceed with a great deal of caution for fear they should run their
00545:   ship upon them.” —_Schouten’s Sixth Circumnavigation_.
00546: 
00547:   “We set sail from the Elbe, wind N.E. in the ship called The
00548:   Jonas-in-the-Whale.... Some say the whale can’t open his mouth, but
00549:   that is a fable.... They frequently climb up the masts to see whether
00550:   they can see a whale, for the first discoverer has a ducat for his
00551:   pains.... I was told of a whale taken near Shetland, that had above a
00552:   barrel of herrings in his belly.... One of our harpooneers told me
00553:   that he caught once a whale in Spitzbergen that was white all over.”
00554:   —_A Voyage to Greenland, A.D._ 1671. _Harris Coll_.
00555: 
00556:   “Several whales have come in upon this coast (Fife) Anno 1652, one
00557:   eighty feet in length of the whale-bone kind came in, which (as I was
00558:   informed), besides a vast quantity of oil, did afford 500 weight of
00559:   baleen. The jaws of it stand for a gate in the garden of Pitferren.”
00560:   —_Sibbald’s Fife and Kinross_.
00561: 
00562:   “Myself have agreed to try whether I can master and kill this
00563:   Sperma-ceti whale, for I could never hear of any of that sort that
00564:   was killed by any man, such is his fierceness and swiftness.”
00565:   —_Richard Strafford’s Letter from the Bermudas. Phil. Trans. A.D._
00566:   1668.
00567: 
00568:   “Whales in the sea God’s voice obey.” —_N. E. Primer_.
00569: 
00570:   “We saw also abundance of large whales, there being more in those
00571:   southern seas, as I may say, by a hundred to one; than we have to the
00572:   northward of us.” —_Captain Cowley’s Voyage round the Globe, A.D._
00573:   1729.
00574: 
00575:   “... and the breath of the whale is frequently attended with such an
00576:   insupportable smell, as to bring on a disorder of the brain.”
00577:   —_Ulloa’s South America_.
00578: 
00579: 
00580:   “To fifty chosen sylphs of special note, We trust the important
00581:   charge, the petticoat. Oft have we known that seven-fold fence to
00582:   fail, Tho’ stuffed with hoops and armed with ribs of whale.” —_Rape
00583:   of the Lock_.
00584: 
00585: 
00586: 
00587:   “If we compare land animals in respect to magnitude, with those that
00588:   take up their abode in the deep, we shall find they will appear
00589:   contemptible in the comparison. The whale is doubtless the largest
00590:   animal in creation.” —_Goldsmith, Nat. Hist_.
00591: 
00592:   “If you should write a fable for little fishes, you would make them
00593:   speak like great whales.” —_Goldsmith to Johnson_.
00594: 
00595:   “In the afternoon we saw what was supposed to be a rock, but it was
00596:   found to be a dead whale, which some Asiatics had killed, and were
00597:   then towing ashore. They seemed to endeavor to conceal themselves
00598:   behind the whale, in order to avoid being seen by us.” —_Cook’s
00599:   Voyages_.
00600: 
00601:   “The larger whales, they seldom venture to attack. They stand in so
00602:   great dread of some of them, that when out at sea they are afraid to
00603:   mention even their names, and carry dung, lime-stone, juniper-wood,
00604:   and some other articles of the same nature in their boats, in order
00605:   to terrify and prevent their too near approach.” —_Uno Von Troil’s
00606:   Letters on Banks’s and Solander’s Voyage to Iceland in_ 1772.
00607: 
00608:   “The Spermacetti Whale found by the Nantuckois, is an active, fierce
00609:   animal, and requires vast address and boldness in the fishermen.”
00610:   —_Thomas Jefferson’s Whale Memorial to the French minister in_ 1778.
00611: 
00612:   “And pray, sir, what in the world is equal to it?” —_Edmund Burke’s
00613:   reference in Parliament to the Nantucket Whale-Fishery_.
00614: 
00615:   “Spain—a great whale stranded on the shores of Europe.” —_Edmund
00616:   Burke_. (_somewhere_.)
00617: 
00618:   “A tenth branch of the king’s ordinary revenue, said to be grounded
00619:   on the consideration of his guarding and protecting the seas from

00744:   ahoy! Do you see that whale now?” “Ay ay, sir!  A shoal of Sperm
00745:   Whales! There she blows!  There she breaches!” “Sing out! sing out

00839: 
00840: 
00841: 
00842: 
00843: 
00844: CHAPTER 1. Loomings.
00845: 
00846: Call me Ishmael. Some years ago—never mind how long precisely—having
00847: little or no money in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me
00848: on shore, I thought I would sail about a little and see the watery part
00849: of the world. It is a way I have of driving off the spleen and
00850: regulating the circulation. Whenever I find myself growing grim about
00851: the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul; whenever
00852: I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses, and
00853: bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever
00854: my hypos get such an upper hand of me, that it requires a strong moral
00855: principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street, and
00856: methodically knocking people’s hats off—then, I account it high time to
00857: get to sea as soon as I can. This is my substitute for pistol and ball.
00858: With a philosophical flourish Cato throws himself upon his sword; I
00859: quietly take to the ship. There is nothing surprising in this. If they
00860: but knew it, almost all men in their degree, some time or other,
00861: cherish very nearly the same feelings towards the ocean with me.
00862: 
00863: There now is your insular city of the Manhattoes, belted round by
00864: wharves as Indian isles by coral reefs—commerce surrounds it with her
00865: surf. Right and left, the streets take you waterward. Its extreme
00866: downtown is the battery, where that noble mole is washed by waves, and
00867: cooled by breezes, which a few hours previous were out of sight of
00868: land. Look at the crowds of water-gazers there.
00869: 
00870: Circumambulate the city of a dreamy Sabbath afternoon. Go from Corlears
00871: Hook to Coenties Slip, and from thence, by Whitehall, northward. What
00872: do you see?—Posted like silent sentinels all around the town, stand
00873: thousands upon thousands of mortal men fixed in ocean reveries. Some
00874: leaning against the spiles; some seated upon the pier-heads; some
00875: looking over the bulwarks of ships from China; some high aloft in the
00876: rigging, as if striving to get a still better seaward peep. But these
00877: are all landsmen; of week days pent up in lath and plaster—tied to
00878: counters, nailed to benches, clinched to desks. How then is this? Are
00879: the green fields gone? What do they here?
00880: 
00881: But look! here come more crowds, pacing straight for the water, and
00882: seemingly bound for a dive. Strange! Nothing will content them but the
00883: extremest limit of the land; loitering under the shady lee of yonder
00884: warehouses will not suffice. No. They must get just as nigh the water
00885: as they possibly can without falling in. And there they stand—miles of
00886: them—leagues. Inlanders all, they come from lanes and alleys, streets
00887: and avenues—north, east, south, and west. Yet here they all unite. Tell
00888: me, does the magnetic virtue of the needles of the compasses of all
00889: those ships attract them thither?
00890: 
00891: Once more. Say you are in the country; in some high land of lakes. Take
00892: almost any path you please, and ten to one it carries you down in a
00893: dale, and leaves you there by a pool in the stream. There is magic in
00894: it. Let the most absent-minded of men be plunged in his deepest
00895: reveries—stand that man on his legs, set his feet a-going, and he will
00896: infallibly lead you to water, if water there be in all that region.
00897: Should you ever be athirst in the great American desert, try this
00898: experiment, if your caravan happen to be supplied with a metaphysical
00899: professor. Yes, as every one knows, meditation and water are wedded for
00900: ever.
00901: 
00902: But here is an artist. He desires to paint you the dreamiest, shadiest,
00903: quietest, most enchanting bit of romantic landscape in all the valley
00904: of the Saco. What is the chief element he employs? There stand his
00905: trees, each with a hollow trunk, as if a hermit and a crucifix were
00906: within; and here sleeps his meadow, and there sleep his cattle; and up
00907: from yonder cottage goes a sleepy smoke. Deep into distant woodlands
00908: winds a mazy way, reaching to overlapping spurs of mountains bathed in
00909: their hill-side blue. But though the picture lies thus tranced, and
00910: though this pine-tree shakes down its sighs like leaves upon this
00911: shepherd’s head, yet all were vain, unless the shepherd’s eye were
00912: fixed upon the magic stream before him. Go visit the Prairies in June,
00913: when for scores on scores of miles you wade knee-deep among
00914: Tiger-lilies—what is the one charm wanting?—Water—there is not a drop
00915: of water there! Were Niagara but a cataract of sand, would you travel
00916: your thousand miles to see it? Why did the poor poet of Tennessee, upon
00917: suddenly receiving two handfuls of silver, deliberate whether to buy
00918: him a coat, which he sadly needed, or invest his money in a pedestrian
00919: trip to Rockaway Beach? Why is almost every robust healthy boy with a
00920: robust healthy soul in him, at some time or other crazy to go to sea?
00921: Why upon your first voyage as a passenger, did you yourself feel such a
00922: mystical vibration, when first told that you and your ship were now out
00923: of sight of land? Why did the old Persians hold the sea holy? Why did
00924: the Greeks give it a separate deity, and own brother of Jove? Surely
00925: all this is not without meaning. And still deeper the meaning of that
00926: story of Narcissus, who because he could not grasp the tormenting, mild
00927: image he saw in the fountain, plunged into it and was drowned. But that
00928: same image, we ourselves see in all rivers and oceans. It is the image
00929: of the ungraspable phantom of life; and this is the key to it all.
00930: 
00931: Now, when I say that I am in the habit of going to sea whenever I begin
00932: to grow hazy about the eyes, and begin to be over conscious of my
00933: lungs, I do not mean to have it inferred that I ever go to sea as a
00934: passenger. For to go as a passenger you must needs have a purse, and a
00935: purse is but a rag unless you have something in it. Besides, passengers
00936: get sea-sick—grow quarrelsome—don’t sleep of nights—do not enjoy
00937: themselves much, as a general thing;—no, I never go as a passenger;
00938: nor, though I am something of a salt, do I ever go to sea as a
00939: Commodore, or a Captain, or a Cook. I abandon the glory and distinction
00940: of such offices to those who like them. For my part, I abominate all
00941: honorable respectable toils, trials, and tribulations of every kind
00942: whatsoever. It is quite as much as I can do to take care of myself,
00943: without taking care of ships, barques, brigs, schooners, and what not.
00944: And as for going as cook,—though I confess there is considerable glory
00945: in that, a cook being a sort of officer on ship-board—yet, somehow, I
00946: never fancied broiling fowls;—though once broiled, judiciously
00947: buttered, and judgmatically salted and peppered, there is no one who
00948: will speak more respectfully, not to say reverentially, of a broiled
00949: fowl than I will. It is out of the idolatrous dotings of the old
00950: Egyptians upon broiled ibis and roasted river horse, that you see the
00951: mummies of those creatures in their huge bake-houses the pyramids.
00952: 
00953: No, when I go to sea, I go as a simple sailor, right before the mast,
00954: plumb down into the forecastle, aloft there to the royal mast-head.
00955: True, they rather order me about some, and make me jump from spar to
00956: spar, like a grasshopper in a May meadow. And at first, this sort of
00957: thing is unpleasant enough. It touches one’s sense of honor,
00958: particularly if you come of an old established family in the land, the
00959: Van Rensselaers, or Randolphs, or Hardicanutes. And more than all, if
00960: just previous to putting your hand into the tar-pot, you have been
00961: lording it as a country schoolmaster, making the tallest boys stand in
00962: awe of you. The transition is a keen one, I assure you, from a
00963: schoolmaster to a sailor, and requires a strong decoction of Seneca and
00964: the Stoics to enable you to grin and bear it. But even this wears off
00965: in time.
00966: 
00967: What of it, if some old hunks of a sea-captain orders me to get a broom
00968: and sweep down the decks? What does that indignity amount to, weighed,
00969: I mean, in the scales of the New Testament? Do you think the archangel
00970: Gabriel thinks anything the less of me, because I promptly and
00971: respectfully obey that old hunks in that particular instance? Who ain’t
00972: a slave? Tell me that. Well, then, however the old sea-captains may
00973: order me about—however they may thump and punch me about, I have the
00974: satisfaction of knowing that it is all right; that everybody else is
00975: one way or other served in much the same way—either in a physical or
00976: metaphysical point of view, that is; and so the universal thump is
00977: passed round, and all hands should rub each other’s shoulder-blades,
00978: and be content.
00979: 
00980: Again, I always go to sea as a sailor, because they make a point of
00981: paying me for my trouble, whereas they never pay passengers a single
00982: penny that I ever heard of. On the contrary, passengers themselves must
00983: pay. And there is all the difference in the world between paying and
00984: being paid. The act of paying is perhaps the most uncomfortable
00985: infliction that the two orchard thieves entailed upon us. But _being
00986: paid_,—what will compare with it? The urbane activity with which a man
00987: receives money is really marvellous, considering that we so earnestly
00988: believe money to be the root of all earthly ills, and that on no
00989: account can a monied man enter heaven. Ah! how cheerfully we consign
00990: ourselves to perdition!
00991: 
00992: Finally, I always go to sea as a sailor, because of the wholesome
00993: exercise and pure air of the fore-castle deck. For as in this world,
00994: head winds are far more prevalent than winds from astern (that is, if
00995: you never violate the Pythagorean maxim), so for the most part the
00996: Commodore on the quarter-deck gets his atmosphere at second hand from
00997: the sailors on the forecastle. He thinks he breathes it first; but not
00998: so. In much the same way do the commonalty lead their leaders in many
00999: other things, at the same time that the leaders little suspect it. But
01000: wherefore it was that after having repeatedly smelt the sea as a
01001: merchant sailor, I should now take it into my head to go on a whaling
01002: voyage; this the invisible police officer of the Fates, who has the
01003: constant surveillance of me, and secretly dogs me, and influences me in
01004: some unaccountable way—he can better answer than any one else. And,
01005: doubtless, my going on this whaling voyage, formed part of the grand
01006: programme of Providence that was drawn up a long time ago. It came in
01007: as a sort of brief interlude and solo between more extensive
01008: performances. I take it that this part of the bill must have run
01009: something like this:
01010: 
01011: “_Grand Contested Election for the Presidency of the United States._
01012: “WHALING VOYAGE BY ONE ISHMAEL. “BLOODY BATTLE IN AFFGHANISTAN.”
01013: 
01014: Though I cannot tell why it was exactly that those stage managers, the
01015: Fates, put me down for this shabby part of a whaling voyage, when
01016: others were set down for magnificent parts in high tragedies, and short
01017: and easy parts in genteel comedies, and jolly parts in farces—though I
01018: cannot tell why this was exactly; yet, now that I recall all the
01019: circumstances, I think I can see a little into the springs and motives
01020: which being cunningly presented to me under various disguises, induced
01021: me to set about performing the part I did, besides cajoling me into the
01022: delusion that it was a choice resulting from my own unbiased freewill
01023: and discriminating judgment.
01024: 
01025: Chief among these motives was the overwhelming idea of the great whale
01026: himself. Such a portentous and mysterious monster roused all my
01027: curiosity. Then the wild and distant seas where he rolled his island
01028: bulk; the undeliverable, nameless perils of the whale; these, with all
01029: the attending marvels of a thousand Patagonian sights and sounds,
01030: helped to sway me to my wish. With other men, perhaps, such things
01031: would not have been inducements; but as for me, I am tormented with an
01032: everlasting itch for things remote. I love to sail forbidden seas, and
01033: land on barbarous coasts. Not ignoring what is good, I am quick to
01034: perceive a horror, and could still be social with it—would they let
01035: me—since it is but well to be on friendly terms with all the inmates of
01036: the place one lodges in.
01037: 
01038: By reason of these things, then, the whaling voyage was welcome; the
01039: great flood-gates of the wonder-world swung open, and in the wild
01040: conceits that swayed me to my purpose, two and two there floated into
01041: my inmost soul, endless processions of the whale, and, mid most of them
01042: all, one grand hooded phantom, like a snow hill in the air.
01043: 
01044: 
01045: CHAPTER 2. The Carpet-Bag.
01046: 
01047: I stuffed a shirt or two into my old carpet-bag, tucked it under my
01048: arm, and started for Cape Horn and the Pacific. Quitting the good city
01049: of old Manhatto, I duly arrived in New Bedford. It was a Saturday night
01050: in December. Much was I disappointed upon learning that the little
01051: packet for Nantucket had already sailed, and that no way of reaching
01052: that place would offer, till the following Monday.
01053: 
01054: As most young candidates for the pains and penalties of whaling stop at
01055: this same New Bedford, thence to embark on their voyage, it may as well
01056: be related that I, for one, had no idea of so doing. For my mind was
01057: made up to sail in no other than a Nantucket craft, because there was a
01058: fine, boisterous something about everything connected with that famous
01059: old island, which amazingly pleased me. Besides though New Bedford has
01060: of late been gradually monopolising the business of whaling, and though
01061: in this matter poor old Nantucket is now much behind her, yet Nantucket
01062: was her great original—the Tyre of this Carthage;—the place where the
01063: first dead American whale was stranded. Where else but from Nantucket
01064: did those aboriginal whalemen, the Red-Men, first sally out in canoes
01065: to give chase to the Leviathan? And where but from Nantucket, too, did
01066: that first adventurous little sloop put forth, partly laden with
01067: imported cobblestones—so goes the story—to throw at the whales, in
01068: order to discover when they were nigh enough to risk a harpoon from the
01069: bowsprit?
01070: 
01071: Now having a night, a day, and still another night following before me
01072: in New Bedford, ere I could embark for my destined port, it became a
01073: matter of concernment where I was to eat and sleep meanwhile. It was a
01074: very dubious-looking, nay, a very dark and dismal night, bitingly cold
01075: and cheerless. I knew no one in the place. With anxious grapnels I had
01076: sounded my pocket, and only brought up a few pieces of silver,—So,
01077: wherever you go, Ishmael, said I to myself, as I stood in the middle of
01078: a dreary street shouldering my bag, and comparing the gloom towards the
01079: north with the darkness towards the south—wherever in your wisdom you
01080: may conclude to lodge for the night, my dear Ishmael, be sure to
01081: inquire the price, and don’t be too particular.
01082: 
01083: With halting steps I paced the streets, and passed the sign of “The
01084: Crossed Harpoons”—but it looked too expensive and jolly there. Further
01085: on, from the bright red windows of the “Sword-Fish Inn,” there came
01086: such fervent rays, that it seemed to have melted the packed snow and
01087: ice from before the house, for everywhere else the congealed frost lay
01088: ten inches thick in a hard, asphaltic pavement,—rather weary for me,
01089: when I struck my foot against the flinty projections, because from
01090: hard, remorseless service the soles of my boots were in a most
01091: miserable plight. Too expensive and jolly, again thought I, pausing one
01092: moment to watch the broad glare in the street, and hear the sounds of
01093: the tinkling glasses within. But go on, Ishmael, said I at last; don’t
01094: you hear? get away from before the door; your patched boots are
01095: stopping the way. So on I went. I now by instinct followed the streets
01096: that took me waterward, for there, doubtless, were the cheapest, if not
01097: the cheeriest inns.
01098: 
01099: Such dreary streets! blocks of blackness, not houses, on either hand,
01100: and here and there a candle, like a candle moving about in a tomb. At
01101: this hour of the night, of the last day of the week, that quarter of
01102: the town proved all but deserted. But presently I came to a smoky light
01103: proceeding from a low, wide building, the door of which stood
01104: invitingly open. It had a careless look, as if it were meant for the
01105: uses of the public; so, entering, the first thing I did was to stumble
01106: over an ash-box in the porch. Ha! thought I, ha, as the flying
01107: particles almost choked me, are these ashes from that destroyed city,
01108: Gomorrah? But “The Crossed Harpoons,” and “The Sword-Fish?”—this, then
01109: must needs be the sign of “The Trap.” However, I picked myself up and
01110: hearing a loud voice within, pushed on and opened a second, interior
01111: door.
01112: 
01113: It seemed the great Black Parliament sitting in Tophet. A hundred black
01114: faces turned round in their rows to peer; and beyond, a black Angel of
01115: Doom was beating a book in a pulpit. It was a negro church; and the
01116: preacher’s text was about the blackness of darkness, and the weeping
01117: and wailing and teeth-gnashing there. Ha, Ishmael, muttered I, backing
01118: out, Wretched entertainment at the sign of ‘The Trap!’
01119: 
01120: Moving on, I at last came to a dim sort of light not far from the
01121: docks, and heard a forlorn creaking in the air; and looking up, saw a
01122: swinging sign over the door with a white painting upon it, faintly
01123: representing a tall straight jet of misty spray, and these words
01124: underneath—“The Spouter Inn:—Peter Coffin.”
01125: 
01126: Coffin?—Spouter?—Rather ominous in that particular connexion, thought
01127: I. But it is a common name in Nantucket, they say, and I suppose this
01128: Peter here is an emigrant from there. As the light looked so dim, and
01129: the place, for the time, looked quiet enough, and the dilapidated
01130: little wooden house itself looked as if it might have been carted here
01131: from the ruins of some burnt district, and as the swinging sign had a
01132: poverty-stricken sort of creak to it, I thought that here was the very
01133: spot for cheap lodgings, and the best of pea coffee.
01134: 
01135: It was a queer sort of place—a gable-ended old house, one side palsied
01136: as it were, and leaning over sadly. It stood on a sharp bleak corner,
01137: where that tempestuous wind Euroclydon kept up a worse howling than
01138: ever it did about poor Paul’s tossed craft. Euroclydon, nevertheless,
01139: is a mighty pleasant zephyr to any one in-doors, with his feet on the
01140: hob quietly toasting for bed. “In judging of that tempestuous wind
01141: called Euroclydon,” says an old writer—of whose works I possess the
01142: only copy extant—“it maketh a marvellous difference, whether thou
01143: lookest out at it from a glass window where the frost is all on the
01144: outside, or whether thou observest it from that sashless window, where
01145: the frost is on both sides, and of which the wight Death is the only
01146: glazier.” True enough, thought I, as this passage occurred to my
01147: mind—old black-letter, thou reasonest well. Yes, these eyes are
01148: windows, and this body of mine is the house. What a pity they didn’t
01149: stop up the chinks and the crannies though, and thrust in a little lint
01150: here and there. But it’s too late to make any improvements now. The
01151: universe is finished; the copestone is on, and the chips were carted
01152: off a million years ago. Poor Lazarus there, chattering his teeth
01153: against the curbstone for his pillow, and shaking off his tatters with
01154: his shiverings, he might plug up both ears with rags, and put a
01155: corn-cob into his mouth, and yet that would not keep out the
01156: tempestuous Euroclydon. Euroclydon! says old Dives, in his red silken
01157: wrapper—(he had a redder one afterwards) pooh, pooh! What a fine frosty
01158: night; how Orion glitters; what northern lights! Let them talk of their
01159: oriental summer climes of everlasting conservatories; give me the
01160: privilege of making my own summer with my own coals.
01161: 
01162: But what thinks Lazarus? Can he warm his blue hands by holding them up
01163: to the grand northern lights? Would not Lazarus rather be in Sumatra
01164: than here? Would he not far rather lay him down lengthwise along the
01165: line of the equator; yea, ye gods! go down to the fiery pit itself, in
01166: order to keep out this frost?
01167: 
01168: Now, that Lazarus should lie stranded there on the curbstone before the
01169: door of Dives, this is more wonderful than that an iceberg should be
01170: moored to one of the Moluccas. Yet Dives himself, he too lives like a
01171: Czar in an ice palace made of frozen sighs, and being a president of a
01172: temperance society, he only drinks the tepid tears of orphans.
01173: 
01174: But no more of this blubbering now, we are going a-whaling, and there
01175: is plenty of that yet to come. Let us scrape the ice from our frosted
01176: feet, and see what sort of a place this “Spouter” may be.
01177: 
01178: 
01179: CHAPTER 3. The Spouter-Inn.
01180: 
01181: Entering that gable-ended Spouter-Inn, you found yourself in a wide,
01182: low, straggling entry with old-fashioned wainscots, reminding one of
01183: the bulwarks of some condemned old craft. On one side hung a very large
01184: oilpainting so thoroughly besmoked, and every way defaced, that in the
01185: unequal crosslights by which you viewed it, it was only by diligent
01186: study and a series of systematic visits to it, and careful inquiry of
01187: the neighbors, that you could any way arrive at an understanding of its
01188: purpose. Such unaccountable masses of shades and shadows, that at first
01189: you almost thought some ambitious young artist, in the time of the New
01190: England hags, had endeavored to delineate chaos bewitched. But by dint
01191: of much and earnest contemplation, and oft repeated ponderings, and
01192: especially by throwing open the little window towards the back of the
01193: entry, you at last come to the conclusion that such an idea, however
01194: wild, might not be altogether unwarranted.
01195: 
01196: But what most puzzled and confounded you was a long, limber,
01197: portentous, black mass of something hovering in the centre of the
01198: picture over three blue, dim, perpendicular lines floating in a
01199: nameless yeast. A boggy, soggy, squitchy picture truly, enough to drive
01200: a nervous man distracted. Yet was there a sort of indefinite,
01201: half-attained, unimaginable sublimity about it that fairly froze you to
01202: it, till you involuntarily took an oath with yourself to find out what
01203: that marvellous painting meant. Ever and anon a bright, but, alas,
01204: deceptive idea would dart you through.—It’s the Black Sea in a midnight
01205: gale.—It’s the unnatural combat of the four primal elements.—It’s a
01206: blasted heath.—It’s a Hyperborean winter scene.—It’s the breaking-up of
01207: the icebound stream of Time. But at last all these fancies yielded to
01208: that one portentous something in the picture’s midst. _That_ once found
01209: out, and all the rest were plain. But stop; does it not bear a faint
01210: resemblance to a gigantic fish? even the great leviathan himself?
01211: 
01212: In fact, the artist’s design seemed this: a final theory of my own,
01213: partly based upon the aggregated opinions of many aged persons with
01214: whom I conversed upon the subject. The picture represents a Cape-Horner
01215: in a great hurricane; the half-foundered ship weltering there with its
01216: three dismantled masts alone visible; and an exasperated whale,
01217: purposing to spring clean over the craft, is in the enormous act of
01218: impaling himself upon the three mast-heads.
01219: 
01220: The opposite wall of this entry was hung all over with a heathenish
01221: array of monstrous clubs and spears. Some were thickly set with
01222: glittering teeth resembling ivory saws; others were tufted with knots
01223: of human hair; and one was sickle-shaped, with a vast handle sweeping
01224: round like the segment made in the new-mown grass by a long-armed
01225: mower. You shuddered as you gazed, and wondered what monstrous cannibal
01226: and savage could ever have gone a death-harvesting with such a hacking,
01227: horrifying implement. Mixed with these were rusty old whaling lances
01228: and harpoons all broken and deformed. Some were storied weapons. With
01229: this once long lance, now wildly elbowed, fifty years ago did Nathan
01230: Swain kill fifteen whales between a sunrise and a sunset. And that
01231: harpoon—so like a corkscrew now—was flung in Javan seas, and run away
01232: with by a whale, years afterwards slain off the Cape of Blanco. The
01233: original iron entered nigh the tail, and, like a restless needle
01234: sojourning in the body of a man, travelled full forty feet, and at last
01235: was found imbedded in the hump.
01236: 
01237: Crossing this dusky entry, and on through yon low-arched way—cut
01238: through what in old times must have been a great central chimney with
01239: fireplaces all round—you enter the public room. A still duskier place
01240: is this, with such low ponderous beams above, and such old wrinkled
01241: planks beneath, that you would almost fancy you trod some old craft’s
01242: cockpits, especially of such a howling night, when this corner-anchored
01243: old ark rocked so furiously. On one side stood a long, low, shelf-like
01244: table covered with cracked glass cases, filled with dusty rarities
01245: gathered from this wide world’s remotest nooks. Projecting from the
01246: further angle of the room stands a dark-looking den—the bar—a rude
01247: attempt at a right whale’s head. Be that how it may, there stands the
01248: vast arched bone of the whale’s jaw, so wide, a coach might almost
01249: drive beneath it. Within are shabby shelves, ranged round with old
01250: decanters, bottles, flasks; and in those jaws of swift destruction,
01251: like another cursed Jonah (by which name indeed they called him),
01252: bustles a little withered old man, who, for their money, dearly sells
01253: the sailors deliriums and death.
01254: 
01255: Abominable are the tumblers into which he pours his poison. Though true
01256: cylinders without—within, the villanous green goggling glasses
01257: deceitfully tapered downwards to a cheating bottom. Parallel meridians
01258: rudely pecked into the glass, surround these footpads’ goblets. Fill to
01259: _this_ mark, and your charge is but a penny; to _this_ a penny more;
01260: and so on to the full glass—the Cape Horn measure, which you may gulp
01261: down for a shilling.
01262: 
01263: Upon entering the place I found a number of young seamen gathered about
01264: a table, examining by a dim light divers specimens of _skrimshander_. I
01265: sought the landlord, and telling him I desired to be accommodated with
01266: a room, received for answer that his house was full—not a bed
01267: unoccupied. “But avast,” he added, tapping his forehead, “you haint no
01268: objections to sharing a harpooneer’s blanket, have ye? I s’pose you are
01269: goin’ a-whalin’, so you’d better get used to that sort of thing.”
01270: 
01271: I told him that I never liked to sleep two in a bed; that if I should
01272: ever do so, it would depend upon who the harpooneer might be, and that
01273: if he (the landlord) really had no other place for me, and the
01274: harpooneer was not decidedly objectionable, why rather than wander
01275: further about a strange town on so bitter a night, I would put up with
01276: the half of any decent man’s blanket.
01277: 
01278: “I thought so. All right; take a seat. Supper?—you want supper?
01279: Supper’ll be ready directly.”
01280: 
01281: I sat down on an old wooden settle, carved all over like a bench on the
01282: Battery. At one end a ruminating tar was still further adorning it with
01283: his jack-knife, stooping over and diligently working away at the space
01284: between his legs. He was trying his hand at a ship under full sail, but
01285: he didn’t make much headway, I thought.
01286: 
01287: At last some four or five of us were summoned to our meal in an
01288: adjoining room. It was cold as Iceland—no fire at all—the landlord said
01289: he couldn’t afford it. Nothing but two dismal tallow candles, each in a
01290: winding sheet. We were fain to button up our monkey jackets, and hold
01291: to our lips cups of scalding tea with our half frozen fingers. But the
01292: fare was of the most substantial kind—not only meat and potatoes, but
01293: dumplings; good heavens! dumplings for supper! One young fellow in a
01294: green box coat, addressed himself to these dumplings in a most direful
01295: manner.
01296: 
01297: “My boy,” said the landlord, “you’ll have the nightmare to a dead
01298: sartainty.”
01299: 
01300: “Landlord,” I whispered, “that aint the harpooneer is it?”
01301: 
01302: “Oh, no,” said he, looking a sort of diabolically funny, “the
01303: harpooneer is a dark complexioned chap. He never eats dumplings, he
01304: don’t—he eats nothing but steaks, and he likes ’em rare.”
01305: 
01306: “The devil he does,” says I. “Where is that harpooneer? Is he here?”
01307: 
01308: “He’ll be here afore long,” was the answer.
01309: 
01310: I could not help it, but I began to feel suspicious of this “dark
01311: complexioned” harpooneer. At any rate, I made up my mind that if it so
01312: turned out that we should sleep together, he must undress and get into
01313: bed before I did.
01314: 
01315: Supper over, the company went back to the bar-room, when, knowing not
01316: what else to do with myself, I resolved to spend the rest of the
01317: evening as a looker on.
01318: 
01319: Presently a rioting noise was heard without. Starting up, the landlord
01320: cried, “That’s the Grampus’s crew. I seed her reported in the offing
01321: this morning; a three years’ voyage, and a full ship. Hurrah, boys; now
01322: we’ll have the latest news from the Feegees.”
01323: 
01324: A tramping of sea boots was heard in the entry; the door was flung
01325: open, and in rolled a wild set of mariners enough. Enveloped in their
01326: shaggy watch coats, and with their heads muffled in woollen comforters,
01327: all bedarned and ragged, and their beards stiff with icicles, they
01328: seemed an eruption of bears from Labrador. They had just landed from
01329: their boat, and this was the first house they entered. No wonder, then,
01330: that they made a straight wake for the whale’s mouth—the bar—when the
01331: wrinkled little old Jonah, there officiating, soon poured them out
01332: brimmers all round. One complained of a bad cold in his head, upon
01333: which Jonah mixed him a pitch-like potion of gin and molasses, which he
01334: swore was a sovereign cure for all colds and catarrhs whatsoever, never
01335: mind of how long standing, or whether caught off the coast of Labrador,
01336: or on the weather side of an ice-island.
01337: 
01338: The liquor soon mounted into their heads, as it generally does even
01339: with the arrantest topers newly landed from sea, and they began
01340: capering about most obstreperously.
01341: 
01342: I observed, however, that one of them held somewhat aloof, and though
01343: he seemed desirous not to spoil the hilarity of his shipmates by his
01344: own sober face, yet upon the whole he refrained from making as much
01345: noise as the rest. This man interested me at once; and since the
01346: sea-gods had ordained that he should soon become my shipmate (though
01347: but a sleeping-partner one, so far as this narrative is concerned), I
01348: will here venture upon a little description of him. He stood full six
01349: feet in height, with noble shoulders, and a chest like a coffer-dam. I
01350: have seldom seen such brawn in a man. His face was deeply brown and
01351: burnt, making his white teeth dazzling by the contrast; while in the
01352: deep shadows of his eyes floated some reminiscences that did not seem
01353: to give him much joy. His voice at once announced that he was a
01354: Southerner, and from his fine stature, I thought he must be one of
01355: those tall mountaineers from the Alleghanian Ridge in Virginia. When
01356: the revelry of his companions had mounted to its height, this man
01357: slipped away unobserved, and I saw no more of him till he became my
01358: comrade on the sea. In a few minutes, however, he was missed by his
01359: shipmates, and being, it seems, for some reason a huge favourite with
01360: them, they raised a cry of “Bulkington! Bulkington! where’s
01361: Bulkington?” and darted out of the house in pursuit of him.
01362: 
01363: It was now about nine o’clock, and the room seeming almost
01364: supernaturally quiet after these orgies, I began to congratulate myself
01365: upon a little plan that had occurred to me just previous to the
01366: entrance of the seamen.
01367: 
01368: No man prefers to sleep two in a bed. In fact, you would a good deal
01369: rather not sleep with your own brother. I don’t know how it is, but
01370: people like to be private when they are sleeping. And when it comes to
01371: sleeping with an unknown stranger, in a strange inn, in a strange town,
01372: and that stranger a harpooneer, then your objections indefinitely
01373: multiply. Nor was there any earthly reason why I as a sailor should
01374: sleep two in a bed, more than anybody else; for sailors no more sleep
01375: two in a bed at sea, than bachelor Kings do ashore. To be sure they all
01376: sleep together in one apartment, but you have your own hammock, and
01377: cover yourself with your own blanket, and sleep in your own skin.
01378: 
01379: The more I pondered over this harpooneer, the more I abominated the
01380: thought of sleeping with him. It was fair to presume that being a
01381: harpooneer, his linen or woollen, as the case might be, would not be of
01382: the tidiest, certainly none of the finest. I began to twitch all over.
01383: Besides, it was getting late, and my decent harpooneer ought to be home
01384: and going bedwards. Suppose now, he should tumble in upon me at
01385: midnight—how could I tell from what vile hole he had been coming?
01386: 
01387: “Landlord! I’ve changed my mind about that harpooneer.—I shan’t sleep
01388: with him. I’ll try the bench here.”
01389: 
01390: “Just as you please; I’m sorry I can’t spare ye a tablecloth for a
01391: mattress, and it’s a plaguy rough board here”—feeling of the knots and
01392: notches. “But wait a bit, Skrimshander; I’ve got a carpenter’s plane
01393: there in the bar—wait, I say, and I’ll make ye snug enough.” So saying
01394: he procured the plane; and with his old silk handkerchief first dusting
01395: the bench, vigorously set to planing away at my bed, the while grinning
01396: like an ape. The shavings flew right and left; till at last the
01397: plane-iron came bump against an indestructible knot. The landlord was
01398: near spraining his wrist, and I told him for heaven’s sake to quit—the
01399: bed was soft enough to suit me, and I did not know how all the planing
01400: in the world could make eider down of a pine plank. So gathering up the
01401: shavings with another grin, and throwing them into the great stove in
01402: the middle of the room, he went about his business, and left me in a
01403: brown study.
01404: 
01405: I now took the measure of the bench, and found that it was a foot too
01406: short; but that could be mended with a chair. But it was a foot too
01407: narrow, and the other bench in the room was about four inches higher
01408: than the planed one—so there was no yoking them. I then placed the
01409: first bench lengthwise along the only clear space against the wall,
01410: leaving a little interval between, for my back to settle down in. But I
01411: soon found that there came such a draught of cold air over me from
01412: under the sill of the window, that this plan would never do at all,
01413: especially as another current from the rickety door met the one from
01414: the window, and both together formed a series of small whirlwinds in
01415: the immediate vicinity of the spot where I had thought to spend the
01416: night.
01417: 
01418: The devil fetch that harpooneer, thought I, but stop, couldn’t I steal
01419: a march on him—bolt his door inside, and jump into his bed, not to be
01420: wakened by the most violent knockings? It seemed no bad idea; but upon
01421: second thoughts I dismissed it. For who could tell but what the next
01422: morning, so soon as I popped out of the room, the harpooneer might be
01423: standing in the entry, all ready to knock me down!
01424: 
01425: Still, looking round me again, and seeing no possible chance of
01426: spending a sufferable night unless in some other person’s bed, I began
01427: to think that after all I might be cherishing unwarrantable prejudices
01428: against this unknown harpooneer. Thinks I, I’ll wait awhile; he must be
01429: dropping in before long. I’ll have a good look at him then, and perhaps
01430: we may become jolly good bedfellows after all—there’s no telling.
01431: 
01432: But though the other boarders kept coming in by ones, twos, and threes,
01433: and going to bed, yet no sign of my harpooneer.
01434: 
01435: “Landlord!” said I, “what sort of a chap is he—does he always keep such
01436: late hours?” It was now hard upon twelve o’clock.
01437: 
01438: The landlord chuckled again with his lean chuckle, and seemed to be
01439: mightily tickled at something beyond my comprehension. “No,” he
01440: answered, “generally he’s an early bird—airley to bed and airley to
01441: rise—yes, he’s the bird what catches the worm. But to-night he went out
01442: a peddling, you see, and I don’t see what on airth keeps him so late,
01443: unless, may be, he can’t sell his head.”
01444: 
01445: “Can’t sell his head?—What sort of a bamboozingly story is this you are
01446: telling me?” getting into a towering rage. “Do you pretend to say,
01447: landlord, that this harpooneer is actually engaged this blessed
01448: Saturday night, or rather Sunday morning, in peddling his head around
01449: this town?”
01450: 
01451: “That’s precisely it,” said the landlord, “and I told him he couldn’t
01452: sell it here, the market’s overstocked.”
01453: 
01454: “With what?” shouted I.
01455: 
01456: “With heads to be sure; ain’t there too many heads in the world?”
01457: 
01458: “I tell you what it is, landlord,” said I quite calmly, “you’d better
01459: stop spinning that yarn to me—I’m not green.”
01460: 
01461: “May be not,” taking out a stick and whittling a toothpick, “but I
01462: rayther guess you’ll be done _brown_ if that ere harpooneer hears you a
01463: slanderin’ his head.”
01464: 
01465: “I’ll break it for him,” said I, now flying into a passion again at
01466: this unaccountable farrago of the landlord’s.
01467: 
01468: “It’s broke a’ready,” said he.
01469: 
01470: “Broke,” said I—“_broke_, do you mean?”
01471: 
01472: “Sartain, and that’s the very reason he can’t sell it, I guess.”
01473: 
01474: “Landlord,” said I, going up to him as cool as Mt. Hecla in a
01475: snow-storm—“landlord, stop whittling. You and I must understand one
01476: another, and that too without delay. I come to your house and want a
01477: bed; you tell me you can only give me half a one; that the other half
01478: belongs to a certain harpooneer. And about this harpooneer, whom I have
01479: not yet seen, you persist in telling me the most mystifying and
01480: exasperating stories tending to beget in me an uncomfortable feeling
01481: towards the man whom you design for my bedfellow—a sort of connexion,
01482: landlord, which is an intimate and confidential one in the highest
01483: degree. I now demand of you to speak out and tell me who and what this
01484: harpooneer is, and whether I shall be in all respects safe to spend the
01485: night with him. And in the first place, you will be so good as to unsay
01486: that story about selling his head, which if true I take to be good
01487: evidence that this harpooneer is stark mad, and I’ve no idea of
01488: sleeping with a madman; and you, sir, _you_ I mean, landlord, _you_,
01489: sir, by trying to induce me to do so knowingly, would thereby render
01490: yourself liable to a criminal prosecution.”
01491: 
01492: “Wall,” said the landlord, fetching a long breath, “that’s a purty long
01493: sarmon for a chap that rips a little now and then. But be easy, be
01494: easy, this here harpooneer I have been tellin’ you of has just arrived
01495: from the south seas, where he bought up a lot of ’balmed New Zealand
01496: heads (great curios, you know), and he’s sold all on ’em but one, and
01497: that one he’s trying to sell to-night, cause to-morrow’s Sunday, and it
01498: would not do to be sellin’ human heads about the streets when folks is
01499: goin’ to churches. He wanted to, last Sunday, but I stopped him just as
01500: he was goin’ out of the door with four heads strung on a string, for
01501: all the airth like a string of inions.”
01502: 
01503: This account cleared up the otherwise unaccountable mystery, and showed
01504: that the landlord, after all, had had no idea of fooling me—but at the
01505: same time what could I think of a harpooneer who stayed out of a
01506: Saturday night clean into the holy Sabbath, engaged in such a cannibal
01507: business as selling the heads of dead idolators?
01508: 
01509: “Depend upon it, landlord, that harpooneer is a dangerous man.”
01510: 
01511: “He pays reg’lar,” was the rejoinder. “But come, it’s getting dreadful
01512: late, you had better be turning flukes—it’s a nice bed; Sal and me
01513: slept in that ere bed the night we were spliced. There’s plenty of room
01514: for two to kick about in that bed; it’s an almighty big bed that. Why,
01515: afore we give it up, Sal used to put our Sam and little Johnny in the
01516: foot of it. But I got a dreaming and sprawling about one night, and
01517: somehow, Sam got pitched on the floor, and came near breaking his arm.
01518: Arter that, Sal said it wouldn’t do. Come along here, I’ll give ye a
01519: glim in a jiffy;” and so saying he lighted a candle and held it towards
01520: me, offering to lead the way. But I stood irresolute; when looking at a
01521: clock in the corner, he exclaimed “I vum it’s Sunday—you won’t see that
01522: harpooneer to-night; he’s come to anchor somewhere—come along then;
01523: _do_ come; _won’t_ ye come?”
01524: 
01525: I considered the matter a moment, and then up stairs we went, and I was
01526: ushered into a small room, cold as a clam, and furnished, sure enough,
01527: with a prodigious bed, almost big enough indeed for any four
01528: harpooneers to sleep abreast.
01529: 
01530: “There,” said the landlord, placing the candle on a crazy old sea chest
01531: that did double duty as a wash-stand and centre table; “there, make
01532: yourself comfortable now, and good night to ye.” I turned round from
01533: eyeing the bed, but he had disappeared.
01534: 
01535: Folding back the counterpane, I stooped over the bed. Though none of
01536: the most elegant, it yet stood the scrutiny tolerably well. I then
01537: glanced round the room; and besides the bedstead and centre table,
01538: could see no other furniture belonging to the place, but a rude shelf,
01539: the four walls, and a papered fireboard representing a man striking a
01540: whale. Of things not properly belonging to the room, there was a
01541: hammock lashed up, and thrown upon the floor in one corner; also a
01542: large seaman’s bag, containing the harpooneer’s wardrobe, no doubt in
01543: lieu of a land trunk. Likewise, there was a parcel of outlandish bone
01544: fish hooks on the shelf over the fire-place, and a tall harpoon
01545: standing at the head of the bed.
01546: 
01547: But what is this on the chest? I took it up, and held it close to the
01548: light, and felt it, and smelt it, and tried every way possible to
01549: arrive at some satisfactory conclusion concerning it. I can compare it
01550: to nothing but a large door mat, ornamented at the edges with little
01551: tinkling tags something like the stained porcupine quills round an
01552: Indian moccasin. There was a hole or slit in the middle of this mat, as
01553: you see the same in South American ponchos. But could it be possible
01554: that any sober harpooneer would get into a door mat, and parade the
01555: streets of any Christian town in that sort of guise? I put it on, to
01556: try it, and it weighed me down like a hamper, being uncommonly shaggy
01557: and thick, and I thought a little damp, as though this mysterious
01558: harpooneer had been wearing it of a rainy day. I went up in it to a bit
01559: of glass stuck against the wall, and I never saw such a sight in my
01560: life. I tore myself out of it in such a hurry that I gave myself a kink
01561: in the neck.
01562: 
01563: I sat down on the side of the bed, and commenced thinking about this
01564: head-peddling harpooneer, and his door mat. After thinking some time on
01565: the bed-side, I got up and took off my monkey jacket, and then stood in
01566: the middle of the room thinking. I then took off my coat, and thought a
01567: little more in my shirt sleeves. But beginning to feel very cold now,
01568: half undressed as I was, and remembering what the landlord said about
01569: the harpooneer’s not coming home at all that night, it being so very
01570: late, I made no more ado, but jumped out of my pantaloons and boots,
01571: and then blowing out the light tumbled into bed, and commended myself
01572: to the care of heaven.
01573: 
01574: Whether that mattress was stuffed with corn-cobs or broken crockery,
01575: there is no telling, but I rolled about a good deal, and could not
01576: sleep for a long time. At last I slid off into a light doze, and had
01577: pretty nearly made a good offing towards the land of Nod, when I heard
01578: a heavy footfall in the passage, and saw a glimmer of light come into
01579: the room from under the door.
01580: 
01581: Lord save me, thinks I, that must be the harpooneer, the infernal
01582: head-peddler. But I lay perfectly still, and resolved not to say a word
01583: till spoken to. Holding a light in one hand, and that identical New
01584: Zealand head in the other, the stranger entered the room, and without
01585: looking towards the bed, placed his candle a good way off from me on
01586: the floor in one corner, and then began working away at the knotted
01587: cords of the large bag I before spoke of as being in the room. I was
01588: all eagerness to see his face, but he kept it averted for some time
01589: while employed in unlacing the bag’s mouth. This accomplished, however,
01590: he turned round—when, good heavens! what a sight! Such a face! It was
01591: of a dark, purplish, yellow colour, here and there stuck over with
01592: large blackish looking squares. Yes, it’s just as I thought, he’s a
01593: terrible bedfellow; he’s been in a fight, got dreadfully cut, and here
01594: he is, just from the surgeon. But at that moment he chanced to turn his
01595: face so towards the light, that I plainly saw they could not be
01596: sticking-plasters at all, those black squares on his cheeks. They were
01597: stains of some sort or other. At first I knew not what to make of this;
01598: but soon an inkling of the truth occurred to me. I remembered a story
01599: of a white man—a whaleman too—who, falling among the cannibals, had
01600: been tattooed by them. I concluded that this harpooneer, in the course
01601: of his distant voyages, must have met with a similar adventure. And
01602: what is it, thought I, after all! It’s only his outside; a man can be
01603: honest in any sort of skin. But then, what to make of his unearthly
01604: complexion, that part of it, I mean, lying round about, and completely
01605: independent of the squares of tattooing. To be sure, it might be
01606: nothing but a good coat of tropical tanning; but I never heard of a hot
01607: sun’s tanning a white man into a purplish yellow one. However, I had
01608: never been in the South Seas; and perhaps the sun there produced these
01609: extraordinary effects upon the skin. Now, while all these ideas were
01610: passing through me like lightning, this harpooneer never noticed me at
01611: all. But, after some difficulty having opened his bag, he commenced
01612: fumbling in it, and presently pulled out a sort of tomahawk, and a
01613: seal-skin wallet with the hair on. Placing these on the old chest in
01614: the middle of the room, he then took the New Zealand head—a ghastly
01615: thing enough—and crammed it down into the bag. He now took off his
01616: hat—a new beaver hat—when I came nigh singing out with fresh surprise.
01617: There was no hair on his head—none to speak of at least—nothing but a
01618: small scalp-knot twisted up on his forehead. His bald purplish head now
01619: looked for all the world like a mildewed skull. Had not the stranger
01620: stood between me and the door, I would have bolted out of it quicker
01621: than ever I bolted a dinner.
01622: 
01623: Even as it was, I thought something of slipping out of the window, but
01624: it was the second floor back. I am no coward, but what to make of this
01625: head-peddling purple rascal altogether passed my comprehension.
01626: Ignorance is the parent of fear, and being completely nonplussed and
01627: confounded about the stranger, I confess I was now as much afraid of
01628: him as if it was the devil himself who had thus broken into my room at
01629: the dead of night. In fact, I was so afraid of him that I was not game
01630: enough just then to address him, and demand a satisfactory answer
01631: concerning what seemed inexplicable in him.
01632: 
01633: Meanwhile, he continued the business of undressing, and at last showed
01634: his chest and arms. As I live, these covered parts of him were
01635: checkered with the same squares as his face; his back, too, was all
01636: over the same dark squares; he seemed to have been in a Thirty Years’
01637: War, and just escaped from it with a sticking-plaster shirt. Still
01638: more, his very legs were marked, as if a parcel of dark green frogs
01639: were running up the trunks of young palms. It was now quite plain that
01640: he must be some abominable savage or other shipped aboard of a whaleman
01641: in the South Seas, and so landed in this Christian country. I quaked to
01642: think of it. A peddler of heads too—perhaps the heads of his own
01643: brothers. He might take a fancy to mine—heavens! look at that tomahawk!
01644: 
01645: But there was no time for shuddering, for now the savage went about
01646: something that completely fascinated my attention, and convinced me
01647: that he must indeed be a heathen. Going to his heavy grego, or wrapall,
01648: or dreadnaught, which he had previously hung on a chair, he fumbled in
01649: the pockets, and produced at length a curious little deformed image
01650: with a hunch on its back, and exactly the colour of a three days’ old
01651: Congo baby. Remembering the embalmed head, at first I almost thought
01652: that this black manikin was a real baby preserved in some similar
01653: manner. But seeing that it was not at all limber, and that it glistened
01654: a good deal like polished ebony, I concluded that it must be nothing
01655: but a wooden idol, which indeed it proved to be. For now the savage
01656: goes up to the empty fire-place, and removing the papered fire-board,
01657: sets up this little hunch-backed image, like a tenpin, between the
01658: andirons. The chimney jambs and all the bricks inside were very sooty,
01659: so that I thought this fire-place made a very appropriate little shrine
01660: or chapel for his Congo idol.
01661: 
01662: I now screwed my eyes hard towards the half hidden image, feeling but
01663: ill at ease meantime—to see what was next to follow. First he takes
01664: about a double handful of shavings out of his grego pocket, and places
01665: them carefully before the idol; then laying a bit of ship biscuit on
01666: top and applying the flame from the lamp, he kindled the shavings into
01667: a sacrificial blaze. Presently, after many hasty snatches into the
01668: fire, and still hastier withdrawals of his fingers (whereby he seemed
01669: to be scorching them badly), he at last succeeded in drawing out the
01670: biscuit; then blowing off the heat and ashes a little, he made a polite
01671: offer of it to the little negro. But the little devil did not seem to
01672: fancy such dry sort of fare at all; he never moved his lips. All these
01673: strange antics were accompanied by still stranger guttural noises from
01674: the devotee, who seemed to be praying in a sing-song or else singing
01675: some pagan psalmody or other, during which his face twitched about in
01676: the most unnatural manner. At last extinguishing the fire, he took the
01677: idol up very unceremoniously, and bagged it again in his grego pocket
01678: as carelessly as if he were a sportsman bagging a dead woodcock.
01679: 
01680: All these queer proceedings increased my uncomfortableness, and seeing
01681: him now exhibiting strong symptoms of concluding his business
01682: operations, and jumping into bed with me, I thought it was high time,
01683: now or never, before the light was put out, to break the spell in which
01684: I had so long been bound.
01685: 
01686: But the interval I spent in deliberating what to say, was a fatal one.
01687: Taking up his tomahawk from the table, he examined the head of it for
01688: an instant, and then holding it to the light, with his mouth at the
01689: handle, he puffed out great clouds of tobacco smoke. The next moment
01690: the light was extinguished, and this wild cannibal, tomahawk between
01691: his teeth, sprang into bed with me. I sang out, I could not help it
01692: now; and giving a sudden grunt of astonishment he began feeling me.
01693: 
01694: Stammering out something, I knew not what, I rolled away from him
01695: against the wall, and then conjured him, whoever or whatever he might
01696: be, to keep quiet, and let me get up and light the lamp again. But his
01697: guttural responses satisfied me at once that he but ill comprehended my
01698: meaning.
01699: 
01700: “Who-e debel you?”—he at last said—“you no speak-e, dam-me, I kill-e.”
01701: And so saying the lighted tomahawk began flourishing about me in the
01702: dark.
01703: 
01704: “Landlord, for God’s sake, Peter Coffin!” shouted I. “Landlord! Watch!
01705: Coffin! Angels! save me!”
01706: 
01707: “Speak-e! tell-ee me who-ee be, or dam-me, I kill-e!” again growled the
01708: cannibal, while his horrid flourishings of the tomahawk scattered the
01709: hot tobacco ashes about me till I thought my linen would get on fire.
01710: But thank heaven, at that moment the landlord came into the room light
01711: in hand, and leaping from the bed I ran up to him.
01712: 
01713: “Don’t be afraid now,” said he, grinning again, “Queequeg here wouldn’t
01714: harm a hair of your head.”
01715: 
01716: “Stop your grinning,” shouted I, “and why didn’t you tell me that that
01717: infernal harpooneer was a cannibal?”
01718: 
01719: “I thought ye know’d it;—didn’t I tell ye, he was a peddlin’ heads
01720: around town?—but turn flukes again and go to sleep. Queequeg, look
01721: here—you sabbee me, I sabbee—you this man sleepe you—you sabbee?”
01722: 
01723: “Me sabbee plenty”—grunted Queequeg, puffing away at his pipe and
01724: sitting up in bed.
01725: 
01726: “You gettee in,” he added, motioning to me with his tomahawk, and
01727: throwing the clothes to one side. He really did this in not only a
01728: civil but a really kind and charitable way. I stood looking at him a
01729: moment. For all his tattooings he was on the whole a clean, comely
01730: looking cannibal. What’s all this fuss I have been making about,
01731: thought I to myself—the man’s a human being just as I am: he has just
01732: as much reason to fear me, as I have to be afraid of him. Better sleep
01733: with a sober cannibal than a drunken Christian.
01734: 
01735: “Landlord,” said I, “tell him to stash his tomahawk there, or pipe, or
01736: whatever you call it; tell him to stop smoking, in short, and I will
01737: turn in with him. But I don’t fancy having a man smoking in bed with
01738: me. It’s dangerous. Besides, I ain’t insured.”
01739: 
01740: This being told to Queequeg, he at once complied, and again politely
01741: motioned me to get into bed—rolling over to one side as much as to
01742: say—“I won’t touch a leg of ye.”
01743: 
01744: “Good night, landlord,” said I, “you may go.”
01745: 
01746: I turned in, and never slept better in my life.
01747: 
01748: 
01749: CHAPTER 4. The Counterpane.
01750: 
01751: Upon waking next morning about daylight, I found Queequeg’s arm thrown
01752: over me in the most loving and affectionate manner. You had almost
01753: thought I had been his wife. The counterpane was of patchwork, full of
01754: odd little parti-coloured squares and triangles; and this arm of his
01755: tattooed all over with an interminable Cretan labyrinth of a figure, no
01756: two parts of which were of one precise shade—owing I suppose to his
01757: keeping his arm at sea unmethodically in sun and shade, his shirt
01758: sleeves irregularly rolled up at various times—this same arm of his, I
01759: say, looked for all the world like a strip of that same patchwork
01760: quilt. Indeed, partly lying on it as the arm did when I first awoke, I
01761: could hardly tell it from the quilt, they so blended their hues
01762: together; and it was only by the sense of weight and pressure that I
01763: could tell that Queequeg was hugging me.
01764: 
01765: My sensations were strange. Let me try to explain them. When I was a
01766: child, I well remember a somewhat similar circumstance that befell me;
01767: whether it was a reality or a dream, I never could entirely settle. The
01768: circumstance was this. I had been cutting up some caper or other—I
01769: think it was trying to crawl up the chimney, as I had seen a little
01770: sweep do a few days previous; and my stepmother who, somehow or other,
01771: was all the time whipping me, or sending me to bed supperless,—my
01772: mother dragged me by the legs out of the chimney and packed me off to
01773: bed, though it was only two o’clock in the afternoon of the 21st June,
01774: the longest day in the year in our hemisphere. I felt dreadfully. But
01775: there was no help for it, so up stairs I went to my little room in the
01776: third floor, undressed myself as slowly as possible so as to kill time,
01777: and with a bitter sigh got between the sheets.
01778: 
01779: I lay there dismally calculating that sixteen entire hours must elapse
01780: before I could hope for a resurrection. Sixteen hours in bed! the small
01781: of my back ached to think of it. And it was so light too; the sun
01782: shining in at the window, and a great rattling of coaches in the
01783: streets, and the sound of gay voices all over the house. I felt worse
01784: and worse—at last I got up, dressed, and softly going down in my
01785: stockinged feet, sought out my stepmother, and suddenly threw myself at
01786: her feet, beseeching her as a particular favour to give me a good
01787: slippering for my misbehaviour; anything indeed but condemning me to
01788: lie abed such an unendurable length of time. But she was the best and
01789: most conscientious of stepmothers, and back I had to go to my room. For
01790: several hours I lay there broad awake, feeling a great deal worse than
01791: I have ever done since, even from the greatest subsequent misfortunes.
01792: At last I must have fallen into a troubled nightmare of a doze; and
01793: slowly waking from it—half steeped in dreams—I opened my eyes, and the
01794: before sun-lit room was now wrapped in outer darkness. Instantly I felt
01795: a shock running through all my frame; nothing was to be seen, and
01796: nothing was to be heard; but a supernatural hand seemed placed in mine.
01797: My arm hung over the counterpane, and the nameless, unimaginable,
01798: silent form or phantom, to which the hand belonged, seemed closely
01799: seated by my bed-side. For what seemed ages piled on ages, I lay there,
01800: frozen with the most awful fears, not daring to drag away my hand; yet
01801: ever thinking that if I could but stir it one single inch, the horrid
01802: spell would be broken. I knew not how this consciousness at last glided
01803: away from me; but waking in the morning, I shudderingly remembered it
01804: all, and for days and weeks and months afterwards I lost myself in
01805: confounding attempts to explain the mystery. Nay, to this very hour, I
01806: often puzzle myself with it.
01807: 
01808: Now, take away the awful fear, and my sensations at feeling the
01809: supernatural hand in mine were very similar, in their strangeness, to
01810: those which I experienced on waking up and seeing Queequeg’s pagan arm
01811: thrown round me. But at length all the past night’s events soberly
01812: recurred, one by one, in fixed reality, and then I lay only alive to
01813: the comical predicament. For though I tried to move his arm—unlock his
01814: bridegroom clasp—yet, sleeping as he was, he still hugged me tightly,
01815: as though naught but death should part us twain. I now strove to rouse
01816: him—“Queequeg!”—but his only answer was a snore. I then rolled over, my
01817: neck feeling as if it were in a horse-collar; and suddenly felt a
01818: slight scratch. Throwing aside the counterpane, there lay the tomahawk
01819: sleeping by the savage’s side, as if it were a hatchet-faced baby. A
01820: pretty pickle, truly, thought I; abed here in a strange house in the
01821: broad day, with a cannibal and a tomahawk! “Queequeg!—in the name of
01822: goodness, Queequeg, wake!” At length, by dint of much wriggling, and
01823: loud and incessant expostulations upon the unbecomingness of his
01824: hugging a fellow male in that matrimonial sort of style, I succeeded in
01825: extracting a grunt; and presently, he drew back his arm, shook himself
01826: all over like a Newfoundland dog just from the water, and sat up in
01827: bed, stiff as a pike-staff, looking at me, and rubbing his eyes as if
01828: he did not altogether remember how I came to be there, though a dim
01829: consciousness of knowing something about me seemed slowly dawning over
01830: him. Meanwhile, I lay quietly eyeing him, having no serious misgivings
01831: now, and bent upon narrowly observing so curious a creature. When, at
01832: last, his mind seemed made up touching the character of his bedfellow,
