01833: and he became, as it were, reconciled to the fact; he jumped out upon
01834: the floor, and by certain signs and sounds gave me to understand that,
01835: if it pleased me, he would dress first and then leave me to dress
01836: afterwards, leaving the whole apartment to myself. Thinks I, Queequeg,
01837: under the circumstances, this is a very civilized overture; but, the
01838: truth is, these savages have an innate sense of delicacy, say what you
01839: will; it is marvellous how essentially polite they are. I pay this
01840: particular compliment to Queequeg, because he treated me with so much
01841: civility and consideration, while I was guilty of great rudeness;
01842: staring at him from the bed, and watching all his toilette motions; for
01843: the time my curiosity getting the better of my breeding. Nevertheless,
01844: a man like Queequeg you don’t see every day, he and his ways were well
01845: worth unusual regarding.
01846: 
01847: He commenced dressing at top by donning his beaver hat, a very tall
01848: one, by the by, and then—still minus his trowsers—he hunted up his
01849: boots. What under the heavens he did it for, I cannot tell, but his
01850: next movement was to crush himself—boots in hand, and hat on—under the
01851: bed; when, from sundry violent gaspings and strainings, I inferred he
01852: was hard at work booting himself; though by no law of propriety that I
01853: ever heard of, is any man required to be private when putting on his
01854: boots. But Queequeg, do you see, was a creature in the transition
01855: stage—neither caterpillar nor butterfly. He was just enough civilized
01856: to show off his outlandishness in the strangest possible manners. His
01857: education was not yet completed. He was an undergraduate. If he had not
01858: been a small degree civilized, he very probably would not have troubled
01859: himself with boots at all; but then, if he had not been still a savage,
01860: he never would have dreamt of getting under the bed to put them on. At
01861: last, he emerged with his hat very much dented and crushed down over
01862: his eyes, and began creaking and limping about the room, as if, not
01863: being much accustomed to boots, his pair of damp, wrinkled cowhide
01864: ones—probably not made to order either—rather pinched and tormented him
01865: at the first go off of a bitter cold morning.
01866: 
01867: Seeing, now, that there were no curtains to the window, and that the
01868: street being very narrow, the house opposite commanded a plain view
01869: into the room, and observing more and more the indecorous figure that
01870: Queequeg made, staving about with little else but his hat and boots on;
01871: I begged him as well as I could, to accelerate his toilet somewhat, and
01872: particularly to get into his pantaloons as soon as possible. He
01873: complied, and then proceeded to wash himself. At that time in the
01874: morning any Christian would have washed his face; but Queequeg, to my
01875: amazement, contented himself with restricting his ablutions to his
01876: chest, arms, and hands. He then donned his waistcoat, and taking up a
01877: piece of hard soap on the wash-stand centre table, dipped it into water
01878: and commenced lathering his face. I was watching to see where he kept
01879: his razor, when lo and behold, he takes the harpoon from the bed
01880: corner, slips out the long wooden stock, unsheathes the head, whets it
01881: a little on his boot, and striding up to the bit of mirror against the
01882: wall, begins a vigorous scraping, or rather harpooning of his cheeks.
01883: Thinks I, Queequeg, this is using Rogers’s best cutlery with a
01884: vengeance. Afterwards I wondered the less at this operation when I came
01885: to know of what fine steel the head of a harpoon is made, and how
01886: exceedingly sharp the long straight edges are always kept.
01887: 
01888: The rest of his toilet was soon achieved, and he proudly marched out of
01889: the room, wrapped up in his great pilot monkey jacket, and sporting his
01890: harpoon like a marshal’s baton.
01891: 
01892: 
01893: CHAPTER 5. Breakfast.
01894: 
01895: I quickly followed suit, and descending into the bar-room accosted the
01896: grinning landlord very pleasantly. I cherished no malice towards him,
01897: though he had been skylarking with me not a little in the matter of my
01898: bedfellow.
01899: 
01900: However, a good laugh is a mighty good thing, and rather too scarce a
01901: good thing; the more’s the pity. So, if any one man, in his own proper
01902: person, afford stuff for a good joke to anybody, let him not be
01903: backward, but let him cheerfully allow himself to spend and be spent in
01904: that way. And the man that has anything bountifully laughable about
01905: him, be sure there is more in that man than you perhaps think for.
01906: 
01907: The bar-room was now full of the boarders who had been dropping in the
01908: night previous, and whom I had not as yet had a good look at. They were
01909: nearly all whalemen; chief mates, and second mates, and third mates,
01910: and sea carpenters, and sea coopers, and sea blacksmiths, and
01911: harpooneers, and ship keepers; a brown and brawny company, with bosky
01912: beards; an unshorn, shaggy set, all wearing monkey jackets for morning
01913: gowns.
01914: 
01915: You could pretty plainly tell how long each one had been ashore. This
01916: young fellow’s healthy cheek is like a sun-toasted pear in hue, and
01917: would seem to smell almost as musky; he cannot have been three days
01918: landed from his Indian voyage. That man next him looks a few shades
01919: lighter; you might say a touch of satin wood is in him. In the
01920: complexion of a third still lingers a tropic tawn, but slightly
01921: bleached withal; _he_ doubtless has tarried whole weeks ashore. But who
01922: could show a cheek like Queequeg? which, barred with various tints,
01923: seemed like the Andes’ western slope, to show forth in one array,
01924: contrasting climates, zone by zone.
01925: 
01926: “Grub, ho!” now cried the landlord, flinging open a door, and in we
01927: went to breakfast.
01928: 
01929: They say that men who have seen the world, thereby become quite at ease
01930: in manner, quite self-possessed in company. Not always, though:
01931: Ledyard, the great New England traveller, and Mungo Park, the Scotch
01932: one; of all men, they possessed the least assurance in the parlor. But
01933: perhaps the mere crossing of Siberia in a sledge drawn by dogs as
01934: Ledyard did, or the taking a long solitary walk on an empty stomach, in
01935: the negro heart of Africa, which was the sum of poor Mungo’s
01936: performances—this kind of travel, I say, may not be the very best mode
01937: of attaining a high social polish. Still, for the most part, that sort
01938: of thing is to be had anywhere.
01939: 
01940: These reflections just here are occasioned by the circumstance that
01941: after we were all seated at the table, and I was preparing to hear some
01942: good stories about whaling; to my no small surprise, nearly every man
01943: maintained a profound silence. And not only that, but they looked
01944: embarrassed. Yes, here were a set of sea-dogs, many of whom without the
01945: slightest bashfulness had boarded great whales on the high seas—entire
01946: strangers to them—and duelled them dead without winking; and yet, here
01947: they sat at a social breakfast table—all of the same calling, all of
01948: kindred tastes—looking round as sheepishly at each other as though they
01949: had never been out of sight of some sheepfold among the Green
01950: Mountains. A curious sight; these bashful bears, these timid warrior
01951: whalemen!
01952: 
01953: But as for Queequeg—why, Queequeg sat there among them—at the head of
01954: the table, too, it so chanced; as cool as an icicle. To be sure I
01955: cannot say much for his breeding. His greatest admirer could not have
01956: cordially justified his bringing his harpoon into breakfast with him,
01957: and using it there without ceremony; reaching over the table with it,
01958: to the imminent jeopardy of many heads, and grappling the beefsteaks
01959: towards him. But _that_ was certainly very coolly done by him, and
01960: every one knows that in most people’s estimation, to do anything coolly
01961: is to do it genteelly.
01962: 
01963: We will not speak of all Queequeg’s peculiarities here; how he eschewed
01964: coffee and hot rolls, and applied his undivided attention to
01965: beefsteaks, done rare. Enough, that when breakfast was over he withdrew
01966: like the rest into the public room, lighted his tomahawk-pipe, and was
01967: sitting there quietly digesting and smoking with his inseparable hat
01968: on, when I sallied out for a stroll.
01969: 
01970: 
01971: CHAPTER 6. The Street.
01972: 
01973: If I had been astonished at first catching a glimpse of so outlandish
01974: an individual as Queequeg circulating among the polite society of a
01975: civilized town, that astonishment soon departed upon taking my first
01976: daylight stroll through the streets of New Bedford.
01977: 
01978: In thoroughfares nigh the docks, any considerable seaport will
01979: frequently offer to view the queerest looking nondescripts from foreign
01980: parts. Even in Broadway and Chestnut streets, Mediterranean mariners
01981: will sometimes jostle the affrighted ladies. Regent Street is not
01982: unknown to Lascars and Malays; and at Bombay, in the Apollo Green, live
01983: Yankees have often scared the natives. But New Bedford beats all Water
01984: Street and Wapping. In these last-mentioned haunts you see only
01985: sailors; but in New Bedford, actual cannibals stand chatting at street
01986: corners; savages outright; many of whom yet carry on their bones unholy
01987: flesh. It makes a stranger stare.
01988: 
01989: But, besides the Feegeeans, Tongatobooarrs, Erromanggoans, Pannangians,
01990: and Brighggians, and, besides the wild specimens of the whaling-craft
01991: which unheeded reel about the streets, you will see other sights still
01992: more curious, certainly more comical. There weekly arrive in this town
01993: scores of green Vermonters and New Hampshire men, all athirst for gain
01994: and glory in the fishery. They are mostly young, of stalwart frames;
01995: fellows who have felled forests, and now seek to drop the axe and
01996: snatch the whale-lance. Many are as green as the Green Mountains whence
01997: they came. In some things you would think them but a few hours old.
01998: Look there! that chap strutting round the corner. He wears a beaver hat
01999: and swallow-tailed coat, girdled with a sailor-belt and sheath-knife.
02000: Here comes another with a sou’-wester and a bombazine cloak.
02001: 
02002: No town-bred dandy will compare with a country-bred one—I mean a
02003: downright bumpkin dandy—a fellow that, in the dog-days, will mow his
02004: two acres in buckskin gloves for fear of tanning his hands. Now when a
02005: country dandy like this takes it into his head to make a distinguished
02006: reputation, and joins the great whale-fishery, you should see the
02007: comical things he does upon reaching the seaport. In bespeaking his
02008: sea-outfit, he orders bell-buttons to his waistcoats; straps to his
02009: canvas trowsers. Ah, poor Hay-Seed! how bitterly will burst those
02010: straps in the first howling gale, when thou art driven, straps,
02011: buttons, and all, down the throat of the tempest.
02012: 
02013: But think not that this famous town has only harpooneers, cannibals,
02014: and bumpkins to show her visitors. Not at all. Still New Bedford is a
02015: queer place. Had it not been for us whalemen, that tract of land would
02016: this day perhaps have been in as howling condition as the coast of
02017: Labrador. As it is, parts of her back country are enough to frighten
02018: one, they look so bony. The town itself is perhaps the dearest place to
02019: live in, in all New England. It is a land of oil, true enough: but not
02020: like Canaan; a land, also, of corn and wine. The streets do not run
02021: with milk; nor in the spring-time do they pave them with fresh eggs.
02022: Yet, in spite of this, nowhere in all America will you find more
02023: patrician-like houses; parks and gardens more opulent, than in New
02024: Bedford. Whence came they? how planted upon this once scraggy scoria of
02025: a country?
02026: 
02027: Go and gaze upon the iron emblematical harpoons round yonder lofty
02028: mansion, and your question will be answered. Yes; all these brave
02029: houses and flowery gardens came from the Atlantic, Pacific, and Indian
02030: oceans. One and all, they were harpooned and dragged up hither from the
02031: bottom of the sea. Can Herr Alexander perform a feat like that?
02032: 
02033: In New Bedford, fathers, they say, give whales for dowers to their
02034: daughters, and portion off their nieces with a few porpoises a-piece.
02035: You must go to New Bedford to see a brilliant wedding; for, they say,
02036: they have reservoirs of oil in every house, and every night recklessly
02037: burn their lengths in spermaceti candles.
02038: 
02039: In summer time, the town is sweet to see; full of fine maples—long
02040: avenues of green and gold. And in August, high in air, the beautiful
02041: and bountiful horse-chestnuts, candelabra-wise, proffer the passer-by
02042: their tapering upright cones of congregated blossoms. So omnipotent is
02043: art; which in many a district of New Bedford has superinduced bright
02044: terraces of flowers upon the barren refuse rocks thrown aside at
02045: creation’s final day.
02046: 
02047: And the women of New Bedford, they bloom like their own red roses. But
02048: roses only bloom in summer; whereas the fine carnation of their cheeks
02049: is perennial as sunlight in the seventh heavens. Elsewhere match that
02050: bloom of theirs, ye cannot, save in Salem, where they tell me the young
02051: girls breathe such musk, their sailor sweethearts smell them miles off
02052: shore, as though they were drawing nigh the odorous Moluccas instead of
02053: the Puritanic sands.
02054: 
02055: 
02056: CHAPTER 7. The Chapel.
02057: 
02058: In this same New Bedford there stands a Whaleman’s Chapel, and few are
02059: the moody fishermen, shortly bound for the Indian Ocean or Pacific, who
02060: fail to make a Sunday visit to the spot. I am sure that I did not.
02061: 
02062: Returning from my first morning stroll, I again sallied out upon this
02063: special errand. The sky had changed from clear, sunny cold, to driving
02064: sleet and mist. Wrapping myself in my shaggy jacket of the cloth called
02065: bearskin, I fought my way against the stubborn storm. Entering, I found
02066: a small scattered congregation of sailors, and sailors’ wives and
02067: widows. A muffled silence reigned, only broken at times by the shrieks
02068: of the storm. Each silent worshipper seemed purposely sitting apart
02069: from the other, as if each silent grief were insular and
02070: incommunicable. The chaplain had not yet arrived; and there these
02071: silent islands of men and women sat steadfastly eyeing several marble
02072: tablets, with black borders, masoned into the wall on either side the
02073: pulpit. Three of them ran something like the following, but I do not
02074: pretend to quote:—
02075: 
02076: SACRED TO THE MEMORY OF JOHN TALBOT, Who, at the age of eighteen, was
02077: lost overboard, Near the Isle of Desolation, off Patagonia, _November_
02078: 1_st_, 1836. THIS TABLET Is erected to his Memory BY HIS SISTER.
02079: 
02080: SACRED TO THE MEMORY OF ROBERT LONG, WILLIS ELLERY, NATHAN COLEMAN,
02081: WALTER CANNY, SETH MACY, AND SAMUEL GLEIG, Forming one of the boats’
02082: crews OF THE SHIP ELIZA Who were towed out of sight by a Whale, On the
02083: Off-shore Ground in the PACIFIC, _December_ 31_st_, 1839. THIS MARBLE
02084: Is here placed by their surviving SHIPMATES.
02085: 
02086: SACRED TO THE MEMORY OF The late CAPTAIN EZEKIEL HARDY, Who in the bows
02087: of his boat was killed by a Sperm Whale on the coast of Japan, _August_
02088: 3_d_, 1833. THIS TABLET Is erected to his Memory BY HIS WIDOW.
02089: 
02090: Shaking off the sleet from my ice-glazed hat and jacket, I seated
02091: myself near the door, and turning sideways was surprised to see
02092: Queequeg near me. Affected by the solemnity of the scene, there was a
02093: wondering gaze of incredulous curiosity in his countenance. This savage
02094: was the only person present who seemed to notice my entrance; because
02095: he was the only one who could not read, and, therefore, was not reading
02096: those frigid inscriptions on the wall. Whether any of the relatives of
02097: the seamen whose names appeared there were now among the congregation,
02098: I knew not; but so many are the unrecorded accidents in the fishery,
02099: and so plainly did several women present wear the countenance if not
02100: the trappings of some unceasing grief, that I feel sure that here
02101: before me were assembled those, in whose unhealing hearts the sight of
02102: those bleak tablets sympathetically caused the old wounds to bleed
02103: afresh.
02104: 
02105: Oh! ye whose dead lie buried beneath the green grass; who standing
02106: among flowers can say—here, _here_ lies my beloved; ye know not the
02107: desolation that broods in bosoms like these. What bitter blanks in
02108: those black-bordered marbles which cover no ashes! What despair in
02109: those immovable inscriptions! What deadly voids and unbidden
02110: infidelities in the lines that seem to gnaw upon all Faith, and refuse
02111: resurrections to the beings who have placelessly perished without a
02112: grave. As well might those tablets stand in the cave of Elephanta as
02113: here.
02114: 
02115: In what census of living creatures, the dead of mankind are included;
02116: why it is that a universal proverb says of them, that they tell no
02117: tales, though containing more secrets than the Goodwin Sands; how it is
02118: that to his name who yesterday departed for the other world, we prefix
02119: so significant and infidel a word, and yet do not thus entitle him, if
02120: he but embarks for the remotest Indies of this living earth; why the
02121: Life Insurance Companies pay death-forfeitures upon immortals; in what
02122: eternal, unstirring paralysis, and deadly, hopeless trance, yet lies
02123: antique Adam who died sixty round centuries ago; how it is that we
02124: still refuse to be comforted for those who we nevertheless maintain are
02125: dwelling in unspeakable bliss; why all the living so strive to hush all
02126: the dead; wherefore but the rumor of a knocking in a tomb will terrify
02127: a whole city. All these things are not without their meanings.
02128: 
02129: But Faith, like a jackal, feeds among the tombs, and even from these
02130: dead doubts she gathers her most vital hope.
02131: 
02132: It needs scarcely to be told, with what feelings, on the eve of a
02133: Nantucket voyage, I regarded those marble tablets, and by the murky
02134: light of that darkened, doleful day read the fate of the whalemen who
02135: had gone before me. Yes, Ishmael, the same fate may be thine. But
02136: somehow I grew merry again. Delightful inducements to embark, fine
02137: chance for promotion, it seems—aye, a stove boat will make me an
02138: immortal by brevet. Yes, there is death in this business of whaling—a
02139: speechlessly quick chaotic bundling of a man into Eternity. But what
02140: then? Methinks we have hugely mistaken this matter of Life and Death.
02141: Methinks that what they call my shadow here on earth is my true
02142: substance. Methinks that in looking at things spiritual, we are too
02143: much like oysters observing the sun through the water, and thinking
02144: that thick water the thinnest of air. Methinks my body is but the lees
02145: of my better being. In fact take my body who will, take it I say, it is
02146: not me. And therefore three cheers for Nantucket; and come a stove boat
02147: and stove body when they will, for stave my soul, Jove himself cannot.
02148: 
02149: 
02150: CHAPTER 8. The Pulpit.
02151: 
02152: I had not been seated very long ere a man of a certain venerable
02153: robustness entered; immediately as the storm-pelted door flew back upon
02154: admitting him, a quick regardful eyeing of him by all the congregation,
02155: sufficiently attested that this fine old man was the chaplain. Yes, it
02156: was the famous Father Mapple, so called by the whalemen, among whom he
02157: was a very great favourite. He had been a sailor and a harpooneer in
02158: his youth, but for many years past had dedicated his life to the
02159: ministry. At the time I now write of, Father Mapple was in the hardy
02160: winter of a healthy old age; that sort of old age which seems merging
02161: into a second flowering youth, for among all the fissures of his
02162: wrinkles, there shone certain mild gleams of a newly developing
02163: bloom—the spring verdure peeping forth even beneath February’s snow. No
02164: one having previously heard his history, could for the first time
02165: behold Father Mapple without the utmost interest, because there were
02166: certain engrafted clerical peculiarities about him, imputable to that
02167: adventurous maritime life he had led. When he entered I observed that
02168: he carried no umbrella, and certainly had not come in his carriage, for
02169: his tarpaulin hat ran down with melting sleet, and his great pilot
02170: cloth jacket seemed almost to drag him to the floor with the weight of
02171: the water it had absorbed. However, hat and coat and overshoes were one
02172: by one removed, and hung up in a little space in an adjacent corner;
02173: when, arrayed in a decent suit, he quietly approached the pulpit.
02174: 
02175: Like most old fashioned pulpits, it was a very lofty one, and since a
02176: regular stairs to such a height would, by its long angle with the
02177: floor, seriously contract the already small area of the chapel, the
02178: architect, it seemed, had acted upon the hint of Father Mapple, and
02179: finished the pulpit without a stairs, substituting a perpendicular side
02180: ladder, like those used in mounting a ship from a boat at sea. The wife
02181: of a whaling captain had provided the chapel with a handsome pair of
02182: red worsted man-ropes for this ladder, which, being itself nicely
02183: headed, and stained with a mahogany colour, the whole contrivance,
02184: considering what manner of chapel it was, seemed by no means in bad
02185: taste. Halting for an instant at the foot of the ladder, and with both
02186: hands grasping the ornamental knobs of the man-ropes, Father Mapple
02187: cast a look upwards, and then with a truly sailor-like but still
02188: reverential dexterity, hand over hand, mounted the steps as if
02189: ascending the main-top of his vessel.
02190: 
02191: The perpendicular parts of this side ladder, as is usually the case
02192: with swinging ones, were of cloth-covered rope, only the rounds were of
02193: wood, so that at every step there was a joint. At my first glimpse of
02194: the pulpit, it had not escaped me that however convenient for a ship,
02195: these joints in the present instance seemed unnecessary. For I was not
02196: prepared to see Father Mapple after gaining the height, slowly turn
02197: round, and stooping over the pulpit, deliberately drag up the ladder
02198: step by step, till the whole was deposited within, leaving him
02199: impregnable in his little Quebec.
02200: 
02201: I pondered some time without fully comprehending the reason for this.
02202: Father Mapple enjoyed such a wide reputation for sincerity and
02203: sanctity, that I could not suspect him of courting notoriety by any
02204: mere tricks of the stage. No, thought I, there must be some sober
02205: reason for this thing; furthermore, it must symbolize something unseen.
02206: Can it be, then, that by that act of physical isolation, he signifies
02207: his spiritual withdrawal for the time, from all outward worldly ties
02208: and connexions? Yes, for replenished with the meat and wine of the
02209: word, to the faithful man of God, this pulpit, I see, is a
02210: self-containing stronghold—a lofty Ehrenbreitstein, with a perennial
02211: well of water within the walls.
02212: 
02213: But the side ladder was not the only strange feature of the place,
02214: borrowed from the chaplain’s former sea-farings. Between the marble
02215: cenotaphs on either hand of the pulpit, the wall which formed its back
02216: was adorned with a large painting representing a gallant ship beating
02217: against a terrible storm off a lee coast of black rocks and snowy
02218: breakers. But high above the flying scud and dark-rolling clouds, there
02219: floated a little isle of sunlight, from which beamed forth an angel’s
02220: face; and this bright face shed a distinct spot of radiance upon the
02221: ship’s tossed deck, something like that silver plate now inserted into
02222: the Victory’s plank where Nelson fell. “Ah, noble ship,” the angel
02223: seemed to say, “beat on, beat on, thou noble ship, and bear a hardy
02224: helm; for lo! the sun is breaking through; the clouds are rolling
02225: off—serenest azure is at hand.”
02226: 
02227: Nor was the pulpit itself without a trace of the same sea-taste that
02228: had achieved the ladder and the picture. Its panelled front was in the
02229: likeness of a ship’s bluff bows, and the Holy Bible rested on a
02230: projecting piece of scroll work, fashioned after a ship’s fiddle-headed
02231: beak.
02232: 
02233: What could be more full of meaning?—for the pulpit is ever this earth’s
02234: foremost part; all the rest comes in its rear; the pulpit leads the
02235: world. From thence it is the storm of God’s quick wrath is first
02236: descried, and the bow must bear the earliest brunt. From thence it is
02237: the God of breezes fair or foul is first invoked for favourable winds.
02238: Yes, the world’s a ship on its passage out, and not a voyage complete;
02239: and the pulpit is its prow.
02240: 
02241: 
02242: CHAPTER 9. The Sermon.
02243: 
02244: Father Mapple rose, and in a mild voice of unassuming authority ordered
02245: the scattered people to condense. “Starboard gangway, there! side away
02246: to larboard—larboard gangway to starboard! Midships! midships!”
02247: 
02248: There was a low rumbling of heavy sea-boots among the benches, and a
02249: still slighter shuffling of women’s shoes, and all was quiet again, and
02250: every eye on the preacher.
02251: 
02252: He paused a little; then kneeling in the pulpit’s bows, folded his
02253: large brown hands across his chest, uplifted his closed eyes, and
02254: offered a prayer so deeply devout that he seemed kneeling and praying
02255: at the bottom of the sea.
02256: 
02257: This ended, in prolonged solemn tones, like the continual tolling of a
02258: bell in a ship that is foundering at sea in a fog—in such tones he
02259: commenced reading the following hymn; but changing his manner towards
02260: the concluding stanzas, burst forth with a pealing exultation and joy—
02261: 
02262: 
02263:   “The ribs and terrors in the whale, Arched over me a dismal gloom,
02264:   While all God’s sun-lit waves rolled by, And lift me deepening down
02265:   to doom.
02266: 
02267:   “I saw the opening maw of hell, With endless pains and sorrows there;
02268:   Which none but they that feel can tell— Oh, I was plunging to
02269:   despair.
02270: 
02271:   “In black distress, I called my God, When I could scarce believe him
02272:   mine, He bowed his ear to my complaints— No more the whale did me
02273:   confine.
02274: 
02275:   “With speed he flew to my relief, As on a radiant dolphin borne;
02276:   Awful, yet bright, as lightning shone The face of my Deliverer God.
02277: 
02278:   “My song for ever shall record That terrible, that joyful hour; I
02279:   give the glory to my God, His all the mercy and the power.”
02280: 
02281: 
02282: 
02283: 
02284: Nearly all joined in singing this hymn, which swelled high above the
02285: howling of the storm. A brief pause ensued; the preacher slowly turned
02286: over the leaves of the Bible, and at last, folding his hand down upon
02287: the proper page, said: “Beloved shipmates, clinch the last verse of the
02288: first chapter of Jonah—‘And God had prepared a great fish to swallow up
02289: Jonah.’”
02290: 
02291: “Shipmates, this book, containing only four chapters—four yarns—is one
02292: of the smallest strands in the mighty cable of the Scriptures. Yet what
02293: depths of the soul does Jonah’s deep sealine sound! what a pregnant
02294: lesson to us is this prophet! What a noble thing is that canticle in
02295: the fish’s belly! How billow-like and boisterously grand! We feel the
02296: floods surging over us; we sound with him to the kelpy bottom of the
02297: waters; sea-weed and all the slime of the sea is about us! But _what_
02298: is this lesson that the book of Jonah teaches? Shipmates, it is a
02299: two-stranded lesson; a lesson to us all as sinful men, and a lesson to
02300: me as a pilot of the living God. As sinful men, it is a lesson to us
02301: all, because it is a story of the sin, hard-heartedness, suddenly
02302: awakened fears, the swift punishment, repentance, prayers, and finally
02303: the deliverance and joy of Jonah. As with all sinners among men, the
02304: sin of this son of Amittai was in his wilful disobedience of the
02305: command of God—never mind now what that command was, or how
02306: conveyed—which he found a hard command. But all the things that God
02307: would have us do are hard for us to do—remember that—and hence, he
02308: oftener commands us than endeavors to persuade. And if we obey God, we
02309: must disobey ourselves; and it is in this disobeying ourselves, wherein
02310: the hardness of obeying God consists.
02311: 
02312: “With this sin of disobedience in him, Jonah still further flouts at
02313: God, by seeking to flee from Him. He thinks that a ship made by men
02314: will carry him into countries where God does not reign, but only the
02315: Captains of this earth. He skulks about the wharves of Joppa, and seeks
02316: a ship that’s bound for Tarshish. There lurks, perhaps, a hitherto
02317: unheeded meaning here. By all accounts Tarshish could have been no
02318: other city than the modern Cadiz. That’s the opinion of learned men.
02319: And where is Cadiz, shipmates? Cadiz is in Spain; as far by water, from
02320: Joppa, as Jonah could possibly have sailed in those ancient days, when
02321: the Atlantic was an almost unknown sea. Because Joppa, the modern
02322: Jaffa, shipmates, is on the most easterly coast of the Mediterranean,
02323: the Syrian; and Tarshish or Cadiz more than two thousand miles to the
02324: westward from that, just outside the Straits of Gibraltar. See ye not
02325: then, shipmates, that Jonah sought to flee world-wide from God?
02326: Miserable man! Oh! most contemptible and worthy of all scorn; with
02327: slouched hat and guilty eye, skulking from his God; prowling among the
02328: shipping like a vile burglar hastening to cross the seas. So
02329: disordered, self-condemning is his look, that had there been policemen
02330: in those days, Jonah, on the mere suspicion of something wrong, had
02331: been arrested ere he touched a deck. How plainly he’s a fugitive! no
02332: baggage, not a hat-box, valise, or carpet-bag,—no friends accompany him
02333: to the wharf with their adieux. At last, after much dodging search, he
02334: finds the Tarshish ship receiving the last items of her cargo; and as
02335: he steps on board to see its Captain in the cabin, all the sailors for
02336: the moment desist from hoisting in the goods, to mark the stranger’s
02337: evil eye. Jonah sees this; but in vain he tries to look all ease and
02338: confidence; in vain essays his wretched smile. Strong intuitions of the
02339: man assure the mariners he can be no innocent. In their gamesome but
02340: still serious way, one whispers to the other—“Jack, he’s robbed a
02341: widow;” or, “Joe, do you mark him; he’s a bigamist;” or, “Harry lad, I
02342: guess he’s the adulterer that broke jail in old Gomorrah, or belike,
02343: one of the missing murderers from Sodom.” Another runs to read the bill
02344: that’s stuck against the spile upon the wharf to which the ship is
02345: moored, offering five hundred gold coins for the apprehension of a
02346: parricide, and containing a description of his person. He reads, and
02347: looks from Jonah to the bill; while all his sympathetic shipmates now
02348: crowd round Jonah, prepared to lay their hands upon him. Frighted Jonah
02349: trembles, and summoning all his boldness to his face, only looks so
02350: much the more a coward. He will not confess himself suspected; but that
02351: itself is strong suspicion. So he makes the best of it; and when the
02352: sailors find him not to be the man that is advertised, they let him
02353: pass, and he descends into the cabin.
02354: 
02355: “‘Who’s there?’ cries the Captain at his busy desk, hurriedly making
02356: out his papers for the Customs—‘Who’s there?’ Oh! how that harmless
02357: question mangles Jonah! For the instant he almost turns to flee again.
02358: But he rallies. ‘I seek a passage in this ship to Tarshish; how soon
02359: sail ye, sir?’ Thus far the busy Captain had not looked up to Jonah,
02360: though the man now stands before him; but no sooner does he hear that
02361: hollow voice, than he darts a scrutinizing glance. ‘We sail with the
02362: next coming tide,’ at last he slowly answered, still intently eyeing
02363: him. ‘No sooner, sir?’—‘Soon enough for any honest man that goes a
02364: passenger.’ Ha! Jonah, that’s another stab. But he swiftly calls away
02365: the Captain from that scent. ‘I’ll sail with ye,’—he says,—‘the passage
02366: money how much is that?—I’ll pay now.’ For it is particularly written,
02367: shipmates, as if it were a thing not to be overlooked in this history,
02368: ‘that he paid the fare thereof’ ere the craft did sail. And taken with
02369: the context, this is full of meaning.
02370: 
02371: “Now Jonah’s Captain, shipmates, was one whose discernment detects
02372: crime in any, but whose cupidity exposes it only in the penniless. In
02373: this world, shipmates, sin that pays its way can travel freely, and
02374: without a passport; whereas Virtue, if a pauper, is stopped at all
02375: frontiers. So Jonah’s Captain prepares to test the length of Jonah’s
02376: purse, ere he judge him openly. He charges him thrice the usual sum;
02377: and it’s assented to. Then the Captain knows that Jonah is a fugitive;
02378: but at the same time resolves to help a flight that paves its rear with
02379: gold. Yet when Jonah fairly takes out his purse, prudent suspicions
02380: still molest the Captain. He rings every coin to find a counterfeit.
02381: Not a forger, any way, he mutters; and Jonah is put down for his
02382: passage. ‘Point out my state-room, Sir,’ says Jonah now, ‘I’m
02383: travel-weary; I need sleep.’ ‘Thou lookest like it,’ says the Captain,
02384: ‘there’s thy room.’ Jonah enters, and would lock the door, but the lock
02385: contains no key. Hearing him foolishly fumbling there, the Captain
02386: laughs lowly to himself, and mutters something about the doors of
02387: convicts’ cells being never allowed to be locked within. All dressed
02388: and dusty as he is, Jonah throws himself into his berth, and finds the
02389: little state-room ceiling almost resting on his forehead. The air is
02390: close, and Jonah gasps. Then, in that contracted hole, sunk, too,
02391: beneath the ship’s water-line, Jonah feels the heralding presentiment
02392: of that stifling hour, when the whale shall hold him in the smallest of
02393: his bowels’ wards.
02394: 
02395: “Screwed at its axis against the side, a swinging lamp slightly
02396: oscillates in Jonah’s room; and the ship, heeling over towards the
02397: wharf with the weight of the last bales received, the lamp, flame and
02398: all, though in slight motion, still maintains a permanent obliquity
02399: with reference to the room; though, in truth, infallibly straight
02400: itself, it but made obvious the false, lying levels among which it
02401: hung. The lamp alarms and frightens Jonah; as lying in his berth his
02402: tormented eyes roll round the place, and this thus far successful
02403: fugitive finds no refuge for his restless glance. But that
02404: contradiction in the lamp more and more appals him. The floor, the
02405: ceiling, and the side, are all awry. ‘Oh! so my conscience hangs in
02406: me!’ he groans, ‘straight upwards, so it burns; but the chambers of my
02407: soul are all in crookedness!’
02408: 
02409: “Like one who after a night of drunken revelry hies to his bed, still
02410: reeling, but with conscience yet pricking him, as the plungings of the
02411: Roman race-horse but so much the more strike his steel tags into him;
02412: as one who in that miserable plight still turns and turns in giddy
02413: anguish, praying God for annihilation until the fit be passed; and at
02414: last amid the whirl of woe he feels, a deep stupor steals over him, as
02415: over the man who bleeds to death, for conscience is the wound, and
02416: there’s naught to staunch it; so, after sore wrestlings in his berth,
02417: Jonah’s prodigy of ponderous misery drags him drowning down to sleep.
02418: 
02419: “And now the time of tide has come; the ship casts off her cables; and
02420: from the deserted wharf the uncheered ship for Tarshish, all careening,
02421: glides to sea. That ship, my friends, was the first of recorded
02422: smugglers! the contraband was Jonah. But the sea rebels; he will not
02423: bear the wicked burden. A dreadful storm comes on, the ship is like to
02424: break. But now when the boatswain calls all hands to lighten her; when
02425: boxes, bales, and jars are clattering overboard; when the wind is
02426: shrieking, and the men are yelling, and every plank thunders with
02427: trampling feet right over Jonah’s head; in all this raging tumult,
02428: Jonah sleeps his hideous sleep. He sees no black sky and raging sea,
02429: feels not the reeling timbers, and little hears he or heeds he the far
02430: rush of the mighty whale, which even now with open mouth is cleaving
02431: the seas after him. Aye, shipmates, Jonah was gone down into the sides
02432: of the ship—a berth in the cabin as I have taken it, and was fast
02433: asleep. But the frightened master comes to him, and shrieks in his dead
02434: ear, ‘What meanest thou, O, sleeper! arise!’ Startled from his lethargy
02435: by that direful cry, Jonah staggers to his feet, and stumbling to the
02436: deck, grasps a shroud, to look out upon the sea. But at that moment he
02437: is sprung upon by a panther billow leaping over the bulwarks. Wave
02438: after wave thus leaps into the ship, and finding no speedy vent runs
02439: roaring fore and aft, till the mariners come nigh to drowning while yet
02440: afloat. And ever, as the white moon shows her affrighted face from the
02441: steep gullies in the blackness overhead, aghast Jonah sees the rearing
02442: bowsprit pointing high upward, but soon beat downward again towards the
02443: tormented deep.
02444: 
02445: “Terrors upon terrors run shouting through his soul. In all his
02446: cringing attitudes, the God-fugitive is now too plainly known. The
02447: sailors mark him; more and more certain grow their suspicions of him,
02448: and at last, fully to test the truth, by referring the whole matter to
02449: high Heaven, they fall to casting lots, to see for whose cause this
02450: great tempest was upon them. The lot is Jonah’s; that discovered, then
02451: how furiously they mob him with their questions. ‘What is thine
02452: occupation? Whence comest thou? Thy country? What people? But mark now,
02453: my shipmates, the behavior of poor Jonah. The eager mariners but ask
02454: him who he is, and where from; whereas, they not only receive an answer
02455: to those questions, but likewise another answer to a question not put
02456: by them, but the unsolicited answer is forced from Jonah by the hard
02457: hand of God that is upon him.
02458: 
02459: “‘I am a Hebrew,’ he cries—and then—‘I fear the Lord the God of Heaven
02460: who hath made the sea and the dry land!’ Fear him, O Jonah? Aye, well
02461: mightest thou fear the Lord God _then!_ Straightway, he now goes on to
02462: make a full confession; whereupon the mariners became more and more
02463: appalled, but still are pitiful. For when Jonah, not yet supplicating
02464: God for mercy, since he but too well knew the darkness of his
02465: deserts,—when wretched Jonah cries out to them to take him and cast him
02466: forth into the sea, for he knew that for _his_ sake this great tempest
02467: was upon them; they mercifully turn from him, and seek by other means
02468: to save the ship. But all in vain; the indignant gale howls louder;
02469: then, with one hand raised invokingly to God, with the other they not
02470: unreluctantly lay hold of Jonah.
02471: 
02472: “And now behold Jonah taken up as an anchor and dropped into the sea;
02473: when instantly an oily calmness floats out from the east, and the sea
02474: is still, as Jonah carries down the gale with him, leaving smooth water
02475: behind. He goes down in the whirling heart of such a masterless
02476: commotion that he scarce heeds the moment when he drops seething into
02477: the yawning jaws awaiting him; and the whale shoots-to all his ivory
02478: teeth, like so many white bolts, upon his prison. Then Jonah prayed
02479: unto the Lord out of the fish’s belly. But observe his prayer, and
02480: learn a weighty lesson. For sinful as he is, Jonah does not weep and
02481: wail for direct deliverance. He feels that his dreadful punishment is
02482: just. He leaves all his deliverance to God, contenting himself with
02483: this, that spite of all his pains and pangs, he will still look towards
02484: His holy temple. And here, shipmates, is true and faithful repentance;
02485: not clamorous for pardon, but grateful for punishment. And how pleasing
02486: to God was this conduct in Jonah, is shown in the eventual deliverance
02487: of him from the sea and the whale. Shipmates, I do not place Jonah
02488: before you to be copied for his sin but I do place him before you as a
02489: model for repentance. Sin not; but if you do, take heed to repent of it
02490: like Jonah.”
02491: 
02492: While he was speaking these words, the howling of the shrieking,
02493: slanting storm without seemed to add new power to the preacher, who,
02494: when describing Jonah’s sea-storm, seemed tossed by a storm himself.
02495: His deep chest heaved as with a ground-swell; his tossed arms seemed
02496: the warring elements at work; and the thunders that rolled away from
02497: off his swarthy brow, and the light leaping from his eye, made all his
02498: simple hearers look on him with a quick fear that was strange to them.
02499: 
02500: There now came a lull in his look, as he silently turned over the
02501: leaves of the Book once more; and, at last, standing motionless, with
02502: closed eyes, for the moment, seemed communing with God and himself.
02503: 
02504: But again he leaned over towards the people, and bowing his head lowly,
02505: with an aspect of the deepest yet manliest humility, he spake these
02506: words:
02507: 
02508: “Shipmates, God has laid but one hand upon you; both his hands press
02509: upon me. I have read ye by what murky light may be mine the lesson that
02510: Jonah teaches to all sinners; and therefore to ye, and still more to
02511: me, for I am a greater sinner than ye. And now how gladly would I come
02512: down from this mast-head and sit on the hatches there where you sit,
02513: and listen as you listen, while some one of you reads _me_ that other
02514: and more awful lesson which Jonah teaches to _me_, as a pilot of the
02515: living God. How being an anointed pilot-prophet, or speaker of true
02516: things, and bidden by the Lord to sound those unwelcome truths in the
02517: ears of a wicked Nineveh, Jonah, appalled at the hostility he should
02518: raise, fled from his mission, and sought to escape his duty and his God
02519: by taking ship at Joppa. But God is everywhere; Tarshish he never
02520: reached. As we have seen, God came upon him in the whale, and swallowed
02521: him down to living gulfs of doom, and with swift slantings tore him
02522: along ‘into the midst of the seas,’ where the eddying depths sucked him
02523: ten thousand fathoms down, and ‘the weeds were wrapped about his head,’
02524: and all the watery world of woe bowled over him. Yet even then beyond
02525: the reach of any plummet—‘out of the belly of hell’—when the whale
02526: grounded upon the ocean’s utmost bones, even then, God heard the
02527: engulphed, repenting prophet when he cried. Then God spake unto the
02528: fish; and from the shuddering cold and blackness of the sea, the whale
02529: came breeching up towards the warm and pleasant sun, and all the
02530: delights of air and earth; and ‘vomited out Jonah upon the dry land;’
02531: when the word of the Lord came a second time; and Jonah, bruised and
02532: beaten—his ears, like two sea-shells, still multitudinously murmuring
02533: of the ocean—Jonah did the Almighty’s bidding. And what was that,
02534: shipmates? To preach the Truth to the face of Falsehood! That was it!
02535: 
02536: “This, shipmates, this is that other lesson; and woe to that pilot of
02537: the living God who slights it. Woe to him whom this world charms from
02538: Gospel duty! Woe to him who seeks to pour oil upon the waters when God
02539: has brewed them into a gale! Woe to him who seeks to please rather than
02540: to appal! Woe to him whose good name is more to him than goodness! Woe
02541: to him who, in this world, courts not dishonor! Woe to him who would
02542: not be true, even though to be false were salvation! Yea, woe to him
02543: who, as the great Pilot Paul has it, while preaching to others is
02544: himself a castaway!”
02545: 
02546: He dropped and fell away from himself for a moment; then lifting his
02547: face to them again, showed a deep joy in his eyes, as he cried out with
02548: a heavenly enthusiasm,—“But oh! shipmates! on the starboard hand of
02549: every woe, there is a sure delight; and higher the top of that delight,
02550: than the bottom of the woe is deep. Is not the main-truck higher than
02551: the kelson is low? Delight is to him—a far, far upward, and inward
02552: delight—who against the proud gods and commodores of this earth, ever
02553: stands forth his own inexorable self. Delight is to him whose strong
02554: arms yet support him, when the ship of this base treacherous world has
02555: gone down beneath him. Delight is to him, who gives no quarter in the
02556: truth, and kills, burns, and destroys all sin though he pluck it out
02557: from under the robes of Senators and Judges. Delight,—top-gallant
02558: delight is to him, who acknowledges no law or lord, but the Lord his
02559: God, and is only a patriot to heaven. Delight is to him, whom all the
02560: waves of the billows of the seas of the boisterous mob can never shake
02561: from this sure Keel of the Ages. And eternal delight and deliciousness
02562: will be his, who coming to lay him down, can say with his final
02563: breath—O Father!—chiefly known to me by Thy rod—mortal or immortal,
02564: here I die. I have striven to be Thine, more than to be this world’s,
02565: or mine own. Yet this is nothing: I leave eternity to Thee; for what is
02566: man that he should live out the lifetime of his God?”
02567: 
02568: He said no more, but slowly waving a benediction, covered his face with
02569: his hands, and so remained kneeling, till all the people had departed,
02570: and he was left alone in the place.
02571: 
02572: 
02573: CHAPTER 10. A Bosom Friend.
02574: 
02575: Returning to the Spouter-Inn from the Chapel, I found Queequeg there
02576: quite alone; he having left the Chapel before the benediction some
02577: time. He was sitting on a bench before the fire, with his feet on the
02578: stove hearth, and in one hand was holding close up to his face that
02579: little negro idol of his; peering hard into its face, and with a
02580: jack-knife gently whittling away at its nose, meanwhile humming to
02581: himself in his heathenish way.
02582: 
02583: But being now interrupted, he put up the image; and pretty soon, going
02584: to the table, took up a large book there, and placing it on his lap
02585: began counting the pages with deliberate regularity; at every fiftieth
02586: page—as I fancied—stopping a moment, looking vacantly around him, and
02587: giving utterance to a long-drawn gurgling whistle of astonishment. He
02588: would then begin again at the next fifty; seeming to commence at number
02589: one each time, as though he could not count more than fifty, and it was
02590: only by such a large number of fifties being found together, that his
02591: astonishment at the multitude of pages was excited.
02592: 
02593: With much interest I sat watching him. Savage though he was, and
02594: hideously marred about the face—at least to my taste—his countenance
02595: yet had a something in it which was by no means disagreeable. You
02596: cannot hide the soul. Through all his unearthly tattooings, I thought I
02597: saw the traces of a simple honest heart; and in his large, deep eyes,
02598: fiery black and bold, there seemed tokens of a spirit that would dare a
02599: thousand devils. And besides all this, there was a certain lofty
02600: bearing about the Pagan, which even his uncouthness could not
02601: altogether maim. He looked like a man who had never cringed and never
02602: had had a creditor. Whether it was, too, that his head being shaved,
02603: his forehead was drawn out in freer and brighter relief, and looked
02604: more expansive than it otherwise would, this I will not venture to
02605: decide; but certain it was his head was phrenologically an excellent
02606: one. It may seem ridiculous, but it reminded me of General Washington’s
02607: head, as seen in the popular busts of him. It had the same long
02608: regularly graded retreating slope from above the brows, which were
02609: likewise very projecting, like two long promontories thickly wooded on
02610: top. Queequeg was George Washington cannibalistically developed.
02611: 
02612: Whilst I was thus closely scanning him, half-pretending meanwhile to be
02613: looking out at the storm from the casement, he never heeded my
02614: presence, never troubled himself with so much as a single glance; but
02615: appeared wholly occupied with counting the pages of the marvellous
02616: book. Considering how sociably we had been sleeping together the night
02617: previous, and especially considering the affectionate arm I had found
02618: thrown over me upon waking in the morning, I thought this indifference
02619: of his very strange. But savages are strange beings; at times you do
02620: not know exactly how to take them. At first they are overawing; their
02621: calm self-collectedness of simplicity seems a Socratic wisdom. I had
02622: noticed also that Queequeg never consorted at all, or but very little,
02623: with the other seamen in the inn. He made no advances whatever;
02624: appeared to have no desire to enlarge the circle of his acquaintances.
02625: All this struck me as mighty singular; yet, upon second thoughts, there
02626: was something almost sublime in it. Here was a man some twenty thousand
02627: miles from home, by the way of Cape Horn, that is—which was the only
02628: way he could get there—thrown among people as strange to him as though
02629: he were in the planet Jupiter; and yet he seemed entirely at his ease;
02630: preserving the utmost serenity; content with his own companionship;
02631: always equal to himself. Surely this was a touch of fine philosophy;
02632: though no doubt he had never heard there was such a thing as that. But,
02633: perhaps, to be true philosophers, we mortals should not be conscious of
02634: so living or so striving. So soon as I hear that such or such a man
02635: gives himself out for a philosopher, I conclude that, like the
02636: dyspeptic old woman, he must have “broken his digester.”
02637: 
02638: As I sat there in that now lonely room; the fire burning low, in that
02639: mild stage when, after its first intensity has warmed the air, it then
02640: only glows to be looked at; the evening shades and phantoms gathering
02641: round the casements, and peering in upon us silent, solitary twain; the
02642: storm booming without in solemn swells; I began to be sensible of
02643: strange feelings. I felt a melting in me. No more my splintered heart
02644: and maddened hand were turned against the wolfish world. This soothing
02645: savage had redeemed it. There he sat, his very indifference speaking a
02646: nature in which there lurked no civilized hypocrisies and bland
02647: deceits. Wild he was; a very sight of sights to see; yet I began to
02648: feel myself mysteriously drawn towards him. And those same things that
02649: would have repelled most others, they were the very magnets that thus
02650: drew me. I’ll try a pagan friend, thought I, since Christian kindness
02651: has proved but hollow courtesy. I drew my bench near him, and made some
02652: friendly signs and hints, doing my best to talk with him meanwhile. At
02653: first he little noticed these advances; but presently, upon my
02654: referring to his last night’s hospitalities, he made out to ask me
02655: whether we were again to be bedfellows. I told him yes; whereat I
02656: thought he looked pleased, perhaps a little complimented.
02657: 
02658: We then turned over the book together, and I endeavored to explain to
02659: him the purpose of the printing, and the meaning of the few pictures
02660: that were in it. Thus I soon engaged his interest; and from that we
02661: went to jabbering the best we could about the various outer sights to
02662: be seen in this famous town. Soon I proposed a social smoke; and,
02663: producing his pouch and tomahawk, he quietly offered me a puff. And
02664: then we sat exchanging puffs from that wild pipe of his, and keeping it
02665: regularly passing between us.
02666: 
02667: If there yet lurked any ice of indifference towards me in the Pagan’s
02668: breast, this pleasant, genial smoke we had, soon thawed it out, and
02669: left us cronies. He seemed to take to me quite as naturally and
02670: unbiddenly as I to him; and when our smoke was over, he pressed his
02671: forehead against mine, clasped me round the waist, and said that
02672: henceforth we were married; meaning, in his country’s phrase, that we
02673: were bosom friends; he would gladly die for me, if need should be. In a
02674: countryman, this sudden flame of friendship would have seemed far too
02675: premature, a thing to be much distrusted; but in this simple savage
02676: those old rules would not apply.
02677: 
02678: After supper, and another social chat and smoke, we went to our room
02679: together. He made me a present of his embalmed head; took out his
02680: enormous tobacco wallet, and groping under the tobacco, drew out some
02681: thirty dollars in silver; then spreading them on the table, and
02682: mechanically dividing them into two equal portions, pushed one of them
02683: towards me, and said it was mine. I was going to remonstrate; but he
02684: silenced me by pouring them into my trowsers’ pockets. I let them stay.
02685: He then went about his evening prayers, took out his idol, and removed
02686: the paper fireboard. By certain signs and symptoms, I thought he seemed
02687: anxious for me to join him; but well knowing what was to follow, I
02688: deliberated a moment whether, in case he invited me, I would comply or
02689: otherwise.
02690: 
02691: I was a good Christian; born and bred in the bosom of the infallible
02692: Presbyterian Church. How then could I unite with this wild idolator in
02693: worshipping his piece of wood? But what is worship? thought I. Do you
02694: suppose now, Ishmael, that the magnanimous God of heaven and
02695: earth—pagans and all included—can possibly be jealous of an
02696: insignificant bit of black wood? Impossible! But what is worship?—to do
02697: the will of God—_that_ is worship. And what is the will of God?—to do
02698: to my fellow man what I would have my fellow man to do to me—_that_ is
02699: the will of God. Now, Queequeg is my fellow man. And what do I wish
02700: that this Queequeg would do to me? Why, unite with me in my particular
02701: Presbyterian form of worship. Consequently, I must then unite with him
02702: in his; ergo, I must turn idolator. So I kindled the shavings; helped
02703: prop up the innocent little idol; offered him burnt biscuit with
02704: Queequeg; salamed before him twice or thrice; kissed his nose; and that
02705: done, we undressed and went to bed, at peace with our own consciences
02706: and all the world. But we did not go to sleep without some little chat.
02707: 
02708: How it is I know not; but there is no place like a bed for confidential
02709: disclosures between friends. Man and wife, they say, there open the
02710: very bottom of their souls to each other; and some old couples often
02711: lie and chat over old times till nearly morning. Thus, then, in our
02712: hearts’ honeymoon, lay I and Queequeg—a cosy, loving pair.
02713: 
02714: 
02715: CHAPTER 11. Nightgown.
02716: 
02717: We had lain thus in bed, chatting and napping at short intervals, and
02718: Queequeg now and then affectionately throwing his brown tattooed legs
02719: over mine, and then drawing them back; so entirely sociable and free
02720: and easy were we; when, at last, by reason of our confabulations, what
02721: little nappishness remained in us altogether departed, and we felt like
02722: getting up again, though day-break was yet some way down the future.
02723: 
02724: Yes, we became very wakeful; so much so that our recumbent position
02725: began to grow wearisome, and by little and little we found ourselves
02726: sitting up; the clothes well tucked around us, leaning against the
02727: head-board with our four knees drawn up close together, and our two
02728: noses bending over them, as if our kneepans were warming-pans. We felt
02729: very nice and snug, the more so since it was so chilly out of doors;
02730: indeed out of bed-clothes too, seeing that there was no fire in the
02731: room. The more so, I say, because truly to enjoy bodily warmth, some
02732: small part of you must be cold, for there is no quality in this world
02733: that is not what it is merely by contrast. Nothing exists in itself. If
02734: you flatter yourself that you are all over comfortable, and have been
02735: so a long time, then you cannot be said to be comfortable any more. But
02736: if, like Queequeg and me in the bed, the tip of your nose or the crown
02737: of your head be slightly chilled, why then, indeed, in the general
02738: consciousness you feel most delightfully and unmistakably warm. For
02739: this reason a sleeping apartment should never be furnished with a fire,
02740: which is one of the luxurious discomforts of the rich. For the height
02741: of this sort of deliciousness is to have nothing but the blanket
02742: between you and your snugness and the cold of the outer air. Then there
02743: you lie like the one warm spark in the heart of an arctic crystal.
02744: 
02745: We had been sitting in this crouching manner for some time, when all at
02746: once I thought I would open my eyes; for when between sheets, whether
02747: by day or by night, and whether asleep or awake, I have a way of always
02748: keeping my eyes shut, in order the more to concentrate the snugness of
02749: being in bed. Because no man can ever feel his own identity aright
02750: except his eyes be closed; as if darkness were indeed the proper
02751: element of our essences, though light be more congenial to our clayey
02752: part. Upon opening my eyes then, and coming out of my own pleasant and
02753: self-created darkness into the imposed and coarse outer gloom of the
02754: unilluminated twelve-o’clock-at-night, I experienced a disagreeable
02755: revulsion. Nor did I at all object to the hint from Queequeg that
02756: perhaps it were best to strike a light, seeing that we were so wide
02757: awake; and besides he felt a strong desire to have a few quiet puffs
02758: from his Tomahawk. Be it said, that though I had felt such a strong
02759: repugnance to his smoking in the bed the night before, yet see how
02760: elastic our stiff prejudices grow when love once comes to bend them.
02761: For now I liked nothing better than to have Queequeg smoking by me,
02762: even in bed, because he seemed to be full of such serene household joy
02763: then. I no more felt unduly concerned for the landlord’s policy of
02764: insurance. I was only alive to the condensed confidential
02765: comfortableness of sharing a pipe and a blanket with a real friend.
02766: With our shaggy jackets drawn about our shoulders, we now passed the
02767: Tomahawk from one to the other, till slowly there grew over us a blue
02768: hanging tester of smoke, illuminated by the flame of the new-lit lamp.
02769: 
02770: Whether it was that this undulating tester rolled the savage away to
02771: far distant scenes, I know not, but he now spoke of his native island;
02772: and, eager to hear his history, I begged him to go on and tell it. He
02773: gladly complied. Though at the time I but ill comprehended not a few of
02774: his words, yet subsequent disclosures, when I had become more familiar
02775: with his broken phraseology, now enable me to present the whole story
02776: such as it may prove in the mere skeleton I give.
02777: 
02778: 
02779: CHAPTER 12. Biographical.
02780: 
02781: Queequeg was a native of Rokovoko, an island far away to the West and
02782: South. It is not down in any map; true places never are.
02783: 
02784: When a new-hatched savage running wild about his native woodlands in a
02785: grass clout, followed by the nibbling goats, as if he were a green
02786: sapling; even then, in Queequeg’s ambitious soul, lurked a strong
02787: desire to see something more of Christendom than a specimen whaler or
02788: two. His father was a High Chief, a King; his uncle a High Priest; and
02789: on the maternal side he boasted aunts who were the wives of
02790: unconquerable warriors. There was excellent blood in his veins—royal
02791: stuff; though sadly vitiated, I fear, by the cannibal propensity he
02792: nourished in his untutored youth.
02793: 
02794: A Sag Harbor ship visited his father’s bay, and Queequeg sought a
02795: passage to Christian lands. But the ship, having her full complement of
02796: seamen, spurned his suit; and not all the King his father’s influence
02797: could prevail. But Queequeg vowed a vow. Alone in his canoe, he paddled
02798: off to a distant strait, which he knew the ship must pass through when
02799: she quitted the island. On one side was a coral reef; on the other a
02800: low tongue of land, covered with mangrove thickets that grew out into
02801: the water. Hiding his canoe, still afloat, among these thickets, with
02802: its prow seaward, he sat down in the stern, paddle low in hand; and
02803: when the ship was gliding by, like a flash he darted out; gained her
02804: side; with one backward dash of his foot capsized and sank his canoe;
02805: climbed up the chains; and throwing himself at full length upon the
02806: deck, grappled a ring-bolt there, and swore not to let it go, though
02807: hacked in pieces.
02808: 
02809: In vain the captain threatened to throw him overboard; suspended a
02810: cutlass over his naked wrists; Queequeg was the son of a King, and
02811: Queequeg budged not. Struck by his desperate dauntlessness, and his
02812: wild desire to visit Christendom, the captain at last relented, and
02813: told him he might make himself at home. But this fine young savage—this
02814: sea Prince of Wales, never saw the Captain’s cabin. They put him down
02815: among the sailors, and made a whaleman of him. But like Czar Peter
02816: content to toil in the shipyards of foreign cities, Queequeg disdained
02817: no seeming ignominy, if thereby he might happily gain the power of
02818: enlightening his untutored countrymen. For at bottom—so he told me—he
02819: was actuated by a profound desire to learn among the Christians, the
02820: arts whereby to make his people still happier than they were; and more
02821: than that, still better than they were. But, alas! the practices of
02822: whalemen soon convinced him that even Christians could be both
02823: miserable and wicked; infinitely more so, than all his father’s
02824: heathens. Arrived at last in old Sag Harbor; and seeing what the
02825: sailors did there; and then going on to Nantucket, and seeing how they
02826: spent their wages in _that_ place also, poor Queequeg gave it up for
02827: lost. Thought he, it’s a wicked world in all meridians; I’ll die a
02828: pagan.
02829: 
02830: And thus an old idolator at heart, he yet lived among these Christians,
02831: wore their clothes, and tried to talk their gibberish. Hence the queer
02832: ways about him, though now some time from home.
02833: 
02834: By hints, I asked him whether he did not propose going back, and having
02835: a coronation; since he might now consider his father dead and gone, he
02836: being very old and feeble at the last accounts. He answered no, not
02837: yet; and added that he was fearful Christianity, or rather Christians,
02838: had unfitted him for ascending the pure and undefiled throne of thirty
02839: pagan Kings before him. But by and by, he said, he would return,—as
02840: soon as he felt himself baptized again. For the nonce, however, he
02841: proposed to sail about, and sow his wild oats in all four oceans. They
02842: had made a harpooneer of him, and that barbed iron was in lieu of a
02843: sceptre now.
02844: 
02845: I asked him what might be his immediate purpose, touching his future
02846: movements. He answered, to go to sea again, in his old vocation. Upon
02847: this, I told him that whaling was my own design, and informed him of my
02848: intention to sail out of Nantucket, as being the most promising port
02849: for an adventurous whaleman to embark from. He at once resolved to
02850: accompany me to that island, ship aboard the same vessel, get into the
02851: same watch, the same boat, the same mess with me, in short to share my
02852: every hap; with both my hands in his, boldly dip into the Potluck of
02853: both worlds. To all this I joyously assented; for besides the affection
02854: I now felt for Queequeg, he was an experienced harpooneer, and as such,
02855: could not fail to be of great usefulness to one, who, like me, was
02856: wholly ignorant of the mysteries of whaling, though well acquainted
02857: with the sea, as known to merchant seamen.
02858: 
02859: His story being ended with his pipe’s last dying puff, Queequeg
02860: embraced me, pressed his forehead against mine, and blowing out the
02861: light, we rolled over from each other, this way and that, and very soon
02862: were sleeping.
02863: 
02864: 
02865: CHAPTER 13. Wheelbarrow.
02866: 
02867: Next morning, Monday, after disposing of the embalmed head to a barber,
02868: for a block, I settled my own and comrade’s bill; using, however, my
02869: comrade’s money. The grinning landlord, as well as the boarders, seemed
02870: amazingly tickled at the sudden friendship which had sprung up between
02871: me and Queequeg—especially as Peter Coffin’s cock and bull stories
02872: about him had previously so much alarmed me concerning the very person
02873: whom I now companied with.
02874: 
02875: We borrowed a wheelbarrow, and embarking our things, including my own
02876: poor carpet-bag, and Queequeg’s canvas sack and hammock, away we went
02877: down to “the Moss,” the little Nantucket packet schooner moored at the
02878: wharf. As we were going along the people stared; not at Queequeg so
02879: much—for they were used to seeing cannibals like him in their
02880: streets,—but at seeing him and me upon such confidential terms. But we
02881: heeded them not, going along wheeling the barrow by turns, and Queequeg
02882: now and then stopping to adjust the sheath on his harpoon barbs. I
02883: asked him why he carried such a troublesome thing with him ashore, and
02884: whether all whaling ships did not find their own harpoons. To this, in
02885: substance, he replied, that though what I hinted was true enough, yet
02886: he had a particular affection for his own harpoon, because it was of
02887: assured stuff, well tried in many a mortal combat, and deeply intimate
02888: with the hearts of whales. In short, like many inland reapers and
02889: mowers, who go into the farmers’ meadows armed with their own
02890: scythes—though in no wise obliged to furnish them—even so, Queequeg,
02891: for his own private reasons, preferred his own harpoon.
02892: 
02893: Shifting the barrow from my hand to his, he told me a funny story about
02894: the first wheelbarrow he had ever seen. It was in Sag Harbor. The
02895: owners of his ship, it seems, had lent him one, in which to carry his
02896: heavy chest to his boarding house. Not to seem ignorant about the
02897: thing—though in truth he was entirely so, concerning the precise way in
02898: which to manage the barrow—Queequeg puts his chest upon it; lashes it
02899: fast; and then shoulders the barrow and marches up the wharf. “Why,”
02900: said I, “Queequeg, you might have known better than that, one would
02901: think. Didn’t the people laugh?”
02902: 
02903: Upon this, he told me another story. The people of his island of
02904: Rokovoko, it seems, at their wedding feasts express the fragrant water
02905: of young cocoanuts into a large stained calabash like a punchbowl; and
02906: this punchbowl always forms the great central ornament on the braided
02907: mat where the feast is held. Now a certain grand merchant ship once
02908: touched at Rokovoko, and its commander—from all accounts, a very
02909: stately punctilious gentleman, at least for a sea captain—this
02910: commander was invited to the wedding feast of Queequeg’s sister, a
02911: pretty young princess just turned of ten. Well; when all the wedding
02912: guests were assembled at the bride’s bamboo cottage, this Captain
02913: marches in, and being assigned the post of honor, placed himself over
02914: against the punchbowl, and between the High Priest and his majesty the
02915: King, Queequeg’s father. Grace being said,—for those people have their
02916: grace as well as we—though Queequeg told me that unlike us, who at such
02917: times look downwards to our platters, they, on the contrary, copying
02918: the ducks, glance upwards to the great Giver of all feasts—Grace, I
02919: say, being said, the High Priest opens the banquet by the immemorial
02920: ceremony of the island; that is, dipping his consecrated and
02921: consecrating fingers into the bowl before the blessed beverage
02922: circulates. Seeing himself placed next the Priest, and noting the
02923: ceremony, and thinking himself—being Captain of a ship—as having plain
02924: precedence over a mere island King, especially in the King’s own
02925: house—the Captain coolly proceeds to wash his hands in the
02926: punchbowl;—taking it I suppose for a huge finger-glass. “Now,” said
02927: Queequeg, “what you tink now?—Didn’t our people laugh?”
02928: 
02929: At last, passage paid, and luggage safe, we stood on board the
02930: schooner. Hoisting sail, it glided down the Acushnet river. On one
02931: side, New Bedford rose in terraces of streets, their ice-covered trees
02932: all glittering in the clear, cold air. Huge hills and mountains of
02933: casks on casks were piled upon her wharves, and side by side the
02934: world-wandering whale ships lay silent and safely moored at last; while
02935: from others came a sound of carpenters and coopers, with blended noises
02936: of fires and forges to melt the pitch, all betokening that new cruises
02937: were on the start; that one most perilous and long voyage ended, only
02938: begins a second; and a second ended, only begins a third, and so on,
02939: for ever and for aye. Such is the endlessness, yea, the intolerableness
02940: of all earthly effort.
02941: 
02942: Gaining the more open water, the bracing breeze waxed fresh; the little
02943: Moss tossed the quick foam from her bows, as a young colt his
02944: snortings. How I snuffed that Tartar air!—how I spurned that turnpike
02945: earth!—that common highway all over dented with the marks of slavish
02946: heels and hoofs; and turned me to admire the magnanimity of the sea
02947: which will permit no records.
02948: 
02949: At the same foam-fountain, Queequeg seemed to drink and reel with me.
02950: His dusky nostrils swelled apart; he showed his filed and pointed
02951: teeth. On, on we flew; and our offing gained, the Moss did homage to
02952: the blast; ducked and dived her bows as a slave before the Sultan.
02953: Sideways leaning, we sideways darted; every ropeyarn tingling like a
02954: wire; the two tall masts buckling like Indian canes in land tornadoes.
02955: So full of this reeling scene were we, as we stood by the plunging
02956: bowsprit, that for some time we did not notice the jeering glances of
02957: the passengers, a lubber-like assembly, who marvelled that two fellow
02958: beings should be so companionable; as though a white man were anything
02959: more dignified than a whitewashed negro. But there were some boobies
02960: and bumpkins there, who, by their intense greenness, must have come
02961: from the heart and centre of all verdure. Queequeg caught one of these
02962: young saplings mimicking him behind his back. I thought the bumpkin’s
02963: hour of doom was come. Dropping his harpoon, the brawny savage caught
02964: him in his arms, and by an almost miraculous dexterity and strength,
02965: sent him high up bodily into the air; then slightly tapping his stern
02966: in mid-somerset, the fellow landed with bursting lungs upon his feet,
02967: while Queequeg, turning his back upon him, lighted his tomahawk pipe
02968: and passed it to me for a puff.
02969: 
02970: “Capting! Capting!” yelled the bumpkin, running towards that officer;
02971: “Capting, Capting, here’s the devil.”
02972: 
02973: “Hallo, _you_ sir,” cried the Captain, a gaunt rib of the sea, stalking
02974: up to Queequeg, “what in thunder do you mean by that? Don’t you know
02975: you might have killed that chap?”
02976: 
02977: “What him say?” said Queequeg, as he mildly turned to me.
02978: 
02979: “He say,” said I, “that you came near kill-e that man there,” pointing
02980: to the still shivering greenhorn.
02981: 
02982: “Kill-e,” cried Queequeg, twisting his tattooed face into an unearthly
02983: expression of disdain, “ah! him bevy small-e fish-e; Queequeg no kill-e
02984: so small-e fish-e; Queequeg kill-e big whale!”
02985: 
02986: “Look you,” roared the Captain, “I’ll kill-e _you_, you cannibal, if
02987: you try any more of your tricks aboard here; so mind your eye.”
02988: 
02989: But it so happened just then, that it was high time for the Captain to
02990: mind his own eye. The prodigious strain upon the main-sail had parted
02991: the weather-sheet, and the tremendous boom was now flying from side to
02992: side, completely sweeping the entire after part of the deck. The poor
02993: fellow whom Queequeg had handled so roughly, was swept overboard; all
02994: hands were in a panic; and to attempt snatching at the boom to stay it,
02995: seemed madness. It flew from right to left, and back again, almost in
02996: one ticking of a watch, and every instant seemed on the point of
02997: snapping into splinters. Nothing was done, and nothing seemed capable
02998: of being done; those on deck rushed towards the bows, and stood eyeing
02999: the boom as if it were the lower jaw of an exasperated whale. In the
03000: midst of this consternation, Queequeg dropped deftly to his knees, and
03001: crawling under the path of the boom, whipped hold of a rope, secured
03002: one end to the bulwarks, and then flinging the other like a lasso,
03003: caught it round the boom as it swept over his head, and at the next
03004: jerk, the spar was that way trapped, and all was safe. The schooner was
03005: run into the wind, and while the hands were clearing away the stern
03006: boat, Queequeg, stripped to the waist, darted from the side with a long
03007: living arc of a leap. For three minutes or more he was seen swimming
03008: like a dog, throwing his long arms straight out before him, and by
03009: turns revealing his brawny shoulders through the freezing foam. I
03010: looked at the grand and glorious fellow, but saw no one to be saved.
03011: The greenhorn had gone down. Shooting himself perpendicularly from the
03012: water, Queequeg, now took an instant’s glance around him, and seeming
03013: to see just how matters were, dived down and disappeared. A few minutes
03014: more, and he rose again, one arm still striking out, and with the other
03015: dragging a lifeless form. The boat soon picked them up. The poor
03016: bumpkin was restored. All hands voted Queequeg a noble trump; the
03017: captain begged his pardon. From that hour I clove to Queequeg like a
03018: barnacle; yea, till poor Queequeg took his last long dive.
03019: 
03020: Was there ever such unconsciousness? He did not seem to think that he
03021: at all deserved a medal from the Humane and Magnanimous Societies. He
03022: only asked for water—fresh water—something to wipe the brine off; that
03023: done, he put on dry clothes, lighted his pipe, and leaning against the
03024: bulwarks, and mildly eyeing those around him, seemed to be saying to
