03025: himself—“It’s a mutual, joint-stock world, in all meridians. We
03026: cannibals must help these Christians.”
03027: 
03028: 
03029: CHAPTER 14. Nantucket.
03030: 
03031: Nothing more happened on the passage worthy the mentioning; so, after a
03032: fine run, we safely arrived in Nantucket.
03033: 
03034: Nantucket! Take out your map and look at it. See what a real corner of
03035: the world it occupies; how it stands there, away off shore, more lonely
03036: than the Eddystone lighthouse. Look at it—a mere hillock, and elbow of
03037: sand; all beach, without a background. There is more sand there than
03038: you would use in twenty years as a substitute for blotting paper. Some
03039: gamesome wights will tell you that they have to plant weeds there, they
03040: don’t grow naturally; that they import Canada thistles; that they have
03041: to send beyond seas for a spile to stop a leak in an oil cask; that
03042: pieces of wood in Nantucket are carried about like bits of the true
03043: cross in Rome; that people there plant toadstools before their houses,
03044: to get under the shade in summer time; that one blade of grass makes an
03045: oasis, three blades in a day’s walk a prairie; that they wear quicksand
03046: shoes, something like Laplander snow-shoes; that they are so shut up,
03047: belted about, every way inclosed, surrounded, and made an utter island
03048: of by the ocean, that to their very chairs and tables small clams will
03049: sometimes be found adhering, as to the backs of sea turtles. But these
03050: extravaganzas only show that Nantucket is no Illinois.
03051: 
03052: Look now at the wondrous traditional story of how this island was
03053: settled by the red-men. Thus goes the legend. In olden times an eagle
03054: swooped down upon the New England coast, and carried off an infant
03055: Indian in his talons. With loud lament the parents saw their child
03056: borne out of sight over the wide waters. They resolved to follow in the
03057: same direction. Setting out in their canoes, after a perilous passage
03058: they discovered the island, and there they found an empty ivory
03059: casket,—the poor little Indian’s skeleton.
03060: 
03061: What wonder, then, that these Nantucketers, born on a beach, should
03062: take to the sea for a livelihood! They first caught crabs and quohogs
03063: in the sand; grown bolder, they waded out with nets for mackerel; more
03064: experienced, they pushed off in boats and captured cod; and at last,
03065: launching a navy of great ships on the sea, explored this watery world;
03066: put an incessant belt of circumnavigations round it; peeped in at
03067: Behring’s Straits; and in all seasons and all oceans declared
03068: everlasting war with the mightiest animated mass that has survived the
03069: flood; most monstrous and most mountainous! That Himmalehan, salt-sea
03070: Mastodon, clothed with such portentousness of unconscious power, that
03071: his very panics are more to be dreaded than his most fearless and
03072: malicious assaults!
03073: 
03074: And thus have these naked Nantucketers, these sea hermits, issuing from
03075: their ant-hill in the sea, overrun and conquered the watery world like
03076: so many Alexanders; parcelling out among them the Atlantic, Pacific,
03077: and Indian oceans, as the three pirate powers did Poland. Let America
03078: add Mexico to Texas, and pile Cuba upon Canada; let the English
03079: overswarm all India, and hang out their blazing banner from the sun;
03080: two thirds of this terraqueous globe are the Nantucketer’s. For the sea
03081: is his; he owns it, as Emperors own empires; other seamen having but a
03082: right of way through it. Merchant ships are but extension bridges;
03083: armed ones but floating forts; even pirates and privateers, though
03084: following the sea as highwaymen the road, they but plunder other ships,
03085: other fragments of the land like themselves, without seeking to draw
03086: their living from the bottomless deep itself. The Nantucketer, he alone
03087: resides and riots on the sea; he alone, in Bible language, goes down to
03088: it in ships; to and fro ploughing it as his own special plantation.
03089: _There_ is his home; _there_ lies his business, which a Noah’s flood
03090: would not interrupt, though it overwhelmed all the millions in China.
03091: He lives on the sea, as prairie cocks in the prairie; he hides among
03092: the waves, he climbs them as chamois hunters climb the Alps. For years
03093: he knows not the land; so that when he comes to it at last, it smells
03094: like another world, more strangely than the moon would to an Earthsman.
03095: With the landless gull, that at sunset folds her wings and is rocked to
03096: sleep between billows; so at nightfall, the Nantucketer, out of sight
03097: of land, furls his sails, and lays him to his rest, while under his
03098: very pillow rush herds of walruses and whales.
03099: 
03100: 
03101: CHAPTER 15. Chowder.
03102: 
03103: It was quite late in the evening when the little Moss came snugly to
03104: anchor, and Queequeg and I went ashore; so we could attend to no
03105: business that day, at least none but a supper and a bed. The landlord
03106: of the Spouter-Inn had recommended us to his cousin Hosea Hussey of the
03107: Try Pots, whom he asserted to be the proprietor of one of the best kept
03108: hotels in all Nantucket, and moreover he had assured us that Cousin
03109: Hosea, as he called him, was famous for his chowders. In short, he
03110: plainly hinted that we could not possibly do better than try pot-luck
03111: at the Try Pots. But the directions he had given us about keeping a
03112: yellow warehouse on our starboard hand till we opened a white church to
03113: the larboard, and then keeping that on the larboard hand till we made a
03114: corner three points to the starboard, and that done, then ask the first
03115: man we met where the place was: these crooked directions of his very
03116: much puzzled us at first, especially as, at the outset, Queequeg
03117: insisted that the yellow warehouse—our first point of departure—must be
03118: left on the larboard hand, whereas I had understood Peter Coffin to say
03119: it was on the starboard. However, by dint of beating about a little in
03120: the dark, and now and then knocking up a peaceable inhabitant to
03121: inquire the way, we at last came to something which there was no
03122: mistaking.
03123: 
03124: Two enormous wooden pots painted black, and suspended by asses’ ears,
03125: swung from the cross-trees of an old top-mast, planted in front of an
03126: old doorway. The horns of the cross-trees were sawed off on the other
03127: side, so that this old top-mast looked not a little like a gallows.
03128: Perhaps I was over sensitive to such impressions at the time, but I
03129: could not help staring at this gallows with a vague misgiving. A sort
03130: of crick was in my neck as I gazed up to the two remaining horns; yes,
03131: _two_ of them, one for Queequeg, and one for me. It’s ominous, thinks
03132: I. A Coffin my Innkeeper upon landing in my first whaling port;
03133: tombstones staring at me in the whalemen’s chapel; and here a gallows!
03134: and a pair of prodigious black pots too! Are these last throwing out
03135: oblique hints touching Tophet?
03136: 
03137: I was called from these reflections by the sight of a freckled woman
03138: with yellow hair and a yellow gown, standing in the porch of the inn,
03139: under a dull red lamp swinging there, that looked much like an injured
03140: eye, and carrying on a brisk scolding with a man in a purple woollen
03141: shirt.
03142: 
03143: “Get along with ye,” said she to the man, “or I’ll be combing ye!”
03144: 
03145: “Come on, Queequeg,” said I, “all right. There’s Mrs. Hussey.”
03146: 
03147: And so it turned out; Mr. Hosea Hussey being from home, but leaving
03148: Mrs. Hussey entirely competent to attend to all his affairs. Upon
03149: making known our desires for a supper and a bed, Mrs. Hussey,
03150: postponing further scolding for the present, ushered us into a little
03151: room, and seating us at a table spread with the relics of a recently
03152: concluded repast, turned round to us and said—“Clam or Cod?”
03153: 
03154: “What’s that about Cods, ma’am?” said I, with much politeness.
03155: 
03156: “Clam or Cod?” she repeated.
03157: 
03158: “A clam for supper? a cold clam; is _that_ what you mean, Mrs. Hussey?”
03159: says I, “but that’s a rather cold and clammy reception in the winter
03160: time, ain’t it, Mrs. Hussey?”
03161: 
03162: But being in a great hurry to resume scolding the man in the purple
03163: Shirt, who was waiting for it in the entry, and seeming to hear nothing
03164: but the word “clam,” Mrs. Hussey hurried towards an open door leading
03165: to the kitchen, and bawling out “clam for two,” disappeared.
03166: 
03167: “Queequeg,” said I, “do you think that we can make out a supper for us
03168: both on one clam?”
03169: 
03170: However, a warm savory steam from the kitchen served to belie the
03171: apparently cheerless prospect before us. But when that smoking chowder
03172: came in, the mystery was delightfully explained. Oh, sweet friends!
03173: hearken to me. It was made of small juicy clams, scarcely bigger than
03174: hazel nuts, mixed with pounded ship biscuit, and salted pork cut up
03175: into little flakes; the whole enriched with butter, and plentifully
03176: seasoned with pepper and salt. Our appetites being sharpened by the
03177: frosty voyage, and in particular, Queequeg seeing his favourite fishing
03178: food before him, and the chowder being surpassingly excellent, we
03179: despatched it with great expedition: when leaning back a moment and
03180: bethinking me of Mrs. Hussey’s clam and cod announcement, I thought I
03181: would try a little experiment. Stepping to the kitchen door, I uttered
03182: the word “cod” with great emphasis, and resumed my seat. In a few
03183: moments the savoury steam came forth again, but with a different
03184: flavor, and in good time a fine cod-chowder was placed before us.
03185: 
03186: We resumed business; and while plying our spoons in the bowl, thinks I
03187: to myself, I wonder now if this here has any effect on the head? What’s
03188: that stultifying saying about chowder-headed people? “But look,
03189: Queequeg, ain’t that a live eel in your bowl? Where’s your harpoon?”
03190: 
03191: Fishiest of all fishy places was the Try Pots, which well deserved its
03192: name; for the pots there were always boiling chowders. Chowder for
03193: breakfast, and chowder for dinner, and chowder for supper, till you
03194: began to look for fish-bones coming through your clothes. The area
03195: before the house was paved with clam-shells. Mrs. Hussey wore a
03196: polished necklace of codfish vertebra; and Hosea Hussey had his account
03197: books bound in superior old shark-skin. There was a fishy flavor to the
03198: milk, too, which I could not at all account for, till one morning
03199: happening to take a stroll along the beach among some fishermen’s
03200: boats, I saw Hosea’s brindled cow feeding on fish remnants, and
03201: marching along the sand with each foot in a cod’s decapitated head,
03202: looking very slip-shod, I assure ye.
03203: 
03204: Supper concluded, we received a lamp, and directions from Mrs. Hussey
03205: concerning the nearest way to bed; but, as Queequeg was about to
03206: precede me up the stairs, the lady reached forth her arm, and demanded
03207: his harpoon; she allowed no harpoon in her chambers. “Why not?” said I;
03208: “every true whaleman sleeps with his harpoon—but why not?” “Because
03209: it’s dangerous,” says she. “Ever since young Stiggs coming from that
03210: unfort’nt v’y’ge of his, when he was gone four years and a half, with
03211: only three barrels of _ile_, was found dead in my first floor back,
03212: with his harpoon in his side; ever since then I allow no boarders to
03213: take sich dangerous weepons in their rooms at night. So, Mr. Queequeg”
03214: (for she had learned his name), “I will just take this here iron, and
03215: keep it for you till morning. But the chowder; clam or cod to-morrow
03216: for breakfast, men?”
03217: 
03218: “Both,” says I; “and let’s have a couple of smoked herring by way of
03219: variety.”
03220: 
03221: 
03222: CHAPTER 16. The Ship.
03223: 
03224: In bed we concocted our plans for the morrow. But to my surprise and no
03225: small concern, Queequeg now gave me to understand, that he had been
03226: diligently consulting Yojo—the name of his black little god—and Yojo
03227: had told him two or three times over, and strongly insisted upon it
03228: everyway, that instead of our going together among the whaling-fleet in
03229: harbor, and in concert selecting our craft; instead of this, I say,
03230: Yojo earnestly enjoined that the selection of the ship should rest
03231: wholly with me, inasmuch as Yojo purposed befriending us; and, in order
03232: to do so, had already pitched upon a vessel, which, if left to myself,
03233: I, Ishmael, should infallibly light upon, for all the world as though
03234: it had turned out by chance; and in that vessel I must immediately ship
03235: myself, for the present irrespective of Queequeg.
03236: 
03237: I have forgotten to mention that, in many things, Queequeg placed great
03238: confidence in the excellence of Yojo’s judgment and surprising forecast
03239: of things; and cherished Yojo with considerable esteem, as a rather
03240: good sort of god, who perhaps meant well enough upon the whole, but in
03241: all cases did not succeed in his benevolent designs.
03242: 
03243: Now, this plan of Queequeg’s, or rather Yojo’s, touching the selection
03244: of our craft; I did not like that plan at all. I had not a little
03245: relied upon Queequeg’s sagacity to point out the whaler best fitted to
03246: carry us and our fortunes securely. But as all my remonstrances
03247: produced no effect upon Queequeg, I was obliged to acquiesce; and
03248: accordingly prepared to set about this business with a determined
03249: rushing sort of energy and vigor, that should quickly settle that
03250: trifling little affair. Next morning early, leaving Queequeg shut up
03251: with Yojo in our little bedroom—for it seemed that it was some sort of
03252: Lent or Ramadan, or day of fasting, humiliation, and prayer with
03253: Queequeg and Yojo that day; _how_ it was I never could find out, for,
03254: though I applied myself to it several times, I never could master his
03255: liturgies and XXXIX Articles—leaving Queequeg, then, fasting on his
03256: tomahawk pipe, and Yojo warming himself at his sacrificial fire of
03257: shavings, I sallied out among the shipping. After much prolonged
03258: sauntering and many random inquiries, I learnt that there were three
03259: ships up for three-years’ voyages—The Devil-dam, the Tit-bit, and the
03260: Pequod. _Devil-Dam_, I do not know the origin of; _Tit-bit_ is obvious;
03261: _Pequod_, you will no doubt remember, was the name of a celebrated
03262: tribe of Massachusetts Indians; now extinct as the ancient Medes. I
03263: peered and pryed about the Devil-dam; from her, hopped over to the
03264: Tit-bit; and finally, going on board the Pequod, looked around her for
03265: a moment, and then decided that this was the very ship for us.
03266: 
03267: You may have seen many a quaint craft in your day, for aught I
03268: know;—square-toed luggers; mountainous Japanese junks; butter-box
03269: galliots, and what not; but take my word for it, you never saw such a
03270: rare old craft as this same rare old Pequod. She was a ship of the old
03271: school, rather small if anything; with an old-fashioned claw-footed
03272: look about her. Long seasoned and weather-stained in the typhoons and
03273: calms of all four oceans, her old hull’s complexion was darkened like a
03274: French grenadier’s, who has alike fought in Egypt and Siberia. Her
03275: venerable bows looked bearded. Her masts—cut somewhere on the coast of
03276: Japan, where her original ones were lost overboard in a gale—her masts
03277: stood stiffly up like the spines of the three old kings of Cologne. Her
03278: ancient decks were worn and wrinkled, like the pilgrim-worshipped
03279: flag-stone in Canterbury Cathedral where Becket bled. But to all these
03280: her old antiquities, were added new and marvellous features, pertaining
03281: to the wild business that for more than half a century she had
03282: followed. Old Captain Peleg, many years her chief-mate, before he
03283: commanded another vessel of his own, and now a retired seaman, and one
03284: of the principal owners of the Pequod,—this old Peleg, during the term
03285: of his chief-mateship, had built upon her original grotesqueness, and
03286: inlaid it, all over, with a quaintness both of material and device,
03287: unmatched by anything except it be Thorkill-Hake’s carved buckler or
03288: bedstead. She was apparelled like any barbaric Ethiopian emperor, his
03289: neck heavy with pendants of polished ivory. She was a thing of
03290: trophies. A cannibal of a craft, tricking herself forth in the chased
03291: bones of her enemies. All round, her unpanelled, open bulwarks were
03292: garnished like one continuous jaw, with the long sharp teeth of the
03293: sperm whale, inserted there for pins, to fasten her old hempen thews
03294: and tendons to. Those thews ran not through base blocks of land wood,
03295: but deftly travelled over sheaves of sea-ivory. Scorning a turnstile
03296: wheel at her reverend helm, she sported there a tiller; and that tiller
03297: was in one mass, curiously carved from the long narrow lower jaw of her
03298: hereditary foe. The helmsman who steered by that tiller in a tempest,
03299: felt like the Tartar, when he holds back his fiery steed by clutching
03300: its jaw. A noble craft, but somehow a most melancholy! All noble things
03301: are touched with that.
03302: 
03303: Now when I looked about the quarter-deck, for some one having
03304: authority, in order to propose myself as a candidate for the voyage, at
03305: first I saw nobody; but I could not well overlook a strange sort of
03306: tent, or rather wigwam, pitched a little behind the main-mast. It
03307: seemed only a temporary erection used in port. It was of a conical
03308: shape, some ten feet high; consisting of the long, huge slabs of limber
03309: black bone taken from the middle and highest part of the jaws of the
03310: right-whale. Planted with their broad ends on the deck, a circle of
03311: these slabs laced together, mutually sloped towards each other, and at
03312: the apex united in a tufted point, where the loose hairy fibres waved
03313: to and fro like the top-knot on some old Pottowottamie Sachem’s head. A
03314: triangular opening faced towards the bows of the ship, so that the
03315: insider commanded a complete view forward.
03316: 
03317: And half concealed in this queer tenement, I at length found one who by
03318: his aspect seemed to have authority; and who, it being noon, and the
03319: ship’s work suspended, was now enjoying respite from the burden of
03320: command. He was seated on an old-fashioned oaken chair, wriggling all
03321: over with curious carving; and the bottom of which was formed of a
03322: stout interlacing of the same elastic stuff of which the wigwam was
03323: constructed.
03324: 
03325: There was nothing so very particular, perhaps, about the appearance of
03326: the elderly man I saw; he was brown and brawny, like most old seamen,
03327: and heavily rolled up in blue pilot-cloth, cut in the Quaker style;
03328: only there was a fine and almost microscopic net-work of the minutest
03329: wrinkles interlacing round his eyes, which must have arisen from his
03330: continual sailings in many hard gales, and always looking to
03331: windward;—for this causes the muscles about the eyes to become pursed
03332: together. Such eye-wrinkles are very effectual in a scowl.
03333: 
03334: “Is this the Captain of the Pequod?” said I, advancing to the door of
03335: the tent.
03336: 
03337: “Supposing it be the captain of the Pequod, what dost thou want of
03338: him?” he demanded.
03339: 
03340: “I was thinking of shipping.”
03341: 
03342: “Thou wast, wast thou? I see thou art no Nantucketer—ever been in a
03343: stove boat?”
03344: 
03345: “No, Sir, I never have.”
03346: 
03347: “Dost know nothing at all about whaling, I dare say—eh?
03348: 
03349: “Nothing, Sir; but I have no doubt I shall soon learn. I’ve been
03350: several voyages in the merchant service, and I think that—”
03351: 
03352: “Merchant service be damned. Talk not that lingo to me. Dost see that
03353: leg?—I’ll take that leg away from thy stern, if ever thou talkest of
03354: the marchant service to me again. Marchant service indeed! I suppose
03355: now ye feel considerable proud of having served in those marchant
03356: ships. But flukes! man, what makes thee want to go a whaling, eh?—it
03357: looks a little suspicious, don’t it, eh?—Hast not been a pirate, hast
03358: thou?—Didst not rob thy last Captain, didst thou?—Dost not think of
03359: murdering the officers when thou gettest to sea?”
03360: 
03361: I protested my innocence of these things. I saw that under the mask of
03362: these half humorous innuendoes, this old seaman, as an insulated
03363: Quakerish Nantucketer, was full of his insular prejudices, and rather
03364: distrustful of all aliens, unless they hailed from Cape Cod or the
03365: Vineyard.
03366: 
03367: “But what takes thee a-whaling? I want to know that before I think of
03368: shipping ye.”
03369: 
03370: “Well, sir, I want to see what whaling is. I want to see the world.”
03371: 
03372: “Want to see what whaling is, eh? Have ye clapped eye on Captain Ahab?”
03373: 
03374: “Who is Captain Ahab, sir?”
03375: 
03376: “Aye, aye, I thought so. Captain Ahab is the Captain of this ship.”
03377: 
03378: “I am mistaken then. I thought I was speaking to the Captain himself.”
03379: 
03380: “Thou art speaking to Captain Peleg—that’s who ye are speaking to,
03381: young man. It belongs to me and Captain Bildad to see the Pequod fitted
03382: out for the voyage, and supplied with all her needs, including crew. We
03383: are part owners and agents. But as I was going to say, if thou wantest
03384: to know what whaling is, as thou tellest ye do, I can put ye in a way
03385: of finding it out before ye bind yourself to it, past backing out. Clap
03386: eye on Captain Ahab, young man, and thou wilt find that he has only one
03387: leg.”
03388: 
03389: “What do you mean, sir? Was the other one lost by a whale?”
03390: 
03391: “Lost by a whale! Young man, come nearer to me: it was devoured, chewed
03392: up, crunched by the monstrousest parmacetty that ever chipped a
03393: boat!—ah, ah!”
03394: 
03395: I was a little alarmed by his energy, perhaps also a little touched at
03396: the hearty grief in his concluding exclamation, but said as calmly as I
03397: could, “What you say is no doubt true enough, sir; but how could I know
03398: there was any peculiar ferocity in that particular whale, though indeed
03399: I might have inferred as much from the simple fact of the accident.”
03400: 
03401: “Look ye now, young man, thy lungs are a sort of soft, d’ye see; thou
03402: dost not talk shark a bit. _Sure_, ye’ve been to sea before now; sure
03403: of that?”
03404: 
03405: “Sir,” said I, “I thought I told you that I had been four voyages in
03406: the merchant—”
03407: 
03408: “Hard down out of that! Mind what I said about the marchant
03409: service—don’t aggravate me—I won’t have it. But let us understand each
03410: other. I have given thee a hint about what whaling is; do ye yet feel
03411: inclined for it?”
03412: 
03413: “I do, sir.”
03414: 
03415: “Very good. Now, art thou the man to pitch a harpoon down a live
03416: whale’s throat, and then jump after it? Answer, quick!”
03417: 
03418: “I am, sir, if it should be positively indispensable to do so; not to
03419: be got rid of, that is; which I don’t take to be the fact.”
03420: 
03421: “Good again. Now then, thou not only wantest to go a-whaling, to find
03422: out by experience what whaling is, but ye also want to go in order to
03423: see the world? Was not that what ye said? I thought so. Well then, just
03424: step forward there, and take a peep over the weather-bow, and then back
03425: to me and tell me what ye see there.”
03426: 
03427: For a moment I stood a little puzzled by this curious request, not
03428: knowing exactly how to take it, whether humorously or in earnest. But
03429: concentrating all his crow’s feet into one scowl, Captain Peleg started
03430: me on the errand.
03431: 
03432: Going forward and glancing over the weather bow, I perceived that the
03433: ship swinging to her anchor with the flood-tide, was now obliquely
03434: pointing towards the open ocean. The prospect was unlimited, but
03435: exceedingly monotonous and forbidding; not the slightest variety that I
03436: could see.
03437: 
03438: “Well, what’s the report?” said Peleg when I came back; “what did ye
03439: see?”
03440: 
03441: “Not much,” I replied—“nothing but water; considerable horizon though,
03442: and there’s a squall coming up, I think.”
03443: 
03444: “Well, what does thou think then of seeing the world? Do ye wish to go
03445: round Cape Horn to see any more of it, eh? Can’t ye see the world where
03446: you stand?”
03447: 
03448: I was a little staggered, but go a-whaling I must, and I would; and the
03449: Pequod was as good a ship as any—I thought the best—and all this I now
03450: repeated to Peleg. Seeing me so determined, he expressed his
03451: willingness to ship me.
03452: 
03453: “And thou mayest as well sign the papers right off,” he added—“come
03454: along with ye.” And so saying, he led the way below deck into the
03455: cabin.
03456: 
03457: Seated on the transom was what seemed to me a most uncommon and
03458: surprising figure. It turned out to be Captain Bildad, who along with
03459: Captain Peleg was one of the largest owners of the vessel; the other
03460: shares, as is sometimes the case in these ports, being held by a crowd
03461: of old annuitants; widows, fatherless children, and chancery wards;
03462: each owning about the value of a timber head, or a foot of plank, or a
03463: nail or two in the ship. People in Nantucket invest their money in
03464: whaling vessels, the same way that you do yours in approved state
03465: stocks bringing in good interest.
03466: 
03467: Now, Bildad, like Peleg, and indeed many other Nantucketers, was a
03468: Quaker, the island having been originally settled by that sect; and to
03469: this day its inhabitants in general retain in an uncommon measure the
03470: peculiarities of the Quaker, only variously and anomalously modified by
03471: things altogether alien and heterogeneous. For some of these same
03472: Quakers are the most sanguinary of all sailors and whale-hunters. They
03473: are fighting Quakers; they are Quakers with a vengeance.
03474: 
03475: So that there are instances among them of men, who, named with
03476: Scripture names—a singularly common fashion on the island—and in
03477: childhood naturally imbibing the stately dramatic thee and thou of the
03478: Quaker idiom; still, from the audacious, daring, and boundless
03479: adventure of their subsequent lives, strangely blend with these
03480: unoutgrown peculiarities, a thousand bold dashes of character, not
03481: unworthy a Scandinavian sea-king, or a poetical Pagan Roman. And when
03482: these things unite in a man of greatly superior natural force, with a
03483: globular brain and a ponderous heart; who has also by the stillness and
03484: seclusion of many long night-watches in the remotest waters, and
03485: beneath constellations never seen here at the north, been led to think
03486: untraditionally and independently; receiving all nature’s sweet or
03487: savage impressions fresh from her own virgin voluntary and confiding
03488: breast, and thereby chiefly, but with some help from accidental
03489: advantages, to learn a bold and nervous lofty language—that man makes
03490: one in a whole nation’s census—a mighty pageant creature, formed for
03491: noble tragedies. Nor will it at all detract from him, dramatically
03492: regarded, if either by birth or other circumstances, he have what seems
03493: a half wilful overruling morbidness at the bottom of his nature. For
03494: all men tragically great are made so through a certain morbidness. Be
03495: sure of this, O young ambition, all mortal greatness is but disease.
03496: But, as yet we have not to do with such an one, but with quite another;
03497: and still a man, who, if indeed peculiar, it only results again from
03498: another phase of the Quaker, modified by individual circumstances.
03499: 
03500: Like Captain Peleg, Captain Bildad was a well-to-do, retired whaleman.
03501: But unlike Captain Peleg—who cared not a rush for what are called
03502: serious things, and indeed deemed those self-same serious things the
03503: veriest of all trifles—Captain Bildad had not only been originally
03504: educated according to the strictest sect of Nantucket Quakerism, but
03505: all his subsequent ocean life, and the sight of many unclad, lovely
03506: island creatures, round the Horn—all that had not moved this native
03507: born Quaker one single jot, had not so much as altered one angle of his
03508: vest. Still, for all this immutableness, was there some lack of common
03509: consistency about worthy Captain Bildad. Though refusing, from
03510: conscientious scruples, to bear arms against land invaders, yet himself
03511: had illimitably invaded the Atlantic and Pacific; and though a sworn
03512: foe to human bloodshed, yet had he in his straight-bodied coat, spilled
03513: tuns upon tuns of leviathan gore. How now in the contemplative evening
03514: of his days, the pious Bildad reconciled these things in the
03515: reminiscence, I do not know; but it did not seem to concern him much,
03516: and very probably he had long since come to the sage and sensible
03517: conclusion that a man’s religion is one thing, and this practical world
03518: quite another. This world pays dividends. Rising from a little
03519: cabin-boy in short clothes of the drabbest drab, to a harpooneer in a
03520: broad shad-bellied waistcoat; from that becoming boat-header,
03521: chief-mate, and captain, and finally a ship owner; Bildad, as I hinted
03522: before, had concluded his adventurous career by wholly retiring from
03523: active life at the goodly age of sixty, and dedicating his remaining
03524: days to the quiet receiving of his well-earned income.
03525: 
03526: Now, Bildad, I am sorry to say, had the reputation of being an
03527: incorrigible old hunks, and in his sea-going days, a bitter, hard
03528: task-master. They told me in Nantucket, though it certainly seems a
03529: curious story, that when he sailed the old Categut whaleman, his crew,
03530: upon arriving home, were mostly all carried ashore to the hospital,
03531: sore exhausted and worn out. For a pious man, especially for a Quaker,
03532: he was certainly rather hard-hearted, to say the least. He never used
03533: to swear, though, at his men, they said; but somehow he got an
03534: inordinate quantity of cruel, unmitigated hard work out of them. When
03535: Bildad was a chief-mate, to have his drab-coloured eye intently looking
03536: at you, made you feel completely nervous, till you could clutch
03537: something—a hammer or a marling-spike, and go to work like mad, at
03538: something or other, never mind what. Indolence and idleness perished
03539: before him. His own person was the exact embodiment of his utilitarian
03540: character. On his long, gaunt body, he carried no spare flesh, no
03541: superfluous beard, his chin having a soft, economical nap to it, like
03542: the worn nap of his broad-brimmed hat.
03543: 
03544: Such, then, was the person that I saw seated on the transom when I
03545: followed Captain Peleg down into the cabin. The space between the decks
03546: was small; and there, bolt-upright, sat old Bildad, who always sat so,
03547: and never leaned, and this to save his coat tails. His broad-brim was
03548: placed beside him; his legs were stiffly crossed; his drab vesture was
03549: buttoned up to his chin; and spectacles on nose, he seemed absorbed in
03550: reading from a ponderous volume.
03551: 
03552: “Bildad,” cried Captain Peleg, “at it again, Bildad, eh? Ye have been
03553: studying those Scriptures, now, for the last thirty years, to my
03554: certain knowledge. How far ye got, Bildad?”
03555: 
03556: As if long habituated to such profane talk from his old shipmate,
03557: Bildad, without noticing his present irreverence, quietly looked up,
03558: and seeing me, glanced again inquiringly towards Peleg.
03559: 
03560: “He says he’s our man, Bildad,” said Peleg, “he wants to ship.”
03561: 
03562: “Dost thee?” said Bildad, in a hollow tone, and turning round to me.
03563: 
03564: “I _dost_,” said I unconsciously, he was so intense a Quaker.
03565: 
03566: “What do ye think of him, Bildad?” said Peleg.
03567: 
03568: “He’ll do,” said Bildad, eyeing me, and then went on spelling away at
03569: his book in a mumbling tone quite audible.
03570: 
03571: I thought him the queerest old Quaker I ever saw, especially as Peleg,
03572: his friend and old shipmate, seemed such a blusterer. But I said
03573: nothing, only looking round me sharply. Peleg now threw open a chest,
03574: and drawing forth the ship’s articles, placed pen and ink before him,
03575: and seated himself at a little table. I began to think it was high time
03576: to settle with myself at what terms I would be willing to engage for
03577: the voyage. I was already aware that in the whaling business they paid
03578: no wages; but all hands, including the captain, received certain shares
03579: of the profits called _lays_, and that these lays were proportioned to
03580: the degree of importance pertaining to the respective duties of the
03581: ship’s company. I was also aware that being a green hand at whaling, my
03582: own lay would not be very large; but considering that I was used to the
03583: sea, could steer a ship, splice a rope, and all that, I made no doubt
03584: that from all I had heard I should be offered at least the 275th
03585: lay—that is, the 275th part of the clear net proceeds of the voyage,
03586: whatever that might eventually amount to. And though the 275th lay was
03587: what they call a rather _long lay_, yet it was better than nothing; and
03588: if we had a lucky voyage, might pretty nearly pay for the clothing I
03589: would wear out on it, not to speak of my three years’ beef and board,
03590: for which I would not have to pay one stiver.
03591: 
03592: It might be thought that this was a poor way to accumulate a princely
03593: fortune—and so it was, a very poor way indeed. But I am one of those
03594: that never take on about princely fortunes, and am quite content if the
03595: world is ready to board and lodge me, while I am putting up at this
03596: grim sign of the Thunder Cloud. Upon the whole, I thought that the
03597: 275th lay would be about the fair thing, but would not have been
03598: surprised had I been offered the 200th, considering I was of a
03599: broad-shouldered make.
03600: 
03601: But one thing, nevertheless, that made me a little distrustful about
03602: receiving a generous share of the profits was this: Ashore, I had heard
03603: something of both Captain Peleg and his unaccountable old crony Bildad;
03604: how that they being the principal proprietors of the Pequod, therefore
03605: the other and more inconsiderable and scattered owners, left nearly the
03606: whole management of the ship’s affairs to these two. And I did not know
03607: but what the stingy old Bildad might have a mighty deal to say about
03608: shipping hands, especially as I now found him on board the Pequod,
03609: quite at home there in the cabin, and reading his Bible as if at his
03610: own fireside. Now while Peleg was vainly trying to mend a pen with his
03611: jack-knife, old Bildad, to my no small surprise, considering that he
03612: was such an interested party in these proceedings; Bildad never heeded
03613: us, but went on mumbling to himself out of his book, “_Lay_ not up for
03614: yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth—”
03615: 
03616: “Well, Captain Bildad,” interrupted Peleg, “what d’ye say, what lay
03617: shall we give this young man?”
03618: 
03619: “Thou knowest best,” was the sepulchral reply, “the seven hundred and
03620: seventy-seventh wouldn’t be too much, would it?—‘where moth and rust do
03621: corrupt, but _lay_—’”
03622: 
03623: _Lay_, indeed, thought I, and such a lay! the seven hundred and
03624: seventy-seventh! Well, old Bildad, you are determined that I, for one,
03625: shall not _lay_ up many _lays_ here below, where moth and rust do
03626: corrupt. It was an exceedingly _long lay_ that, indeed; and though from
03627: the magnitude of the figure it might at first deceive a landsman, yet
03628: the slightest consideration will show that though seven hundred and
03629: seventy-seven is a pretty large number, yet, when you come to make a
03630: _teenth_ of it, you will then see, I say, that the seven hundred and
03631: seventy-seventh part of a farthing is a good deal less than seven
03632: hundred and seventy-seven gold doubloons; and so I thought at the time.
03633: 
03634: “Why, blast your eyes, Bildad,” cried Peleg, “thou dost not want to
03635: swindle this young man! he must have more than that.”
03636: 
03637: “Seven hundred and seventy-seventh,” again said Bildad, without lifting
03638: his eyes; and then went on mumbling—“for where your treasure is, there
03639: will your heart be also.”
03640: 
03641: “I am going to put him down for the three hundredth,” said Peleg, “do
03642: ye hear that, Bildad! The three hundredth lay, I say.”
03643: 
03644: Bildad laid down his book, and turning solemnly towards him said,
03645: “Captain Peleg, thou hast a generous heart; but thou must consider the
03646: duty thou owest to the other owners of this ship—widows and orphans,
03647: many of them—and that if we too abundantly reward the labors of this
03648: young man, we may be taking the bread from those widows and those
03649: orphans. The seven hundred and seventy-seventh lay, Captain Peleg.”
03650: 
03651: “Thou Bildad!” roared Peleg, starting up and clattering about the
03652: cabin. “Blast ye, Captain Bildad, if I had followed thy advice in these
03653: matters, I would afore now had a conscience to lug about that would be
03654: heavy enough to founder the largest ship that ever sailed round Cape
03655: Horn.”
03656: 
03657: “Captain Peleg,” said Bildad steadily, “thy conscience may be drawing
03658: ten inches of water, or ten fathoms, I can’t tell; but as thou art
03659: still an impenitent man, Captain Peleg, I greatly fear lest thy
03660: conscience be but a leaky one; and will in the end sink thee foundering
03661: down to the fiery pit, Captain Peleg.”
03662: 
03663: “Fiery pit! fiery pit! ye insult me, man; past all natural bearing, ye
03664: insult me. It’s an all-fired outrage to tell any human creature that
03665: he’s bound to hell. Flukes and flames! Bildad, say that again to me,
03666: and start my soul-bolts, but I’ll—I’ll—yes, I’ll swallow a live goat
03667: with all his hair and horns on. Out of the cabin, ye canting,
03668: drab-coloured son of a wooden gun—a straight wake with ye!”
03669: 
03670: As he thundered out this he made a rush at Bildad, but with a
03671: marvellous oblique, sliding celerity, Bildad for that time eluded him.
03672: 
03673: Alarmed at this terrible outburst between the two principal and
03674: responsible owners of the ship, and feeling half a mind to give up all
03675: idea of sailing in a vessel so questionably owned and temporarily
03676: commanded, I stepped aside from the door to give egress to Bildad, who,
03677: I made no doubt, was all eagerness to vanish from before the awakened
03678: wrath of Peleg. But to my astonishment, he sat down again on the
03679: transom very quietly, and seemed to have not the slightest intention of
03680: withdrawing. He seemed quite used to impenitent Peleg and his ways. As
03681: for Peleg, after letting off his rage as he had, there seemed no more
03682: left in him, and he, too, sat down like a lamb, though he twitched a
03683: little as if still nervously agitated. “Whew!” he whistled at last—“the
03684: squall’s gone off to leeward, I think. Bildad, thou used to be good at
03685: sharpening a lance, mend that pen, will ye. My jack-knife here needs
03686: the grindstone. That’s he; thank ye, Bildad. Now then, my young man,
03687: Ishmael’s thy name, didn’t ye say? Well then, down ye go here, Ishmael,
03688: for the three hundredth lay.”
03689: 
03690: “Captain Peleg,” said I, “I have a friend with me who wants to ship
03691: too—shall I bring him down to-morrow?”
03692: 
03693: “To be sure,” said Peleg. “Fetch him along, and we’ll look at him.”
03694: 
03695: “What lay does he want?” groaned Bildad, glancing up from the book in
03696: which he had again been burying himself.
03697: 
03698: “Oh! never thee mind about that, Bildad,” said Peleg. “Has he ever
03699: whaled it any?” turning to me.
03700: 
03701: “Killed more whales than I can count, Captain Peleg.”
03702: 
03703: “Well, bring him along then.”
03704: 
03705: And, after signing the papers, off I went; nothing doubting but that I
03706: had done a good morning’s work, and that the Pequod was the identical
03707: ship that Yojo had provided to carry Queequeg and me round the Cape.
03708: 
03709: But I had not proceeded far, when I began to bethink me that the
03710: Captain with whom I was to sail yet remained unseen by me; though,
03711: indeed, in many cases, a whale-ship will be completely fitted out, and
03712: receive all her crew on board, ere the captain makes himself visible by
03713: arriving to take command; for sometimes these voyages are so prolonged,
03714: and the shore intervals at home so exceedingly brief, that if the
03715: captain have a family, or any absorbing concernment of that sort, he
03716: does not trouble himself much about his ship in port, but leaves her to
03717: the owners till all is ready for sea. However, it is always as well to
03718: have a look at him before irrevocably committing yourself into his
03719: hands. Turning back I accosted Captain Peleg, inquiring where Captain
03720: Ahab was to be found.
03721: 
03722: “And what dost thou want of Captain Ahab? It’s all right enough; thou
03723: art shipped.”
03724: 
03725: “Yes, but I should like to see him.”
03726: 
03727: “But I don’t think thou wilt be able to at present. I don’t know
03728: exactly what’s the matter with him; but he keeps close inside the
03729: house; a sort of sick, and yet he don’t look so. In fact, he ain’t
03730: sick; but no, he isn’t well either. Any how, young man, he won’t always
03731: see me, so I don’t suppose he will thee. He’s a queer man, Captain
03732: Ahab—so some think—but a good one. Oh, thou’lt like him well enough; no
03733: fear, no fear. He’s a grand, ungodly, god-like man, Captain Ahab;
03734: doesn’t speak much; but, when he does speak, then you may well listen.
03735: Mark ye, be forewarned; Ahab’s above the common; Ahab’s been in
03736: colleges, as well as ’mong the cannibals; been used to deeper wonders
03737: than the waves; fixed his fiery lance in mightier, stranger foes than
03738: whales. His lance! aye, the keenest and the surest that out of all our
03739: isle! Oh! he ain’t Captain Bildad; no, and he ain’t Captain Peleg;
03740: _he’s Ahab_, boy; and Ahab of old, thou knowest, was a crowned king!”
03741: 
03742: “And a very vile one. When that wicked king was slain, the dogs, did
03743: they not lick his blood?”
03744: 
03745: “Come hither to me—hither, hither,” said Peleg, with a significance in
03746: his eye that almost startled me. “Look ye, lad; never say that on board
03747: the Pequod. Never say it anywhere. Captain Ahab did not name himself.
03748: ’Twas a foolish, ignorant whim of his crazy, widowed mother, who died
03749: when he was only a twelvemonth old. And yet the old squaw Tistig, at
03750: Gayhead, said that the name would somehow prove prophetic. And,
03751: perhaps, other fools like her may tell thee the same. I wish to warn
03752: thee. It’s a lie. I know Captain Ahab well; I’ve sailed with him as
03753: mate years ago; I know what he is—a good man—not a pious, good man,
03754: like Bildad, but a swearing good man—something like me—only there’s a
03755: good deal more of him. Aye, aye, I know that he was never very jolly;
03756: and I know that on the passage home, he was a little out of his mind
03757: for a spell; but it was the sharp shooting pains in his bleeding stump
03758: that brought that about, as any one might see. I know, too, that ever
03759: since he lost his leg last voyage by that accursed whale, he’s been a
03760: kind of moody—desperate moody, and savage sometimes; but that will all
03761: pass off. And once for all, let me tell thee and assure thee, young
03762: man, it’s better to sail with a moody good captain than a laughing bad
03763: one. So good-bye to thee—and wrong not Captain Ahab, because he happens
03764: to have a wicked name. Besides, my boy, he has a wife—not three voyages
03765: wedded—a sweet, resigned girl. Think of that; by that sweet girl that
03766: old man has a child: hold ye then there can be any utter, hopeless harm
03767: in Ahab? No, no, my lad; stricken, blasted, if he be, Ahab has his
03768: humanities!”
03769: 
03770: As I walked away, I was full of thoughtfulness; what had been
03771: incidentally revealed to me of Captain Ahab, filled me with a certain
03772: wild vagueness of painfulness concerning him. And somehow, at the time,
03773: I felt a sympathy and a sorrow for him, but for I don’t know what,
03774: unless it was the cruel loss of his leg. And yet I also felt a strange
03775: awe of him; but that sort of awe, which I cannot at all describe, was
03776: not exactly awe; I do not know what it was. But I felt it; and it did
03777: not disincline me towards him; though I felt impatience at what seemed
03778: like mystery in him, so imperfectly as he was known to me then.
03779: However, my thoughts were at length carried in other directions, so
03780: that for the present dark Ahab slipped my mind.
03781: 
03782: 
03783: CHAPTER 17. The Ramadan.
03784: 
03785: As Queequeg’s Ramadan, or Fasting and Humiliation, was to continue all
03786: day, I did not choose to disturb him till towards night-fall; for I
03787: cherish the greatest respect towards everybody’s religious obligations,
03788: never mind how comical, and could not find it in my heart to undervalue
03789: even a congregation of ants worshipping a toad-stool; or those other
03790: creatures in certain parts of our earth, who with a degree of
03791: footmanism quite unprecedented in other planets, bow down before the
03792: torso of a deceased landed proprietor merely on account of the
03793: inordinate possessions yet owned and rented in his name.
03794: 
03795: I say, we good Presbyterian Christians should be charitable in these
03796: things, and not fancy ourselves so vastly superior to other mortals,
03797: pagans and what not, because of their half-crazy conceits on these
03798: subjects. There was Queequeg, now, certainly entertaining the most
03799: absurd notions about Yojo and his Ramadan;—but what of that? Queequeg
03800: thought he knew what he was about, I suppose; he seemed to be content;
03801: and there let him rest. All our arguing with him would not avail; let
03802: him be, I say: and Heaven have mercy on us all—Presbyterians and Pagans
03803: alike—for we are all somehow dreadfully cracked about the head, and
03804: sadly need mending.
03805: 
03806: Towards evening, when I felt assured that all his performances and
03807: rituals must be over, I went up to his room and knocked at the door;
03808: but no answer. I tried to open it, but it was fastened inside.
03809: “Queequeg,” said I softly through the key-hole:—all silent. “I say,
03810: Queequeg! why don’t you speak? It’s I—Ishmael.” But all remained still
03811: as before. I began to grow alarmed. I had allowed him such abundant
03812: time; I thought he might have had an apoplectic fit. I looked through
03813: the key-hole; but the door opening into an odd corner of the room, the
03814: key-hole prospect was but a crooked and sinister one. I could only see
03815: part of the foot-board of the bed and a line of the wall, but nothing
03816: more. I was surprised to behold resting against the wall the wooden
03817: shaft of Queequeg’s harpoon, which the landlady the evening previous
03818: had taken from him, before our mounting to the chamber. That’s strange,
03819: thought I; but at any rate, since the harpoon stands yonder, and he
03820: seldom or never goes abroad without it, therefore he must be inside
03821: here, and no possible mistake.
03822: 
03823: “Queequeg!—Queequeg!”—all still. Something must have happened.
03824: Apoplexy! I tried to burst open the door; but it stubbornly resisted.
03825: Running down stairs, I quickly stated my suspicions to the first person
03826: I met—the chamber-maid. “La! la!” she cried, “I thought something must
03827: be the matter. I went to make the bed after breakfast, and the door was
03828: locked; and not a mouse to be heard; and it’s been just so silent ever
03829: since. But I thought, may be, you had both gone off and locked your
03830: baggage in for safe keeping. La! la, ma’am!—Mistress! murder! Mrs.
03831: Hussey! apoplexy!”—and with these cries, she ran towards the kitchen, I
03832: following.
03833: 
03834: Mrs. Hussey soon appeared, with a mustard-pot in one hand and a
03835: vinegar-cruet in the other, having just broken away from the occupation
03836: of attending to the castors, and scolding her little black boy
03837: meantime.
03838: 
03839: “Wood-house!” cried I, “which way to it? Run for God’s sake, and fetch
03840: something to pry open the door—the axe!—the axe! he’s had a stroke;
03841: depend upon it!”—and so saying I was unmethodically rushing up stairs
03842: again empty-handed, when Mrs. Hussey interposed the mustard-pot and
03843: vinegar-cruet, and the entire castor of her countenance.
03844: 
03845: “What’s the matter with you, young man?”
03846: 
03847: “Get the axe! For God’s sake, run for the doctor, some one, while I pry
03848: it open!”
03849: 
03850: “Look here,” said the landlady, quickly putting down the vinegar-cruet,
03851: so as to have one hand free; “look here; are you talking about prying
03852: open any of my doors?”—and with that she seized my arm. “What’s the
03853: matter with you? What’s the matter with you, shipmate?”
03854: 
03855: In as calm, but rapid a manner as possible, I gave her to understand
03856: the whole case. Unconsciously clapping the vinegar-cruet to one side of
03857: her nose, she ruminated for an instant; then exclaimed—“No! I haven’t
03858: seen it since I put it there.” Running to a little closet under the
03859: landing of the stairs, she glanced in, and returning, told me that
03860: Queequeg’s harpoon was missing. “He’s killed himself,” she cried. “It’s
03861: unfort’nate Stiggs done over again—there goes another counterpane—God
03862: pity his poor mother!—it will be the ruin of my house. Has the poor lad
03863: a sister? Where’s that girl?—there, Betty, go to Snarles the Painter,
03864: and tell him to paint me a sign, with—“no suicides permitted here, and
03865: no smoking in the parlor;”—might as well kill both birds at once. Kill?
03866: The Lord be merciful to his ghost! What’s that noise there? You, young
03867: man, avast there!”
03868: 
03869: And running up after me, she caught me as I was again trying to force
03870: open the door.
03871: 
03872: “I don’t allow it; I won’t have my premises spoiled. Go for the
03873: locksmith, there’s one about a mile from here. But avast!” putting her
03874: hand in her side-pocket, “here’s a key that’ll fit, I guess; let’s
03875: see.” And with that, she turned it in the lock; but, alas! Queequeg’s
03876: supplemental bolt remained unwithdrawn within.
03877: 
03878: “Have to burst it open,” said I, and was running down the entry a
03879: little, for a good start, when the landlady caught at me, again vowing
03880: I should not break down her premises; but I tore from her, and with a
03881: sudden bodily rush dashed myself full against the mark.
03882: 
03883: With a prodigious noise the door flew open, and the knob slamming
03884: against the wall, sent the plaster to the ceiling; and there, good
03885: heavens! there sat Queequeg, altogether cool and self-collected; right
03886: in the middle of the room; squatting on his hams, and holding Yojo on
03887: top of his head. He looked neither one way nor the other way, but sat
03888: like a carved image with scarce a sign of active life.
03889: 
03890: “Queequeg,” said I, going up to him, “Queequeg, what’s the matter with
03891: you?”
03892: 
03893: “He hain’t been a sittin’ so all day, has he?” said the landlady.
03894: 
03895: But all we said, not a word could we drag out of him; I almost felt
03896: like pushing him over, so as to change his position, for it was almost
03897: intolerable, it seemed so painfully and unnaturally constrained;
03898: especially, as in all probability he had been sitting so for upwards of
03899: eight or ten hours, going too without his regular meals.
03900: 
03901: “Mrs. Hussey,” said I, “he’s _alive_ at all events; so leave us, if you
03902: please, and I will see to this strange affair myself.”
03903: 
03904: Closing the door upon the landlady, I endeavored to prevail upon
03905: Queequeg to take a chair; but in vain. There he sat; and all he could
03906: do—for all my polite arts and blandishments—he would not move a peg,
03907: nor say a single word, nor even look at me, nor notice my presence in
03908: the slightest way.
03909: 
03910: I wonder, thought I, if this can possibly be a part of his Ramadan; do
03911: they fast on their hams that way in his native island. It must be so;
03912: yes, it’s part of his creed, I suppose; well, then, let him rest; he’ll
03913: get up sooner or later, no doubt. It can’t last for ever, thank God,
03914: and his Ramadan only comes once a year; and I don’t believe it’s very
03915: punctual then.
03916: 
03917: I went down to supper. After sitting a long time listening to the long
03918: stories of some sailors who had just come from a plum-pudding voyage,
03919: as they called it (that is, a short whaling-voyage in a schooner or
03920: brig, confined to the north of the line, in the Atlantic Ocean only);
03921: after listening to these plum-puddingers till nearly eleven o’clock, I
03922: went up stairs to go to bed, feeling quite sure by this time Queequeg
03923: must certainly have brought his Ramadan to a termination. But no; there
03924: he was just where I had left him; he had not stirred an inch. I began
03925: to grow vexed with him; it seemed so downright senseless and insane to
03926: be sitting there all day and half the night on his hams in a cold room,
03927: holding a piece of wood on his head.
03928: 
03929: “For heaven’s sake, Queequeg, get up and shake yourself; get up and
03930: have some supper. You’ll starve; you’ll kill yourself, Queequeg.” But
03931: not a word did he reply.
03932: 
03933: Despairing of him, therefore, I determined to go to bed and to sleep;
03934: and no doubt, before a great while, he would follow me. But previous to
03935: turning in, I took my heavy bearskin jacket, and threw it over him, as
03936: it promised to be a very cold night; and he had nothing but his
03937: ordinary round jacket on. For some time, do all I would, I could not
03938: get into the faintest doze. I had blown out the candle; and the mere
03939: thought of Queequeg—not four feet off—sitting there in that uneasy
03940: position, stark alone in the cold and dark; this made me really
03941: wretched. Think of it; sleeping all night in the same room with a wide
03942: awake pagan on his hams in this dreary, unaccountable Ramadan!
03943: 
03944: But somehow I dropped off at last, and knew nothing more till break of
03945: day; when, looking over the bedside, there squatted Queequeg, as if he
03946: had been screwed down to the floor. But as soon as the first glimpse of
03947: sun entered the window, up he got, with stiff and grating joints, but
03948: with a cheerful look; limped towards me where I lay; pressed his
03949: forehead again against mine; and said his Ramadan was over.
03950: 
03951: Now, as I before hinted, I have no objection to any person’s religion,
03952: be it what it may, so long as that person does not kill or insult any
03953: other person, because that other person don’t believe it also. But when
03954: a man’s religion becomes really frantic; when it is a positive torment
03955: to him; and, in fine, makes this earth of ours an uncomfortable inn to
03956: lodge in; then I think it high time to take that individual aside and
03957: argue the point with him.
03958: 
03959: And just so I now did with Queequeg. “Queequeg,” said I, “get into bed
03960: now, and lie and listen to me.” I then went on, beginning with the rise
03961: and progress of the primitive religions, and coming down to the various
03962: religions of the present time, during which time I labored to show
03963: Queequeg that all these Lents, Ramadans, and prolonged ham-squattings
03964: in cold, cheerless rooms were stark nonsense; bad for the health;
03965: useless for the soul; opposed, in short, to the obvious laws of Hygiene
03966: and common sense. I told him, too, that he being in other things such
03967: an extremely sensible and sagacious savage, it pained me, very badly
03968: pained me, to see him now so deplorably foolish about this ridiculous
03969: Ramadan of his. Besides, argued I, fasting makes the body cave in;
03970: hence the spirit caves in; and all thoughts born of a fast must
03971: necessarily be half-starved. This is the reason why most dyspeptic
03972: religionists cherish such melancholy notions about their hereafters. In
03973: one word, Queequeg, said I, rather digressively; hell is an idea first
03974: born on an undigested apple-dumpling; and since then perpetuated
03975: through the hereditary dyspepsias nurtured by Ramadans.
03976: 
03977: I then asked Queequeg whether he himself was ever troubled with
03978: dyspepsia; expressing the idea very plainly, so that he could take it
03979: in. He said no; only upon one memorable occasion. It was after a great
03980: feast given by his father the king, on the gaining of a great battle
03981: wherein fifty of the enemy had been killed by about two o’clock in the
03982: afternoon, and all cooked and eaten that very evening.
03983: 
03984: “No more, Queequeg,” said I, shuddering; “that will do;” for I knew the
03985: inferences without his further hinting them. I had seen a sailor who
03986: had visited that very island, and he told me that it was the custom,
03987: when a great battle had been gained there, to barbecue all the slain in
03988: the yard or garden of the victor; and then, one by one, they were
03989: placed in great wooden trenchers, and garnished round like a pilau,
03990: with breadfruit and cocoanuts; and with some parsley in their mouths,
03991: were sent round with the victor’s compliments to all his friends, just
03992: as though these presents were so many Christmas turkeys.
03993: 
03994: After all, I do not think that my remarks about religion made much
03995: impression upon Queequeg. Because, in the first place, he somehow
03996: seemed dull of hearing on that important subject, unless considered
03997: from his own point of view; and, in the second place, he did not more
03998: than one third understand me, couch my ideas simply as I would; and,
03999: finally, he no doubt thought he knew a good deal more about the true
04000: religion than I did. He looked at me with a sort of condescending
04001: concern and compassion, as though he thought it a great pity that such
04002: a sensible young man should be so hopelessly lost to evangelical pagan
04003: piety.
04004: 
04005: At last we rose and dressed; and Queequeg, taking a prodigiously hearty
04006: breakfast of chowders of all sorts, so that the landlady should not
04007: make much profit by reason of his Ramadan, we sallied out to board the
04008: Pequod, sauntering along, and picking our teeth with halibut bones.
04009: 
04010: 
04011: CHAPTER 18. His Mark.
04012: 
04013: As we were walking down the end of the wharf towards the ship, Queequeg
04014: carrying his harpoon, Captain Peleg in his gruff voice loudly hailed us
04015: from his wigwam, saying he had not suspected my friend was a cannibal,
04016: and furthermore announcing that he let no cannibals on board that
04017: craft, unless they previously produced their papers.
04018: 
04019: “What do you mean by that, Captain Peleg?” said I, now jumping on the
04020: bulwarks, and leaving my comrade standing on the wharf.
04021: 
04022: “I mean,” he replied, “he must show his papers.”
04023: 
04024: “Yes,” said Captain Bildad in his hollow voice, sticking his head from
04025: behind Peleg’s, out of the wigwam. “He must show that he’s converted.
04026: Son of darkness,” he added, turning to Queequeg, “art thou at present
04027: in communion with any Christian church?”
04028: 
04029: “Why,” said I, “he’s a member of the first Congregational Church.” Here
04030: be it said, that many tattooed savages sailing in Nantucket ships at
04031: last come to be converted into the churches.
04032: 
04033: “First Congregational Church,” cried Bildad, “what! that worships in
04034: Deacon Deuteronomy Coleman’s meeting-house?” and so saying, taking out
04035: his spectacles, he rubbed them with his great yellow bandana
04036: handkerchief, and putting them on very carefully, came out of the
04037: wigwam, and leaning stiffly over the bulwarks, took a good long look at
04038: Queequeg.
04039: 
04040: “How long hath he been a member?” he then said, turning to me; “not
04041: very long, I rather guess, young man.”
04042: 
04043: “No,” said Peleg, “and he hasn’t been baptized right either, or it
04044: would have washed some of that devil’s blue off his face.”
04045: 
04046: “Do tell, now,” cried Bildad, “is this Philistine a regular member of
04047: Deacon Deuteronomy’s meeting? I never saw him going there, and I pass
04048: it every Lord’s day.”
04049: 
04050: “I don’t know anything about Deacon Deuteronomy or his meeting,” said
04051: I; “all I know is, that Queequeg here is a born member of the First
04052: Congregational Church. He is a deacon himself, Queequeg is.”
04053: 
04054: “Young man,” said Bildad sternly, “thou art skylarking with me—explain
04055: thyself, thou young Hittite. What church dost thee mean? answer me.”
04056: 
04057: Finding myself thus hard pushed, I replied. “I mean, sir, the same
04058: ancient Catholic Church to which you and I, and Captain Peleg there,
04059: and Queequeg here, and all of us, and every mother’s son and soul of us
04060: belong; the great and everlasting First Congregation of this whole
04061: worshipping world; we all belong to that; only some of us cherish some
04062: queer crotchets no ways touching the grand belief; in _that_ we all
04063: join hands.”
04064: 
04065: “Splice, thou mean’st _splice_ hands,” cried Peleg, drawing nearer.
04066: “Young man, you’d better ship for a missionary, instead of a fore-mast
04067: hand; I never heard a better sermon. Deacon Deuteronomy—why Father
04068: Mapple himself couldn’t beat it, and he’s reckoned something. Come
04069: aboard, come aboard; never mind about the papers. I say, tell Quohog
04070: there—what’s that you call him? tell Quohog to step along. By the great
04071: anchor, what a harpoon he’s got there! looks like good stuff that; and
04072: he handles it about right. I say, Quohog, or whatever your name is, did
04073: you ever stand in the head of a whale-boat? did you ever strike a
04074: fish?”
04075: 
04076: Without saying a word, Queequeg, in his wild sort of way, jumped upon
04077: the bulwarks, from thence into the bows of one of the whale-boats
04078: hanging to the side; and then bracing his left knee, and poising his
04079: harpoon, cried out in some such way as this:—
04080: 
04081: “Cap’ain, you see him small drop tar on water dere? You see him? well,
04082: spose him one whale eye, well, den!” and taking sharp aim at it, he
04083: darted the iron right over old Bildad’s broad brim, clean across the
04084: ship’s decks, and struck the glistening tar spot out of sight.
04085: 
04086: “Now,” said Queequeg, quietly hauling in the line, “spos-ee him whale-e
04087: eye; why, dad whale dead.”
04088: 
04089: “Quick, Bildad,” said Peleg, his partner, who, aghast at the close
04090: vicinity of the flying harpoon, had retreated towards the cabin
04091: gangway. “Quick, I say, you Bildad, and get the ship’s papers. We must
04092: have Hedgehog there, I mean Quohog, in one of our boats. Look ye,
04093: Quohog, we’ll give ye the ninetieth lay, and that’s more than ever was
04094: given a harpooneer yet out of Nantucket.”
04095: 
04096: So down we went into the cabin, and to my great joy Queequeg was soon
04097: enrolled among the same ship’s company to which I myself belonged.
04098: 
04099: When all preliminaries were over and Peleg had got everything ready for
04100: signing, he turned to me and said, “I guess, Quohog there don’t know
04101: how to write, does he? I say, Quohog, blast ye! dost thou sign thy name
04102: or make thy mark?”
04103: 
04104: But at this question, Queequeg, who had twice or thrice before taken
04105: part in similar ceremonies, looked no ways abashed; but taking the
04106: offered pen, copied upon the paper, in the proper place, an exact
04107: counterpart of a queer round figure which was tattooed upon his arm; so
04108: that through Captain Peleg’s obstinate mistake touching his
04109: appellative, it stood something like this:—
04110: 
04111: Quohog. his X mark.
04112: 
04113: Meanwhile Captain Bildad sat earnestly and steadfastly eyeing Queequeg,
04114: and at last rising solemnly and fumbling in the huge pockets of his
04115: broad-skirted drab coat, took out a bundle of tracts, and selecting one
04116: entitled “The Latter Day Coming; or No Time to Lose,” placed it in
04117: Queequeg’s hands, and then grasping them and the book with both his,
04118: looked earnestly into his eyes, and said, “Son of darkness, I must do
04119: my duty by thee; I am part owner of this ship, and feel concerned for
04120: the souls of all its crew; if thou still clingest to thy Pagan ways,
04121: which I sadly fear, I beseech thee, remain not for aye a Belial
04122: bondsman. Spurn the idol Bell, and the hideous dragon; turn from the
04123: wrath to come; mind thine eye, I say; oh! goodness gracious! steer
04124: clear of the fiery pit!”
04125: 
04126: Something of the salt sea yet lingered in old Bildad’s language,
04127: heterogeneously mixed with Scriptural and domestic phrases.
04128: 
04129: “Avast there, avast there, Bildad, avast now spoiling our harpooneer,”
04130: cried Peleg. “Pious harpooneers never make good voyagers—it takes the
04131: shark out of ’em; no harpooneer is worth a straw who aint pretty
04132: sharkish. There was young Nat Swaine, once the bravest boat-header out
04133: of all Nantucket and the Vineyard; he joined the meeting, and never
04134: came to good. He got so frightened about his plaguy soul, that he
04135: shrinked and sheered away from whales, for fear of after-claps, in case
04136: he got stove and went to Davy Jones.”
04137: 
04138: “Peleg! Peleg!” said Bildad, lifting his eyes and hands, “thou thyself,
04139: as I myself, hast seen many a perilous time; thou knowest, Peleg, what
04140: it is to have the fear of death; how, then, can’st thou prate in this
04141: ungodly guise. Thou beliest thine own heart, Peleg. Tell me, when this
04142: same Pequod here had her three masts overboard in that typhoon on
04143: Japan, that same voyage when thou went mate with Captain Ahab, did’st
04144: thou not think of Death and the Judgment then?”
04145: 
04146: “Hear him, hear him now,” cried Peleg, marching across the cabin, and
04147: thrusting his hands far down into his pockets,—“hear him, all of ye.
04148: Think of that! When every moment we thought the ship would sink! Death
04149: and the Judgment then? What? With all three masts making such an
04150: everlasting thundering against the side; and every sea breaking over
04151: us, fore and aft. Think of Death and the Judgment then? No! no time to
04152: think about Death then. Life was what Captain Ahab and I was thinking
04153: of; and how to save all hands—how to rig jury-masts—how to get into the
04154: nearest port; that was what I was thinking of.”
04155: 
04156: Bildad said no more, but buttoning up his coat, stalked on deck, where
04157: we followed him. There he stood, very quietly overlooking some
04158: sailmakers who were mending a top-sail in the waist. Now and then he
04159: stooped to pick up a patch, or save an end of tarred twine, which
04160: otherwise might have been wasted.
04161: 
04162: 
04163: CHAPTER 19. The Prophet.
04164: 
04165: “Shipmates, have ye shipped in that ship?”
04166: 
04167: Queequeg and I had just left the Pequod, and were sauntering away from
04168: the water, for the moment each occupied with his own thoughts, when the
04169: above words were put to us by a stranger, who, pausing before us,
04170: levelled his massive forefinger at the vessel in question. He was but
04171: shabbily apparelled in faded jacket and patched trowsers; a rag of a
04172: black handkerchief investing his neck. A confluent small-pox had in all
04173: directions flowed over his face, and left it like the complicated
04174: ribbed bed of a torrent, when the rushing waters have been dried up.
04175: 
04176: “Have ye shipped in her?” he repeated.
04177: 
04178: “You mean the ship Pequod, I suppose,” said I, trying to gain a little
04179: more time for an uninterrupted look at him.
04180: 
04181: “Aye, the Pequod—that ship there,” he said, drawing back his whole arm,
04182: and then rapidly shoving it straight out from him, with the fixed
04183: bayonet of his pointed finger darted full at the object.
04184: 
04185: “Yes,” said I, “we have just signed the articles.”
04186: 
04187: “Anything down there about your souls?”
04188: 
04189: “About what?”
04190: 
04191: “Oh, perhaps you hav’n’t got any,” he said quickly. “No matter though,
04192: I know many chaps that hav’n’t got any,—good luck to ’em; and they are
04193: all the better off for it. A soul’s a sort of a fifth wheel to a
04194: wagon.”
04195: 
04196: “What are you jabbering about, shipmate?” said I.
04197: 
04198: “_He’s_ got enough, though, to make up for all deficiencies of that
04199: sort in other chaps,” abruptly said the stranger, placing a nervous
04200: emphasis upon the word _he_.
04201: 
04202: “Queequeg,” said I, “let’s go; this fellow has broken loose from
04203: somewhere; he’s talking about something and somebody we don’t know.”
04204: 
04205: “Stop!” cried the stranger. “Ye said true—ye hav’n’t seen Old Thunder
04206: yet, have ye?”
04207: 
04208: “Who’s Old Thunder?” said I, again riveted with the insane earnestness
04209: of his manner.
04210: 
04211: “Captain Ahab.”
04212: 
04213: “What! the captain of our ship, the Pequod?”
04214: 
04215: “Aye, among some of us old sailor chaps, he goes by that name. Ye
04216: hav’n’t seen him yet, have ye?”
04217: 
04218: “No, we hav’n’t. He’s sick they say, but is getting better, and will be
04219: all right again before long.”
04220: 
04221: “All right again before long!” laughed the stranger, with a solemnly
04222: derisive sort of laugh. “Look ye; when Captain Ahab is all right, then
04223: this left arm of mine will be all right; not before.”
04224: 
04225: “What do you know about him?”
04226: 
04227: “What did they _tell_ you about him? Say that!”
04228: 
04229: “They didn’t tell much of anything about him; only I’ve heard that he’s
04230: a good whale-hunter, and a good captain to his crew.”
04231: 
04232: “That’s true, that’s true—yes, both true enough. But you must jump when
04233: he gives an order. Step and growl; growl and go—that’s the word with
04234: Captain Ahab. But nothing about that thing that happened to him off
04235: Cape Horn, long ago, when he lay like dead for three days and nights;
04236: nothing about that deadly skrimmage with the Spaniard afore the altar
04237: in Santa?—heard nothing about that, eh? Nothing about the silver
04238: calabash he spat into? And nothing about his losing his leg last
04239: voyage, according to the prophecy. Didn’t ye hear a word about them
04240: matters and something more, eh? No, I don’t think ye did; how could ye?
04241: Who knows it? Not all Nantucket, I guess. But hows’ever, mayhap, ye’ve
04242: heard tell about the leg, and how he lost it; aye, ye have heard of
04243: that, I dare say. Oh yes, _that_ every one knows a’most—I mean they
04244: know he’s only one leg; and that a parmacetti took the other off.”
04245: 
04246: “My friend,” said I, “what all this gibberish of yours is about, I
04247: don’t know, and I don’t much care; for it seems to me that you must be
04248: a little damaged in the head. But if you are speaking of Captain Ahab,
04249: of that ship there, the Pequod, then let me tell you, that I know all
04250: about the loss of his leg.”
04251: 
04252: “_All_ about it, eh—sure you do?—all?”
04253: 
04254: “Pretty sure.”
04255: 
04256: With finger pointed and eye levelled at the Pequod, the beggar-like
04257: stranger stood a moment, as if in a troubled reverie; then starting a
04258: little, turned and said:—“Ye’ve shipped, have ye? Names down on the
04259: papers? Well, well, what’s signed, is signed; and what’s to be, will
04260: be; and then again, perhaps it won’t be, after all. Anyhow, it’s all
04261: fixed and arranged a’ready; and some sailors or other must go with him,
04262: I suppose; as well these as any other men, God pity ’em! Morning to ye,
04263: shipmates, morning; the ineffable heavens bless ye; I’m sorry I stopped
04264: ye.”
04265: 
04266: “Look here, friend,” said I, “if you have anything important to tell
04267: us, out with it; but if you are only trying to bamboozle us, you are
04268: mistaken in your game; that’s all I have to say.”
04269: 
04270: “And it’s said very well, and I like to hear a chap talk up that way;
04271: you are just the man for him—the likes of ye. Morning to ye, shipmates,
04272: morning! Oh! when ye get there, tell ’em I’ve concluded not to make one
04273: of ’em.”
04274: 
04275: “Ah, my dear fellow, you can’t fool us that way—you can’t fool us. It
04276: is the easiest thing in the world for a man to look as if he had a
04277: great secret in him.”
04278: 
04279: “Morning to ye, shipmates, morning.”
04280: 
04281: “Morning it is,” said I. “Come along, Queequeg, let’s leave this crazy
04282: man. But stop, tell me your name, will you?”
04283: 
04284: “Elijah.”
04285: 
04286: Elijah! thought I, and we walked away, both commenting, after each
04287: other’s fashion, upon this ragged old sailor; and agreed that he was
04288: nothing but a humbug, trying to be a bugbear. But we had not gone
04289: perhaps above a hundred yards, when chancing to turn a corner, and
04290: looking back as I did so, who should be seen but Elijah following us,
04291: though at a distance. Somehow, the sight of him struck me so, that I
04292: said nothing to Queequeg of his being behind, but passed on with my
04293: comrade, anxious to see whether the stranger would turn the same corner
04294: that we did. He did; and then it seemed to me that he was dogging us,
04295: but with what intent I could not for the life of me imagine. This
04296: circumstance, coupled with his ambiguous, half-hinting, half-revealing,
04297: shrouded sort of talk, now begat in me all kinds of vague wonderments
04298: and half-apprehensions, and all connected with the Pequod; and Captain
04299: Ahab; and the leg he had lost; and the Cape Horn fit; and the silver
04300: calabash; and what Captain Peleg had said of him, when I left the ship
04301: the day previous; and the prediction of the squaw Tistig; and the
04302: voyage we had bound ourselves to sail; and a hundred other shadowy
04303: things.
04304: 
04305: I was resolved to satisfy myself whether this ragged Elijah was really
04306: dogging us or not, and with that intent crossed the way with Queequeg,
04307: and on that side of it retraced our steps. But Elijah passed on,
04308: without seeming to notice us. This relieved me; and once more, and
04309: finally as it seemed to me, I pronounced him in my heart, a humbug.
04310: 
04311: 
04312: CHAPTER 20. All Astir.
04313: 
04314: A day or two passed, and there was great activity aboard the Pequod.
04315: Not only were the old sails being mended, but new sails were coming on
04316: board, and bolts of canvas, and coils of rigging; in short, everything
04317: betokened that the ship’s preparations were hurrying to a close.
04318: Captain Peleg seldom or never went ashore, but sat in his wigwam
04319: keeping a sharp look-out upon the hands: Bildad did all the purchasing
04320: and providing at the stores; and the men employed in the hold and on
04321: the rigging were working till long after night-fall.
04322: 
04323: On the day following Queequeg’s signing the articles, word was given at
04324: all the inns where the ship’s company were stopping, that their chests
04325: must be on board before night, for there was no telling how soon the
04326: vessel might be sailing. So Queequeg and I got down our traps,
04327: resolving, however, to sleep ashore till the last. But it seems they
04328: always give very long notice in these cases, and the ship did not sail
