04329: for several days. But no wonder; there was a good deal to be done, and
04330: there is no telling how many things to be thought of, before the Pequod
04331: was fully equipped.
04332: 
04333: Every one knows what a multitude of things—beds, sauce-pans, knives and
04334: forks, shovels and tongs, napkins, nut-crackers, and what not, are
04335: indispensable to the business of housekeeping. Just so with whaling,
04336: which necessitates a three-years’ housekeeping upon the wide ocean, far
04337: from all grocers, costermongers, doctors, bakers, and bankers. And
04338: though this also holds true of merchant vessels, yet not by any means
04339: to the same extent as with whalemen. For besides the great length of
04340: the whaling voyage, the numerous articles peculiar to the prosecution
04341: of the fishery, and the impossibility of replacing them at the remote
04342: harbors usually frequented, it must be remembered, that of all ships,
04343: whaling vessels are the most exposed to accidents of all kinds, and
04344: especially to the destruction and loss of the very things upon which
04345: the success of the voyage most depends. Hence, the spare boats, spare
04346: spars, and spare lines and harpoons, and spare everythings, almost, but
04347: a spare Captain and duplicate ship.
04348: 
04349: At the period of our arrival at the Island, the heaviest storage of the
04350: Pequod had been almost completed; comprising her beef, bread, water,
04351: fuel, and iron hoops and staves. But, as before hinted, for some time
04352: there was a continual fetching and carrying on board of divers odds and
04353: ends of things, both large and small.
04354: 
04355: Chief among those who did this fetching and carrying was Captain
04356: Bildad’s sister, a lean old lady of a most determined and indefatigable
04357: spirit, but withal very kindhearted, who seemed resolved that, if _she_
04358: could help it, nothing should be found wanting in the Pequod, after
04359: once fairly getting to sea. At one time she would come on board with a
04360: jar of pickles for the steward’s pantry; another time with a bunch of
04361: quills for the chief mate’s desk, where he kept his log; a third time
04362: with a roll of flannel for the small of some one’s rheumatic back.
04363: Never did any woman better deserve her name, which was Charity—Aunt
04364: Charity, as everybody called her. And like a sister of charity did this
04365: charitable Aunt Charity bustle about hither and thither, ready to turn
04366: her hand and heart to anything that promised to yield safety, comfort,
04367: and consolation to all on board a ship in which her beloved brother
04368: Bildad was concerned, and in which she herself owned a score or two of
04369: well-saved dollars.
04370: 
04371: But it was startling to see this excellent hearted Quakeress coming on
04372: board, as she did the last day, with a long oil-ladle in one hand, and
04373: a still longer whaling lance in the other. Nor was Bildad himself nor
04374: Captain Peleg at all backward. As for Bildad, he carried about with him
04375: a long list of the articles needed, and at every fresh arrival, down
04376: went his mark opposite that article upon the paper. Every once in a
04377: while Peleg came hobbling out of his whalebone den, roaring at the men
04378: down the hatchways, roaring up to the riggers at the mast-head, and
04379: then concluded by roaring back into his wigwam.
04380: 
04381: During these days of preparation, Queequeg and I often visited the
04382: craft, and as often I asked about Captain Ahab, and how he was, and
04383: when he was going to come on board his ship. To these questions they
04384: would answer, that he was getting better and better, and was expected
04385: aboard every day; meantime, the two captains, Peleg and Bildad, could
04386: attend to everything necessary to fit the vessel for the voyage. If I
04387: had been downright honest with myself, I would have seen very plainly
04388: in my heart that I did but half fancy being committed this way to so
04389: long a voyage, without once laying my eyes on the man who was to be the
04390: absolute dictator of it, so soon as the ship sailed out upon the open
04391: sea. But when a man suspects any wrong, it sometimes happens that if he
04392: be already involved in the matter, he insensibly strives to cover up
04393: his suspicions even from himself. And much this way it was with me. I
04394: said nothing, and tried to think nothing.
04395: 
04396: At last it was given out that some time next day the ship would
04397: certainly sail. So next morning, Queequeg and I took a very early
04398: start.
04399: 
04400: 
04401: CHAPTER 21. Going Aboard.
04402: 
04403: It was nearly six o’clock, but only grey imperfect misty dawn, when we
04404: drew nigh the wharf.
04405: 
04406: “There are some sailors running ahead there, if I see right,” said I to
04407: Queequeg, “it can’t be shadows; she’s off by sunrise, I guess; come
04408: on!”
04409: 
04410: “Avast!” cried a voice, whose owner at the same time coming close
04411: behind us, laid a hand upon both our shoulders, and then insinuating
04412: himself between us, stood stooping forward a little, in the uncertain
04413: twilight, strangely peering from Queequeg to me. It was Elijah.
04414: 
04415: “Going aboard?”
04416: 
04417: “Hands off, will you,” said I.
04418: 
04419: “Lookee here,” said Queequeg, shaking himself, “go ’way!”
04420: 
04421: “Ain’t going aboard, then?”
04422: 
04423: “Yes, we are,” said I, “but what business is that of yours? Do you
04424: know, Mr. Elijah, that I consider you a little impertinent?”
04425: 
04426: “No, no, no; I wasn’t aware of that,” said Elijah, slowly and
04427: wonderingly looking from me to Queequeg, with the most unaccountable
04428: glances.
04429: 
04430: “Elijah,” said I, “you will oblige my friend and me by withdrawing. We
04431: are going to the Indian and Pacific Oceans, and would prefer not to be
04432: detained.”
04433: 
04434: “Ye be, be ye? Coming back afore breakfast?”
04435: 
04436: “He’s cracked, Queequeg,” said I, “come on.”
04437: 
04438: “Holloa!” cried stationary Elijah, hailing us when we had removed a few
04439: paces.
04440: 
04441: “Never mind him,” said I, “Queequeg, come on.”
04442: 
04443: But he stole up to us again, and suddenly clapping his hand on my
04444: shoulder, said—“Did ye see anything looking like men going towards that
04445: ship a while ago?”
04446: 
04447: Struck by this plain matter-of-fact question, I answered, saying, “Yes,
04448: I thought I did see four or five men; but it was too dim to be sure.”
04449: 
04450: “Very dim, very dim,” said Elijah. “Morning to ye.”
04451: 
04452: Once more we quitted him; but once more he came softly after us; and
04453: touching my shoulder again, said, “See if you can find ’em now, will
04454: ye?
04455: 
04456: “Find who?”
04457: 
04458: “Morning to ye! morning to ye!” he rejoined, again moving off. “Oh! I
04459: was going to warn ye against—but never mind, never mind—it’s all one,
04460: all in the family too;—sharp frost this morning, ain’t it? Good-bye to
04461: ye. Shan’t see ye again very soon, I guess; unless it’s before the
04462: Grand Jury.” And with these cracked words he finally departed, leaving
04463: me, for the moment, in no small wonderment at his frantic impudence.
04464: 
04465: At last, stepping on board the Pequod, we found everything in profound
04466: quiet, not a soul moving. The cabin entrance was locked within; the
04467: hatches were all on, and lumbered with coils of rigging. Going forward
04468: to the forecastle, we found the slide of the scuttle open. Seeing a
04469: light, we went down, and found only an old rigger there, wrapped in a
04470: tattered pea-jacket. He was thrown at whole length upon two chests, his
04471: face downwards and inclosed in his folded arms. The profoundest slumber
04472: slept upon him.
04473: 
04474: “Those sailors we saw, Queequeg, where can they have gone to?” said I,
04475: looking dubiously at the sleeper. But it seemed that, when on the
04476: wharf, Queequeg had not at all noticed what I now alluded to; hence I
04477: would have thought myself to have been optically deceived in that
04478: matter, were it not for Elijah’s otherwise inexplicable question. But I
04479: beat the thing down; and again marking the sleeper, jocularly hinted to
04480: Queequeg that perhaps we had best sit up with the body; telling him to
04481: establish himself accordingly. He put his hand upon the sleeper’s rear,
04482: as though feeling if it was soft enough; and then, without more ado,
04483: sat quietly down there.
04484: 
04485: “Gracious! Queequeg, don’t sit there,” said I.
04486: 
04487: “Oh! perry dood seat,” said Queequeg, “my country way; won’t hurt him
04488: face.”
04489: 
04490: “Face!” said I, “call that his face? very benevolent countenance then;
04491: but how hard he breathes, he’s heaving himself; get off, Queequeg, you
04492: are heavy, it’s grinding the face of the poor. Get off, Queequeg! Look,
04493: he’ll twitch you off soon. I wonder he don’t wake.”
04494: 
04495: Queequeg removed himself to just beyond the head of the sleeper, and
04496: lighted his tomahawk pipe. I sat at the feet. We kept the pipe passing
04497: over the sleeper, from one to the other. Meanwhile, upon questioning
04498: him in his broken fashion, Queequeg gave me to understand that, in his
04499: land, owing to the absence of settees and sofas of all sorts, the king,
04500: chiefs, and great people generally, were in the custom of fattening
04501: some of the lower orders for ottomans; and to furnish a house
04502: comfortably in that respect, you had only to buy up eight or ten lazy
04503: fellows, and lay them round in the piers and alcoves. Besides, it was
04504: very convenient on an excursion; much better than those garden-chairs
04505: which are convertible into walking-sticks; upon occasion, a chief
04506: calling his attendant, and desiring him to make a settee of himself
04507: under a spreading tree, perhaps in some damp marshy place.
04508: 
04509: While narrating these things, every time Queequeg received the tomahawk
04510: from me, he flourished the hatchet-side of it over the sleeper’s head.
04511: 
04512: “What’s that for, Queequeg?”
04513: 
04514: “Perry easy, kill-e; oh! perry easy!”
04515: 
04516: He was going on with some wild reminiscences about his tomahawk-pipe,
04517: which, it seemed, had in its two uses both brained his foes and soothed
04518: his soul, when we were directly attracted to the sleeping rigger. The
04519: strong vapor now completely filling the contracted hole, it began to
04520: tell upon him. He breathed with a sort of muffledness; then seemed
04521: troubled in the nose; then revolved over once or twice; then sat up and
04522: rubbed his eyes.
04523: 
04524: “Holloa!” he breathed at last, “who be ye smokers?”
04525: 
04526: “Shipped men,” answered I, “when does she sail?”
04527: 
04528: “Aye, aye, ye are going in her, be ye? She sails to-day. The Captain
04529: came aboard last night.”
04530: 
04531: “What Captain?—Ahab?”
04532: 
04533: “Who but him indeed?”
04534: 
04535: I was going to ask him some further questions concerning Ahab, when we
04536: heard a noise on deck.
04537: 
04538: “Holloa! Starbuck’s astir,” said the rigger. “He’s a lively chief mate,
04539: that; good man, and a pious; but all alive now, I must turn to.” And so
04540: saying he went on deck, and we followed.
04541: 
04542: It was now clear sunrise. Soon the crew came on board in twos and
04543: threes; the riggers bestirred themselves; the mates were actively
04544: engaged; and several of the shore people were busy in bringing various
04545: last things on board. Meanwhile Captain Ahab remained invisibly
04546: enshrined within his cabin.
04547: 
04548: 
04549: CHAPTER 22. Merry Christmas.
04550: 
04551: At length, towards noon, upon the final dismissal of the ship’s
04552: riggers, and after the Pequod had been hauled out from the wharf, and
04553: after the ever-thoughtful Charity had come off in a whale-boat, with
04554: her last gift—a night-cap for Stubb, the second mate, her
04555: brother-in-law, and a spare Bible for the steward—after all this, the
04556: two Captains, Peleg and Bildad, issued from the cabin, and turning to
04557: the chief mate, Peleg said:
04558: 
04559: “Now, Mr. Starbuck, are you sure everything is right? Captain Ahab is
04560: all ready—just spoke to him—nothing more to be got from shore, eh?
04561: Well, call all hands, then. Muster ’em aft here—blast ’em!”
04562: 
04563: “No need of profane words, however great the hurry, Peleg,” said
04564: Bildad, “but away with thee, friend Starbuck, and do our bidding.”
04565: 
04566: How now! Here upon the very point of starting for the voyage, Captain
04567: Peleg and Captain Bildad were going it with a high hand on the
04568: quarter-deck, just as if they were to be joint-commanders at sea, as
04569: well as to all appearances in port. And, as for Captain Ahab, no sign
04570: of him was yet to be seen; only, they said he was in the cabin. But
04571: then, the idea was, that his presence was by no means necessary in
04572: getting the ship under weigh, and steering her well out to sea. Indeed,
04573: as that was not at all his proper business, but the pilot’s; and as he
04574: was not yet completely recovered—so they said—therefore, Captain Ahab
04575: stayed below. And all this seemed natural enough; especially as in the
04576: merchant service many captains never show themselves on deck for a
04577: considerable time after heaving up the anchor, but remain over the
04578: cabin table, having a farewell merry-making with their shore friends,
04579: before they quit the ship for good with the pilot.
04580: 
04581: But there was not much chance to think over the matter, for Captain
04582: Peleg was now all alive. He seemed to do most of the talking and
04583: commanding, and not Bildad.
04584: 
04585: “Aft here, ye sons of bachelors,” he cried, as the sailors lingered at
04586: the main-mast. “Mr. Starbuck, drive ’em aft.”
04587: 
04588: “Strike the tent there!”—was the next order. As I hinted before, this
04589: whalebone marquee was never pitched except in port; and on board the
04590: Pequod, for thirty years, the order to strike the tent was well known
04591: to be the next thing to heaving up the anchor.
04592: 
04593: “Man the capstan! Blood and thunder!—jump!”—was the next command, and
04594: the crew sprang for the handspikes.
04595: 
04596: Now in getting under weigh, the station generally occupied by the pilot
04597: is the forward part of the ship. And here Bildad, who, with Peleg, be
04598: it known, in addition to his other officers, was one of the licensed
04599: pilots of the port—he being suspected to have got himself made a pilot
04600: in order to save the Nantucket pilot-fee to all the ships he was
04601: concerned in, for he never piloted any other craft—Bildad, I say, might
04602: now be seen actively engaged in looking over the bows for the
04603: approaching anchor, and at intervals singing what seemed a dismal stave
04604: of psalmody, to cheer the hands at the windlass, who roared forth some
04605: sort of a chorus about the girls in Booble Alley, with hearty good
04606: will. Nevertheless, not three days previous, Bildad had told them that
04607: no profane songs would be allowed on board the Pequod, particularly in
04608: getting under weigh; and Charity, his sister, had placed a small choice
04609: copy of Watts in each seaman’s berth.
04610: 
04611: Meantime, overseeing the other part of the ship, Captain Peleg ripped
04612: and swore astern in the most frightful manner. I almost thought he
04613: would sink the ship before the anchor could be got up; involuntarily I
04614: paused on my handspike, and told Queequeg to do the same, thinking of
04615: the perils we both ran, in starting on the voyage with such a devil for
04616: a pilot. I was comforting myself, however, with the thought that in
04617: pious Bildad might be found some salvation, spite of his seven hundred
04618: and seventy-seventh lay; when I felt a sudden sharp poke in my rear,
04619: and turning round, was horrified at the apparition of Captain Peleg in
04620: the act of withdrawing his leg from my immediate vicinity. That was my
04621: first kick.
04622: 
04623: “Is that the way they heave in the marchant service?” he roared.
04624: “Spring, thou sheep-head; spring, and break thy backbone! Why don’t ye
04625: spring, I say, all of ye—spring! Quohog! spring, thou chap with the red
04626: whiskers; spring there, Scotch-cap; spring, thou green pants. Spring, I
04627: say, all of ye, and spring your eyes out!” And so saying, he moved
04628: along the windlass, here and there using his leg very freely, while
04629: imperturbable Bildad kept leading off with his psalmody. Thinks I,
04630: Captain Peleg must have been drinking something to-day.
04631: 
04632: At last the anchor was up, the sails were set, and off we glided. It
04633: was a short, cold Christmas; and as the short northern day merged into
04634: night, we found ourselves almost broad upon the wintry ocean, whose
04635: freezing spray cased us in ice, as in polished armor. The long rows of
04636: teeth on the bulwarks glistened in the moonlight; and like the white
04637: ivory tusks of some huge elephant, vast curving icicles depended from
04638: the bows.
04639: 
04640: Lank Bildad, as pilot, headed the first watch, and ever and anon, as
04641: the old craft deep dived into the green seas, and sent the shivering
04642: frost all over her, and the winds howled, and the cordage rang, his
04643: steady notes were heard,—
04644: 
04645: 
04646: _“Sweet fields beyond the swelling flood, Stand dressed in living
04647: green. So to the Jews old Canaan stood, While Jordan rolled between.”_
04648: 
04649: 
04650: 
04651: Never did those sweet words sound more sweetly to me than then. They
04652: were full of hope and fruition. Spite of this frigid winter night in
04653: the boisterous Atlantic, spite of my wet feet and wetter jacket, there
04654: was yet, it then seemed to me, many a pleasant haven in store; and
04655: meads and glades so eternally vernal, that the grass shot up by the
04656: spring, untrodden, unwilted, remains at midsummer.
04657: 
04658: At last we gained such an offing, that the two pilots were needed no
04659: longer. The stout sail-boat that had accompanied us began ranging
04660: alongside.
04661: 
04662: It was curious and not unpleasing, how Peleg and Bildad were affected
04663: at this juncture, especially Captain Bildad. For loath to depart, yet;
04664: very loath to leave, for good, a ship bound on so long and perilous a
04665: voyage—beyond both stormy Capes; a ship in which some thousands of his
04666: hard earned dollars were invested; a ship, in which an old shipmate
04667: sailed as captain; a man almost as old as he, once more starting to
04668: encounter all the terrors of the pitiless jaw; loath to say good-bye to
04669: a thing so every way brimful of every interest to him,—poor old Bildad
04670: lingered long; paced the deck with anxious strides; ran down into the
04671: cabin to speak another farewell word there; again came on deck, and
04672: looked to windward; looked towards the wide and endless waters, only
04673: bounded by the far-off unseen Eastern Continents; looked towards the
04674: land; looked aloft; looked right and left; looked everywhere and
04675: nowhere; and at last, mechanically coiling a rope upon its pin,
04676: convulsively grasped stout Peleg by the hand, and holding up a lantern,
04677: for a moment stood gazing heroically in his face, as much as to say,
04678: “Nevertheless, friend Peleg, I can stand it; yes, I can.”
04679: 
04680: As for Peleg himself, he took it more like a philosopher; but for all
04681: his philosophy, there was a tear twinkling in his eye, when the lantern
04682: came too near. And he, too, did not a little run from cabin to deck—now
04683: a word below, and now a word with Starbuck, the chief mate.
04684: 
04685: But, at last, he turned to his comrade, with a final sort of look about
04686: him,—“Captain Bildad—come, old shipmate, we must go. Back the main-yard
04687: there! Boat ahoy! Stand by to come close alongside, now! Careful,
04688: careful!—come, Bildad, boy—say your last. Luck to ye, Starbuck—luck to
04689: ye, Mr. Stubb—luck to ye, Mr. Flask—good-bye and good luck to ye
04690: all—and this day three years I’ll have a hot supper smoking for ye in
04691: old Nantucket. Hurrah and away!”
04692: 
04693: “God bless ye, and have ye in His holy keeping, men,” murmured old
04694: Bildad, almost incoherently. “I hope ye’ll have fine weather now, so
04695: that Captain Ahab may soon be moving among ye—a pleasant sun is all he
04696: needs, and ye’ll have plenty of them in the tropic voyage ye go. Be
04697: careful in the hunt, ye mates. Don’t stave the boats needlessly, ye
04698: harpooneers; good white cedar plank is raised full three per cent.
04699: within the year. Don’t forget your prayers, either. Mr. Starbuck, mind
04700: that cooper don’t waste the spare staves. Oh! the sail-needles are in
04701: the green locker! Don’t whale it too much a’ Lord’s days, men; but
04702: don’t miss a fair chance either, that’s rejecting Heaven’s good gifts.
04703: Have an eye to the molasses tierce, Mr. Stubb; it was a little leaky, I
04704: thought. If ye touch at the islands, Mr. Flask, beware of fornication.
04705: Good-bye, good-bye! Don’t keep that cheese too long down in the hold,
04706: Mr. Starbuck; it’ll spoil. Be careful with the butter—twenty cents the
04707: pound it was, and mind ye, if—”
04708: 
04709: “Come, come, Captain Bildad; stop palavering,—away!” and with that,
04710: Peleg hurried him over the side, and both dropt into the boat.
04711: 
04712: Ship and boat diverged; the cold, damp night breeze blew between; a
04713: screaming gull flew overhead; the two hulls wildly rolled; we gave
04714: three heavy-hearted cheers, and blindly plunged like fate into the lone
04715: Atlantic.
04716: 
04717: 
04718: CHAPTER 23. The Lee Shore.
04719: 
04720: Some chapters back, one Bulkington was spoken of, a tall, newlanded
04721: mariner, encountered in New Bedford at the inn.
04722: 
04723: When on that shivering winter’s night, the Pequod thrust her vindictive
04724: bows into the cold malicious waves, who should I see standing at her
04725: helm but Bulkington! I looked with sympathetic awe and fearfulness upon
04726: the man, who in mid-winter just landed from a four years’ dangerous
04727: voyage, could so unrestingly push off again for still another
04728: tempestuous term. The land seemed scorching to his feet. Wonderfullest
04729: things are ever the unmentionable; deep memories yield no epitaphs;
04730: this six-inch chapter is the stoneless grave of Bulkington. Let me only
04731: say that it fared with him as with the storm-tossed ship, that
04732: miserably drives along the leeward land. The port would fain give
04733: succor; the port is pitiful; in the port is safety, comfort,
04734: hearthstone, supper, warm blankets, friends, all that’s kind to our
04735: mortalities. But in that gale, the port, the land, is that ship’s
04736: direst jeopardy; she must fly all hospitality; one touch of land,
04737: though it but graze the keel, would make her shudder through and
04738: through. With all her might she crowds all sail off shore; in so doing,
04739: fights ’gainst the very winds that fain would blow her homeward; seeks
04740: all the lashed sea’s landlessness again; for refuge’s sake forlornly
04741: rushing into peril; her only friend her bitterest foe!
04742: 
04743: Know ye now, Bulkington? Glimpses do ye seem to see of that mortally
04744: intolerable truth; that all deep, earnest thinking is but the intrepid
04745: effort of the soul to keep the open independence of her sea; while the
04746: wildest winds of heaven and earth conspire to cast her on the
04747: treacherous, slavish shore?
04748: 
04749: But as in landlessness alone resides highest truth, shoreless,
04750: indefinite as God—so, better is it to perish in that howling infinite,
04751: than be ingloriously dashed upon the lee, even if that were safety! For
04752: worm-like, then, oh! who would craven crawl to land! Terrors of the
04753: terrible! is all this agony so vain? Take heart, take heart, O
04754: Bulkington! Bear thee grimly, demigod! Up from the spray of thy
04755: ocean-perishing—straight up, leaps thy apotheosis!
04756: 
04757: 
04758: CHAPTER 24. The Advocate.
04759: 
04760: As Queequeg and I are now fairly embarked in this business of whaling;
04761: and as this business of whaling has somehow come to be regarded among
04762: landsmen as a rather unpoetical and disreputable pursuit; therefore, I
04763: am all anxiety to convince ye, ye landsmen, of the injustice hereby
04764: done to us hunters of whales.
04765: 
04766: In the first place, it may be deemed almost superfluous to establish
04767: the fact, that among people at large, the business of whaling is not
04768: accounted on a level with what are called the liberal professions. If a
04769: stranger were introduced into any miscellaneous metropolitan society,
04770: it would but slightly advance the general opinion of his merits, were
04771: he presented to the company as a harpooneer, say; and if in emulation
04772: of the naval officers he should append the initials S.W.F. (Sperm Whale
04773: Fishery) to his visiting card, such a procedure would be deemed
04774: pre-eminently presuming and ridiculous.
04775: 
04776: Doubtless one leading reason why the world declines honoring us
04777: whalemen, is this: they think that, at best, our vocation amounts to a
04778: butchering sort of business; and that when actively engaged therein, we
04779: are surrounded by all manner of defilements. Butchers we are, that is
04780: true. But butchers, also, and butchers of the bloodiest badge have been
04781: all Martial Commanders whom the world invariably delights to honor. And
04782: as for the matter of the alleged uncleanliness of our business, ye
04783: shall soon be initiated into certain facts hitherto pretty generally
04784: unknown, and which, upon the whole, will triumphantly plant the sperm
04785: whale-ship at least among the cleanliest things of this tidy earth. But
04786: even granting the charge in question to be true; what disordered
04787: slippery decks of a whale-ship are comparable to the unspeakable
04788: carrion of those battle-fields from which so many soldiers return to
04789: drink in all ladies’ plaudits? And if the idea of peril so much
04790: enhances the popular conceit of the soldier’s profession; let me assure
04791: ye that many a veteran who has freely marched up to a battery, would
04792: quickly recoil at the apparition of the sperm whale’s vast tail,
04793: fanning into eddies the air over his head. For what are the
04794: comprehensible terrors of man compared with the interlinked terrors and
04795: wonders of God!
04796: 
04797: But, though the world scouts at us whale hunters, yet does it
04798: unwittingly pay us the profoundest homage; yea, an all-abounding
04799: adoration! for almost all the tapers, lamps, and candles that burn
04800: round the globe, burn, as before so many shrines, to our glory!
04801: 
04802: But look at this matter in other lights; weigh it in all sorts of
04803: scales; see what we whalemen are, and have been.
04804: 
04805: Why did the Dutch in De Witt’s time have admirals of their whaling
04806: fleets? Why did Louis XVI. of France, at his own personal expense, fit
04807: out whaling ships from Dunkirk, and politely invite to that town some
04808: score or two of families from our own island of Nantucket? Why did
04809: Britain between the years 1750 and 1788 pay to her whalemen in bounties
04810: upwards of £1,000,000? And lastly, how comes it that we whalemen of
04811: America now outnumber all the rest of the banded whalemen in the world;
04812: sail a navy of upwards of seven hundred vessels; manned by eighteen
04813: thousand men; yearly consuming 4,000,000 of dollars; the ships worth,
04814: at the time of sailing, $20,000,000! and every year importing into our
04815: harbors a well reaped harvest of $7,000,000. How comes all this, if
04816: there be not something puissant in whaling?
04817: 
04818: But this is not the half; look again.
04819: 
04820: I freely assert, that the cosmopolite philosopher cannot, for his life,
04821: point out one single peaceful influence, which within the last sixty
04822: years has operated more potentially upon the whole broad world, taken
04823: in one aggregate, than the high and mighty business of whaling. One way
04824: and another, it has begotten events so remarkable in themselves, and so
04825: continuously momentous in their sequential issues, that whaling may
04826: well be regarded as that Egyptian mother, who bore offspring themselves
04827: pregnant from her womb. It would be a hopeless, endless task to
04828: catalogue all these things. Let a handful suffice. For many years past
04829: the whale-ship has been the pioneer in ferreting out the remotest and
04830: least known parts of the earth. She has explored seas and archipelagoes
04831: which had no chart, where no Cook or Vancouver had ever sailed. If
04832: American and European men-of-war now peacefully ride in once savage
04833: harbors, let them fire salutes to the honor and glory of the
04834: whale-ship, which originally showed them the way, and first interpreted
04835: between them and the savages. They may celebrate as they will the
04836: heroes of Exploring Expeditions, your Cooks, your Krusensterns; but I
04837: say that scores of anonymous Captains have sailed out of Nantucket,
04838: that were as great, and greater than your Cook and your Krusenstern.
04839: For in their succourless empty-handedness, they, in the heathenish
04840: sharked waters, and by the beaches of unrecorded, javelin islands,
04841: battled with virgin wonders and terrors that Cook with all his marines
04842: and muskets would not willingly have dared. All that is made such a
04843: flourish of in the old South Sea Voyages, those things were but the
04844: life-time commonplaces of our heroic Nantucketers. Often, adventures
04845: which Vancouver dedicates three chapters to, these men accounted
04846: unworthy of being set down in the ship’s common log. Ah, the world! Oh,
04847: the world!
04848: 
04849: Until the whale fishery rounded Cape Horn, no commerce but colonial,
04850: scarcely any intercourse but colonial, was carried on between Europe
04851: and the long line of the opulent Spanish provinces on the Pacific
04852: coast. It was the whaleman who first broke through the jealous policy
04853: of the Spanish crown, touching those colonies; and, if space permitted,
04854: it might be distinctly shown how from those whalemen at last eventuated
04855: the liberation of Peru, Chili, and Bolivia from the yoke of Old Spain,
04856: and the establishment of the eternal democracy in those parts.
04857: 
04858: That great America on the other side of the sphere, Australia, was
04859: given to the enlightened world by the whaleman. After its first
04860: blunder-born discovery by a Dutchman, all other ships long shunned
04861: those shores as pestiferously barbarous; but the whale-ship touched
04862: there. The whale-ship is the true mother of that now mighty colony.
04863: Moreover, in the infancy of the first Australian settlement, the
04864: emigrants were several times saved from starvation by the benevolent
04865: biscuit of the whale-ship luckily dropping an anchor in their waters.
04866: The uncounted isles of all Polynesia confess the same truth, and do
04867: commercial homage to the whale-ship, that cleared the way for the
04868: missionary and the merchant, and in many cases carried the primitive
04869: missionaries to their first destinations. If that double-bolted land,
04870: Japan, is ever to become hospitable, it is the whale-ship alone to whom
04871: the credit will be due; for already she is on the threshold.
04872: 
04873: But if, in the face of all this, you still declare that whaling has no
04874: æsthetically noble associations connected with it, then am I ready to
04875: shiver fifty lances with you there, and unhorse you with a split helmet
04876: every time.
04877: 
04878: The whale has no famous author, and whaling no famous chronicler, you
04879: will say.
04880: 
04881: _The whale no famous author, and whaling no famous chronicler?_ Who
04882: wrote the first account of our Leviathan? Who but mighty Job! And who
04883: composed the first narrative of a whaling-voyage? Who, but no less a
04884: prince than Alfred the Great, who, with his own royal pen, took down
04885: the words from Other, the Norwegian whale-hunter of those times! And
04886: who pronounced our glowing eulogy in Parliament? Who, but Edmund Burke!
04887: 
04888: True enough, but then whalemen themselves are poor devils; they have no
04889: good blood in their veins.
04890: 
04891: _No good blood in their veins?_ They have something better than royal
04892: blood there. The grandmother of Benjamin Franklin was Mary Morrel;
04893: afterwards, by marriage, Mary Folger, one of the old settlers of
04894: Nantucket, and the ancestress to a long line of Folgers and
04895: harpooneers—all kith and kin to noble Benjamin—this day darting the
04896: barbed iron from one side of the world to the other.
04897: 
04898: Good again; but then all confess that somehow whaling is not
04899: respectable.
04900: 
04901: _Whaling not respectable?_ Whaling is imperial! By old English
04902: statutory law, the whale is declared “a royal fish.” *
04903: 
04904: Oh, that’s only nominal! The whale himself has never figured in any
04905: grand imposing way.
04906: 
04907: _The whale never figured in any grand imposing way?_ In one of the
04908: mighty triumphs given to a Roman general upon his entering the world’s
04909: capital, the bones of a whale, brought all the way from the Syrian
04910: coast, were the most conspicuous object in the cymballed procession.*
04911: 
04912: *See subsequent chapters for something more on this head.
04913: 
04914: Grant it, since you cite it; but, say what you will, there is no real
04915: dignity in whaling.
04916: 
04917: _No dignity in whaling?_ The dignity of our calling the very heavens
04918: attest. Cetus is a constellation in the South! No more! Drive down your
04919: hat in presence of the Czar, and take it off to Queequeg! No more! I
04920: know a man that, in his lifetime, has taken three hundred and fifty
04921: whales. I account that man more honorable than that great captain of
04922: antiquity who boasted of taking as many walled towns.
04923: 
04924: And, as for me, if, by any possibility, there be any as yet
04925: undiscovered prime thing in me; if I shall ever deserve any real repute
04926: in that small but high hushed world which I might not be unreasonably
04927: ambitious of; if hereafter I shall do anything that, upon the whole, a
04928: man might rather have done than to have left undone; if, at my death,
04929: my executors, or more properly my creditors, find any precious MSS. in
04930: my desk, then here I prospectively ascribe all the honor and the glory
04931: to whaling; for a whale-ship was my Yale College and my Harvard.
04932: 
04933: 
04934: CHAPTER 25. Postscript.
04935: 
04936: In behalf of the dignity of whaling, I would fain advance naught but
04937: substantiated facts. But after embattling his facts, an advocate who
04938: should wholly suppress a not unreasonable surmise, which might tell
04939: eloquently upon his cause—such an advocate, would he not be
04940: blameworthy?
04941: 
04942: It is well known that at the coronation of kings and queens, even
04943: modern ones, a certain curious process of seasoning them for their
04944: functions is gone through. There is a saltcellar of state, so called,
04945: and there may be a castor of state. How they use the salt,
04946: precisely—who knows? Certain I am, however, that a king’s head is
04947: solemnly oiled at his coronation, even as a head of salad. Can it be,
04948: though, that they anoint it with a view of making its interior run
04949: well, as they anoint machinery? Much might be ruminated here,
04950: concerning the essential dignity of this regal process, because in
04951: common life we esteem but meanly and contemptibly a fellow who anoints
04952: his hair, and palpably smells of that anointing. In truth, a mature man
04953: who uses hair-oil, unless medicinally, that man has probably got a
04954: quoggy spot in him somewhere. As a general rule, he can’t amount to
04955: much in his totality.
04956: 
04957: But the only thing to be considered here, is this—what kind of oil is
04958: used at coronations? Certainly it cannot be olive oil, nor macassar
04959: oil, nor castor oil, nor bear’s oil, nor train oil, nor cod-liver oil.
04960: What then can it possibly be, but sperm oil in its unmanufactured,
04961: unpolluted state, the sweetest of all oils?
04962: 
04963: Think of that, ye loyal Britons! we whalemen supply your kings and
04964: queens with coronation stuff!
04965: 
04966: 
04967: CHAPTER 26. Knights and Squires.
04968: 
04969: The chief mate of the Pequod was Starbuck, a native of Nantucket, and a
04970: Quaker by descent. He was a long, earnest man, and though born on an
04971: icy coast, seemed well adapted to endure hot latitudes, his flesh being
04972: hard as twice-baked biscuit. Transported to the Indies, his live blood
04973: would not spoil like bottled ale. He must have been born in some time
04974: of general drought and famine, or upon one of those fast days for which
04975: his state is famous. Only some thirty arid summers had he seen; those
04976: summers had dried up all his physical superfluousness. But this, his
04977: thinness, so to speak, seemed no more the token of wasting anxieties
04978: and cares, than it seemed the indication of any bodily blight. It was
04979: merely the condensation of the man. He was by no means ill-looking;
04980: quite the contrary. His pure tight skin was an excellent fit; and
04981: closely wrapped up in it, and embalmed with inner health and strength,
04982: like a revivified Egyptian, this Starbuck seemed prepared to endure for
04983: long ages to come, and to endure always, as now; for be it Polar snow
04984: or torrid sun, like a patent chronometer, his interior vitality was
04985: warranted to do well in all climates. Looking into his eyes, you seemed
04986: to see there the yet lingering images of those thousand-fold perils he
04987: had calmly confronted through life. A staid, steadfast man, whose life
04988: for the most part was a telling pantomime of action, and not a tame
04989: chapter of sounds. Yet, for all his hardy sobriety and fortitude, there
04990: were certain qualities in him which at times affected, and in some
04991: cases seemed well nigh to overbalance all the rest. Uncommonly
04992: conscientious for a seaman, and endued with a deep natural reverence,
04993: the wild watery loneliness of his life did therefore strongly incline
04994: him to superstition; but to that sort of superstition, which in some
04995: organizations seems rather to spring, somehow, from intelligence than
04996: from ignorance. Outward portents and inward presentiments were his. And
04997: if at times these things bent the welded iron of his soul, much more
04998: did his far-away domestic memories of his young Cape wife and child,
04999: tend to bend him still more from the original ruggedness of his nature,
05000: and open him still further to those latent influences which, in some
05001: honest-hearted men, restrain the gush of dare-devil daring, so often
05002: evinced by others in the more perilous vicissitudes of the fishery. “I
05003: will have no man in my boat,” said Starbuck, “who is not afraid of a
05004: whale.” By this, he seemed to mean, not only that the most reliable and
05005: useful courage was that which arises from the fair estimation of the
05006: encountered peril, but that an utterly fearless man is a far more
05007: dangerous comrade than a coward.
05008: 
05009: “Aye, aye,” said Stubb, the second mate, “Starbuck, there, is as
05010: careful a man as you’ll find anywhere in this fishery.” But we shall
05011: ere long see what that word “careful” precisely means when used by a
05012: man like Stubb, or almost any other whale hunter.
05013: 
05014: Starbuck was no crusader after perils; in him courage was not a
05015: sentiment; but a thing simply useful to him, and always at hand upon
05016: all mortally practical occasions. Besides, he thought, perhaps, that in
05017: this business of whaling, courage was one of the great staple outfits
05018: of the ship, like her beef and her bread, and not to be foolishly
05019: wasted. Wherefore he had no fancy for lowering for whales after
05020: sun-down; nor for persisting in fighting a fish that too much persisted
05021: in fighting him. For, thought Starbuck, I am here in this critical
05022: ocean to kill whales for my living, and not to be killed by them for
05023: theirs; and that hundreds of men had been so killed Starbuck well knew.
05024: What doom was his own father’s? Where, in the bottomless deeps, could
05025: he find the torn limbs of his brother?
05026: 
05027: With memories like these in him, and, moreover, given to a certain
05028: superstitiousness, as has been said; the courage of this Starbuck which
05029: could, nevertheless, still flourish, must indeed have been extreme. But
05030: it was not in reasonable nature that a man so organized, and with such
05031: terrible experiences and remembrances as he had; it was not in nature
05032: that these things should fail in latently engendering an element in
05033: him, which, under suitable circumstances, would break out from its
05034: confinement, and burn all his courage up. And brave as he might be, it
05035: was that sort of bravery chiefly, visible in some intrepid men, which,
05036: while generally abiding firm in the conflict with seas, or winds, or
05037: whales, or any of the ordinary irrational horrors of the world, yet
05038: cannot withstand those more terrific, because more spiritual terrors,
05039: which sometimes menace you from the concentrating brow of an enraged
05040: and mighty man.
05041: 
05042: But were the coming narrative to reveal in any instance, the complete
05043: abasement of poor Starbuck’s fortitude, scarce might I have the heart
05044: to write it; for it is a thing most sorrowful, nay shocking, to expose
05045: the fall of valour in the soul. Men may seem detestable as joint
05046: stock-companies and nations; knaves, fools, and murderers there may be;
05047: men may have mean and meagre faces; but man, in the ideal, is so noble
05048: and so sparkling, such a grand and glowing creature, that over any
05049: ignominious blemish in him all his fellows should run to throw their
05050: costliest robes. That immaculate manliness we feel within ourselves, so
05051: far within us, that it remains intact though all the outer character
05052: seem gone; bleeds with keenest anguish at the undraped spectacle of a
05053: valor-ruined man. Nor can piety itself, at such a shameful sight,
05054: completely stifle her upbraidings against the permitting stars. But
05055: this august dignity I treat of, is not the dignity of kings and robes,
05056: but that abounding dignity which has no robed investiture. Thou shalt
05057: see it shining in the arm that wields a pick or drives a spike; that
05058: democratic dignity which, on all hands, radiates without end from God;
05059: Himself! The great God absolute! The centre and circumference of all
05060: democracy! His omnipresence, our divine equality!
05061: 
05062: If, then, to meanest mariners, and renegades and castaways, I shall
05063: hereafter ascribe high qualities, though dark; weave round them tragic
05064: graces; if even the most mournful, perchance the most abased, among
05065: them all, shall at times lift himself to the exalted mounts; if I shall
05066: touch that workman’s arm with some ethereal light; if I shall spread a
05067: rainbow over his disastrous set of sun; then against all mortal critics
05068: bear me out in it, thou just Spirit of Equality, which hast spread one
05069: royal mantle of humanity over all my kind! Bear me out in it, thou
05070: great democratic God! who didst not refuse to the swart convict,
05071: Bunyan, the pale, poetic pearl; Thou who didst clothe with doubly
05072: hammered leaves of finest gold, the stumped and paupered arm of old
05073: Cervantes; Thou who didst pick up Andrew Jackson from the pebbles; who
05074: didst hurl him upon a war-horse; who didst thunder him higher than a
05075: throne! Thou who, in all Thy mighty, earthly marchings, ever cullest
05076: Thy selectest champions from the kingly commons; bear me out in it, O
05077: God!
05078: 
05079: 
05080: CHAPTER 27. Knights and Squires.
05081: 
05082: Stubb was the second mate. He was a native of Cape Cod; and hence,
05083: according to local usage, was called a Cape-Cod-man. A happy-go-lucky;
05084: neither craven nor valiant; taking perils as they came with an
05085: indifferent air; and while engaged in the most imminent crisis of the
05086: chase, toiling away, calm and collected as a journeyman joiner engaged
05087: for the year. Good-humored, easy, and careless, he presided over his
05088: whale-boat as if the most deadly encounter were but a dinner, and his
05089: crew all invited guests. He was as particular about the comfortable
05090: arrangement of his part of the boat, as an old stage-driver is about
05091: the snugness of his box. When close to the whale, in the very
05092: death-lock of the fight, he handled his unpitying lance coolly and
05093: off-handedly, as a whistling tinker his hammer. He would hum over his
05094: old rigadig tunes while flank and flank with the most exasperated
05095: monster. Long usage had, for this Stubb, converted the jaws of death
05096: into an easy chair. What he thought of death itself, there is no
05097: telling. Whether he ever thought of it at all, might be a question;
05098: but, if he ever did chance to cast his mind that way after a
05099: comfortable dinner, no doubt, like a good sailor, he took it to be a
05100: sort of call of the watch to tumble aloft, and bestir themselves there,
05101: about something which he would find out when he obeyed the order, and
05102: not sooner.
05103: 
05104: What, perhaps, with other things, made Stubb such an easy-going,
05105: unfearing man, so cheerily trudging off with the burden of life in a
05106: world full of grave pedlars, all bowed to the ground with their packs;
05107: what helped to bring about that almost impious good-humor of his; that
05108: thing must have been his pipe. For, like his nose, his short, black
05109: little pipe was one of the regular features of his face. You would
05110: almost as soon have expected him to turn out of his bunk without his
05111: nose as without his pipe. He kept a whole row of pipes there ready
05112: loaded, stuck in a rack, within easy reach of his hand; and, whenever
05113: he turned in, he smoked them all out in succession, lighting one from
05114: the other to the end of the chapter; then loading them again to be in
05115: readiness anew. For, when Stubb dressed, instead of first putting his
05116: legs into his trowsers, he put his pipe into his mouth.
05117: 
05118: I say this continual smoking must have been one cause, at least, of his
05119: peculiar disposition; for every one knows that this earthly air,
05120: whether ashore or afloat, is terribly infected with the nameless
05121: miseries of the numberless mortals who have died exhaling it; and as in
05122: time of the cholera, some people go about with a camphorated
05123: handkerchief to their mouths; so, likewise, against all mortal
05124: tribulations, Stubb’s tobacco smoke might have operated as a sort of
05125: disinfecting agent.
05126: 
05127: The third mate was Flask, a native of Tisbury, in Martha’s Vineyard. A
05128: short, stout, ruddy young fellow, very pugnacious concerning whales,
05129: who somehow seemed to think that the great leviathans had personally
05130: and hereditarily affronted him; and therefore it was a sort of point of
05131: honor with him, to destroy them whenever encountered. So utterly lost
05132: was he to all sense of reverence for the many marvels of their majestic
05133: bulk and mystic ways; and so dead to anything like an apprehension of
05134: any possible danger from encountering them; that in his poor opinion,
05135: the wondrous whale was but a species of magnified mouse, or at least
05136: water-rat, requiring only a little circumvention and some small
05137: application of time and trouble in order to kill and boil. This
05138: ignorant, unconscious fearlessness of his made him a little waggish in
05139: the matter of whales; he followed these fish for the fun of it; and a
05140: three years’ voyage round Cape Horn was only a jolly joke that lasted
05141: that length of time. As a carpenter’s nails are divided into wrought
05142: nails and cut nails; so mankind may be similarly divided. Little Flask
05143: was one of the wrought ones; made to clinch tight and last long. They
05144: called him King-Post on board of the Pequod; because, in form, he could
05145: be well likened to the short, square timber known by that name in
05146: Arctic whalers; and which by the means of many radiating side timbers
05147: inserted into it, serves to brace the ship against the icy concussions
05148: of those battering seas.
05149: 
05150: Now these three mates—Starbuck, Stubb, and Flask, were momentous men.
05151: They it was who by universal prescription commanded three of the
05152: Pequod’s boats as headsmen. In that grand order of battle in which
05153: Captain Ahab would probably marshal his forces to descend on the
05154: whales, these three headsmen were as captains of companies. Or, being
05155: armed with their long keen whaling spears, they were as a picked trio
05156: of lancers; even as the harpooneers were flingers of javelins.
05157: 
05158: And since in this famous fishery, each mate or headsman, like a Gothic
05159: Knight of old, is always accompanied by his boat-steerer or harpooneer,
05160: who in certain conjunctures provides him with a fresh lance, when the
05161: former one has been badly twisted, or elbowed in the assault; and
05162: moreover, as there generally subsists between the two, a close intimacy
05163: and friendliness; it is therefore but meet, that in this place we set
05164: down who the Pequod’s harpooneers were, and to what headsman each of
05165: them belonged.
05166: 
05167: First of all was Queequeg, whom Starbuck, the chief mate, had selected
05168: for his squire. But Queequeg is already known.
05169: 
05170: Next was Tashtego, an unmixed Indian from Gay Head, the most westerly
05171: promontory of Martha’s Vineyard, where there still exists the last
05172: remnant of a village of red men, which has long supplied the
05173: neighboring island of Nantucket with many of her most daring
05174: harpooneers. In the fishery, they usually go by the generic name of
05175: Gay-Headers. Tashtego’s long, lean, sable hair, his high cheek bones,
05176: and black rounding eyes—for an Indian, Oriental in their largeness, but
05177: Antarctic in their glittering expression—all this sufficiently
05178: proclaimed him an inheritor of the unvitiated blood of those proud
05179: warrior hunters, who, in quest of the great New England moose, had
05180: scoured, bow in hand, the aboriginal forests of the main. But no longer
05181: snuffing in the trail of the wild beasts of the woodland, Tashtego now
05182: hunted in the wake of the great whales of the sea; the unerring harpoon
05183: of the son fitly replacing the infallible arrow of the sires. To look
05184: at the tawny brawn of his lithe snaky limbs, you would almost have
05185: credited the superstitions of some of the earlier Puritans, and
05186: half-believed this wild Indian to be a son of the Prince of the Powers
05187: of the Air. Tashtego was Stubb the second mate’s squire.
05188: 
05189: Third among the harpooneers was Daggoo, a gigantic, coal-black
05190: negro-savage, with a lion-like tread—an Ahasuerus to behold. Suspended
05191: from his ears were two golden hoops, so large that the sailors called
05192: them ring-bolts, and would talk of securing the top-sail halyards to
05193: them. In his youth Daggoo had voluntarily shipped on board of a whaler,
05194: lying in a lonely bay on his native coast. And never having been
05195: anywhere in the world but in Africa, Nantucket, and the pagan harbors
05196: most frequented by whalemen; and having now led for many years the bold
05197: life of the fishery in the ships of owners uncommonly heedful of what
05198: manner of men they shipped; Daggoo retained all his barbaric virtues,
05199: and erect as a giraffe, moved about the decks in all the pomp of six
05200: feet five in his socks. There was a corporeal humility in looking up at
05201: him; and a white man standing before him seemed a white flag come to
05202: beg truce of a fortress. Curious to tell, this imperial negro,
05203: Ahasuerus Daggoo, was the Squire of little Flask, who looked like a
05204: chess-man beside him. As for the residue of the Pequod’s company, be it
05205: said, that at the present day not one in two of the many thousand men
05206: before the mast employed in the American whale fishery, are Americans
05207: born, though pretty nearly all the officers are. Herein it is the same
05208: with the American whale fishery as with the American army and military
05209: and merchant navies, and the engineering forces employed in the
05210: construction of the American Canals and Railroads. The same, I say,
05211: because in all these cases the native American liberally provides the
05212: brains, the rest of the world as generously supplying the muscles. No
05213: small number of these whaling seamen belong to the Azores, where the
05214: outward bound Nantucket whalers frequently touch to augment their crews
05215: from the hardy peasants of those rocky shores. In like manner, the
05216: Greenland whalers sailing out of Hull or London, put in at the Shetland
05217: Islands, to receive the full complement of their crew. Upon the passage
05218: homewards, they drop them there again. How it is, there is no telling,
05219: but Islanders seem to make the best whalemen. They were nearly all
05220: Islanders in the Pequod, _Isolatoes_ too, I call such, not
05221: acknowledging the common continent of men, but each _Isolato_ living on
05222: a separate continent of his own. Yet now, federated along one keel,
05223: what a set these Isolatoes were! An Anacharsis Clootz deputation from
05224: all the isles of the sea, and all the ends of the earth, accompanying
05225: Old Ahab in the Pequod to lay the world’s grievances before that bar
05226: from which not very many of them ever come back. Black Little Pip—he
05227: never did—oh, no! he went before. Poor Alabama boy! On the grim
05228: Pequod’s forecastle, ye shall ere long see him, beating his tambourine;
05229: prelusive of the eternal time, when sent for, to the great quarter-deck
05230: on high, he was bid strike in with angels, and beat his tambourine in
05231: glory; called a coward here, hailed a hero there!
05232: 
05233: 
05234: CHAPTER 28. Ahab.
05235: 
05236: For several days after leaving Nantucket, nothing above hatches was
05237: seen of Captain Ahab. The mates regularly relieved each other at the
05238: watches, and for aught that could be seen to the contrary, they seemed
05239: to be the only commanders of the ship; only they sometimes issued from
05240: the cabin with orders so sudden and peremptory, that after all it was
05241: plain they but commanded vicariously. Yes, their supreme lord and
05242: dictator was there, though hitherto unseen by any eyes not permitted to
05243: penetrate into the now sacred retreat of the cabin.
05244: 
05245: Every time I ascended to the deck from my watches below, I instantly
05246: gazed aft to mark if any strange face were visible; for my first vague
05247: disquietude touching the unknown captain, now in the seclusion of the
05248: sea, became almost a perturbation. This was strangely heightened at
05249: times by the ragged Elijah’s diabolical incoherences uninvitedly
05250: recurring to me, with a subtle energy I could not have before conceived
05251: of. But poorly could I withstand them, much as in other moods I was
05252: almost ready to smile at the solemn whimsicalities of that outlandish
05253: prophet of the wharves. But whatever it was of apprehensiveness or
05254: uneasiness—to call it so—which I felt, yet whenever I came to look
05255: about me in the ship, it seemed against all warrantry to cherish such
05256: emotions. For though the harpooneers, with the great body of the crew,
05257: were a far more barbaric, heathenish, and motley set than any of the
05258: tame merchant-ship companies which my previous experiences had made me
05259: acquainted with, still I ascribed this—and rightly ascribed it—to the
05260: fierce uniqueness of the very nature of that wild Scandinavian vocation
05261: in which I had so abandonedly embarked. But it was especially the
05262: aspect of the three chief officers of the ship, the mates, which was
05263: most forcibly calculated to allay these colourless misgivings, and
05264: induce confidence and cheerfulness in every presentment of the voyage.
05265: Three better, more likely sea-officers and men, each in his own
05266: different way, could not readily be found, and they were every one of
05267: them Americans; a Nantucketer, a Vineyarder, a Cape man. Now, it being
05268: Christmas when the ship shot from out her harbor, for a space we had
05269: biting Polar weather, though all the time running away from it to the
05270: southward; and by every degree and minute of latitude which we sailed,
05271: gradually leaving that merciless winter, and all its intolerable
05272: weather behind us. It was one of those less lowering, but still grey
05273: and gloomy enough mornings of the transition, when with a fair wind the
05274: ship was rushing through the water with a vindictive sort of leaping
05275: and melancholy rapidity, that as I mounted to the deck at the call of
05276: the forenoon watch, so soon as I levelled my glance towards the
05277: taffrail, foreboding shivers ran over me. Reality outran apprehension;
05278: Captain Ahab stood upon his quarter-deck.
05279: 
05280: There seemed no sign of common bodily illness about him, nor of the
05281: recovery from any. He looked like a man cut away from the stake, when
05282: the fire has overrunningly wasted all the limbs without consuming them,
05283: or taking away one particle from their compacted aged robustness. His
05284: whole high, broad form, seemed made of solid bronze, and shaped in an
05285: unalterable mould, like Cellini’s cast Perseus. Threading its way out
05286: from among his grey hairs, and continuing right down one side of his
05287: tawny scorched face and neck, till it disappeared in his clothing, you
05288: saw a slender rod-like mark, lividly whitish. It resembled that
05289: perpendicular seam sometimes made in the straight, lofty trunk of a
05290: great tree, when the upper lightning tearingly darts down it, and
05291: without wrenching a single twig, peels and grooves out the bark from
05292: top to bottom, ere running off into the soil, leaving the tree still
05293: greenly alive, but branded. Whether that mark was born with him, or
05294: whether it was the scar left by some desperate wound, no one could
05295: certainly say. By some tacit consent, throughout the voyage little or
05296: no allusion was made to it, especially by the mates. But once
05297: Tashtego’s senior, an old Gay-Head Indian among the crew,
05298: superstitiously asserted that not till he was full forty years old did
05299: Ahab become that way branded, and then it came upon him, not in the
05300: fury of any mortal fray, but in an elemental strife at sea. Yet, this
05301: wild hint seemed inferentially negatived, by what a grey Manxman
05302: insinuated, an old sepulchral man, who, having never before sailed out
05303: of Nantucket, had never ere this laid eye upon wild Ahab. Nevertheless,
05304: the old sea-traditions, the immemorial credulities, popularly invested
05305: this old Manxman with preternatural powers of discernment. So that no
05306: white sailor seriously contradicted him when he said that if ever
05307: Captain Ahab should be tranquilly laid out—which might hardly come to
05308: pass, so he muttered—then, whoever should do that last office for the
05309: dead, would find a birth-mark on him from crown to sole.
05310: 
05311: So powerfully did the whole grim aspect of Ahab affect me, and the
05312: livid brand which streaked it, that for the first few moments I hardly
05313: noted that not a little of this overbearing grimness was owing to the
05314: barbaric white leg upon which he partly stood. It had previously come
05315: to me that this ivory leg had at sea been fashioned from the polished
05316: bone of the sperm whale’s jaw. “Aye, he was dismasted off Japan,” said
05317: the old Gay-Head Indian once; “but like his dismasted craft, he shipped
05318: another mast without coming home for it. He has a quiver of ’em.”
05319: 
05320: I was struck with the singular posture he maintained. Upon each side of
05321: the Pequod’s quarter deck, and pretty close to the mizzen shrouds,
05322: there was an auger hole, bored about half an inch or so, into the
05323: plank. His bone leg steadied in that hole; one arm elevated, and
05324: holding by a shroud; Captain Ahab stood erect, looking straight out
05325: beyond the ship’s ever-pitching prow. There was an infinity of firmest
05326: fortitude, a determinate, unsurrenderable wilfulness, in the fixed and
05327: fearless, forward dedication of that glance. Not a word he spoke; nor
05328: did his officers say aught to him; though by all their minutest
05329: gestures and expressions, they plainly showed the uneasy, if not
05330: painful, consciousness of being under a troubled master-eye. And not
05331: only that, but moody stricken Ahab stood before them with a crucifixion
05332: in his face; in all the nameless regal overbearing dignity of some
05333: mighty woe.
05334: 
05335: Ere long, from his first visit in the air, he withdrew into his cabin.
05336: But after that morning, he was every day visible to the crew; either
05337: standing in his pivot-hole, or seated upon an ivory stool he had; or
05338: heavily walking the deck. As the sky grew less gloomy; indeed, began to
05339: grow a little genial, he became still less and less a recluse; as if,
05340: when the ship had sailed from home, nothing but the dead wintry
05341: bleakness of the sea had then kept him so secluded. And, by and by, it
05342: came to pass, that he was almost continually in the air; but, as yet,
05343: for all that he said, or perceptibly did, on the at last sunny deck, he
05344: seemed as unnecessary there as another mast. But the Pequod was only
05345: making a passage now; not regularly cruising; nearly all whaling
05346: preparatives needing supervision the mates were fully competent to, so
05347: that there was little or nothing, out of himself, to employ or excite
05348: Ahab, now; and thus chase away, for that one interval, the clouds that
05349: layer upon layer were piled upon his brow, as ever all clouds choose
05350: the loftiest peaks to pile themselves upon.
05351: 
05352: Nevertheless, ere long, the warm, warbling persuasiveness of the
05353: pleasant, holiday weather we came to, seemed gradually to charm him
05354: from his mood. For, as when the red-cheeked, dancing girls, April and
05355: May, trip home to the wintry, misanthropic woods; even the barest,
05356: ruggedest, most thunder-cloven old oak will at least send forth some
05357: few green sprouts, to welcome such glad-hearted visitants; so Ahab did,
05358: in the end, a little respond to the playful allurings of that girlish
05359: air. More than once did he put forth the faint blossom of a look,
05360: which, in any other man, would have soon flowered out in a smile.
05361: 
05362: 
05363: CHAPTER 29. Enter Ahab; to Him, Stubb.
05364: 
05365: Some days elapsed, and ice and icebergs all astern, the Pequod now went
05366: rolling through the bright Quito spring, which, at sea, almost
05367: perpetually reigns on the threshold of the eternal August of the
05368: Tropic. The warmly cool, clear, ringing, perfumed, overflowing,
05369: redundant days, were as crystal goblets of Persian sherbet, heaped
05370: up—flaked up, with rose-water snow. The starred and stately nights
05371: seemed haughty dames in jewelled velvets, nursing at home in lonely
05372: pride, the memory of their absent conquering Earls, the golden helmeted
05373: suns! For sleeping man, ’twas hard to choose between such winsome days
05374: and such seducing nights. But all the witcheries of that unwaning
05375: weather did not merely lend new spells and potencies to the outward
05376: world. Inward they turned upon the soul, especially when the still mild
05377: hours of eve came on; then, memory shot her crystals as the clear ice
05378: most forms of noiseless twilights. And all these subtle agencies, more
05379: and more they wrought on Ahab’s texture.
05380: 
05381: Old age is always wakeful; as if, the longer linked with life, the less
05382: man has to do with aught that looks like death. Among sea-commanders,
05383: the old greybeards will oftenest leave their berths to visit the
05384: night-cloaked deck. It was so with Ahab; only that now, of late, he
05385: seemed so much to live in the open air, that truly speaking, his visits
05386: were more to the cabin, than from the cabin to the planks. “It feels
05387: like going down into one’s tomb,”—he would mutter to himself—“for an
05388: old captain like me to be descending this narrow scuttle, to go to my
05389: grave-dug berth.”
05390: 
05391: So, almost every twenty-four hours, when the watches of the night were
05392: set, and the band on deck sentinelled the slumbers of the band below;
05393: and when if a rope was to be hauled upon the forecastle, the sailors
05394: flung it not rudely down, as by day, but with some cautiousness dropt
05395: it to its place for fear of disturbing their slumbering shipmates; when
05396: this sort of steady quietude would begin to prevail, habitually, the
05397: silent steersman would watch the cabin-scuttle; and ere long the old
05398: man would emerge, gripping at the iron banister, to help his crippled
05399: way. Some considering touch of humanity was in him; for at times like
05400: these, he usually abstained from patrolling the quarter-deck; because
05401: to his wearied mates, seeking repose within six inches of his ivory
05402: heel, such would have been the reverberating crack and din of that bony
05403: step, that their dreams would have been on the crunching teeth of
05404: sharks. But once, the mood was on him too deep for common regardings;
05405: and as with heavy, lumber-like pace he was measuring the ship from
05406: taffrail to mainmast, Stubb, the old second mate, came up from below,
05407: with a certain unassured, deprecating humorousness, hinted that if
05408: Captain Ahab was pleased to walk the planks, then, no one could say
05409: nay; but there might be some way of muffling the noise; hinting
05410: something indistinctly and hesitatingly about a globe of tow, and the
05411: insertion into it, of the ivory heel. Ah! Stubb, thou didst not know
05412: Ahab then.
05413: 
05414: “Am I a cannon-ball, Stubb,” said Ahab, “that thou wouldst wad me that
05415: fashion? But go thy ways; I had forgot. Below to thy nightly grave;
05416: where such as ye sleep between shrouds, to use ye to the filling one at
05417: last.—Down, dog, and kennel!”
05418: 
05419: Starting at the unforseen concluding exclamation of the so suddenly
05420: scornful old man, Stubb was speechless a moment; then said excitedly,
05421: “I am not used to be spoken to that way, sir; I do but less than half
05422: like it, sir.”
05423: 
05424: “Avast! gritted Ahab between his set teeth, and violently moving away,
05425: as if to avoid some passionate temptation.
05426: 
05427: “No, sir; not yet,” said Stubb, emboldened, “I will not tamely be
05428: called a dog, sir.”
05429: 
05430: “Then be called ten times a donkey, and a mule, and an ass, and begone,
05431: or I’ll clear the world of thee!”
05432: 
05433: As he said this, Ahab advanced upon him with such overbearing terrors
05434: in his aspect, that Stubb involuntarily retreated.
05435: 
05436: “I was never served so before without giving a hard blow for it,”
05437: muttered Stubb, as he found himself descending the cabin-scuttle. “It’s
05438: very queer. Stop, Stubb; somehow, now, I don’t well know whether to go
05439: back and strike him, or—what’s that?—down here on my knees and pray for
05440: him? Yes, that was the thought coming up in me; but it would be the
05441: first time I ever _did_ pray. It’s queer; very queer; and he’s queer
05442: too; aye, take him fore and aft, he’s about the queerest old man Stubb
05443: ever sailed with. How he flashed at me!—his eyes like powder-pans! is
05444: he mad? Anyway there’s something on his mind, as sure as there must be
05445: something on a deck when it cracks. He aint in his bed now, either,
05446: more than three hours out of the twenty-four; and he don’t sleep then.
05447: Didn’t that Dough-Boy, the steward, tell me that of a morning he always
05448: finds the old man’s hammock clothes all rumpled and tumbled, and the
05449: sheets down at the foot, and the coverlid almost tied into knots, and
05450: the pillow a sort of frightful hot, as though a baked brick had been on
05451: it? A hot old man! I guess he’s got what some folks ashore call a
05452: conscience; it’s a kind of Tic-Dolly-row they say—worse nor a
05453: toothache. Well, well; I don’t know what it is, but the Lord keep me
05454: from catching it. He’s full of riddles; I wonder what he goes into the
05455: after hold for, every night, as Dough-Boy tells me he suspects; what’s
05456: that for, I should like to know? Who’s made appointments with him in
05457: the hold? Ain’t that queer, now? But there’s no telling, it’s the old
05458: game—Here goes for a snooze. Damn me, it’s worth a fellow’s while to be
05459: born into the world, if only to fall right asleep. And now that I think
05460: of it, that’s about the first thing babies do, and that’s a sort of
05461: queer, too. Damn me, but all things are queer, come to think of ’em.
05462: But that’s against my principles. Think not, is my eleventh
05463: commandment; and sleep when you can, is my twelfth—So here goes again.
05464: But how’s that? didn’t he call me a dog? blazes! he called me ten times
05465: a donkey, and piled a lot of jackasses on top of _that!_ He might as
05466: well have kicked me, and done with it. Maybe he _did_ kick me, and I
05467: didn’t observe it, I was so taken all aback with his brow, somehow. It
05468: flashed like a bleached bone. What the devil’s the matter with me? I
05469: don’t stand right on my legs. Coming afoul of that old man has a sort
05470: of turned me wrong side out. By the Lord, I must have been dreaming,
05471: though—How? how? how?—but the only way’s to stash it; so here goes to
05472: hammock again; and in the morning, I’ll see how this plaguey juggling
05473: thinks over by daylight.”
05474: 
05475: 
05476: CHAPTER 30. The Pipe.
05477: 
05478: When Stubb had departed, Ahab stood for a while leaning over the
05479: bulwarks; and then, as had been usual with him of late, calling a
05480: sailor of the watch, he sent him below for his ivory stool, and also
05481: his pipe. Lighting the pipe at the binnacle lamp and planting the stool
05482: on the weather side of the deck, he sat and smoked.
05483: 
05484: In old Norse times, the thrones of the sea-loving Danish kings were
05485: fabricated, saith tradition, of the tusks of the narwhale. How could
05486: one look at Ahab then, seated on that tripod of bones, without
05487: bethinking him of the royalty it symbolized? For a Khan of the plank,
05488: and a king of the sea, and a great lord of Leviathans was Ahab.
05489: 
05490: Some moments passed, during which the thick vapor came from his mouth
05491: in quick and constant puffs, which blew back again into his face. “How
05492: now,” he soliloquized at last, withdrawing the tube, “this smoking no
05493: longer soothes. Oh, my pipe! hard must it go with me if thy charm be
05494: gone! Here have I been unconsciously toiling, not pleasuring—aye, and
05495: ignorantly smoking to windward all the while; to windward, and with
05496: such nervous whiffs, as if, like the dying whale, my final jets were
05497: the strongest and fullest of trouble. What business have I with this
05498: pipe? This thing that is meant for sereneness, to send up mild white
05499: vapors among mild white hairs, not among torn iron-grey locks like
05500: mine. I’ll smoke no more—”
05501: 
05502: He tossed the still lighted pipe into the sea. The fire hissed in the
05503: waves; the same instant the ship shot by the bubble the sinking pipe
05504: made. With slouched hat, Ahab lurchingly paced the planks.
05505: 
05506: 
05507: CHAPTER 31. Queen Mab.
05508: 
05509: Next morning Stubb accosted Flask.
05510: 
05511: “Such a queer dream, King-Post, I never had. You know the old man’s
05512: ivory leg, well I dreamed he kicked me with it; and when I tried to
05513: kick back, upon my soul, my little man, I kicked my leg right off! And
05514: then, presto! Ahab seemed a pyramid, and I, like a blazing fool, kept
05515: kicking at it. But what was still more curious, Flask—you know how
05516: curious all dreams are—through all this rage that I was in, I somehow
05517: seemed to be thinking to myself, that after all, it was not much of an
05518: insult, that kick from Ahab. ‘Why,’ thinks I, ‘what’s the row? It’s not
05519: a real leg, only a false leg.’ And there’s a mighty difference between
05520: a living thump and a dead thump. That’s what makes a blow from the
05521: hand, Flask, fifty times more savage to bear than a blow from a cane.
05522: The living member—that makes the living insult, my little man. And
05523: thinks I to myself all the while, mind, while I was stubbing my silly
05524: toes against that cursed pyramid—so confoundedly contradictory was it
05525: all, all the while, I say, I was thinking to myself, ‘what’s his leg
05526: now, but a cane—a whalebone cane. Yes,’ thinks I, ‘it was only a
05527: playful cudgelling—in fact, only a whaleboning that he gave me—not a
05528: base kick. Besides,’ thinks I, ‘look at it once; why, the end of it—the
05529: foot part—what a small sort of end it is; whereas, if a broad footed
05530: farmer kicked me, _there’s_ a devilish broad insult. But this insult is
05531: whittled down to a point only.’ But now comes the greatest joke of the
05532: dream, Flask. While I was battering away at the pyramid, a sort of
05533: badger-haired old merman, with a hump on his back, takes me by the
05534: shoulders, and slews me round. ‘What are you ’bout?’ says he. Slid!
05535: man, but I was frightened. Such a phiz! But, somehow, next moment I was
05536: over the fright. ‘What am I about?’ says I at last. ‘And what business
05537: is that of yours, I should like to know, Mr. Humpback? Do _you_ want a
05538: kick?’ By the lord, Flask, I had no sooner said that, than he turned
05539: round his stern to me, bent over, and dragging up a lot of seaweed he
05540: had for a clout—what do you think, I saw?—why thunder alive, man, his
05541: stern was stuck full of marlinspikes, with the points out. Says I, on
05542: second thoughts, ‘I guess I won’t kick you, old fellow.’ ‘Wise Stubb,’
05543: said he, ‘wise Stubb;’ and kept muttering it all the time, a sort of
05544: eating of his own gums like a chimney hag. Seeing he wasn’t going to
05545: stop saying over his ‘wise Stubb, wise Stubb,’ I thought I might as
05546: well fall to kicking the pyramid again. But I had only just lifted my
05547: foot for it, when he roared out, ‘Stop that kicking!’ ‘Halloa,’ says I,
05548: ‘what’s the matter now, old fellow?’ ‘Look ye here,’ says he; ‘let’s
05549: argue the insult. Captain Ahab kicked ye, didn’t he?’ ‘Yes, he did,’
05550: says I—‘right _here_ it was.’ ‘Very good,’ says he—‘he used his ivory
05551: leg, didn’t he?’ ‘Yes, he did,’ says I. ‘Well then,’ says he, ‘wise
05552: Stubb, what have you to complain of? Didn’t he kick with right good
05553: will? it wasn’t a common pitch pine leg he kicked with, was it? No, you
05554: were kicked by a great man, and with a beautiful ivory leg, Stubb. It’s
05555: an honor; I consider it an honor. Listen, wise Stubb. In old England
05556: the greatest lords think it great glory to be slapped by a queen, and
05557: made garter-knights of; but, be _your_ boast, Stubb, that ye were
05558: kicked by old Ahab, and made a wise man of. Remember what I say; _be_
05559: kicked by him; account his kicks honors; and on no account kick back;
05560: for you can’t help yourself, wise Stubb. Don’t you see that pyramid?’
05561: With that, he all of a sudden seemed somehow, in some queer fashion, to
05562: swim off into the air. I snored; rolled over; and there I was in my
05563: hammock! Now, what do you think of that dream, Flask?”
05564: 
05565: “I don’t know; it seems a sort of foolish to me, tho.’”
05566: 
05567: “May be; may be. But it’s made a wise man of me, Flask. D’ye see Ahab
05568: standing there, sideways looking over the stern? Well, the best thing
05569: you can do, Flask, is to let the old man alone; never speak to him,
05570: whatever he says. Halloa! What’s that he shouts? Hark!”
05571: 
05572: “Mast-head, there! Look sharp, all of ye! There are whales hereabouts!
05573:
