05574: “If ye see a white one, split your lungs for him!
05575: 
05576: “What do you think of that now, Flask? ain’t there a small drop of
05577: something queer about that, eh? A white whale—did ye mark that, man?
05578: Look ye—there’s something special in the wind. Stand by for it, Flask.
05579: Ahab has that that’s bloody on his mind. But, mum; he comes this way.”
05580: 
05581: 
05582: CHAPTER 32. Cetology.
05583: 
05584: Already we are boldly launched upon the deep; but soon we shall be lost
05585: in its unshored, harbourless immensities. Ere that come to pass; ere
05586: the Pequod’s weedy hull rolls side by side with the barnacled hulls of
05587: the leviathan; at the outset it is but well to attend to a matter
05588: almost indispensable to a thorough appreciative understanding of the
05589: more special leviathanic revelations and allusions of all sorts which
05590: are to follow.
05591: 
05592: It is some systematized exhibition of the whale in his broad genera,
05593: that I would now fain put before you. Yet is it no easy task. The
05594: classification of the constituents of a chaos, nothing less is here
05595: essayed. Listen to what the best and latest authorities have laid down.
05596: 
05597: “No branch of Zoology is so much involved as that which is entitled
05598: Cetology,” says Captain Scoresby, A.D. 1820.
05599: 
05600: “It is not my intention, were it in my power, to enter into the inquiry
05601: as to the true method of dividing the cetacea into groups and families.
05602: * * * Utter confusion exists among the historians of this animal”
05603: (sperm whale), says Surgeon Beale, A.D. 1839.
05604: 
05605: “Unfitness to pursue our research in the unfathomable waters.”
05606: “Impenetrable veil covering our knowledge of the cetacea.” “A field
05607: strewn with thorns.” “All these incomplete indications but serve to
05608: torture us naturalists.”
05609: 
05610: Thus speak of the whale, the great Cuvier, and John Hunter, and Lesson,
05611: those lights of zoology and anatomy. Nevertheless, though of real
05612: knowledge there be little, yet of books there are a plenty; and so in
05613: some small degree, with cetology, or the science of whales. Many are
05614: the men, small and great, old and new, landsmen and seamen, who have at
05615: large or in little, written of the whale. Run over a few:—The Authors
05616: of the Bible; Aristotle; Pliny; Aldrovandi; Sir Thomas Browne; Gesner;
05617: Ray; Linnæus; Rondeletius; Willoughby; Green; Artedi; Sibbald; Brisson;
05618: Marten; Lacépède; Bonneterre; Desmarest; Baron Cuvier; Frederick
05619: Cuvier; John Hunter; Owen; Scoresby; Beale; Bennett; J. Ross Browne;
05620: the Author of Miriam Coffin; Olmstead; and the Rev. T. Cheever. But to
05621: what ultimate generalizing purpose all these have written, the above
05622: cited extracts will show.
05623: 
05624: Of the names in this list of whale authors, only those following Owen
05625: ever saw living whales; and but one of them was a real professional
05626: harpooneer and whaleman. I mean Captain Scoresby. On the separate
05627: subject of the Greenland or right-whale, he is the best existing
05628: authority. But Scoresby knew nothing and says nothing of the great
05629: sperm whale, compared with which the Greenland whale is almost unworthy
05630: mentioning. And here be it said, that the Greenland whale is an usurper
05631: upon the throne of the seas. He is not even by any means the largest of
05632: the whales. Yet, owing to the long priority of his claims, and the
05633: profound ignorance which, till some seventy years back, invested the
05634: then fabulous or utterly unknown sperm-whale, and which ignorance to
05635: this present day still reigns in all but some few scientific retreats
05636: and whale-ports; this usurpation has been every way complete. Reference
05637: to nearly all the leviathanic allusions in the great poets of past
05638: days, will satisfy you that the Greenland whale, without one rival, was
05639: to them the monarch of the seas. But the time has at last come for a
05640: new proclamation. This is Charing Cross; hear ye! good people all,—the
05641: Greenland whale is deposed,—the great sperm whale now reigneth!
05642: 
05643: There are only two books in being which at all pretend to put the
05644: living sperm whale before you, and at the same time, in the remotest
05645: degree succeed in the attempt. Those books are Beale’s and Bennett’s;
05646: both in their time surgeons to English South-Sea whale-ships, and both
05647: exact and reliable men. The original matter touching the sperm whale to
05648: be found in their volumes is necessarily small; but so far as it goes,
05649: it is of excellent quality, though mostly confined to scientific
05650: description. As yet, however, the sperm whale, scientific or poetic,
05651: lives not complete in any literature. Far above all other hunted
05652: whales, his is an unwritten life.
05653: 
05654: Now the various species of whales need some sort of popular
05655: comprehensive classification, if only an easy outline one for the
05656: present, hereafter to be filled in all its departments by subsequent
05657: laborers. As no better man advances to take this matter in hand, I
05658: hereupon offer my own poor endeavors. I promise nothing complete;
05659: because any human thing supposed to be complete, must for that very
05660: reason infallibly be faulty. I shall not pretend to a minute anatomical
05661: description of the various species, or—in this place at least—to much
05662: of any description. My object here is simply to project the draught of
05663: a systematization of cetology. I am the architect, not the builder.
05664: 
05665: But it is a ponderous task; no ordinary letter-sorter in the
05666: Post-Office is equal to it. To grope down into the bottom of the sea
05667: after them; to have one’s hands among the unspeakable foundations,
05668: ribs, and very pelvis of the world; this is a fearful thing. What am I
05669: that I should essay to hook the nose of this leviathan! The awful
05670: tauntings in Job might well appal me. Will he (the leviathan) make a
05671: covenant with thee? Behold the hope of him is vain! But I have swam
05672: through libraries and sailed through oceans; I have had to do with
05673: whales with these visible hands; I am in earnest; and I will try. There
05674: are some preliminaries to settle.
05675: 
05676: First: The uncertain, unsettled condition of this science of Cetology
05677: is in the very vestibule attested by the fact, that in some quarters it
05678: still remains a moot point whether a whale be a fish. In his System of
05679: Nature, A.D. 1776, Linnæus declares, “I hereby separate the whales from
05680: the fish.” But of my own knowledge, I know that down to the year 1850,
05681: sharks and shad, alewives and herring, against Linnæus’s express edict,
05682: were still found dividing the possession of the same seas with the
05683: Leviathan.
05684: 
05685: The grounds upon which Linnæus would fain have banished the whales from
05686: the waters, he states as follows: “On account of their warm bilocular
05687: heart, their lungs, their movable eyelids, their hollow ears, penem
05688: intrantem feminam mammis lactantem,” and finally, “ex lege naturæ jure
05689: meritoque.” I submitted all this to my friends Simeon Macey and Charley
05690: Coffin, of Nantucket, both messmates of mine in a certain voyage, and
05691: they united in the opinion that the reasons set forth were altogether
05692: insufficient. Charley profanely hinted they were humbug.
05693: 
05694: Be it known that, waiving all argument, I take the good old fashioned
05695: ground that the whale is a fish, and call upon holy Jonah to back me.
05696: This fundamental thing settled, the next point is, in what internal
05697: respect does the whale differ from other fish. Above, Linnæus has given
05698: you those items. But in brief, they are these: lungs and warm blood;
05699: whereas, all other fish are lungless and cold blooded.
05700: 
05701: Next: how shall we define the whale, by his obvious externals, so as
05702: conspicuously to label him for all time to come? To be short, then, a
05703: whale is _a spouting fish with a horizontal tail_. There you have him.
05704: However contracted, that definition is the result of expanded
05705: meditation. A walrus spouts much like a whale, but the walrus is not a
05706: fish, because he is amphibious. But the last term of the definition is
05707: still more cogent, as coupled with the first. Almost any one must have
05708: noticed that all the fish familiar to landsmen have not a flat, but a
05709: vertical, or up-and-down tail. Whereas, among spouting fish the tail,
05710: though it may be similarly shaped, invariably assumes a horizontal
05711: position.
05712: 
05713: By the above definition of what a whale is, I do by no means exclude
05714: from the leviathanic brotherhood any sea creature hitherto identified
05715: with the whale by the best informed Nantucketers; nor, on the other
05716: hand, link with it any fish hitherto authoritatively regarded as
05717: alien.* Hence, all the smaller, spouting, and horizontal tailed fish
05718: must be included in this ground-plan of Cetology. Now, then, come the
05719: grand divisions of the entire whale host.
05720: 
05721: *I am aware that down to the present time, the fish styled Lamatins and
05722: Dugongs (Pig-fish and Sow-fish of the Coffins of Nantucket) are
05723: included by many naturalists among the whales. But as these pig-fish
05724: are a noisy, contemptible set, mostly lurking in the mouths of rivers,
05725: and feeding on wet hay, and especially as they do not spout, I deny
05726: their credentials as whales; and have presented them with their
05727: passports to quit the Kingdom of Cetology.
05728: 
05729: First: According to magnitude I divide the whales into three primary
05730: BOOKS (subdivisible into CHAPTERS), and these shall comprehend them
05731: all, both small and large.
05732: 
05733: I. THE FOLIO WHALE; II. the OCTAVO WHALE; III. the DUODECIMO WHALE.
05734: 
05735: As the type of the FOLIO I present the _Sperm Whale_; of the OCTAVO,
05736: the _Grampus_; of the DUODECIMO, the _Porpoise_.
05737: 
05738: FOLIOS. Among these I here include the following chapters:—I. The
05739: _Sperm Whale_; II. the _Right Whale_; III. the _Fin-Back Whale_; IV.
05740: the _Hump-backed Whale_; V. the _Razor Back Whale_; VI. the _Sulphur
05741: Bottom Whale_.
05742: 
05743: BOOK I. (_Folio_), CHAPTER I. (_Sperm Whale_).—This whale, among the
05744: English of old vaguely known as the Trumpa whale, and the Physeter
05745: whale, and the Anvil Headed whale, is the present Cachalot of the
05746: French, and the Pottsfich of the Germans, and the Macrocephalus of the
05747: Long Words. He is, without doubt, the largest inhabitant of the globe;
05748: the most formidable of all whales to encounter; the most majestic in
05749: aspect; and lastly, by far the most valuable in commerce; he being the
05750: only creature from which that valuable substance, spermaceti, is
05751: obtained. All his peculiarities will, in many other places, be enlarged
05752: upon. It is chiefly with his name that I now have to do. Philologically
05753: considered, it is absurd. Some centuries ago, when the Sperm whale was
05754: almost wholly unknown in his own proper individuality, and when his oil
05755: was only accidentally obtained from the stranded fish; in those days
05756: spermaceti, it would seem, was popularly supposed to be derived from a
05757: creature identical with the one then known in England as the Greenland
05758: or Right Whale. It was the idea also, that this same spermaceti was
05759: that quickening humor of the Greenland Whale which the first syllable
05760: of the word literally expresses. In those times, also, spermaceti was
05761: exceedingly scarce, not being used for light, but only as an ointment
05762: and medicament. It was only to be had from the druggists as you
05763: nowadays buy an ounce of rhubarb. When, as I opine, in the course of
05764: time, the true nature of spermaceti became known, its original name was
05765: still retained by the dealers; no doubt to enhance its value by a
05766: notion so strangely significant of its scarcity. And so the appellation
05767: must at last have come to be bestowed upon the whale from which this
05768: spermaceti was really derived.
05769: 
05770: BOOK I. (_Folio_), CHAPTER II. (_Right Whale_).—In one respect this is
05771: the most venerable of the leviathans, being the one first regularly
05772: hunted by man. It yields the article commonly known as whalebone or
05773: baleen; and the oil specially known as “whale oil,” an inferior article
05774: in commerce. Among the fishermen, he is indiscriminately designated by
05775: all the following titles: The Whale; the Greenland Whale; the Black
05776: Whale; the Great Whale; the True Whale; the Right Whale. There is a
05777: deal of obscurity concerning the identity of the species thus
05778: multitudinously baptised. What then is the whale, which I include in
05779: the second species of my Folios? It is the Great Mysticetus of the
05780: English naturalists; the Greenland Whale of the English whalemen; the
05781: Baleine Ordinaire of the French whalemen; the Growlands Walfish of the
05782: Swedes. It is the whale which for more than two centuries past has been
05783: hunted by the Dutch and English in the Arctic seas; it is the whale
05784: which the American fishermen have long pursued in the Indian ocean, on
05785: the Brazil Banks, on the Nor’ West Coast, and various other parts of
05786: the world, designated by them Right Whale Cruising Grounds.
05787: 
05788: Some pretend to see a difference between the Greenland whale of the
05789: English and the right whale of the Americans. But they precisely agree
05790: in all their grand features; nor has there yet been presented a single
05791: determinate fact upon which to ground a radical distinction. It is by
05792: endless subdivisions based upon the most inconclusive differences, that
05793: some departments of natural history become so repellingly intricate.
05794: The right whale will be elsewhere treated of at some length, with
05795: reference to elucidating the sperm whale.
05796: 
05797: BOOK I. (_Folio_), CHAPTER III. (_Fin-Back_).—Under this head I reckon
05798: a monster which, by the various names of Fin-Back, Tall-Spout, and
05799: Long-John, has been seen almost in every sea and is commonly the whale
05800: whose distant jet is so often descried by passengers crossing the
05801: Atlantic, in the New York packet-tracks. In the length he attains, and
05802: in his baleen, the Fin-back resembles the right whale, but is of a less
05803: portly girth, and a lighter colour, approaching to olive. His great
05804: lips present a cable-like aspect, formed by the intertwisting, slanting
05805: folds of large wrinkles. His grand distinguishing feature, the fin,
05806: from which he derives his name, is often a conspicuous object. This fin
05807: is some three or four feet long, growing vertically from the hinder
05808: part of the back, of an angular shape, and with a very sharp pointed
05809: end. Even if not the slightest other part of the creature be visible,
05810: this isolated fin will, at times, be seen plainly projecting from the
05811: surface. When the sea is moderately calm, and slightly marked with
05812: spherical ripples, and this gnomon-like fin stands up and casts shadows
05813: upon the wrinkled surface, it may well be supposed that the watery
05814: circle surrounding it somewhat resembles a dial, with its style and
05815: wavy hour-lines graved on it. On that Ahaz-dial the shadow often goes
05816: back. The Fin-Back is not gregarious. He seems a whale-hater, as some
05817: men are man-haters. Very shy; always going solitary; unexpectedly
05818: rising to the surface in the remotest and most sullen waters; his
05819: straight and single lofty jet rising like a tall misanthropic spear
05820: upon a barren plain; gifted with such wondrous power and velocity in
05821: swimming, as to defy all present pursuit from man; this leviathan seems
05822: the banished and unconquerable Cain of his race, bearing for his mark
05823: that style upon his back. From having the baleen in his mouth, the
05824: Fin-Back is sometimes included with the right whale, among a theoretic
05825: species denominated _Whalebone whales_, that is, whales with baleen. Of
05826: these so called Whalebone whales, there would seem to be several
05827: varieties, most of which, however, are little known. Broad-nosed whales
05828: and beaked whales; pike-headed whales; bunched whales; under-jawed
05829: whales and rostrated whales, are the fishermen’s names for a few sorts.
05830: 
05831: In connection with this appellative of “Whalebone whales,” it is of
05832: great importance to mention, that however such a nomenclature may be
05833: convenient in facilitating allusions to some kind of whales, yet it is
05834: in vain to attempt a clear classification of the Leviathan, founded
05835: upon either his baleen, or hump, or fin, or teeth; notwithstanding that
05836: those marked parts or features very obviously seem better adapted to
05837: afford the basis for a regular system of Cetology than any other
05838: detached bodily distinctions, which the whale, in his kinds, presents.
05839: How then? The baleen, hump, back-fin, and teeth; these are things whose
05840: peculiarities are indiscriminately dispersed among all sorts of whales,
05841: without any regard to what may be the nature of their structure in
05842: other and more essential particulars. Thus, the sperm whale and the
05843: humpbacked whale, each has a hump; but there the similitude ceases.
05844: Then, this same humpbacked whale and the Greenland whale, each of these
05845: has baleen; but there again the similitude ceases. And it is just the
05846: same with the other parts above mentioned. In various sorts of whales,
05847: they form such irregular combinations; or, in the case of any one of
05848: them detached, such an irregular isolation; as utterly to defy all
05849: general methodization formed upon such a basis. On this rock every one
05850: of the whale-naturalists has split.
05851: 
05852: But it may possibly be conceived that, in the internal parts of the
05853: whale, in his anatomy—there, at least, we shall be able to hit the
05854: right classification. Nay; what thing, for example, is there in the
05855: Greenland whale’s anatomy more striking than his baleen? Yet we have
05856: seen that by his baleen it is impossible correctly to classify the
05857: Greenland whale. And if you descend into the bowels of the various
05858: leviathans, why there you will not find distinctions a fiftieth part as
05859: available to the systematizer as those external ones already
05860: enumerated. What then remains? nothing but to take hold of the whales
05861: bodily, in their entire liberal volume, and boldly sort them that way.
05862: And this is the Bibliographical system here adopted; and it is the only
05863: one that can possibly succeed, for it alone is practicable. To proceed.
05864: 
05865: BOOK I. (_Folio_) CHAPTER IV. (_Hump Back_).—This whale is often seen
05866: on the northern American coast. He has been frequently captured there,
05867: and towed into harbor. He has a great pack on him like a peddler; or
05868: you might call him the Elephant and Castle whale. At any rate, the
05869: popular name for him does not sufficiently distinguish him, since the
05870: sperm whale also has a hump though a smaller one. His oil is not very
05871: valuable. He has baleen. He is the most gamesome and light-hearted of
05872: all the whales, making more gay foam and white water generally than any
05873: other of them.
05874: 
05875: BOOK I. (_Folio_), CHAPTER V. (_Razor Back_).—Of this whale little is
05876: known but his name. I have seen him at a distance off Cape Horn. Of a
05877: retiring nature, he eludes both hunters and philosophers. Though no
05878: coward, he has never yet shown any part of him but his back, which
05879: rises in a long sharp ridge. Let him go. I know little more of him, nor
05880: does anybody else.
05881: 
05882: BOOK I. (_Folio_), CHAPTER VI. (_Sulphur Bottom_).—Another retiring
05883: gentleman, with a brimstone belly, doubtless got by scraping along the
05884: Tartarian tiles in some of his profounder divings. He is seldom seen;
05885: at least I have never seen him except in the remoter southern seas, and
05886: then always at too great a distance to study his countenance. He is
05887: never chased; he would run away with rope-walks of line. Prodigies are
05888: told of him. Adieu, Sulphur Bottom! I can say nothing more that is true
05889: of ye, nor can the oldest Nantucketer.
05890: 
05891: Thus ends BOOK I. (_Folio_), and now begins BOOK II. (_Octavo_).
05892: 
05893: OCTAVOES.*—These embrace the whales of middling magnitude, among which
05894: present may be numbered:—I., the _Grampus_; II., the _Black Fish_;
05895: III., the _Narwhale_; IV., the _Thrasher_; V., the _Killer_.
05896: 
05897: *Why this book of whales is not denominated the Quarto is very plain.
05898: Because, while the whales of this order, though smaller than those of
05899: the former order, nevertheless retain a proportionate likeness to them
05900: in figure, yet the bookbinder’s Quarto volume in its dimensioned form
05901: does not preserve the shape of the Folio volume, but the Octavo volume
05902: does.
05903: 
05904: BOOK II. (_Octavo_), CHAPTER I. (_Grampus_).—Though this fish, whose
05905: loud sonorous breathing, or rather blowing, has furnished a proverb to
05906: landsmen, is so well known a denizen of the deep, yet is he not
05907: popularly classed among whales. But possessing all the grand
05908: distinctive features of the leviathan, most naturalists have recognised
05909: him for one. He is of moderate octavo size, varying from fifteen to
05910: twenty-five feet in length, and of corresponding dimensions round the
05911: waist. He swims in herds; he is never regularly hunted, though his oil
05912: is considerable in quantity, and pretty good for light. By some
05913: fishermen his approach is regarded as premonitory of the advance of the
05914: great sperm whale.
05915: 
05916: BOOK II. (_Octavo_), CHAPTER II. (_Black Fish_).—I give the popular
05917: fishermen’s names for all these fish, for generally they are the best.
05918: Where any name happens to be vague or inexpressive, I shall say so, and
05919: suggest another. I do so now, touching the Black Fish, so-called,
05920: because blackness is the rule among almost all whales. So, call him the
05921: Hyena Whale, if you please. His voracity is well known, and from the
05922: circumstance that the inner angles of his lips are curved upwards, he
05923: carries an everlasting Mephistophelean grin on his face. This whale
05924: averages some sixteen or eighteen feet in length. He is found in almost
05925: all latitudes. He has a peculiar way of showing his dorsal hooked fin
05926: in swimming, which looks something like a Roman nose. When not more
05927: profitably employed, the sperm whale hunters sometimes capture the
05928: Hyena whale, to keep up the supply of cheap oil for domestic
05929: employment—as some frugal housekeepers, in the absence of company, and
05930: quite alone by themselves, burn unsavory tallow instead of odorous wax.
05931: Though their blubber is very thin, some of these whales will yield you
05932: upwards of thirty gallons of oil.
05933: 
05934: BOOK II. (_Octavo_), CHAPTER III. (_Narwhale_), that is, _Nostril
05935: whale_.—Another instance of a curiously named whale, so named I suppose
05936: from his peculiar horn being originally mistaken for a peaked nose. The
05937: creature is some sixteen feet in length, while its horn averages five
05938: feet, though some exceed ten, and even attain to fifteen feet. Strictly
05939: speaking, this horn is but a lengthened tusk, growing out from the jaw
05940: in a line a little depressed from the horizontal. But it is only found
05941: on the sinister side, which has an ill effect, giving its owner
05942: something analogous to the aspect of a clumsy left-handed man. What
05943: precise purpose this ivory horn or lance answers, it would be hard to
05944: say. It does not seem to be used like the blade of the sword-fish and
05945: bill-fish; though some sailors tell me that the Narwhale employs it for
05946: a rake in turning over the bottom of the sea for food. Charley Coffin
05947: said it was used for an ice-piercer; for the Narwhale, rising to the
05948: surface of the Polar Sea, and finding it sheeted with ice, thrusts his
05949: horn up, and so breaks through. But you cannot prove either of these
05950: surmises to be correct. My own opinion is, that however this one-sided
05951: horn may really be used by the Narwhale—however that may be—it would
05952: certainly be very convenient to him for a folder in reading pamphlets.
05953: The Narwhale I have heard called the Tusked whale, the Horned whale,
05954: and the Unicorn whale. He is certainly a curious example of the
05955: Unicornism to be found in almost every kingdom of animated nature. From
05956: certain cloistered old authors I have gathered that this same
05957: sea-unicorn’s horn was in ancient days regarded as the great antidote
05958: against poison, and as such, preparations of it brought immense prices.
05959: It was also distilled to a volatile salts for fainting ladies, the same
05960: way that the horns of the male deer are manufactured into hartshorn.
05961: Originally it was in itself accounted an object of great curiosity.
05962: Black Letter tells me that Sir Martin Frobisher on his return from that
05963: voyage, when Queen Bess did gallantly wave her jewelled hand to him
05964: from a window of Greenwich Palace, as his bold ship sailed down the
05965: Thames; “when Sir Martin returned from that voyage,” saith Black
05966: Letter, “on bended knees he presented to her highness a prodigious long
05967: horn of the Narwhale, which for a long period after hung in the castle
05968: at Windsor.” An Irish author avers that the Earl of Leicester, on
05969: bended knees, did likewise present to her highness another horn,
05970: pertaining to a land beast of the unicorn nature.
05971: 
05972: The Narwhale has a very picturesque, leopard-like look, being of a
05973: milk-white ground colour, dotted with round and oblong spots of black.
05974: His oil is very superior, clear and fine; but there is little of it,
05975: and he is seldom hunted. He is mostly found in the circumpolar seas.
05976: 
05977: BOOK II. (_Octavo_), CHAPTER IV. (_Killer_).—Of this whale little is
05978: precisely known to the Nantucketer, and nothing at all to the professed
05979: naturalist. From what I have seen of him at a distance, I should say
05980: that he was about the bigness of a grampus. He is very savage—a sort of
05981: Feegee fish. He sometimes takes the great Folio whales by the lip, and
05982: hangs there like a leech, till the mighty brute is worried to death.
05983: The Killer is never hunted. I never heard what sort of oil he has.
05984: Exception might be taken to the name bestowed upon this whale, on the
05985: ground of its indistinctness. For we are all killers, on land and on
05986: sea; Bonapartes and Sharks included.
05987: 
05988: BOOK II. (_Octavo_), CHAPTER V. (_Thrasher_).—This gentleman is famous
05989: for his tail, which he uses for a ferule in thrashing his foes. He
05990: mounts the Folio whale’s back, and as he swims, he works his passage by
05991: flogging him; as some schoolmasters get along in the world by a similar
05992: process. Still less is known of the Thrasher than of the Killer. Both
05993: are outlaws, even in the lawless seas.
05994: 
05995:  Thus ends BOOK II. (_Octavo_), and begins BOOK III. (_Duodecimo_).
05996: 
05997: DUODECIMOES.—These include the smaller whales. I. The Huzza Porpoise.
05998: II. The Algerine Porpoise. III. The Mealy-mouthed Porpoise.
05999: 
06000: To those who have not chanced specially to study the subject, it may
06001: possibly seem strange, that fishes not commonly exceeding four or five
06002: feet should be marshalled among WHALES—a word, which, in the popular
06003: sense, always conveys an idea of hugeness. But the creatures set down
06004: above as Duodecimoes are infallibly whales, by the terms of my
06005: definition of what a whale is—_i.e._ a spouting fish, with a horizontal
06006: tail.
06007: 
06008: BOOK III. (_Duodecimo_), CHAPTER 1. (_Huzza Porpoise_).—This is the
06009: common porpoise found almost all over the globe. The name is of my own
06010: bestowal; for there are more than one sort of porpoises, and something
06011: must be done to distinguish them. I call him thus, because he always
06012: swims in hilarious shoals, which upon the broad sea keep tossing
06013: themselves to heaven like caps in a Fourth-of-July crowd. Their
06014: appearance is generally hailed with delight by the mariner. Full of
06015: fine spirits, they invariably come from the breezy billows to windward.
06016: They are the lads that always live before the wind. They are accounted
06017: a lucky omen. If you yourself can withstand three cheers at beholding
06018: these vivacious fish, then heaven help ye; the spirit of godly
06019: gamesomeness is not in ye. A well-fed, plump Huzza Porpoise will yield
06020: you one good gallon of good oil. But the fine and delicate fluid
06021: extracted from his jaws is exceedingly valuable. It is in request among
06022: jewellers and watchmakers. Sailors put it on their hones. Porpoise meat
06023: is good eating, you know. It may never have occurred to you that a
06024: porpoise spouts. Indeed, his spout is so small that it is not very
06025: readily discernible. But the next time you have a chance, watch him;
06026: and you will then see the great Sperm whale himself in miniature.
06027: 
06028: BOOK III. (_Duodecimo_), CHAPTER II. (_Algerine Porpoise_).—A pirate.
06029: Very savage. He is only found, I think, in the Pacific. He is somewhat
06030: larger than the Huzza Porpoise, but much of the same general make.
06031: Provoke him, and he will buckle to a shark. I have lowered for him many
06032: times, but never yet saw him captured.
06033: 
06034: BOOK III. (_Duodecimo_), CHAPTER III. (_Mealy-mouthed Porpoise_).—The
06035: largest kind of Porpoise; and only found in the Pacific, so far as it
06036: is known. The only English name, by which he has hitherto been
06037: designated, is that of the fishers—Right-Whale Porpoise, from the
06038: circumstance that he is chiefly found in the vicinity of that Folio. In
06039: shape, he differs in some degree from the Huzza Porpoise, being of a
06040: less rotund and jolly girth; indeed, he is of quite a neat and
06041: gentleman-like figure. He has no fins on his back (most other porpoises
06042: have), he has a lovely tail, and sentimental Indian eyes of a hazel
06043: hue. But his mealy-mouth spoils all. Though his entire back down to his
06044: side fins is of a deep sable, yet a boundary line, distinct as the mark
06045: in a ship’s hull, called the “bright waist,” that line streaks him from
06046: stem to stern, with two separate colours, black above and white below.
06047: The white comprises part of his head, and the whole of his mouth, which
06048: makes him look as if he had just escaped from a felonious visit to a
06049: meal-bag. A most mean and mealy aspect! His oil is much like that of
06050: the common porpoise.
06051: 
06052:   * * * * * *
06053: 
06054: Beyond the DUODECIMO, this system does not proceed, inasmuch as the
06055: Porpoise is the smallest of the whales. Above, you have all the
06056: Leviathans of note. But there are a rabble of uncertain, fugitive,
06057: half-fabulous whales, which, as an American whaleman, I know by
06058: reputation, but not personally. I shall enumerate them by their
06059: fore-castle appellations; for possibly such a list may be valuable to
06060: future investigators, who may complete what I have here but begun. If
06061: any of the following whales, shall hereafter be caught and marked, then
06062: he can readily be incorporated into this System, according to his
06063: Folio, Octavo, or Duodecimo magnitude:—The Bottle-Nose Whale; the Junk
06064: Whale; the Pudding-Headed Whale; the Cape Whale; the Leading Whale; the
06065: Cannon Whale; the Scragg Whale; the Coppered Whale; the Elephant Whale;
06066: the Iceberg Whale; the Quog Whale; the Blue Whale; etc. From Icelandic,
06067: Dutch, and old English authorities, there might be quoted other lists
06068: of uncertain whales, blessed with all manner of uncouth names. But I
06069: omit them as altogether obsolete; and can hardly help suspecting them
06070: for mere sounds, full of Leviathanism, but signifying nothing.
06071: 
06072: Finally: It was stated at the outset, that this system would not be
06073: here, and at once, perfected. You cannot but plainly see that I have
06074: kept my word. But I now leave my cetological System standing thus
06075: unfinished, even as the great Cathedral of Cologne was left, with the
06076: crane still standing upon the top of the uncompleted tower. For small
06077: erections may be finished by their first architects; grand ones, true
06078: ones, ever leave the copestone to posterity. God keep me from ever
06079: completing anything. This whole book is but a draught—nay, but the
06080: draught of a draught. Oh, Time, Strength, Cash, and Patience!
06081: 
06082: 
06083: CHAPTER 33. The Specksnyder.
06084: 
06085: Concerning the officers of the whale-craft, this seems as good a place
06086: as any to set down a little domestic peculiarity on ship-board, arising
06087: from the existence of the harpooneer class of officers, a class unknown
06088: of course in any other marine than the whale-fleet.
06089: 
06090: The large importance attached to the harpooneer’s vocation is evinced
06091: by the fact, that originally in the old Dutch Fishery, two centuries
06092: and more ago, the command of a whale ship was not wholly lodged in the
06093: person now called the captain, but was divided between him and an
06094: officer called the Specksnyder. Literally this word means Fat-Cutter;
06095: usage, however, in time made it equivalent to Chief Harpooneer. In
06096: those days, the captain’s authority was restricted to the navigation
06097: and general management of the vessel; while over the whale-hunting
06098: department and all its concerns, the Specksnyder or Chief Harpooneer
06099: reigned supreme. In the British Greenland Fishery, under the corrupted
06100: title of Specksioneer, this old Dutch official is still retained, but
06101: his former dignity is sadly abridged. At present he ranks simply as
06102: senior Harpooneer; and as such, is but one of the captain’s more
06103: inferior subalterns. Nevertheless, as upon the good conduct of the
06104: harpooneers the success of a whaling voyage largely depends, and since
06105: in the American Fishery he is not only an important officer in the
06106: boat, but under certain circumstances (night watches on a whaling
06107: ground) the command of the ship’s deck is also his; therefore the grand
06108: political maxim of the sea demands, that he should nominally live apart
06109: from the men before the mast, and be in some way distinguished as their
06110: professional superior; though always, by them, familiarly regarded as
06111: their social equal.
06112: 
06113: Now, the grand distinction drawn between officer and man at sea, is
06114: this—the first lives aft, the last forward. Hence, in whale-ships and
06115: merchantmen alike, the mates have their quarters with the captain; and
06116: so, too, in most of the American whalers the harpooneers are lodged in
06117: the after part of the ship. That is to say, they take their meals in
06118: the captain’s cabin, and sleep in a place indirectly communicating with
06119: it.
06120: 
06121: Though the long period of a Southern whaling voyage (by far the longest
06122: of all voyages now or ever made by man), the peculiar perils of it, and
06123: the community of interest prevailing among a company, all of whom, high
06124: or low, depend for their profits, not upon fixed wages, but upon their
06125: common luck, together with their common vigilance, intrepidity, and
06126: hard work; though all these things do in some cases tend to beget a
06127: less rigorous discipline than in merchantmen generally; yet, never mind
06128: how much like an old Mesopotamian family these whalemen may, in some
06129: primitive instances, live together; for all that, the punctilious
06130: externals, at least, of the quarter-deck are seldom materially relaxed,
06131: and in no instance done away. Indeed, many are the Nantucket ships in
06132: which you will see the skipper parading his quarter-deck with an elated
06133: grandeur not surpassed in any military navy; nay, extorting almost as
06134: much outward homage as if he wore the imperial purple, and not the
06135: shabbiest of pilot-cloth.
06136: 
06137: And though of all men the moody captain of the Pequod was the least
06138: given to that sort of shallowest assumption; and though the only homage
06139: he ever exacted, was implicit, instantaneous obedience; though he
06140: required no man to remove the shoes from his feet ere stepping upon the
06141: quarter-deck; and though there were times when, owing to peculiar
06142: circumstances connected with events hereafter to be detailed, he
06143: addressed them in unusual terms, whether of condescension or _in
06144: terrorem_, or otherwise; yet even Captain Ahab was by no means
06145: unobservant of the paramount forms and usages of the sea.
06146: 
06147: Nor, perhaps, will it fail to be eventually perceived, that behind
06148: those forms and usages, as it were, he sometimes masked himself;
06149: incidentally making use of them for other and more private ends than
06150: they were legitimately intended to subserve. That certain sultanism of
06151: his brain, which had otherwise in a good degree remained unmanifested;
06152: through those forms that same sultanism became incarnate in an
06153: irresistible dictatorship. For be a man’s intellectual superiority what
06154: it will, it can never assume the practical, available supremacy over
06155: other men, without the aid of some sort of external arts and
06156: entrenchments, always, in themselves, more or less paltry and base.
06157: This it is, that for ever keeps God’s true princes of the Empire from
06158: the world’s hustings; and leaves the highest honors that this air can
06159: give, to those men who become famous more through their infinite
06160: inferiority to the choice hidden handful of the Divine Inert, than
06161: through their undoubted superiority over the dead level of the mass.
06162: Such large virtue lurks in these small things when extreme political
06163: superstitions invest them, that in some royal instances even to idiot
06164: imbecility they have imparted potency. But when, as in the case of
06165: Nicholas the Czar, the ringed crown of geographical empire encircles an
06166: imperial brain; then, the plebeian herds crouch abased before the
06167: tremendous centralization. Nor, will the tragic dramatist who would
06168: depict mortal indomitableness in its fullest sweep and direct swing,
06169: ever forget a hint, incidentally so important in his art, as the one
06170: now alluded to.
06171: 
06172: But Ahab, my Captain, still moves before me in all his Nantucket
06173: grimness and shagginess; and in this episode touching Emperors and
06174: Kings, I must not conceal that I have only to do with a poor old
06175: whale-hunter like him; and, therefore, all outward majestical trappings
06176: and housings are denied me. Oh, Ahab! what shall be grand in thee, it
06177: must needs be plucked at from the skies, and dived for in the deep, and
06178: featured in the unbodied air!
06179: 
06180: 
06181: CHAPTER 34. The Cabin-Table.
06182: 
06183: It is noon; and Dough-Boy, the steward, thrusting his pale
06184: loaf-of-bread face from the cabin-scuttle, announces dinner to his lord
06185: and master; who, sitting in the lee quarter-boat, has just been taking
06186: an observation of the sun; and is now mutely reckoning the latitude on
06187: the smooth, medallion-shaped tablet, reserved for that daily purpose on
06188: the upper part of his ivory leg. From his complete inattention to the
06189: tidings, you would think that moody Ahab had not heard his menial. But
06190: presently, catching hold of the mizen shrouds, he swings himself to the
06191: deck, and in an even, unexhilarated voice, saying, “Dinner, Mr.
06192: Starbuck,” disappears into the cabin.
06193: 
06194: When the last echo of his sultan’s step has died away, and Starbuck,
06195: the first Emir, has every reason to suppose that he is seated, then
06196: Starbuck rouses from his quietude, takes a few turns along the planks,
06197: and, after a grave peep into the binnacle, says, with some touch of
06198: pleasantness, “Dinner, Mr. Stubb,” and descends the scuttle. The second
06199: Emir lounges about the rigging awhile, and then slightly shaking the
06200: main brace, to see whether it will be all right with that important
06201: rope, he likewise takes up the old burden, and with a rapid “Dinner,
06202: Mr. Flask,” follows after his predecessors.
06203: 
06204: But the third Emir, now seeing himself all alone on the quarter-deck,
06205: seems to feel relieved from some curious restraint; for, tipping all
06206: sorts of knowing winks in all sorts of directions, and kicking off his
06207: shoes, he strikes into a sharp but noiseless squall of a hornpipe right
06208: over the Grand Turk’s head; and then, by a dexterous sleight, pitching
06209: his cap up into the mizentop for a shelf, he goes down rollicking so
06210: far at least as he remains visible from the deck, reversing all other
06211: processions, by bringing up the rear with music. But ere stepping into
06212: the cabin doorway below, he pauses, ships a new face altogether, and,
06213: then, independent, hilarious little Flask enters King Ahab’s presence,
06214: in the character of Abjectus, or the Slave.
06215: 
06216: It is not the least among the strange things bred by the intense
06217: artificialness of sea-usages, that while in the open air of the deck
06218: some officers will, upon provocation, bear themselves boldly and
06219: defyingly enough towards their commander; yet, ten to one, let those
06220: very officers the next moment go down to their customary dinner in that
06221: same commander’s cabin, and straightway their inoffensive, not to say
06222: deprecatory and humble air towards him, as he sits at the head of the
06223: table; this is marvellous, sometimes most comical. Wherefore this
06224: difference? A problem? Perhaps not. To have been Belshazzar, King of
06225: Babylon; and to have been Belshazzar, not haughtily but courteously,
06226: therein certainly must have been some touch of mundane grandeur. But he
06227: who in the rightly regal and intelligent spirit presides over his own
06228: private dinner-table of invited guests, that man’s unchallenged power
06229: and dominion of individual influence for the time; that man’s royalty
06230: of state transcends Belshazzar’s, for Belshazzar was not the greatest.
06231: Who has but once dined his friends, has tasted what it is to be Cæsar.
06232: It is a witchery of social czarship which there is no withstanding.
06233: Now, if to this consideration you superadd the official supremacy of a
06234: ship-master, then, by inference, you will derive the cause of that
06235: peculiarity of sea-life just mentioned.
06236: 
06237: Over his ivory-inlaid table, Ahab presided like a mute, maned sea-lion
06238: on the white coral beach, surrounded by his warlike but still
06239: deferential cubs. In his own proper turn, each officer waited to be
06240: served. They were as little children before Ahab; and yet, in Ahab,
06241: there seemed not to lurk the smallest social arrogance. With one mind,
06242: their intent eyes all fastened upon the old man’s knife, as he carved
06243: the chief dish before him. I do not suppose that for the world they
06244: would have profaned that moment with the slightest observation, even
06245: upon so neutral a topic as the weather. No! And when reaching out his
06246: knife and fork, between which the slice of beef was locked, Ahab
06247: thereby motioned Starbuck’s plate towards him, the mate received his
06248: meat as though receiving alms; and cut it tenderly; and a little
06249: started if, perchance, the knife grazed against the plate; and chewed
06250: it noiselessly; and swallowed it, not without circumspection. For, like
06251: the Coronation banquet at Frankfort, where the German Emperor
06252: profoundly dines with the seven Imperial Electors, so these cabin meals
06253: were somehow solemn meals, eaten in awful silence; and yet at table old
06254: Ahab forbade not conversation; only he himself was dumb. What a relief
06255: it was to choking Stubb, when a rat made a sudden racket in the hold
06256: below. And poor little Flask, he was the youngest son, and little boy
06257: of this weary family party. His were the shinbones of the saline beef;
06258: his would have been the drumsticks. For Flask to have presumed to help
06259: himself, this must have seemed to him tantamount to larceny in the
06260: first degree. Had he helped himself at that table, doubtless, never
06261: more would he have been able to hold his head up in this honest world;
06262: nevertheless, strange to say, Ahab never forbade him. And had Flask
06263: helped himself, the chances were Ahab had never so much as noticed it.
06264: Least of all, did Flask presume to help himself to butter. Whether he
06265: thought the owners of the ship denied it to him, on account of its
06266: clotting his clear, sunny complexion; or whether he deemed that, on so
06267: long a voyage in such marketless waters, butter was at a premium, and
06268: therefore was not for him, a subaltern; however it was, Flask, alas!
06269: was a butterless man!
06270: 
06271: Another thing. Flask was the last person down at the dinner, and Flask
06272: is the first man up. Consider! For hereby Flask’s dinner was badly
06273: jammed in point of time. Starbuck and Stubb both had the start of him;
06274: and yet they also have the privilege of lounging in the rear. If Stubb
06275: even, who is but a peg higher than Flask, happens to have but a small
06276: appetite, and soon shows symptoms of concluding his repast, then Flask
06277: must bestir himself, he will not get more than three mouthfuls that
06278: day; for it is against holy usage for Stubb to precede Flask to the
06279: deck. Therefore it was that Flask once admitted in private, that ever
06280: since he had arisen to the dignity of an officer, from that moment he
06281: had never known what it was to be otherwise than hungry, more or less.
06282: For what he ate did not so much relieve his hunger, as keep it immortal
06283: in him. Peace and satisfaction, thought Flask, have for ever departed
06284: from my stomach. I am an officer; but, how I wish I could fish a bit of
06285: old-fashioned beef in the forecastle, as I used to when I was before
06286: the mast. There’s the fruits of promotion now; there’s the vanity of
06287: glory: there’s the insanity of life! Besides, if it were so that any
06288: mere sailor of the Pequod had a grudge against Flask in Flask’s
06289: official capacity, all that sailor had to do, in order to obtain ample
06290: vengeance, was to go aft at dinner-time, and get a peep at Flask
06291: through the cabin sky-light, sitting silly and dumfoundered before
06292: awful Ahab.
06293: 
06294: Now, Ahab and his three mates formed what may be called the first table
06295: in the Pequod’s cabin. After their departure, taking place in inverted
06296: order to their arrival, the canvas cloth was cleared, or rather was
06297: restored to some hurried order by the pallid steward. And then the
06298: three harpooneers were bidden to the feast, they being its residuary
06299: legatees. They made a sort of temporary servants’ hall of the high and
06300: mighty cabin.
06301: 
06302: In strange contrast to the hardly tolerable constraint and nameless
06303: invisible domineerings of the captain’s table, was the entire care-free
06304: license and ease, the almost frantic democracy of those inferior
06305: fellows the harpooneers. While their masters, the mates, seemed afraid
06306: of the sound of the hinges of their own jaws, the harpooneers chewed
06307: their food with such a relish that there was a report to it. They dined
06308: like lords; they filled their bellies like Indian ships all day loading
06309: with spices. Such portentous appetites had Queequeg and Tashtego, that
06310: to fill out the vacancies made by the previous repast, often the pale
06311: Dough-Boy was fain to bring on a great baron of salt-junk, seemingly
06312: quarried out of the solid ox. And if he were not lively about it, if he
06313: did not go with a nimble hop-skip-and-jump, then Tashtego had an
06314: ungentlemanly way of accelerating him by darting a fork at his back,
06315: harpoon-wise. And once Daggoo, seized with a sudden humor, assisted
06316: Dough-Boy’s memory by snatching him up bodily, and thrusting his head
06317: into a great empty wooden trencher, while Tashtego, knife in hand,
06318: began laying out the circle preliminary to scalping him. He was
06319: naturally a very nervous, shuddering sort of little fellow, this
06320: bread-faced steward; the progeny of a bankrupt baker and a hospital
06321: nurse. And what with the standing spectacle of the black terrific Ahab,
06322: and the periodical tumultuous visitations of these three savages,
06323: Dough-Boy’s whole life was one continual lip-quiver. Commonly, after
06324: seeing the harpooneers furnished with all things they demanded, he
06325: would escape from their clutches into his little pantry adjoining, and
06326: fearfully peep out at them through the blinds of its door, till all was
06327: over.
06328: 
06329: It was a sight to see Queequeg seated over against Tashtego, opposing
06330: his filed teeth to the Indian’s: crosswise to them, Daggoo seated on
06331: the floor, for a bench would have brought his hearse-plumed head to the
06332: low carlines; at every motion of his colossal limbs, making the low
06333: cabin framework to shake, as when an African elephant goes passenger in
06334: a ship. But for all this, the great negro was wonderfully abstemious,
06335: not to say dainty. It seemed hardly possible that by such comparatively
06336: small mouthfuls he could keep up the vitality diffused through so
06337: broad, baronial, and superb a person. But, doubtless, this noble savage
06338: fed strong and drank deep of the abounding element of air; and through
06339: his dilated nostrils snuffed in the sublime life of the worlds. Not by
06340: beef or by bread, are giants made or nourished. But Queequeg, he had a
06341: mortal, barbaric smack of the lip in eating—an ugly sound enough—so
06342: much so, that the trembling Dough-Boy almost looked to see whether any
06343: marks of teeth lurked in his own lean arms. And when he would hear
06344: Tashtego singing out for him to produce himself, that his bones might
06345: be picked, the simple-witted steward all but shattered the crockery
06346: hanging round him in the pantry, by his sudden fits of the palsy. Nor
06347: did the whetstone which the harpooneers carried in their pockets, for
06348: their lances and other weapons; and with which whetstones, at dinner,
06349: they would ostentatiously sharpen their knives; that grating sound did
06350: not at all tend to tranquillize poor Dough-Boy. How could he forget
06351: that in his Island days, Queequeg, for one, must certainly have been
06352: guilty of some murderous, convivial indiscretions. Alas! Dough-Boy!
06353: hard fares the white waiter who waits upon cannibals. Not a napkin
06354: should he carry on his arm, but a buckler. In good time, though, to his
06355: great delight, the three salt-sea warriors would rise and depart; to
06356: his credulous, fable-mongering ears, all their martial bones jingling
06357: in them at every step, like Moorish scimetars in scabbards.
06358: 
06359: But, though these barbarians dined in the cabin, and nominally lived
06360: there; still, being anything but sedentary in their habits, they were
06361: scarcely ever in it except at mealtimes, and just before sleeping-time,
06362: when they passed through it to their own peculiar quarters.
06363: 
06364: In this one matter, Ahab seemed no exception to most American whale
06365: captains, who, as a set, rather incline to the opinion that by rights
06366: the ship’s cabin belongs to them; and that it is by courtesy alone that
06367: anybody else is, at any time, permitted there. So that, in real truth,
06368: the mates and harpooneers of the Pequod might more properly be said to
06369: have lived out of the cabin than in it. For when they did enter it, it
06370: was something as a street-door enters a house; turning inwards for a
06371: moment, only to be turned out the next; and, as a permanent thing,
06372: residing in the open air. Nor did they lose much hereby; in the cabin
06373: was no companionship; socially, Ahab was inaccessible. Though nominally
06374: included in the census of Christendom, he was still an alien to it. He
06375: lived in the world, as the last of the Grisly Bears lived in settled
06376: Missouri. And as when Spring and Summer had departed, that wild Logan
06377: of the woods, burying himself in the hollow of a tree, lived out the
06378: winter there, sucking his own paws; so, in his inclement, howling old
06379: age, Ahab’s soul, shut up in the caved trunk of his body, there fed
06380: upon the sullen paws of its gloom!
06381: 
06382: 
06383: CHAPTER 35. The Mast-Head.
06384: 
06385: It was during the more pleasant weather, that in due rotation with the
06386: other seamen my first mast-head came round.
06387: 
06388: In most American whalemen the mast-heads are manned almost
06389: simultaneously with the vessel’s leaving her port; even though she may
06390: have fifteen thousand miles, and more, to sail ere reaching her proper
06391: cruising ground. And if, after a three, four, or five years’ voyage she
06392: is drawing nigh home with anything empty in her—say, an empty vial
06393: even—then, her mast-heads are kept manned to the last; and not till her
06394: skysail-poles sail in among the spires of the port, does she altogether
06395: relinquish the hope of capturing one whale more.
06396: 
06397: Now, as the business of standing mast-heads, ashore or afloat, is a
06398: very ancient and interesting one, let us in some measure expatiate
06399: here. I take it, that the earliest standers of mast-heads were the old
06400: Egyptians; because, in all my researches, I find none prior to them.
06401: For though their progenitors, the builders of Babel, must doubtless, by
06402: their tower, have intended to rear the loftiest mast-head in all Asia,
06403: or Africa either; yet (ere the final truck was put to it) as that great
06404: stone mast of theirs may be said to have gone by the board, in the
06405: dread gale of God’s wrath; therefore, we cannot give these Babel
06406: builders priority over the Egyptians. And that the Egyptians were a
06407: nation of mast-head standers, is an assertion based upon the general
06408: belief among archæologists, that the first pyramids were founded for
06409: astronomical purposes: a theory singularly supported by the peculiar
06410: stair-like formation of all four sides of those edifices; whereby, with
06411: prodigious long upliftings of their legs, those old astronomers were
06412: wont to mount to the apex, and sing out for new stars; even as the
06413: look-outs of a modern ship sing out for a sail, or a whale just bearing
06414: in sight. In Saint Stylites, the famous Christian hermit of old times,
06415: who built him a lofty stone pillar in the desert and spent the whole
06416: latter portion of his life on its summit, hoisting his food from the
06417: ground with a tackle; in him we have a remarkable instance of a
06418: dauntless stander-of-mast-heads; who was not to be driven from his
06419: place by fogs or frosts, rain, hail, or sleet; but valiantly facing
06420: everything out to the last, literally died at his post. Of modern
06421: standers-of-mast-heads we have but a lifeless set; mere stone, iron,
06422: and bronze men; who, though well capable of facing out a stiff gale,
06423: are still entirely incompetent to the business of singing out upon
06424: discovering any strange sight. There is Napoleon; who, upon the top of
06425: the column of Vendome, stands with arms folded, some one hundred and
06426: fifty feet in the air; careless, now, who rules the decks below;
06427: whether Louis Philippe, Louis Blanc, or Louis the Devil. Great
06428: Washington, too, stands high aloft on his towering main-mast in
06429: Baltimore, and like one of Hercules’ pillars, his column marks that
06430: point of human grandeur beyond which few mortals will go. Admiral
06431: Nelson, also, on a capstan of gun-metal, stands his mast-head in
06432: Trafalgar Square; and ever when most obscured by that London smoke,
06433: token is yet given that a hidden hero is there; for where there is
06434: smoke, must be fire. But neither great Washington, nor Napoleon, nor
06435: Nelson, will answer a single hail from below, however madly invoked to
06436: befriend by their counsels the distracted decks upon which they gaze;
06437: however it may be surmised, that their spirits penetrate through the
06438: thick haze of the future, and descry what shoals and what rocks must be
06439: shunned.
06440: 
06441: It may seem unwarrantable to couple in any respect the mast-head
06442: standers of the land with those of the sea; but that in truth it is not
06443: so, is plainly evinced by an item for which Obed Macy, the sole
06444: historian of Nantucket, stands accountable. The worthy Obed tells us,
06445: that in the early times of the whale fishery, ere ships were regularly
06446: launched in pursuit of the game, the people of that island erected
06447: lofty spars along the sea-coast, to which the look-outs ascended by
06448: means of nailed cleats, something as fowls go upstairs in a hen-house.
06449: A few years ago this same plan was adopted by the Bay whalemen of New
06450: Zealand, who, upon descrying the game, gave notice to the ready-manned
06451: boats nigh the beach. But this custom has now become obsolete; turn we
06452: then to the one proper mast-head, that of a whale-ship at sea. The
06453: three mast-heads are kept manned from sun-rise to sun-set; the seamen
06454: taking their regular turns (as at the helm), and relieving each other
06455: every two hours. In the serene weather of the tropics it is exceedingly
06456: pleasant the mast-head; nay, to a dreamy meditative man it is
06457: delightful. There you stand, a hundred feet above the silent decks,
06458: striding along the deep, as if the masts were gigantic stilts, while
06459: beneath you and between your legs, as it were, swim the hugest monsters
06460: of the sea, even as ships once sailed between the boots of the famous
06461: Colossus at old Rhodes. There you stand, lost in the infinite series of
06462: the sea, with nothing ruffled but the waves. The tranced ship
06463: indolently rolls; the drowsy trade winds blow; everything resolves you
06464: into languor. For the most part, in this tropic whaling life, a sublime
06465: uneventfulness invests you; you hear no news; read no gazettes; extras
06466: with startling accounts of commonplaces never delude you into
06467: unnecessary excitements; you hear of no domestic afflictions; bankrupt
06468: securities; fall of stocks; are never troubled with the thought of what
06469: you shall have for dinner—for all your meals for three years and more
06470: are snugly stowed in casks, and your bill of fare is immutable.
06471: 
06472: In one of those southern whalesmen, on a long three or four years’
06473: voyage, as often happens, the sum of the various hours you spend at the
06474: mast-head would amount to several entire months. And it is much to be
06475: deplored that the place to which you devote so considerable a portion
06476: of the whole term of your natural life, should be so sadly destitute of
06477: anything approaching to a cosy inhabitiveness, or adapted to breed a
06478: comfortable localness of feeling, such as pertains to a bed, a hammock,
06479: a hearse, a sentry box, a pulpit, a coach, or any other of those small
06480: and snug contrivances in which men temporarily isolate themselves. Your
06481: most usual point of perch is the head of the t’ gallant-mast, where you
06482: stand upon two thin parallel sticks (almost peculiar to whalemen)
06483: called the t’ gallant cross-trees. Here, tossed about by the sea, the
06484: beginner feels about as cosy as he would standing on a bull’s horns. To
06485: be sure, in cold weather you may carry your house aloft with you, in
06486: the shape of a watch-coat; but properly speaking the thickest
06487: watch-coat is no more of a house than the unclad body; for as the soul
06488: is glued inside of its fleshy tabernacle, and cannot freely move about
06489: in it, nor even move out of it, without running great risk of perishing
06490: (like an ignorant pilgrim crossing the snowy Alps in winter); so a
06491: watch-coat is not so much of a house as it is a mere envelope, or
06492: additional skin encasing you. You cannot put a shelf or chest of
06493: drawers in your body, and no more can you make a convenient closet of
06494: your watch-coat.
06495: 
06496: Concerning all this, it is much to be deplored that the mast-heads of a
06497: southern whale ship are unprovided with those enviable little tents or
06498: pulpits, called _crow’s-nests_, in which the look-outs of a Greenland
06499: whaler are protected from the inclement weather of the frozen seas. In
06500: the fireside narrative of Captain Sleet, entitled “A Voyage among the
06501: Icebergs, in quest of the Greenland Whale, and incidentally for the
06502: re-discovery of the Lost Icelandic Colonies of Old Greenland;” in this
06503: admirable volume, all standers of mast-heads are furnished with a
06504: charmingly circumstantial account of the then recently invented
06505: _crow’s-nest_ of the Glacier, which was the name of Captain Sleet’s
06506: good craft. He called it the _Sleet’s crow’s-nest_, in honor of
06507: himself; he being the original inventor and patentee, and free from all
06508: ridiculous false delicacy, and holding that if we call our own children
06509: after our own names (we fathers being the original inventors and
06510: patentees), so likewise should we denominate after ourselves any other
06511: apparatus we may beget. In shape, the Sleet’s crow’s-nest is something
06512: like a large tierce or pipe; it is open above, however, where it is
06513: furnished with a movable side-screen to keep to windward of your head
06514: in a hard gale. Being fixed on the summit of the mast, you ascend into
06515: it through a little trap-hatch in the bottom. On the after side, or
06516: side next the stern of the ship, is a comfortable seat, with a locker
06517: underneath for umbrellas, comforters, and coats. In front is a leather
06518: rack, in which to keep your speaking trumpet, pipe, telescope, and
06519: other nautical conveniences. When Captain Sleet in person stood his
06520: mast-head in this crow’s-nest of his, he tells us that he always had a
06521: rifle with him (also fixed in the rack), together with a powder flask
06522: and shot, for the purpose of popping off the stray narwhales, or
06523: vagrant sea unicorns infesting those waters; for you cannot
06524: successfully shoot at them from the deck owing to the resistance of the
06525: water, but to shoot down upon them is a very different thing. Now, it
06526: was plainly a labor of love for Captain Sleet to describe, as he does,
06527: all the little detailed conveniences of his crow’s-nest; but though he
06528: so enlarges upon many of these, and though he treats us to a very
06529: scientific account of his experiments in this crow’s-nest, with a small
06530: compass he kept there for the purpose of counteracting the errors
06531: resulting from what is called the “local attraction” of all binnacle
06532: magnets; an error ascribable to the horizontal vicinity of the iron in
06533: the ship’s planks, and in the Glacier’s case, perhaps, to there having
06534: been so many broken-down blacksmiths among her crew; I say, that though
06535: the Captain is very discreet and scientific here, yet, for all his
06536: learned “binnacle deviations,” “azimuth compass observations,” and
06537: “approximate errors,” he knows very well, Captain Sleet, that he was
06538: not so much immersed in those profound magnetic meditations, as to fail
06539: being attracted occasionally towards that well replenished little
06540: case-bottle, so nicely tucked in on one side of his crow’s nest, within
06541: easy reach of his hand. Though, upon the whole, I greatly admire and
06542: even love the brave, the honest, and learned Captain; yet I take it
06543: very ill of him that he should so utterly ignore that case-bottle,
06544: seeing what a faithful friend and comforter it must have been, while
06545: with mittened fingers and hooded head he was studying the mathematics
06546: aloft there in that bird’s nest within three or four perches of the
06547: pole.
06548: 
06549: But if we Southern whale-fishers are not so snugly housed aloft as
06550: Captain Sleet and his Greenlandmen were; yet that disadvantage is
06551: greatly counter-balanced by the widely contrasting serenity of those
06552: seductive seas in which we South fishers mostly float. For one, I used
06553: to lounge up the rigging very leisurely, resting in the top to have a
06554: chat with Queequeg, or any one else off duty whom I might find there;
06555: then ascending a little way further, and throwing a lazy leg over the
06556: top-sail yard, take a preliminary view of the watery pastures, and so
06557: at last mount to my ultimate destination.
06558: 
06559: Let me make a clean breast of it here, and frankly admit that I kept
06560: but sorry guard. With the problem of the universe revolving in me, how
06561: could I—being left completely to myself at such a thought-engendering
06562: altitude—how could I but lightly hold my obligations to observe all
06563: whale-ships’ standing orders, “Keep your weather eye open, and sing out
06564: every time.”
06565: 
06566: And let me in this place movingly admonish you, ye ship-owners of
06567: Nantucket! Beware of enlisting in your vigilant fisheries any lad with
06568: lean brow and hollow eye; given to unseasonable meditativeness; and who
06569: offers to ship with the Phædon instead of Bowditch in his head. Beware
06570: of such an one, I say; your whales must be seen before they can be
06571: killed; and this sunken-eyed young Platonist will tow you ten wakes
06572: round the world, and never make you one pint of sperm the richer. Nor
06573: are these monitions at all unneeded. For nowadays, the whale-fishery
06574: furnishes an asylum for many romantic, melancholy, and absent-minded
06575: young men, disgusted with the carking cares of earth, and seeking
06576: sentiment in tar and blubber. Childe Harold not unfrequently perches
06577: himself upon the mast-head of some luckless disappointed whale-ship,
06578: and in moody phrase ejaculates:—
06579: 
06580: 
06581: “Roll on, thou deep and dark blue ocean, roll! Ten thousand
06582: blubber-hunters sweep over thee in vain.”
06583: 
06584: 
06585: 
06586: Very often do the captains of such ships take those absent-minded young
06587: philosophers to task, upbraiding them with not feeling sufficient
06588: “interest” in the voyage; half-hinting that they are so hopelessly lost
06589: to all honorable ambition, as that in their secret souls they would
06590: rather not see whales than otherwise. But all in vain; those young
06591: Platonists have a notion that their vision is imperfect; they are
06592: short-sighted; what use, then, to strain the visual nerve? They have
06593: left their opera-glasses at home.
06594: 
06595: “Why, thou monkey,” said a harpooneer to one of these lads, “we’ve been
06596: cruising now hard upon three years, and thou hast not raised a whale
06597: yet. Whales are scarce as hen’s teeth whenever thou art up here.”
06598: Perhaps they were; or perhaps there might have been shoals of them in
06599: the far horizon; but lulled into such an opium-like listlessness of
06600: vacant, unconscious reverie is this absent-minded youth by the blending
06601: cadence of waves with thoughts, that at last he loses his identity;
06602: takes the mystic ocean at his feet for the visible image of that deep,
06603: blue, bottomless soul, pervading mankind and nature; and every strange,
06604: half-seen, gliding, beautiful thing that eludes him; every
06605: dimly-discovered, uprising fin of some undiscernible form, seems to him
06606: the embodiment of those elusive thoughts that only people the soul by
06607: continually flitting through it. In this enchanted mood, thy spirit
06608: ebbs away to whence it came; becomes diffused through time and space;
06609: like Cranmer’s sprinkled Pantheistic ashes, forming at last a part of
06610: every shore the round globe over.
06611: 
06612: There is no life in thee, now, except that rocking life imparted by a
06613: gently rolling ship; by her, borrowed from the sea; by the sea, from
06614: the inscrutable tides of God. But while this sleep, this dream is on
06615: ye, move your foot or hand an inch; slip your hold at all; and your
06616: identity comes back in horror. Over Descartian vortices you hover. And
06617: perhaps, at mid-day, in the fairest weather, with one half-throttled
06618: shriek you drop through that transparent air into the summer sea, no
06619: more to rise for ever. Heed it well, ye Pantheists!
06620: 
06621: 
06622: CHAPTER 36. The Quarter-Deck.
06623: 
06624: (_Enter Ahab: Then, all._)
06625: 
06626: It was not a great while after the affair of the pipe, that one morning
06627: shortly after breakfast, Ahab, as was his wont, ascended the
06628: cabin-gangway to the deck. There most sea-captains usually walk at that
06629: hour, as country gentlemen, after the same meal, take a few turns in
06630: the garden.
06631: 
06632: Soon his steady, ivory stride was heard, as to and fro he paced his old
06633: rounds, upon planks so familiar to his tread, that they were all over
06634: dented, like geological stones, with the peculiar mark of his walk. Did
06635: you fixedly gaze, too, upon that ribbed and dented brow; there also,
06636: you would see still stranger foot-prints—the foot-prints of his one
06637: unsleeping, ever-pacing thought.
06638: 
06639: But on the occasion in question, those dents looked deeper, even as his
06640: nervous step that morning left a deeper mark. And, so full of his
06641: thought was Ahab, that at every uniform turn that he made, now at the
06642: main-mast and now at the binnacle, you could almost see that thought
06643: turn in him as he turned, and pace in him as he paced; so completely
06644: possessing him, indeed, that it all but seemed the inward mould of
06645: every outer movement.
06646: 
06647: “D’ye mark him, Flask?” whispered Stubb; “the chick that’s in him pecks
06648: the shell. ’Twill soon be out.”
06649: 
06650: The hours wore on;—Ahab now shut up within his cabin; anon, pacing the
06651: deck, with the same intense bigotry of purpose in his aspect.
06652: 
06653: It drew near the close of day. Suddenly he came to a halt by the
06654: bulwarks, and inserting his bone leg into the auger-hole there, and
06655: with one hand grasping a shroud, he ordered Starbuck to send everybody
06656: aft.
06657: 
06658: “Sir!” said the mate, astonished at an order seldom or never given on
06659: ship-board except in some extraordinary case.
06660: 
06661: “Send everybody aft,” repeated Ahab. “Mast-heads, there! come down!”
06662: 
06663: When the entire ship’s company were assembled, and with curious and not
06664: wholly unapprehensive faces, were eyeing him, for he looked not unlike
06665: the weather horizon when a storm is coming up, Ahab, after rapidly
06666: glancing over the bulwarks, and then darting his eyes among the crew,
06667: started from his standpoint; and as though not a soul were nigh him
06668: resumed his heavy turns upon the deck. With bent head and half-slouched
06669: hat he continued to pace, unmindful of the wondering whispering among
06670: the men; till Stubb cautiously whispered to Flask, that Ahab must have
06671: summoned them there for the purpose of witnessing a pedestrian feat.
06672: But this did not last long. Vehemently pausing, he cried:—
06673: 
06674: “What do ye do when ye see a whale, men?”
06675: 
06676: “Sing out for him!” was the impulsive rejoinder from a score of clubbed
06677: voices.
06678: 
06679: “Good!” cried Ahab, with a wild approval in his tones; observing the
06680: hearty animation into which his unexpected question had so magnetically
06681: thrown them.
06682: 
06683: “And what do ye next, men?”
06684: 
06685: “Lower away, and after him!”
06686: 
06687: “And what tune is it ye pull to, men?”
06688: 
06689: “A dead whale or a stove boat!”
06690: 
06691: More and more strangely and fiercely glad and approving, grew the
06692: countenance of the old man at every shout; while the mariners began to
06693: gaze curiously at each other, as if marvelling how it was that they
06694: themselves became so excited at such seemingly purposeless questions.
06695: 
06696: But, they were all eagerness again, as Ahab, now half-revolving in his
06697: pivot-hole, with one hand reaching high up a shroud, and tightly,
06698: almost convulsively grasping it, addressed them thus:—
06699: 
06700: “All ye mast-headers have before now heard me give orders about a white
06701: whale. Look ye! d’ye see this Spanish ounce of gold?”—holding up a
06702: broad bright coin to the sun—“it is a sixteen dollar piece, men. D’ye
06703: see it? Mr. Starbuck, hand me yon top-maul.”
06704: 
06705: While the mate was getting the hammer, Ahab, without speaking, was
06706: slowly rubbing the gold piece against the skirts of his jacket, as if
06707: to heighten its lustre, and without using any words was meanwhile lowly
06708: humming to himself, producing a sound so strangely muffled and
06709: inarticulate that it seemed the mechanical humming of the wheels of his
06710: vitality in him.
06711: 
06712: Receiving the top-maul from Starbuck, he advanced towards the main-mast
06713: with the hammer uplifted in one hand, exhibiting the gold with the
06714: other, and with a high raised voice exclaiming: “Whosoever of ye raises
06715: me a white-headed whale with a wrinkled brow and a crooked jaw;
06716: whosoever of ye raises me that white-headed whale, with three holes
06717: punctured in his starboard fluke—look ye, whosoever of ye raises me
06718: that same white whale, he shall have this gold ounce, my boys!”
06719: 
06720: “Huzza! huzza!” cried the seamen, as with swinging tarpaulins they
06721: hailed the act of nailing the gold to the mast.
06722: 
06723: “It’s a white whale, I say,” resumed Ahab, as he threw down the
06724: topmaul: “a white whale. Skin your eyes for him, men; look sharp for
06725: white water; if ye see but a bubble, sing out.”
06726: 
06727: All this while Tashtego, Daggoo, and Queequeg had looked on with even
06728: more intense interest and surprise than the rest, and at the mention of
06729: the wrinkled brow and crooked jaw they had started as if each was
06730: separately touched by some specific recollection.
06731: 
06732: “Captain Ahab,” said Tashtego, “that white whale must be the same that
06733: some call Moby Dick.”
06734: 
06735: “Moby Dick?” shouted Ahab. “Do ye know the white whale then, Tash?”
06736: 
06737: “Does he fan-tail a little curious, sir, before he goes down?” said the
06738: Gay-Header deliberately.
06739: 
06740: “And has he a curious spout, too,” said Daggoo, “very bushy, even for a
06741: parmacetty, and mighty quick, Captain Ahab?”
06742: 
06743: “And he have one, two, three—oh! good many iron in him hide, too,
06744: Captain,” cried Queequeg disjointedly, “all twiske-tee be-twisk, like
06745: him—him—” faltering hard for a word, and screwing his hand round and
06746: round as though uncorking a bottle—“like him—him—”
06747: 
06748: “Corkscrew!” cried Ahab, “aye, Queequeg, the harpoons lie all twisted
06749: and wrenched in him; aye, Daggoo, his spout is a big one, like a whole
06750: shock of wheat, and white as a pile of our Nantucket wool after the
06751: great annual sheep-shearing; aye, Tashtego, and he fan-tails like a
06752: split jib in a squall. Death and devils! men, it is Moby Dick ye have
06753: seen—Moby Dick—Moby Dick!”
06754: 
06755: “Captain Ahab,” said Starbuck, who, with Stubb and Flask, had thus far
06756: been eyeing his superior with increasing surprise, but at last seemed
06757: struck with a thought which somewhat explained all the wonder. “Captain
06758: Ahab, I have heard of Moby Dick—but it was not Moby Dick that took off
06759: thy leg?”
06760: 
06761: “Who told thee that?” cried Ahab; then pausing, “Aye, Starbuck; aye, my
06762: hearties all round; it was Moby Dick that dismasted me; Moby Dick that
06763: brought me to this dead stump I stand on now. Aye, aye,” he shouted
06764: with a terrific, loud, animal sob, like that of a heart-stricken moose;
06765: “Aye, aye! it was that accursed white whale that razeed me; made a poor
06766: pegging lubber of me for ever and a day!” Then tossing both arms, with
06767: measureless imprecations he shouted out: “Aye, aye! and I’ll chase him
