06768: round Good Hope, and round the Horn, and round the Norway Maelstrom,
06769: and round perdition’s flames before I give him up. And this is what ye
06770: have shipped for, men! to chase that white whale on both sides of land,
06771: and over all sides of earth, till he spouts black blood and rolls fin
06772: out. What say ye, men, will ye splice hands on it, now? I think ye do
06773: look brave.”
06774: 
06775: “Aye, aye!” shouted the harpooneers and seamen, running closer to the
06776: excited old man: “A sharp eye for the white whale; a sharp lance for
06777: Moby Dick!”
06778: 
06779: “God bless ye,” he seemed to half sob and half shout. “God bless ye,
06780: men. Steward! go draw the great measure of grog. But what’s this long
06781: face about, Mr. Starbuck; wilt thou not chase the white whale? art not
06782: game for Moby Dick?”
06783: 
06784: “I am game for his crooked jaw, and for the jaws of Death too, Captain
06785: Ahab, if it fairly comes in the way of the business we follow; but I
06786: came here to hunt whales, not my commander’s vengeance. How many
06787: barrels will thy vengeance yield thee even if thou gettest it, Captain
06788: Ahab? it will not fetch thee much in our Nantucket market.”
06789: 
06790: “Nantucket market! Hoot! But come closer, Starbuck; thou requirest a
06791: little lower layer. If money’s to be the measurer, man, and the
06792: accountants have computed their great counting-house the globe, by
06793: girdling it with guineas, one to every three parts of an inch; then,
06794: let me tell thee, that my vengeance will fetch a great premium _here!_”
06795: 
06796: “He smites his chest,” whispered Stubb, “what’s that for? methinks it
06797: rings most vast, but hollow.”
06798: 
06799: “Vengeance on a dumb brute!” cried Starbuck, “that simply smote thee
06800: from blindest instinct! Madness! To be enraged with a dumb thing,
06801: Captain Ahab, seems blasphemous.”
06802: 
06803: “Hark ye yet again—the little lower layer. All visible objects, man,
06804: are but as pasteboard masks. But in each event—in the living act, the
06805: undoubted deed—there, some unknown but still reasoning thing puts forth
06806: the mouldings of its features from behind the unreasoning mask. If man
06807: will strike, strike through the mask! How can the prisoner reach
06808: outside except by thrusting through the wall? To me, the white whale is
06809: that wall, shoved near to me. Sometimes I think there’s naught beyond.
06810: But ’tis enough. He tasks me; he heaps me; I see in him outrageous
06811: strength, with an inscrutable malice sinewing it. That inscrutable
06812: thing is chiefly what I hate; and be the white whale agent, or be the
06813: white whale principal, I will wreak that hate upon him. Talk not to me
06814: of blasphemy, man; I’d strike the sun if it insulted me. For could the
06815: sun do that, then could I do the other; since there is ever a sort of
06816: fair play herein, jealousy presiding over all creations. But not my
06817: master, man, is even that fair play. Who’s over me? Truth hath no
06818: confines. Take off thine eye! more intolerable than fiends’ glarings is
06819: a doltish stare! So, so; thou reddenest and palest; my heat has melted
06820: thee to anger-glow. But look ye, Starbuck, what is said in heat, that
06821: thing unsays itself. There are men from whom warm words are small
06822: indignity. I meant not to incense thee. Let it go. Look! see yonder
06823: Turkish cheeks of spotted tawn—living, breathing pictures painted by
06824: the sun. The Pagan leopards—the unrecking and unworshipping things,
06825: that live; and seek, and give no reasons for the torrid life they feel!
06826: The crew, man, the crew! Are they not one and all with Ahab, in this
06827: matter of the whale? See Stubb! he laughs! See yonder Chilian! he
06828: snorts to think of it. Stand up amid the general hurricane, thy one
06829: tost sapling cannot, Starbuck! And what is it? Reckon it. ’Tis but to
06830: help strike a fin; no wondrous feat for Starbuck. What is it more? From
06831: this one poor hunt, then, the best lance out of all Nantucket, surely
06832: he will not hang back, when every foremast-hand has clutched a
06833: whetstone? Ah! constrainings seize thee; I see! the billow lifts thee!
06834: Speak, but speak!—Aye, aye! thy silence, then, _that_ voices thee.
06835: (_Aside_) Something shot from my dilated nostrils, he has inhaled it in
06836: his lungs. Starbuck now is mine; cannot oppose me now, without
06837: rebellion.”
06838: 
06839: “God keep me!—keep us all!” murmured Starbuck, lowly.
06840: 
06841: But in his joy at the enchanted, tacit acquiescence of the mate, Ahab
06842: did not hear his foreboding invocation; nor yet the low laugh from the
06843: hold; nor yet the presaging vibrations of the winds in the cordage; nor
06844: yet the hollow flap of the sails against the masts, as for a moment
06845: their hearts sank in. For again Starbuck’s downcast eyes lighted up
06846: with the stubbornness of life; the subterranean laugh died away; the
06847: winds blew on; the sails filled out; the ship heaved and rolled as
06848: before. Ah, ye admonitions and warnings! why stay ye not when ye come?
06849: But rather are ye predictions than warnings, ye shadows! Yet not so
06850: much predictions from without, as verifications of the foregoing things
06851: within. For with little external to constrain us, the innermost
06852: necessities in our being, these still drive us on.
06853: 
06854: “The measure! the measure!” cried Ahab.
06855: 
06856: Receiving the brimming pewter, and turning to the harpooneers, he
06857: ordered them to produce their weapons. Then ranging them before him
06858: near the capstan, with their harpoons in their hands, while his three
06859: mates stood at his side with their lances, and the rest of the ship’s
06860: company formed a circle round the group; he stood for an instant
06861: searchingly eyeing every man of his crew. But those wild eyes met his,
06862: as the bloodshot eyes of the prairie wolves meet the eye of their
06863: leader, ere he rushes on at their head in the trail of the bison; but,
06864: alas! only to fall into the hidden snare of the Indian.
06865: 
06866: “Drink and pass!” he cried, handing the heavy charged flagon to the
06867: nearest seaman. “The crew alone now drink. Round with it, round! Short
06868: draughts—long swallows, men; ’tis hot as Satan’s hoof. So, so; it goes
06869: round excellently. It spiralizes in ye; forks out at the
06870: serpent-snapping eye. Well done; almost drained. That way it went, this
06871: way it comes. Hand it me—here’s a hollow! Men, ye seem the years; so
06872: brimming life is gulped and gone. Steward, refill!
06873: 
06874: “Attend now, my braves. I have mustered ye all round this capstan; and
06875: ye mates, flank me with your lances; and ye harpooneers, stand there
06876: with your irons; and ye, stout mariners, ring me in, that I may in some
06877: sort revive a noble custom of my fisherman fathers before me. O men,
06878: you will yet see that—Ha! boy, come back? bad pennies come not sooner.
06879: Hand it me. Why, now, this pewter had run brimming again, wer’t not
06880: thou St. Vitus’ imp—away, thou ague!
06881: 
06882: “Advance, ye mates! Cross your lances full before me. Well done! Let me
06883: touch the axis.” So saying, with extended arm, he grasped the three
06884: level, radiating lances at their crossed centre; while so doing,
06885: suddenly and nervously twitched them; meanwhile, glancing intently from
06886: Starbuck to Stubb; from Stubb to Flask. It seemed as though, by some
06887: nameless, interior volition, he would fain have shocked into them the
06888: same fiery emotion accumulated within the Leyden jar of his own
06889: magnetic life. The three mates quailed before his strong, sustained,
06890: and mystic aspect. Stubb and Flask looked sideways from him; the honest
06891: eye of Starbuck fell downright.
06892: 
06893: “In vain!” cried Ahab; “but, maybe, ’tis well. For did ye three but
06894: once take the full-forced shock, then mine own electric thing, _that_
06895: had perhaps expired from out me. Perchance, too, it would have dropped
06896: ye dead. Perchance ye need it not. Down lances! And now, ye mates, I do
06897: appoint ye three cupbearers to my three pagan kinsmen there—yon three
06898: most honorable gentlemen and noblemen, my valiant harpooneers. Disdain
06899: the task? What, when the great Pope washes the feet of beggars, using
06900: his tiara for ewer? Oh, my sweet cardinals! your own condescension,
06901: _that_ shall bend ye to it. I do not order ye; ye will it. Cut your
06902: seizings and draw the poles, ye harpooneers!”
06903: 
06904: Silently obeying the order, the three harpooneers now stood with the
06905: detached iron part of their harpoons, some three feet long, held, barbs
06906: up, before him.
06907: 
06908: “Stab me not with that keen steel! Cant them; cant them over! know ye
06909: not the goblet end? Turn up the socket! So, so; now, ye cup-bearers,
06910: advance. The irons! take them; hold them while I fill!” Forthwith,
06911: slowly going from one officer to the other, he brimmed the harpoon
06912: sockets with the fiery waters from the pewter.
06913: 
06914: “Now, three to three, ye stand. Commend the murderous chalices! Bestow
06915: them, ye who are now made parties to this indissoluble league. Ha!
06916: Starbuck! but the deed is done! Yon ratifying sun now waits to sit upon
06917: it. Drink, ye harpooneers! drink and swear, ye men that man the
06918: deathful whaleboat’s bow—Death to Moby Dick! God hunt us all, if we do
06919: not hunt Moby Dick to his death!” The long, barbed steel goblets were
06920: lifted; and to cries and maledictions against the white whale, the
06921: spirits were simultaneously quaffed down with a hiss. Starbuck paled,
06922: and turned, and shivered. Once more, and finally, the replenished
06923: pewter went the rounds among the frantic crew; when, waving his free
06924: hand to them, they all dispersed; and Ahab retired within his cabin.
06925: 
06926: 
06927: CHAPTER 37. Sunset.
06928: 
06929: _The cabin; by the stern windows; Ahab sitting alone, and gazing out_.
06930: 
06931: I leave a white and turbid wake; pale waters, paler cheeks, where’er I
06932: sail. The envious billows sidelong swell to whelm my track; let them;
06933: but first I pass.
06934: 
06935: Yonder, by ever-brimming goblet’s rim, the warm waves blush like wine.
06936: The gold brow plumbs the blue. The diver sun—slow dived from noon—goes
06937: down; my soul mounts up! she wearies with her endless hill. Is, then,
06938: the crown too heavy that I wear? this Iron Crown of Lombardy. Yet is it
06939: bright with many a gem; I the wearer, see not its far flashings; but
06940: darkly feel that I wear that, that dazzlingly confounds. ’Tis iron—that
06941: I know—not gold. ’Tis split, too—that I feel; the jagged edge galls me
06942: so, my brain seems to beat against the solid metal; aye, steel skull,
06943: mine; the sort that needs no helmet in the most brain-battering fight!
06944: 
06945: Dry heat upon my brow? Oh! time was, when as the sunrise nobly spurred
06946: me, so the sunset soothed. No more. This lovely light, it lights not
06947: me; all loveliness is anguish to me, since I can ne’er enjoy. Gifted
06948: with the high perception, I lack the low, enjoying power; damned, most
06949: subtly and most malignantly! damned in the midst of Paradise! Good
06950: night—good night! (_waving his hand, he moves from the window_.)
06951: 
06952: ’Twas not so hard a task. I thought to find one stubborn, at the least;
06953: but my one cogged circle fits into all their various wheels, and they
06954: revolve. Or, if you will, like so many ant-hills of powder, they all
06955: stand before me; and I their match. Oh, hard! that to fire others, the
06956: match itself must needs be wasting! What I’ve dared, I’ve willed; and
06957: what I’ve willed, I’ll do! They think me mad—Starbuck does; but I’m
06958: demoniac, I am madness maddened! That wild madness that’s only calm to
06959: comprehend itself! The prophecy was that I should be dismembered;
06960: and—Aye! I lost this leg. I now prophesy that I will dismember my
06961: dismemberer. Now, then, be the prophet and the fulfiller one. That’s
06962: more than ye, ye great gods, ever were. I laugh and hoot at ye, ye
06963: cricket-players, ye pugilists, ye deaf Burkes and blinded Bendigoes! I
06964: will not say as schoolboys do to bullies—Take some one of your own
06965: size; don’t pommel _me!_ No, ye’ve knocked me down, and I am up again;
06966: but _ye_ have run and hidden. Come forth from behind your cotton bags!
06967: I have no long gun to reach ye. Come, Ahab’s compliments to ye; come
06968: and see if ye can swerve me. Swerve me? ye cannot swerve me, else ye
06969: swerve yourselves! man has ye there. Swerve me? The path to my fixed
06970: purpose is laid with iron rails, whereon my soul is grooved to run.
06971: Over unsounded gorges, through the rifled hearts of mountains, under
06972: torrents’ beds, unerringly I rush! Naught’s an obstacle, naught’s an
06973: angle to the iron way!
06974: 
06975: 
06976: CHAPTER 38. Dusk.
06977: 
06978: _By the Mainmast; Starbuck leaning against it_.
06979: 
06980: My soul is more than matched; she’s overmanned; and by a madman!
06981: Insufferable sting, that sanity should ground arms on such a field! But
06982: he drilled deep down, and blasted all my reason out of me! I think I
06983: see his impious end; but feel that I must help him to it. Will I, nill
06984: I, the ineffable thing has tied me to him; tows me with a cable I have
06985: no knife to cut. Horrible old man! Who’s over him, he cries;—aye, he
06986: would be a democrat to all above; look, how he lords it over all below!
06987: Oh! I plainly see my miserable office,—to obey, rebelling; and worse
06988: yet, to hate with touch of pity! For in his eyes I read some lurid woe
06989: would shrivel me up, had I it. Yet is there hope. Time and tide flow
06990: wide. The hated whale has the round watery world to swim in, as the
06991: small gold-fish has its glassy globe. His heaven-insulting purpose, God
06992: may wedge aside. I would up heart, were it not like lead. But my whole
06993: clock’s run down; my heart the all-controlling weight, I have no key to
06994: lift again.
06995: 
06996: [_A burst of revelry from the forecastle_.]
06997: 
06998: Oh, God! to sail with such a heathen crew that have small touch of
06999: human mothers in them! Whelped somewhere by the sharkish sea. The white
07000: whale is their demigorgon. Hark! the infernal orgies! that revelry is
07001: forward! mark the unfaltering silence aft! Methinks it pictures life.
07002: Foremost through the sparkling sea shoots on the gay, embattled,
07003: bantering bow, but only to drag dark Ahab after it, where he broods
07004: within his sternward cabin, builded over the dead water of the wake,
07005: and further on, hunted by its wolfish gurglings. The long howl thrills
07006: me through! Peace! ye revellers, and set the watch! Oh, life! ’tis in
07007: an hour like this, with soul beat down and held to knowledge,—as wild,
07008: untutored things are forced to feed—Oh, life! ’tis now that I do feel
07009: the latent horror in thee! but ’tis not me! that horror’s out of me!
07010: and with the soft feeling of the human in me, yet will I try to fight
07011: ye, ye grim, phantom futures! Stand by me, hold me, bind me, O ye
07012: blessed influences!
07013: 
07014: 
07015: CHAPTER 39. First Night-Watch.
07016: 
07017: Fore-Top.
07018: 
07019: (_Stubb solus, and mending a brace_.)
07020: 
07021: Ha! ha! ha! ha! hem! clear my throat!—I’ve been thinking over it ever
07022: since, and that ha, ha’s the final consequence. Why so? Because a
07023: laugh’s the wisest, easiest answer to all that’s queer; and come what
07024: will, one comfort’s always left—that unfailing comfort is, it’s all
07025: predestinated. I heard not all his talk with Starbuck; but to my poor
07026: eye Starbuck then looked something as I the other evening felt. Be sure
07027: the old Mogul has fixed him, too. I twigged it, knew it; had had the
07028: gift, might readily have prophesied it—for when I clapped my eye upon
07029: his skull I saw it. Well, Stubb, _wise_ Stubb—that’s my title—well,
07030: Stubb, what of it, Stubb? Here’s a carcase. I know not all that may be
07031: coming, but be it what it will, I’ll go to it laughing. Such a waggish
07032: leering as lurks in all your horribles! I feel funny. Fa, la! lirra,
07033: skirra! What’s my juicy little pear at home doing now? Crying its eyes
07034: out?—Giving a party to the last arrived harpooneers, I dare say, gay as
07035: a frigate’s pennant, and so am I—fa, la! lirra, skirra! Oh—
07036: 
07037: 
07038: We’ll drink to-night with hearts as light, To love, as gay and fleeting
07039: As bubbles that swim, on the beaker’s brim, And break on the lips while
07040: meeting.
07041: 
07042: 
07043: 
07044: A brave stave that—who calls? Mr. Starbuck? Aye, aye, sir—(_Aside_)
07045: he’s my superior, he has his too, if I’m not mistaken.—Aye, aye, sir,
07046: just through with this job—coming.
07047: 
07048: 
07049: CHAPTER 40. Midnight, Forecastle.
07050: 
07051: HARPOONEERS AND SAILORS.
07052: 
07053: (_Foresail rises and discovers the watch standing, lounging, leaning,
07054: and lying in various attitudes, all singing in chorus_.)
07055: 
07056: 
07057:   Farewell and adieu to you, Spanish ladies! Farewell and adieu to you,
07058:   ladies of Spain! Our captain’s commanded.—
07059: 
07060: 
07061: 
07062: 1ST NANTUCKET SAILOR. Oh, boys, don’t be sentimental; it’s bad for the
07063: digestion! Take a tonic, follow me!
07064: 
07065: (_Sings, and all follow._)
07066: 
07067: 
07068:  Our captain stood upon the deck, A spy-glass in his hand, A viewing of
07069:  those gallant whales That blew at every strand. Oh, your tubs in your
07070:  boats, my boys, And by your braces stand, And we’ll have one of those
07071:  fine whales, Hand, boys, over hand! So, be cheery, my lads! may your
07072:  hearts never fail! While the bold harpooner is striking the whale!
07073: 
07074: 
07075: 
07076: MATE’S VOICE FROM THE QUARTER-DECK. Eight bells there, forward!
07077: 
07078: 2ND NANTUCKET SAILOR. Avast the chorus! Eight bells there! d’ye hear,
07079: bell-boy? Strike the bell eight, thou Pip! thou blackling! and let me
07080: call the watch. I’ve the sort of mouth for that—the hogshead mouth. So,
07081: so, (_thrusts his head down the scuttle_,) Star-bo-l-e-e-n-s, a-h-o-y!
07082: Eight bells there below! Tumble up!
07083: 
07084: DUTCH SAILOR. Grand snoozing to-night, maty; fat night for that. I mark
07085: this in our old Mogul’s wine; it’s quite as deadening to some as
07086: filliping to others. We sing; they sleep—aye, lie down there, like
07087: ground-tier butts. At ’em again! There, take this copper-pump, and hail
07088: ’em through it. Tell ’em to avast dreaming of their lasses. Tell ’em
07089: it’s the resurrection; they must kiss their last, and come to judgment.
07090: That’s the way—_that’s_ it; thy throat ain’t spoiled with eating
07091: Amsterdam butter.
07092: 
07093: FRENCH SAILOR. Hist, boys! let’s have a jig or two before we ride to
07094: anchor in Blanket Bay. What say ye? There comes the other watch. Stand
07095: by all legs! Pip! little Pip! hurrah with your tambourine!
07096: 
07097: PIP. (_Sulky and sleepy._) Don’t know where it is.
07098: 
07099: FRENCH SAILOR. Beat thy belly, then, and wag thy ears. Jig it, men, I
07100: say; merry’s the word; hurrah! Damn me, won’t you dance? Form, now,
07101: Indian-file, and gallop into the double-shuffle? Throw yourselves!
07102: Legs! legs!
07103: 
07104: ICELAND SAILOR. I don’t like your floor, maty; it’s too springy to my
07105: taste. I’m used to ice-floors. I’m sorry to throw cold water on the
07106: subject; but excuse me.
07107: 
07108: MALTESE SAILOR. Me too; where’s your girls? Who but a fool would take
07109: his left hand by his right, and say to himself, how d’ye do? Partners!
07110: I must have partners!
07111: 
07112: SICILIAN SAILOR. Aye; girls and a green!—then I’ll hop with ye; yea,
07113: turn grasshopper!
07114: 
07115: LONG-ISLAND SAILOR. Well, well, ye sulkies, there’s plenty more of us.
07116: Hoe corn when you may, say I. All legs go to harvest soon. Ah! here
07117: comes the music; now for it!
07118: 
07119: AZORE SAILOR. (_Ascending, and pitching the tambourine up the
07120: scuttle_.) Here you are, Pip; and there’s the windlass-bitts; up you
07121: mount! Now, boys! (_The half of them dance to the tambourine; some go
07122: below; some sleep or lie among the coils of rigging. Oaths a-plenty_.)
07123: 
07124: AZORE SAILOR. (_Dancing_) Go it, Pip! Bang it, bell-boy! Rig it, dig
07125: it, stig it, quig it, bell-boy! Make fire-flies; break the jinglers!
07126: 
07127: PIP. Jinglers, you say?—there goes another, dropped off; I pound it so.
07128: 
07129: CHINA SAILOR. Rattle thy teeth, then, and pound away; make a pagoda of
07130: thyself.
07131: 
07132: FRENCH SAILOR. Merry-mad! Hold up thy hoop, Pip, till I jump through
07133: it! Split jibs! tear yourselves!
07134: 
07135: TASHTEGO. (_Quietly smoking._) That’s a white man; he calls that fun:
07136: humph! I save my sweat.
07137: 
07138: OLD MANX SAILOR. I wonder whether those jolly lads bethink them of what
07139: they are dancing over. I’ll dance over your grave, I will—that’s the
07140: bitterest threat of your night-women, that beat head-winds round
07141: corners. O Christ! to think of the green navies and the green-skulled
07142: crews! Well, well; belike the whole world’s a ball, as you scholars
07143: have it; and so ’tis right to make one ballroom of it. Dance on, lads,
07144: you’re young; I was once.
07145: 
07146: 3D NANTUCKET SAILOR. Spell oh!—whew! this is worse than pulling after
07147: whales in a calm—give us a whiff, Tash.
07148: 
07149: (_They cease dancing, and gather in clusters. Meantime the sky
07150: darkens—the wind rises_.)
07151: 
07152: LASCAR SAILOR. By Brahma! boys, it’ll be douse sail soon. The sky-born,
07153: high-tide Ganges turned to wind! Thou showest thy black brow, Seeva!
07154: 
07155: MALTESE SAILOR. (_Reclining and shaking his cap_.) It’s the waves—the
07156: snow’s caps turn to jig it now. They’ll shake their tassels soon. Now
07157: would all the waves were women, then I’d go drown, and chassee with
07158: them evermore! There’s naught so sweet on earth—heaven may not match
07159: it!—as those swift glances of warm, wild bosoms in the dance, when the
07160: over-arboring arms hide such ripe, bursting grapes.
07161: 
07162: SICILIAN SAILOR. (_Reclining_.) Tell me not of it! Hark ye, lad—fleet
07163: interlacings of the limbs—lithe swayings—coyings—flutterings! lip!
07164: heart! hip! all graze: unceasing touch and go! not taste, observe ye,
07165: else come satiety. Eh, Pagan? (_Nudging_.)
07166: 
07167: TAHITAN SAILOR. (_Reclining on a mat_.) Hail, holy nakedness of our
07168: dancing girls!—the Heeva-Heeva! Ah! low veiled, high palmed Tahiti! I
07169: still rest me on thy mat, but the soft soil has slid! I saw thee woven
07170: in the wood, my mat! green the first day I brought ye thence; now worn
07171: and wilted quite. Ah me!—not thou nor I can bear the change! How then,
07172: if so be transplanted to yon sky? Hear I the roaring streams from
07173: Pirohitee’s peak of spears, when they leap down the crags and drown the
07174: villages?—The blast! the blast! Up, spine, and meet it! (_Leaps to his
07175: feet_.)
07176: 
07177: PORTUGUESE SAILOR. How the sea rolls swashing ’gainst the side! Stand
07178: by for reefing, hearties! the winds are just crossing swords, pell-mell
07179: they’ll go lunging presently.
07180: 
07181: DANISH SAILOR. Crack, crack, old ship! so long as thou crackest, thou
07182: holdest! Well done! The mate there holds ye to it stiffly. He’s no more
07183: afraid than the isle fort at Cattegat, put there to fight the Baltic
07184: with storm-lashed guns, on which the sea-salt cakes!
07185: 
07186: 4TH NANTUCKET SAILOR. He has his orders, mind ye that. I heard old Ahab
07187: tell him he must always kill a squall, something as they burst a
07188: waterspout with a pistol—fire your ship right into it!
07189: 
07190: ENGLISH SAILOR. Blood! but that old man’s a grand old cove! We are the
07191: lads to hunt him up his whale!
07192: 
07193: ALL. Aye! aye!
07194: 
07195: OLD MANX SAILOR. How the three pines shake! Pines are the hardest sort
07196: of tree to live when shifted to any other soil, and here there’s none
07197: but the crew’s cursed clay. Steady, helmsman! steady. This is the sort
07198: of weather when brave hearts snap ashore, and keeled hulls split at
07199: sea. Our captain has his birthmark; look yonder, boys, there’s another
07200: in the sky—lurid-like, ye see, all else pitch black.
07201: 
07202: DAGGOO. What of that? Who’s afraid of black’s afraid of me! I’m
07203: quarried out of it!
07204: 
07205: SPANISH SAILOR. (_Aside_.) He wants to bully, ah!—the old grudge makes
07206: me touchy (_Advancing_.) Aye, harpooneer, thy race is the undeniable
07207: dark side of mankind—devilish dark at that. No offence.
07208: 
07209: DAGGOO (_grimly_). None.
07210: 
07211: ST. JAGO’S SAILOR. That Spaniard’s mad or drunk. But that can’t be, or
07212: else in his one case our old Mogul’s fire-waters are somewhat long in
07213: working.
07214: 
07215: 5TH NANTUCKET SAILOR. What’s that I saw—lightning? Yes.
07216: 
07217: SPANISH SAILOR. No; Daggoo showing his teeth.
07218: 
07219: DAGGOO (_springing_). Swallow thine, mannikin! White skin, white liver!
07220: 
07221: SPANISH SAILOR (_meeting him_). Knife thee heartily! big frame, small
07222: spirit!
07223: 
07224: ALL. A row! a row! a row!
07225: 
07226: TASHTEGO (_with a whiff_). A row a’low, and a row aloft—Gods and
07227: men—both brawlers! Humph!
07228: 
07229: BELFAST SAILOR. A row! arrah a row! The Virgin be blessed, a row!
07230: Plunge in with ye!
07231: 
07232: ENGLISH SAILOR. Fair play! Snatch the Spaniard’s knife! A ring, a ring!
07233: 
07234: OLD MANX SAILOR. Ready formed. There! the ringed horizon. In that ring
07235: Cain struck Abel. Sweet work, right work! No? Why then, God, mad’st
07236: thou the ring?
07237: 
07238: MATE’S VOICE FROM THE QUARTER-DECK. Hands by the halyards! in
07239: top-gallant sails! Stand by to reef topsails!
07240: 
07241: ALL. The squall! the squall! jump, my jollies! (_They scatter_.)
07242: 
07243: PIP (_shrinking under the windlass_). Jollies? Lord help such jollies!
07244: Crish, crash! there goes the jib-stay! Blang-whang! God! Duck lower,
07245: Pip, here comes the royal yard! It’s worse than being in the whirled
07246: woods, the last day of the year! Who’d go climbing after chestnuts now?
07247: But there they go, all cursing, and here I don’t. Fine prospects to
07248: ’em; they’re on the road to heaven. Hold on hard! Jimmini, what a
07249: squall! But those chaps there are worse yet—they are your white
07250: squalls, they. White squalls? white whale, shirr! shirr! Here have I
07251: heard all their chat just now, and the white whale—shirr! shirr!—but
07252: spoken of once! and only this evening—it makes me jingle all over like
07253: my tambourine—that anaconda of an old man swore ’em in to hunt him! Oh,
07254: thou big white God aloft there somewhere in yon darkness, have mercy on
07255: this small black boy down here; preserve him from all men that have no
07256: bowels to feel fear!
07257: 
07258: 
07259: CHAPTER 41. Moby Dick.
07260: 
07261: I, Ishmael, was one of that crew; my shouts had gone up with the rest;
07262: my oath had been welded with theirs; and stronger I shouted, and more
07263: did I hammer and clinch my oath, because of the dread in my soul. A
07264: wild, mystical, sympathetical feeling was in me; Ahab’s quenchless feud
07265: seemed mine. With greedy ears I learned the history of that murderous
07266: monster against whom I and all the others had taken our oaths of
07267: violence and revenge.
07268: 
07269: For some time past, though at intervals only, the unaccompanied,
07270: secluded White Whale had haunted those uncivilized seas mostly
07271: frequented by the Sperm Whale fishermen. But not all of them knew of
07272: his existence; only a few of them, comparatively, had knowingly seen
07273: him; while the number who as yet had actually and knowingly given
07274: battle to him, was small indeed. For, owing to the large number of
07275: whale-cruisers; the disorderly way they were sprinkled over the entire
07276: watery circumference, many of them adventurously pushing their quest
07277: along solitary latitudes, so as seldom or never for a whole twelvemonth
07278: or more on a stretch, to encounter a single news-telling sail of any
07279: sort; the inordinate length of each separate voyage; the irregularity
07280: of the times of sailing from home; all these, with other circumstances,
07281: direct and indirect, long obstructed the spread through the whole
07282: world-wide whaling-fleet of the special individualizing tidings
07283: concerning Moby Dick. It was hardly to be doubted, that several vessels
07284: reported to have encountered, at such or such a time, or on such or
07285: such a meridian, a Sperm Whale of uncommon magnitude and malignity,
07286: which whale, after doing great mischief to his assailants, had
07287: completely escaped them; to some minds it was not an unfair
07288: presumption, I say, that the whale in question must have been no other
07289: than Moby Dick. Yet as of late the Sperm Whale fishery had been marked
07290: by various and not unfrequent instances of great ferocity, cunning, and
07291: malice in the monster attacked; therefore it was, that those who by
07292: accident ignorantly gave battle to Moby Dick; such hunters, perhaps,
07293: for the most part, were content to ascribe the peculiar terror he bred,
07294: more, as it were, to the perils of the Sperm Whale fishery at large,
07295: than to the individual cause. In that way, mostly, the disastrous
07296: encounter between Ahab and the whale had hitherto been popularly
07297: regarded.
07298: 
07299: And as for those who, previously hearing of the White Whale, by chance
07300: caught sight of him; in the beginning of the thing they had every one
07301: of them, almost, as boldly and fearlessly lowered for him, as for any
07302: other whale of that species. But at length, such calamities did ensue
07303: in these assaults—not restricted to sprained wrists and ankles, broken
07304: limbs, or devouring amputations—but fatal to the last degree of
07305: fatality; those repeated disastrous repulses, all accumulating and
07306: piling their terrors upon Moby Dick; those things had gone far to shake
07307: the fortitude of many brave hunters, to whom the story of the White
07308: Whale had eventually come.
07309: 
07310: Nor did wild rumors of all sorts fail to exaggerate, and still the more
07311: horrify the true histories of these deadly encounters. For not only do
07312: fabulous rumors naturally grow out of the very body of all surprising
07313: terrible events,—as the smitten tree gives birth to its fungi; but, in
07314: maritime life, far more than in that of terra firma, wild rumors
07315: abound, wherever there is any adequate reality for them to cling to.
07316: And as the sea surpasses the land in this matter, so the whale fishery
07317: surpasses every other sort of maritime life, in the wonderfulness and
07318: fearfulness of the rumors which sometimes circulate there. For not only
07319: are whalemen as a body unexempt from that ignorance and
07320: superstitiousness hereditary to all sailors; but of all sailors, they
07321: are by all odds the most directly brought into contact with whatever is
07322: appallingly astonishing in the sea; face to face they not only eye its
07323: greatest marvels, but, hand to jaw, give battle to them. Alone, in such
07324: remotest waters, that though you sailed a thousand miles, and passed a
07325: thousand shores, you would not come to any chiseled hearth-stone, or
07326: aught hospitable beneath that part of the sun; in such latitudes and
07327: longitudes, pursuing too such a calling as he does, the whaleman is
07328: wrapped by influences all tending to make his fancy pregnant with many
07329: a mighty birth.
07330: 
07331: No wonder, then, that ever gathering volume from the mere transit over
07332: the widest watery spaces, the outblown rumors of the White Whale did in
07333: the end incorporate with themselves all manner of morbid hints, and
07334: half-formed fœtal suggestions of supernatural agencies, which
07335: eventually invested Moby Dick with new terrors unborrowed from anything
07336: that visibly appears. So that in many cases such a panic did he finally
07337: strike, that few who by those rumors, at least, had heard of the White
07338: Whale, few of those hunters were willing to encounter the perils of his
07339: jaw.
07340: 
07341: But there were still other and more vital practical influences at work.
07342: Not even at the present day has the original prestige of the Sperm
07343: Whale, as fearfully distinguished from all other species of the
07344: leviathan, died out of the minds of the whalemen as a body. There are
07345: those this day among them, who, though intelligent and courageous
07346: enough in offering battle to the Greenland or Right whale, would
07347: perhaps—either from professional inexperience, or incompetency, or
07348: timidity, decline a contest with the Sperm Whale; at any rate, there
07349: are plenty of whalemen, especially among those whaling nations not
07350: sailing under the American flag, who have never hostilely encountered
07351: the Sperm Whale, but whose sole knowledge of the leviathan is
07352: restricted to the ignoble monster primitively pursued in the North;
07353: seated on their hatches, these men will hearken with a childish
07354: fireside interest and awe, to the wild, strange tales of Southern
07355: whaling. Nor is the pre-eminent tremendousness of the great Sperm Whale
07356: anywhere more feelingly comprehended, than on board of those prows
07357: which stem him.
07358: 
07359: And as if the now tested reality of his might had in former legendary
07360: times thrown its shadow before it; we find some book
07361: naturalists—Olassen and Povelson—declaring the Sperm Whale not only to
07362: be a consternation to every other creature in the sea, but also to be
07363: so incredibly ferocious as continually to be athirst for human blood.
07364: Nor even down to so late a time as Cuvier’s, were these or almost
07365: similar impressions effaced. For in his Natural History, the Baron
07366: himself affirms that at sight of the Sperm Whale, all fish (sharks
07367: included) are “struck with the most lively terrors,” and “often in the
07368: precipitancy of their flight dash themselves against the rocks with
07369: such violence as to cause instantaneous death.” And however the general
07370: experiences in the fishery may amend such reports as these; yet in
07371: their full terribleness, even to the bloodthirsty item of Povelson, the
07372: superstitious belief in them is, in some vicissitudes of their
07373: vocation, revived in the minds of the hunters.
07374: 
07375: So that overawed by the rumors and portents concerning him, not a few
07376: of the fishermen recalled, in reference to Moby Dick, the earlier days
07377: of the Sperm Whale fishery, when it was oftentimes hard to induce long
07378: practised Right whalemen to embark in the perils of this new and daring
07379: warfare; such men protesting that although other leviathans might be
07380: hopefully pursued, yet to chase and point lance at such an apparition
07381: as the Sperm Whale was not for mortal man. That to attempt it, would be
07382: inevitably to be torn into a quick eternity. On this head, there are
07383: some remarkable documents that may be consulted.
07384: 
07385: Nevertheless, some there were, who even in the face of these things
07386: were ready to give chase to Moby Dick; and a still greater number who,
07387: chancing only to hear of him distantly and vaguely, without the
07388: specific details of any certain calamity, and without superstitious
07389: accompaniments, were sufficiently hardy not to flee from the battle if
07390: offered.
07391: 
07392: One of the wild suggestions referred to, as at last coming to be linked
07393: with the White Whale in the minds of the superstitiously inclined, was
07394: the unearthly conceit that Moby Dick was ubiquitous; that he had
07395: actually been encountered in opposite latitudes at one and the same
07396: instant of time.
07397: 
07398: Nor, credulous as such minds must have been, was this conceit
07399: altogether without some faint show of superstitious probability. For as
07400: the secrets of the currents in the seas have never yet been divulged,
07401: even to the most erudite research; so the hidden ways of the Sperm
07402: Whale when beneath the surface remain, in great part, unaccountable to
07403: his pursuers; and from time to time have originated the most curious
07404: and contradictory speculations regarding them, especially concerning
07405: the mystic modes whereby, after sounding to a great depth, he
07406: transports himself with such vast swiftness to the most widely distant
07407: points.
07408: 
07409: It is a thing well known to both American and English whale-ships, and
07410: as well a thing placed upon authoritative record years ago by Scoresby,
07411: that some whales have been captured far north in the Pacific, in whose
07412: bodies have been found the barbs of harpoons darted in the Greenland
07413: seas. Nor is it to be gainsaid, that in some of these instances it has
07414: been declared that the interval of time between the two assaults could
07415: not have exceeded very many days. Hence, by inference, it has been
07416: believed by some whalemen, that the Nor’ West Passage, so long a
07417: problem to man, was never a problem to the whale. So that here, in the
07418: real living experience of living men, the prodigies related in old
07419: times of the inland Strello mountain in Portugal (near whose top there
07420: was said to be a lake in which the wrecks of ships floated up to the
07421: surface); and that still more wonderful story of the Arethusa fountain
07422: near Syracuse (whose waters were believed to have come from the Holy
07423: Land by an underground passage); these fabulous narrations are almost
07424: fully equalled by the realities of the whalemen.
07425: 
07426: Forced into familiarity, then, with such prodigies as these; and
07427: knowing that after repeated, intrepid assaults, the White Whale had
07428: escaped alive; it cannot be much matter of surprise that some whalemen
07429: should go still further in their superstitions; declaring Moby Dick not
07430: only ubiquitous, but immortal (for immortality is but ubiquity in
07431: time); that though groves of spears should be planted in his flanks, he
07432: would still swim away unharmed; or if indeed he should ever be made to
07433: spout thick blood, such a sight would be but a ghastly deception; for
07434: again in unensanguined billows hundreds of leagues away, his unsullied
07435: jet would once more be seen.
07436: 
07437: But even stripped of these supernatural surmisings, there was enough in
07438: the earthly make and incontestable character of the monster to strike
07439: the imagination with unwonted power. For, it was not so much his
07440: uncommon bulk that so much distinguished him from other sperm whales,
07441: but, as was elsewhere thrown out—a peculiar snow-white wrinkled
07442: forehead, and a high, pyramidical white hump. These were his prominent
07443: features; the tokens whereby, even in the limitless, uncharted seas, he
07444: revealed his identity, at a long distance, to those who knew him.
07445: 
07446: The rest of his body was so streaked, and spotted, and marbled with the
07447: same shrouded hue, that, in the end, he had gained his distinctive
07448: appellation of the White Whale; a name, indeed, literally justified by
07449: his vivid aspect, when seen gliding at high noon through a dark blue
07450: sea, leaving a milky-way wake of creamy foam, all spangled with golden
07451: gleamings.
07452: 
07453: Nor was it his unwonted magnitude, nor his remarkable hue, nor yet his
07454: deformed lower jaw, that so much invested the whale with natural
07455: terror, as that unexampled, intelligent malignity which, according to
07456: specific accounts, he had over and over again evinced in his assaults.
07457: More than all, his treacherous retreats struck more of dismay than
07458: perhaps aught else. For, when swimming before his exulting pursuers,
07459: with every apparent symptom of alarm, he had several times been known
07460: to turn round suddenly, and, bearing down upon them, either stave their
07461: boats to splinters, or drive them back in consternation to their ship.
07462: 
07463: Already several fatalities had attended his chase. But though similar
07464: disasters, however little bruited ashore, were by no means unusual in
07465: the fishery; yet, in most instances, such seemed the White Whale’s
07466: infernal aforethought of ferocity, that every dismembering or death
07467: that he caused, was not wholly regarded as having been inflicted by an
07468: unintelligent agent.
07469: 
07470: Judge, then, to what pitches of inflamed, distracted fury the minds of
07471: his more desperate hunters were impelled, when amid the chips of chewed
07472: boats, and the sinking limbs of torn comrades, they swam out of the
07473: white curds of the whale’s direful wrath into the serene, exasperating
07474: sunlight, that smiled on, as if at a birth or a bridal.
07475: 
07476: His three boats stove around him, and oars and men both whirling in the
07477: eddies; one captain, seizing the line-knife from his broken prow, had
07478: dashed at the whale, as an Arkansas duellist at his foe, blindly
07479: seeking with a six inch blade to reach the fathom-deep life of the
07480: whale. That captain was Ahab. And then it was, that suddenly sweeping
07481: his sickle-shaped lower jaw beneath him, Moby Dick had reaped away
07482: Ahab’s leg, as a mower a blade of grass in the field. No turbaned Turk,
07483: no hired Venetian or Malay, could have smote him with more seeming
07484: malice. Small reason was there to doubt, then, that ever since that
07485: almost fatal encounter, Ahab had cherished a wild vindictiveness
07486: against the whale, all the more fell for that in his frantic morbidness
07487: he at last came to identify with him, not only all his bodily woes, but
07488: all his intellectual and spiritual exasperations. The White Whale swam
07489: before him as the monomaniac incarnation of all those malicious
07490: agencies which some deep men feel eating in them, till they are left
07491: living on with half a heart and half a lung. That intangible malignity
07492: which has been from the beginning; to whose dominion even the modern
07493: Christians ascribe one-half of the worlds; which the ancient Ophites of
07494: the east reverenced in their statue devil;—Ahab did not fall down and
07495: worship it like them; but deliriously transferring its idea to the
07496: abhorred white whale, he pitted himself, all mutilated, against it. All
07497: that most maddens and torments; all that stirs up the lees of things;
07498: all truth with malice in it; all that cracks the sinews and cakes the
07499: brain; all the subtle demonisms of life and thought; all evil, to crazy
07500: Ahab, were visibly personified, and made practically assailable in Moby
07501: Dick. He piled upon the whale’s white hump the sum of all the general
07502: rage and hate felt by his whole race from Adam down; and then, as if
07503: his chest had been a mortar, he burst his hot heart’s shell upon it.
07504: 
07505: It is not probable that this monomania in him took its instant rise at
07506: the precise time of his bodily dismemberment. Then, in darting at the
07507: monster, knife in hand, he had but given loose to a sudden, passionate,
07508: corporal animosity; and when he received the stroke that tore him, he
07509: probably but felt the agonizing bodily laceration, but nothing more.
07510: Yet, when by this collision forced to turn towards home, and for long
07511: months of days and weeks, Ahab and anguish lay stretched together in
07512: one hammock, rounding in mid winter that dreary, howling Patagonian
07513: Cape; then it was, that his torn body and gashed soul bled into one
07514: another; and so interfusing, made him mad. That it was only then, on
07515: the homeward voyage, after the encounter, that the final monomania
07516: seized him, seems all but certain from the fact that, at intervals
07517: during the passage, he was a raving lunatic; and, though unlimbed of a
07518: leg, yet such vital strength yet lurked in his Egyptian chest, and was
07519: moreover intensified by his delirium, that his mates were forced to
07520: lace him fast, even there, as he sailed, raving in his hammock. In a
07521: strait-jacket, he swung to the mad rockings of the gales. And, when
07522: running into more sufferable latitudes, the ship, with mild stun’sails
07523: spread, floated across the tranquil tropics, and, to all appearances,
07524: the old man’s delirium seemed left behind him with the Cape Horn
07525: swells, and he came forth from his dark den into the blessed light and
07526: air; even then, when he bore that firm, collected front, however pale,
07527: and issued his calm orders once again; and his mates thanked God the
07528: direful madness was now gone; even then, Ahab, in his hidden self,
07529: raved on. Human madness is oftentimes a cunning and most feline thing.
07530: When you think it fled, it may have but become transfigured into some
07531: still subtler form. Ahab’s full lunacy subsided not, but deepeningly
07532: contracted; like the unabated Hudson, when that noble Northman flows
07533: narrowly, but unfathomably through the Highland gorge. But, as in his
07534: narrow-flowing monomania, not one jot of Ahab’s broad madness had been
07535: left behind; so in that broad madness, not one jot of his great natural
07536: intellect had perished. That before living agent, now became the living
07537: instrument. If such a furious trope may stand, his special lunacy
07538: stormed his general sanity, and carried it, and turned all its
07539: concentred cannon upon its own mad mark; so that far from having lost
07540: his strength, Ahab, to that one end, did now possess a thousand fold
07541: more potency than ever he had sanely brought to bear upon any one
07542: reasonable object.
07543: 
07544: This is much; yet Ahab’s larger, darker, deeper part remains unhinted.
07545: But vain to popularize profundities, and all truth is profound. Winding
07546: far down from within the very heart of this spiked Hotel de Cluny where
07547: we here stand—however grand and wonderful, now quit it;—and take your
07548: way, ye nobler, sadder souls, to those vast Roman halls of Thermes;
07549: where far beneath the fantastic towers of man’s upper earth, his root
07550: of grandeur, his whole awful essence sits in bearded state; an antique
07551: buried beneath antiquities, and throned on torsoes! So with a broken
07552: throne, the great gods mock that captive king; so like a Caryatid, he
07553: patient sits, upholding on his frozen brow the piled entablatures of
07554: ages. Wind ye down there, ye prouder, sadder souls! question that
07555: proud, sad king! A family likeness! aye, he did beget ye, ye young
07556: exiled royalties; and from your grim sire only will the old
07557: State-secret come.
07558: 
07559: Now, in his heart, Ahab had some glimpse of this, namely: all my means
07560: are sane, my motive and my object mad. Yet without power to kill, or
07561: change, or shun the fact; he likewise knew that to mankind he did long
07562: dissemble; in some sort, did still. But that thing of his dissembling
07563: was only subject to his perceptibility, not to his will determinate.
07564: Nevertheless, so well did he succeed in that dissembling, that when
07565: with ivory leg he stepped ashore at last, no Nantucketer thought him
07566: otherwise than but naturally grieved, and that to the quick, with the
07567: terrible casualty which had overtaken him.
07568: 
07569: The report of his undeniable delirium at sea was likewise popularly
07570: ascribed to a kindred cause. And so too, all the added moodiness which
07571: always afterwards, to the very day of sailing in the Pequod on the
07572: present voyage, sat brooding on his brow. Nor is it so very unlikely,
07573: that far from distrusting his fitness for another whaling voyage, on
07574: account of such dark symptoms, the calculating people of that prudent
07575: isle were inclined to harbor the conceit, that for those very reasons
07576: he was all the better qualified and set on edge, for a pursuit so full
07577: of rage and wildness as the bloody hunt of whales. Gnawed within and
07578: scorched without, with the infixed, unrelenting fangs of some incurable
07579: idea; such an one, could he be found, would seem the very man to dart
07580: his iron and lift his lance against the most appalling of all brutes.
07581: Or, if for any reason thought to be corporeally incapacitated for that,
07582: yet such an one would seem superlatively competent to cheer and howl on
07583: his underlings to the attack. But be all this as it may, certain it is,
07584: that with the mad secret of his unabated rage bolted up and keyed in
07585: him, Ahab had purposely sailed upon the present voyage with the one
07586: only and all-engrossing object of hunting the White Whale. Had any one
07587: of his old acquaintances on shore but half dreamed of what was lurking
07588: in him then, how soon would their aghast and righteous souls have
07589: wrenched the ship from such a fiendish man! They were bent on
07590: profitable cruises, the profit to be counted down in dollars from the
07591: mint. He was intent on an audacious, immitigable, and supernatural
07592: revenge.
07593: 
07594: Here, then, was this grey-headed, ungodly old man, chasing with curses
07595: a Job’s whale round the world, at the head of a crew, too, chiefly made
07596: up of mongrel renegades, and castaways, and cannibals—morally enfeebled
07597: also, by the incompetence of mere unaided virtue or right-mindedness in
07598: Starbuck, the invulnerable jollity of indifference and recklessness in
07599: Stubb, and the pervading mediocrity in Flask. Such a crew, so
07600: officered, seemed specially picked and packed by some infernal fatality
07601: to help him to his monomaniac revenge. How it was that they so
07602: aboundingly responded to the old man’s ire—by what evil magic their
07603: souls were possessed, that at times his hate seemed almost theirs; the
07604: White Whale as much their insufferable foe as his; how all this came to
07605: be—what the White Whale was to them, or how to their unconscious
07606: understandings, also, in some dim, unsuspected way, he might have
07607: seemed the gliding great demon of the seas of life,—all this to
07608: explain, would be to dive deeper than Ishmael can go. The subterranean
07609: miner that works in us all, how can one tell whither leads his shaft by
07610: the ever shifting, muffled sound of his pick? Who does not feel the
07611: irresistible arm drag? What skiff in tow of a seventy-four can stand
07612: still? For one, I gave myself up to the abandonment of the time and the
07613: place; but while yet all a-rush to encounter the whale, could see
07614: naught in that brute but the deadliest ill.
07615: 
07616: 
07617: CHAPTER 42. The Whiteness of the Whale.
07618: 
07619: What the white whale was to Ahab, has been hinted; what, at times, he
07620: was to me, as yet remains unsaid.
07621: 
07622: Aside from those more obvious considerations touching Moby Dick, which
07623: could not but occasionally awaken in any man’s soul some alarm, there
07624: was another thought, or rather vague, nameless horror concerning him,
07625: which at times by its intensity completely overpowered all the rest;
07626: and yet so mystical and well nigh ineffable was it, that I almost
07627: despair of putting it in a comprehensible form. It was the whiteness of
07628: the whale that above all things appalled me. But how can I hope to
07629: explain myself here; and yet, in some dim, random way, explain myself I
07630: must, else all these chapters might be naught.
07631: 
07632: Though in many natural objects, whiteness refiningly enhances beauty,
07633: as if imparting some special virtue of its own, as in marbles,
07634: japonicas, and pearls; and though various nations have in some way
07635: recognised a certain royal preeminence in this hue; even the barbaric,
07636: grand old kings of Pegu placing the title “Lord of the White Elephants”
07637: above all their other magniloquent ascriptions of dominion; and the
07638: modern kings of Siam unfurling the same snow-white quadruped in the
07639: royal standard; and the Hanoverian flag bearing the one figure of a
07640: snow-white charger; and the great Austrian Empire, Cæsarian, heir to
07641: overlording Rome, having for the imperial colour the same imperial hue;
07642: and though this pre-eminence in it applies to the human race itself,
07643: giving the white man ideal mastership over every dusky tribe; and
07644: though, besides, all this, whiteness has been even made significant of
07645: gladness, for among the Romans a white stone marked a joyful day; and
07646: though in other mortal sympathies and symbolizings, this same hue is
07647: made the emblem of many touching, noble things—the innocence of brides,
07648: the benignity of age; though among the Red Men of America the giving of
07649: the white belt of wampum was the deepest pledge of honor; though in
07650: many climes, whiteness typifies the majesty of Justice in the ermine of
07651: the Judge, and contributes to the daily state of kings and queens drawn
07652: by milk-white steeds; though even in the higher mysteries of the most
07653: august religions it has been made the symbol of the divine spotlessness
07654: and power; by the Persian fire worshippers, the white forked flame
07655: being held the holiest on the altar; and in the Greek mythologies,
07656: Great Jove himself being made incarnate in a snow-white bull; and
07657: though to the noble Iroquois, the midwinter sacrifice of the sacred
07658: White Dog was by far the holiest festival of their theology, that
07659: spotless, faithful creature being held the purest envoy they could send
07660: to the Great Spirit with the annual tidings of their own fidelity; and
07661: though directly from the Latin word for white, all Christian priests
07662: derive the name of one part of their sacred vesture, the alb or tunic,
07663: worn beneath the cassock; and though among the holy pomps of the Romish
07664: faith, white is specially employed in the celebration of the Passion of
07665: our Lord; though in the Vision of St. John, white robes are given to
07666: the redeemed, and the four-and-twenty elders stand clothed in white
07667: before the great white throne, and the Holy One that sitteth there
07668: white like wool; yet for all these accumulated associations, with
07669: whatever is sweet, and honorable, and sublime, there yet lurks an
07670: elusive something in the innermost idea of this hue, which strikes more
07671: of panic to the soul than that redness which affrights in blood.
07672: 
07673: This elusive quality it is, which causes the thought of whiteness, when
07674: divorced from more kindly associations, and coupled with any object
07675: terrible in itself, to heighten that terror to the furthest bounds.
07676: Witness the white bear of the poles, and the white shark of the
07677: tropics; what but their smooth, flaky whiteness makes them the
07678: transcendent horrors they are? That ghastly whiteness it is which
07679: imparts such an abhorrent mildness, even more loathsome than terrific,
07680: to the dumb gloating of their aspect. So that not the fierce-fanged
07681: tiger in his heraldic coat can so stagger courage as the white-shrouded
07682: bear or shark.*
07683: 
07684: *With reference to the Polar bear, it may possibly be urged by him who
07685: would fain go still deeper into this matter, that it is not the
07686: whiteness, separately regarded, which heightens the intolerable
07687: hideousness of that brute; for, analysed, that heightened hideousness,
07688: it might be said, only rises from the circumstance, that the
07689: irresponsible ferociousness of the creature stands invested in the
07690: fleece of celestial innocence and love; and hence, by bringing together
07691: two such opposite emotions in our minds, the Polar bear frightens us
07692: with so unnatural a contrast. But even assuming all this to be true;
07693: yet, were it not for the whiteness, you would not have that intensified
07694: terror.
07695: 
07696: As for the white shark, the white gliding ghostliness of repose in that
07697: creature, when beheld in his ordinary moods, strangely tallies with the
07698: same quality in the Polar quadruped. This peculiarity is most vividly
07699: hit by the French in the name they bestow upon that fish. The Romish
07700: mass for the dead begins with “Requiem eternam” (eternal rest), whence
07701: _Requiem_ denominating the mass itself, and any other funeral music.
07702: Now, in allusion to the white, silent stillness of death in this shark,
07703: and the mild deadliness of his habits, the French call him _Requin_.
07704: 
07705: Bethink thee of the albatross, whence come those clouds of spiritual
07706: wonderment and pale dread, in which that white phantom sails in all
07707: imaginations? Not Coleridge first threw that spell; but God’s great,
07708: unflattering laureate, Nature.*
07709: 
07710: *I remember the first albatross I ever saw. It was during a prolonged
07711: gale, in waters hard upon the Antarctic seas. From my forenoon watch
07712: below, I ascended to the overclouded deck; and there, dashed upon the
07713: main hatches, I saw a regal, feathery thing of unspotted whiteness, and
07714: with a hooked, Roman bill sublime. At intervals, it arched forth its
07715: vast archangel wings, as if to embrace some holy ark. Wondrous
07716: flutterings and throbbings shook it. Though bodily unharmed, it uttered
07717: cries, as some king’s ghost in supernatural distress. Through its
07718: inexpressible, strange eyes, methought I peeped to secrets which took
07719: hold of God. As Abraham before the angels, I bowed myself; the white
07720: thing was so white, its wings so wide, and in those for ever exiled
07721: waters, I had lost the miserable warping memories of traditions and of
07722: towns. Long I gazed at that prodigy of plumage. I cannot tell, can only
07723: hint, the things that darted through me then. But at last I awoke; and
07724: turning, asked a sailor what bird was this. A goney, he replied. Goney!
07725: never had heard that name before; is it conceivable that this glorious
07726: thing is utterly unknown to men ashore! never! But some time after, I
07727: learned that goney was some seaman’s name for albatross. So that by no
07728: possibility could Coleridge’s wild Rhyme have had aught to do with
07729: those mystical impressions which were mine, when I saw that bird upon
07730: our deck. For neither had I then read the Rhyme, nor knew the bird to
07731: be an albatross. Yet, in saying this, I do but indirectly burnish a
07732: little brighter the noble merit of the poem and the poet.
07733: 
07734: I assert, then, that in the wondrous bodily whiteness of the bird
07735: chiefly lurks the secret of the spell; a truth the more evinced in
07736: this, that by a solecism of terms there are birds called grey
07737: albatrosses; and these I have frequently seen, but never with such
07738: emotions as when I beheld the Antarctic fowl.
07739: 
07740: But how had the mystic thing been caught? Whisper it not, and I will
07741: tell; with a treacherous hook and line, as the fowl floated on the sea.
07742: At last the Captain made a postman of it; tying a lettered, leathern
07743: tally round its neck, with the ship’s time and place; and then letting
07744: it escape. But I doubt not, that leathern tally, meant for man, was
07745: taken off in Heaven, when the white fowl flew to join the wing-folding,
07746: the invoking, and adoring cherubim!
07747: 
07748: Most famous in our Western annals and Indian traditions is that of the
07749: White Steed of the Prairies; a magnificent milk-white charger,
07750: large-eyed, small-headed, bluff-chested, and with the dignity of a
07751: thousand monarchs in his lofty, overscorning carriage. He was the
07752: elected Xerxes of vast herds of wild horses, whose pastures in those
07753: days were only fenced by the Rocky Mountains and the Alleghanies. At
07754: their flaming head he westward trooped it like that chosen star which
07755: every evening leads on the hosts of light. The flashing cascade of his
07756: mane, the curving comet of his tail, invested him with housings more
07757: resplendent than gold and silver-beaters could have furnished him. A
07758: most imperial and archangelical apparition of that unfallen, western
07759: world, which to the eyes of the old trappers and hunters revived the
07760: glories of those primeval times when Adam walked majestic as a god,
07761: bluff-browed and fearless as this mighty steed. Whether marching amid
07762: his aides and marshals in the van of countless cohorts that endlessly
07763: streamed it over the plains, like an Ohio; or whether with his
07764: circumambient subjects browsing all around at the horizon, the White
07765: Steed gallopingly reviewed them with warm nostrils reddening through
07766: his cool milkiness; in whatever aspect he presented himself, always to
07767: the bravest Indians he was the object of trembling reverence and awe.
07768: Nor can it be questioned from what stands on legendary record of this
07769: noble horse, that it was his spiritual whiteness chiefly, which so
07770: clothed him with divineness; and that this divineness had that in it
07771: which, though commanding worship, at the same time enforced a certain
07772: nameless terror.
07773: 
07774: But there are other instances where this whiteness loses all that
07775: accessory and strange glory which invests it in the White Steed and
07776: Albatross.
07777: 
07778: What is it that in the Albino man so peculiarly repels and often shocks
07779: the eye, as that sometimes he is loathed by his own kith and kin! It is
07780: that whiteness which invests him, a thing expressed by the name he
07781: bears. The Albino is as well made as other men—has no substantive
07782: deformity—and yet this mere aspect of all-pervading whiteness makes him
07783: more strangely hideous than the ugliest abortion. Why should this be
07784: so?
07785: 
07786: Nor, in quite other aspects, does Nature in her least palpable but not
07787: the less malicious agencies, fail to enlist among her forces this
07788: crowning attribute of the terrible. From its snowy aspect, the
07789: gauntleted ghost of the Southern Seas has been denominated the White
07790: Squall. Nor, in some historic instances, has the art of human malice
07791: omitted so potent an auxiliary. How wildly it heightens the effect of
07792: that passage in Froissart, when, masked in the snowy symbol of their
07793: faction, the desperate White Hoods of Ghent murder their bailiff in the
07794: market-place!
07795: 
07796: Nor, in some things, does the common, hereditary experience of all
07797: mankind fail to bear witness to the supernaturalism of this hue. It
07798: cannot well be doubted, that the one visible quality in the aspect of
07799: the dead which most appals the gazer, is the marble pallor lingering
07800: there; as if indeed that pallor were as much like the badge of
07801: consternation in the other world, as of mortal trepidation here. And
07802: from that pallor of the dead, we borrow the expressive hue of the
07803: shroud in which we wrap them. Nor even in our superstitions do we fail
07804: to throw the same snowy mantle round our phantoms; all ghosts rising in
07805: a milk-white fog—Yea, while these terrors seize us, let us add, that
07806: even the king of terrors, when personified by the evangelist, rides on
07807: his pallid horse.
07808: 
07809: Therefore, in his other moods, symbolize whatever grand or gracious
07810: thing he will by whiteness, no man can deny that in its profoundest
07811: idealized significance it calls up a peculiar apparition to the soul.
07812: 
07813: But though without dissent this point be fixed, how is mortal man to
07814: account for it? To analyse it, would seem impossible. Can we, then, by
07815: the citation of some of those instances wherein this thing of
07816: whiteness—though for the time either wholly or in great part stripped
07817: of all direct associations calculated to impart to it aught fearful,
07818: but nevertheless, is found to exert over us the same sorcery, however
07819: modified;—can we thus hope to light upon some chance clue to conduct us
07820: to the hidden cause we seek?
07821: 
07822: Let us try. But in a matter like this, subtlety appeals to subtlety,
07823: and without imagination no man can follow another into these halls. And
07824: though, doubtless, some at least of the imaginative impressions about
07825: to be presented may have been shared by most men, yet few perhaps were
07826: entirely conscious of them at the time, and therefore may not be able
07827: to recall them now.
07828: 
07829: Why to the man of untutored ideality, who happens to be but loosely
07830: acquainted with the peculiar character of the day, does the bare
07831: mention of Whitsuntide marshal in the fancy such long, dreary,
07832: speechless processions of slow-pacing pilgrims, down-cast and hooded
07833: with new-fallen snow? Or, to the unread, unsophisticated Protestant of
07834: the Middle American States, why does the passing mention of a White
07835: Friar or a White Nun, evoke such an eyeless statue in the soul?
07836: 
07837: Or what is there apart from the traditions of dungeoned warriors and
07838: kings (which will not wholly account for it) that makes the White Tower
07839: of London tell so much more strongly on the imagination of an
07840: untravelled American, than those other storied structures, its
07841: neighbors—the Byward Tower, or even the Bloody? And those sublimer
07842: towers, the White Mountains of New Hampshire, whence, in peculiar
07843: moods, comes that gigantic ghostliness over the soul at the bare
07844: mention of that name, while the thought of Virginia’s Blue Ridge is
07845: full of a soft, dewy, distant dreaminess? Or why, irrespective of all
07846: latitudes and longitudes, does the name of the White Sea exert such a
07847: spectralness over the fancy, while that of the Yellow Sea lulls us with
07848: mortal thoughts of long lacquered mild afternoons on the waves,
07849: followed by the gaudiest and yet sleepiest of sunsets? Or, to choose a
07850: wholly unsubstantial instance, purely addressed to the fancy, why, in
07851: reading the old fairy tales of Central Europe, does “the tall pale man”
07852: of the Hartz forests, whose changeless pallor unrustlingly glides
07853: through the green of the groves—why is this phantom more terrible than
07854: all the whooping imps of the Blocksburg?
07855: 
07856: Nor is it, altogether, the remembrance of her cathedral-toppling
07857: earthquakes; nor the stampedoes of her frantic seas; nor the
07858: tearlessness of arid skies that never rain; nor the sight of her wide
07859: field of leaning spires, wrenched cope-stones, and crosses all adroop
07860: (like canted yards of anchored fleets); and her suburban avenues of
07861: house-walls lying over upon each other, as a tossed pack of cards;—it
07862: is not these things alone which make tearless Lima, the strangest,
07863: saddest city thou can’st see. For Lima has taken the white veil; and
07864: there is a higher horror in this whiteness of her woe. Old as Pizarro,
07865: this whiteness keeps her ruins for ever new; admits not the cheerful
07866: greenness of complete decay; spreads over her broken ramparts the rigid
07867: pallor of an apoplexy that fixes its own distortions.
07868: 
07869: I know that, to the common apprehension, this phenomenon of whiteness
07870: is not confessed to be the prime agent in exaggerating the terror of
07871: objects otherwise terrible; nor to the unimaginative mind is there
07872: aught of terror in those appearances whose awfulness to another mind
07873: almost solely consists in this one phenomenon, especially when
07874: exhibited under any form at all approaching to muteness or
07875: universality. What I mean by these two statements may perhaps be
07876: respectively elucidated by the following examples.
07877: 
07878: First: The mariner, when drawing nigh the coasts of foreign lands, if
07879: by night he hear the roar of breakers, starts to vigilance, and feels
07880: just enough of trepidation to sharpen all his faculties; but under
07881: precisely similar circumstances, let him be called from his hammock to
07882: view his ship sailing through a midnight sea of milky whiteness—as if
07883: from encircling headlands shoals of combed white bears were swimming
07884: round him, then he feels a silent, superstitious dread; the shrouded
07885: phantom of the whitened waters is horrible to him as a real ghost; in
07886: vain the lead assures him he is still off soundings; heart and helm
07887: they both go down; he never rests till blue water is under him again.
07888: Yet where is the mariner who will tell thee, “Sir, it was not so much
07889: the fear of striking hidden rocks, as the fear of that hideous
07890: whiteness that so stirred me?”
07891: 
07892: Second: To the native Indian of Peru, the continual sight of the
07893: snow-howdahed Andes conveys naught of dread, except, perhaps, in the
07894: mere fancying of the eternal frosted desolateness reigning at such vast
07895: altitudes, and the natural conceit of what a fearfulness it would be to
07896: lose oneself in such inhuman solitudes. Much the same is it with the
07897: backwoodsman of the West, who with comparative indifference views an
07898: unbounded prairie sheeted with driven snow, no shadow of tree or twig
07899: to break the fixed trance of whiteness. Not so the sailor, beholding
07900: the scenery of the Antarctic seas; where at times, by some infernal
07901: trick of legerdemain in the powers of frost and air, he, shivering and
07902: half shipwrecked, instead of rainbows speaking hope and solace to his
07903: misery, views what seems a boundless churchyard grinning upon him with
07904: its lean ice monuments and splintered crosses.
07905: 
07906: But thou sayest, methinks that white-lead chapter about whiteness is
07907: but a white flag hung out from a craven soul; thou surrenderest to a
07908: hypo, Ishmael.
07909: 
07910: Tell me, why this strong young colt, foaled in some peaceful valley of
07911: Vermont, far removed from all beasts of prey—why is it that upon the
07912: sunniest day, if you but shake a fresh buffalo robe behind him, so that
07913: he cannot even see it, but only smells its wild animal muskiness—why
07914: will he start, snort, and with bursting eyes paw the ground in
07915: phrensies of affright? There is no remembrance in him of any gorings of
07916: wild creatures in his green northern home, so that the strange
07917: muskiness he smells cannot recall to him anything associated with the
07918: experience of former perils; for what knows he, this New England colt,
07919: of the black bisons of distant Oregon?
07920: 
07921: No: but here thou beholdest even in a dumb brute, the instinct of the
07922: knowledge of the demonism in the world. Though thousands of miles from
07923: Oregon, still when he smells that savage musk, the rending, goring
07924: bison herds are as present as to the deserted wild foal of the
07925: prairies, which this instant they may be trampling into dust.
07926: 
07927: Thus, then, the muffled rollings of a milky sea; the bleak rustlings of
07928: the festooned frosts of mountains; the desolate shiftings of the
07929: windrowed snows of prairies; all these, to Ishmael, are as the shaking
07930: of that buffalo robe to the frightened colt!
07931: 
07932: Though neither knows where lie the nameless things of which the mystic
07933: sign gives forth such hints; yet with me, as with the colt, somewhere
07934: those things must exist. Though in many of its aspects this visible
07935: world seems formed in love, the invisible spheres were formed in
07936: fright.
07937: 
07938: But not yet have we solved the incantation of this whiteness, and
07939: learned why it appeals with such power to the soul; and more strange
07940: and far more portentous—why, as we have seen, it is at once the most
07941: meaning symbol of spiritual things, nay, the very veil of the
07942: Christian’s Deity; and yet should be as it is, the intensifying agent
07943: in things the most appalling to mankind.
07944: 
07945: Is it that by its indefiniteness it shadows forth the heartless voids
07946: and immensities of the universe, and thus stabs us from behind with the
07947: thought of annihilation, when beholding the white depths of the milky
07948: way? Or is it, that as in essence whiteness is not so much a colour as
07949: the visible absence of colour; and at the same time the concrete of all
07950: colours; is it for these reasons that there is such a dumb blankness,
07951: full of meaning, in a wide landscape of snows—a colourless, all-colour
07952: of atheism from which we shrink? And when we consider that other theory
07953: of the natural philosophers, that all other earthly hues—every stately
07954: or lovely emblazoning—the sweet tinges of sunset skies and woods; yea,
07955: and the gilded velvets of butterflies, and the butterfly cheeks of
07956: young girls; all these are but subtile deceits, not actually inherent
07957: in substances, but only laid on from without; so that all deified
07958: Nature absolutely paints like the harlot, whose allurements cover
07959: nothing but the charnel-house within; and when we proceed further, and
07960: consider that the mystical cosmetic which produces every one of her
07961: hues, the great principle of light, for ever remains white or colorless
07962: in itself, and if operating without medium upon matter, would touch all
07963: objects, even tulips and roses, with its own blank tinge—pondering all
07964: this, the palsied universe lies before us a leper; and like wilful
07965: travellers in Lapland, who refuse to wear coloured and colouring
07966: glasses upon their eyes, so the wretched infidel gazes himself blind at
07967: the monumental white shroud that wraps all the prospect around him. And
07968: of all these things the Albino whale was the symbol. Wonder ye then at
07969: the fiery hunt?
07970: 
07971: 
07972: CHAPTER 43. Hark!
07973: 
07974: “HIST! Did you hear that noise, Cabaco?”
07975: 
07976: It was the middle-watch: a fair moonlight; the seamen were standing in
07977: a cordon, extending from one of the fresh-water butts in the waist, to
07978: the scuttle-butt near the taffrail. In this manner, they passed the
07979: buckets to fill the scuttle-butt. Standing, for the most part, on the
07980: hallowed precincts of the quarter-deck, they were careful not to speak
07981: or rustle their feet. From hand to hand, the buckets went in the
07982: deepest silence, only broken by the occasional flap of a sail, and the
07983: steady hum of the unceasingly advancing keel.
07984: 
07985: It was in the midst of this repose, that Archy, one of the cordon,
07986: whose post was near the after-hatches, whispered to his neighbor, a
07987: Cholo, the words above.
07988: 
07989: “Hist! did you hear that noise, Cabaco?”
07990: 
07991: “Take the bucket, will ye, Archy? what noise d’ye mean?”
07992: 
07993: “There it is again—under the hatches—don’t you hear it—a cough—it
07994: sounded like a cough.”
07995: 
07996: “Cough be damned! Pass along that return bucket.”
07997: 
07998: “There again—there it is!—it sounds like two or three sleepers turning
07999: over, now!”
08000: 
08001: “Caramba! have done, shipmate, will ye? It’s the three soaked biscuits
08002: ye eat for supper turning over inside of ye—nothing else. Look to the
08003: bucket!”
08004: 
08005: “Say what ye will, shipmate; I’ve sharp ears.”
08006: 
08007: “Aye, you are the chap, ain’t ye, that heard the hum of the old
08008: Quakeress’s knitting-needles fifty miles at sea from Nantucket; you’re
08009: the chap.”
08010: 
08011: “Grin away; we’ll see what turns up. Hark ye, Cabaco, there is somebody
08012: down in the after-hold that has not yet been seen on deck; and I
08013: suspect our old Mogul knows something of it too. I heard Stubb tell
08014: Flask, one morning watch, that there was something of that sort in the
08015: wind.”
08016: 
08017: “Tish! the bucket!”
08018: 
08019: 
08020: CHAPTER 44. The Chart.
08021: 
08022: Had you followed Captain Ahab down into his cabin after the squall that
08023: took place on the night succeeding that wild ratification of his
08024: purpose with his crew, you would have seen him go to a locker in the
08025: transom, and bringing out a large wrinkled roll of yellowish sea
08026: charts, spread them before him on his screwed-down table. Then seating
08027: himself before it, you would have seen him intently study the various
08028: lines and shadings which there met his eye; and with slow but steady
08029: pencil trace additional courses over spaces that before were blank. At
08030: intervals, he would refer to piles of old log-books beside him, wherein
08031: were set down the seasons and places in which, on various former
