08032: voyages of various ships, sperm whales had been captured or seen.
08033: 
08034: While thus employed, the heavy pewter lamp suspended in chains over his
08035: head, continually rocked with the motion of the ship, and for ever
08036: threw shifting gleams and shadows of lines upon his wrinkled brow, till
08037: it almost seemed that while he himself was marking out lines and
08038: courses on the wrinkled charts, some invisible pencil was also tracing
08039: lines and courses upon the deeply marked chart of his forehead.
08040: 
08041: But it was not this night in particular that, in the solitude of his
08042: cabin, Ahab thus pondered over his charts. Almost every night they were
08043: brought out; almost every night some pencil marks were effaced, and
08044: others were substituted. For with the charts of all four oceans before
08045: him, Ahab was threading a maze of currents and eddies, with a view to
08046: the more certain accomplishment of that monomaniac thought of his soul.
08047: 
08048: Now, to any one not fully acquainted with the ways of the leviathans,
08049: it might seem an absurdly hopeless task thus to seek out one solitary
08050: creature in the unhooped oceans of this planet. But not so did it seem
08051: to Ahab, who knew the sets of all tides and currents; and thereby
08052: calculating the driftings of the sperm whale’s food; and, also, calling
08053: to mind the regular, ascertained seasons for hunting him in particular
08054: latitudes; could arrive at reasonable surmises, almost approaching to
08055: certainties, concerning the timeliest day to be upon this or that
08056: ground in search of his prey.
08057: 
08058: So assured, indeed, is the fact concerning the periodicalness of the
08059: sperm whale’s resorting to given waters, that many hunters believe
08060: that, could he be closely observed and studied throughout the world;
08061: were the logs for one voyage of the entire whale fleet carefully
08062: collated, then the migrations of the sperm whale would be found to
08063: correspond in invariability to those of the herring-shoals or the
08064: flights of swallows. On this hint, attempts have been made to construct
08065: elaborate migratory charts of the sperm whale.*
08066: 
08067: 
08068:   *Since the above was written, the statement is happily borne out by
08069:   an official circular, issued by Lieutenant Maury, of the National
08070:   Observatory, Washington, April 16th, 1851. By that circular, it
08071:   appears that precisely such a chart is in course of completion; and
08072:   portions of it are presented in the circular. “This chart divides the
08073:   ocean into districts of five degrees of latitude by five degrees of
08074:   longitude; perpendicularly through each of which districts are twelve
08075:   columns for the twelve months; and horizontally through each of which
08076:   districts are three lines; one to show the number of days that have
08077:   been spent in each month in every district, and the two others to
08078:   show the number of days in which whales, sperm or right, have been
08079:   seen.”
08080: 
08081: 
08082: 
08083: 
08084: Besides, when making a passage from one feeding-ground to another, the
08085: sperm whales, guided by some infallible instinct—say, rather, secret
08086: intelligence from the Deity—mostly swim in _veins_, as they are called;
08087: continuing their way along a given ocean-line with such undeviating
08088: exactitude, that no ship ever sailed her course, by any chart, with one
08089: tithe of such marvellous precision. Though, in these cases, the
08090: direction taken by any one whale be straight as a surveyor’s parallel,
08091: and though the line of advance be strictly confined to its own
08092: unavoidable, straight wake, yet the arbitrary _vein_ in which at these
08093: times he is said to swim, generally embraces some few miles in width
08094: (more or less, as the vein is presumed to expand or contract); but
08095: never exceeds the visual sweep from the whale-ship’s mast-heads, when
08096: circumspectly gliding along this magic zone. The sum is, that at
08097: particular seasons within that breadth and along that path, migrating
08098: whales may with great confidence be looked for.
08099: 
08100: And hence not only at substantiated times, upon well known separate
08101: feeding-grounds, could Ahab hope to encounter his prey; but in crossing
08102: the widest expanses of water between those grounds he could, by his
08103: art, so place and time himself on his way, as even then not to be
08104: wholly without prospect of a meeting.
08105: 
08106: There was a circumstance which at first sight seemed to entangle his
08107: delirious but still methodical scheme. But not so in the reality,
08108: perhaps. Though the gregarious sperm whales have their regular seasons
08109: for particular grounds, yet in general you cannot conclude that the
08110: herds which haunted such and such a latitude or longitude this year,
08111: say, will turn out to be identically the same with those that were
08112: found there the preceding season; though there are peculiar and
08113: unquestionable instances where the contrary of this has proved true. In
08114: general, the same remark, only within a less wide limit, applies to the
08115: solitaries and hermits among the matured, aged sperm whales. So that
08116: though Moby Dick had in a former year been seen, for example, on what
08117: is called the Seychelle ground in the Indian ocean, or Volcano Bay on
08118: the Japanese Coast; yet it did not follow, that were the Pequod to
08119: visit either of those spots at any subsequent corresponding season, she
08120: would infallibly encounter him there. So, too, with some other feeding
08121: grounds, where he had at times revealed himself. But all these seemed
08122: only his casual stopping-places and ocean-inns, so to speak, not his
08123: places of prolonged abode. And where Ahab’s chances of accomplishing
08124: his object have hitherto been spoken of, allusion has only been made to
08125: whatever way-side, antecedent, extra prospects were his, ere a
08126: particular set time or place were attained, when all possibilities
08127: would become probabilities, and, as Ahab fondly thought, every
08128: possibility the next thing to a certainty. That particular set time and
08129: place were conjoined in the one technical phrase—the
08130: Season-on-the-Line. For there and then, for several consecutive years,
08131: Moby Dick had been periodically descried, lingering in those waters for
08132: awhile, as the sun, in its annual round, loiters for a predicted
08133: interval in any one sign of the Zodiac. There it was, too, that most of
08134: the deadly encounters with the white whale had taken place; there the
08135: waves were storied with his deeds; there also was that tragic spot
08136: where the monomaniac old man had found the awful motive to his
08137: vengeance. But in the cautious comprehensiveness and unloitering
08138: vigilance with which Ahab threw his brooding soul into this unfaltering
08139: hunt, he would not permit himself to rest all his hopes upon the one
08140: crowning fact above mentioned, however flattering it might be to those
08141: hopes; nor in the sleeplessness of his vow could he so tranquillize his
08142: unquiet heart as to postpone all intervening quest.
08143: 
08144: Now, the Pequod had sailed from Nantucket at the very beginning of the
08145: Season-on-the-Line. No possible endeavor then could enable her
08146: commander to make the great passage southwards, double Cape Horn, and
08147: then running down sixty degrees of latitude arrive in the equatorial
08148: Pacific in time to cruise there. Therefore, he must wait for the next
08149: ensuing season. Yet the premature hour of the Pequod’s sailing had,
08150: perhaps, been correctly selected by Ahab, with a view to this very
08151: complexion of things. Because, an interval of three hundred and
08152: sixty-five days and nights was before him; an interval which, instead
08153: of impatiently enduring ashore, he would spend in a miscellaneous hunt;
08154: if by chance the White Whale, spending his vacation in seas far remote
08155: from his periodical feeding-grounds, should turn up his wrinkled brow
08156: off the Persian Gulf, or in the Bengal Bay, or China Seas, or in any
08157: other waters haunted by his race. So that Monsoons, Pampas,
08158: Nor’-Westers, Harmattans, Trades; any wind but the Levanter and Simoon,
08159: might blow Moby Dick into the devious zig-zag world-circle of the
08160: Pequod’s circumnavigating wake.
08161: 
08162: But granting all this; yet, regarded discreetly and coolly, seems it
08163: not but a mad idea, this; that in the broad boundless ocean, one
08164: solitary whale, even if encountered, should be thought capable of
08165: individual recognition from his hunter, even as a white-bearded Mufti
08166: in the thronged thoroughfares of Constantinople? Yes. For the peculiar
08167: snow-white brow of Moby Dick, and his snow-white hump, could not but be
08168: unmistakable. And have I not tallied the whale, Ahab would mutter to
08169: himself, as after poring over his charts till long after midnight he
08170: would throw himself back in reveries—tallied him, and shall he escape?
08171: His broad fins are bored, and scalloped out like a lost sheep’s ear!
08172: And here, his mad mind would run on in a breathless race; till a
08173: weariness and faintness of pondering came over him; and in the open air
08174: of the deck he would seek to recover his strength. Ah, God! what
08175: trances of torments does that man endure who is consumed with one
08176: unachieved revengeful desire. He sleeps with clenched hands; and wakes
08177: with his own bloody nails in his palms.
08178: 
08179: Often, when forced from his hammock by exhausting and intolerably vivid
08180: dreams of the night, which, resuming his own intense thoughts through
08181: the day, carried them on amid a clashing of phrensies, and whirled them
08182: round and round and round in his blazing brain, till the very throbbing
08183: of his life-spot became insufferable anguish; and when, as was
08184: sometimes the case, these spiritual throes in him heaved his being up
08185: from its base, and a chasm seemed opening in him, from which forked
08186: flames and lightnings shot up, and accursed fiends beckoned him to leap
08187: down among them; when this hell in himself yawned beneath him, a wild
08188: cry would be heard through the ship; and with glaring eyes Ahab would
08189: burst from his state room, as though escaping from a bed that was on
08190: fire. Yet these, perhaps, instead of being the unsuppressable symptoms
08191: of some latent weakness, or fright at his own resolve, were but the
08192: plainest tokens of its intensity. For, at such times, crazy Ahab, the
08193: scheming, unappeasedly steadfast hunter of the white whale; this Ahab
08194: that had gone to his hammock, was not the agent that so caused him to
08195: burst from it in horror again. The latter was the eternal, living
08196: principle or soul in him; and in sleep, being for the time dissociated
08197: from the characterizing mind, which at other times employed it for its
08198: outer vehicle or agent, it spontaneously sought escape from the
08199: scorching contiguity of the frantic thing, of which, for the time, it
08200: was no longer an integral. But as the mind does not exist unless
08201: leagued with the soul, therefore it must have been that, in Ahab’s
08202: case, yielding up all his thoughts and fancies to his one supreme
08203: purpose; that purpose, by its own sheer inveteracy of will, forced
08204: itself against gods and devils into a kind of self-assumed, independent
08205: being of its own. Nay, could grimly live and burn, while the common
08206: vitality to which it was conjoined, fled horror-stricken from the
08207: unbidden and unfathered birth. Therefore, the tormented spirit that
08208: glared out of bodily eyes, when what seemed Ahab rushed from his room,
08209: was for the time but a vacated thing, a formless somnambulistic being,
08210: a ray of living light, to be sure, but without an object to colour, and
08211: therefore a blankness in itself. God help thee, old man, thy thoughts
08212: have created a creature in thee; and he whose intense thinking thus
08213: makes him a Prometheus; a vulture feeds upon that heart for ever; that
08214: vulture the very creature he creates.
08215: 
08216: 
08217: CHAPTER 45. The Affidavit.
08218: 
08219: So far as what there may be of a narrative in this book; and, indeed,
08220: as indirectly touching one or two very interesting and curious
08221: particulars in the habits of sperm whales, the foregoing chapter, in
08222: its earlier part, is as important a one as will be found in this
08223: volume; but the leading matter of it requires to be still further and
08224: more familiarly enlarged upon, in order to be adequately understood,
08225: and moreover to take away any incredulity which a profound ignorance of
08226: the entire subject may induce in some minds, as to the natural verity
08227: of the main points of this affair.
08228: 
08229: I care not to perform this part of my task methodically; but shall be
08230: content to produce the desired impression by separate citations of
08231: items, practically or reliably known to me as a whaleman; and from
08232: these citations, I take it—the conclusion aimed at will naturally
08233: follow of itself.
08234: 
08235: First: I have personally known three instances where a whale, after
08236: receiving a harpoon, has effected a complete escape; and, after an
08237: interval (in one instance of three years), has been again struck by the
08238: same hand, and slain; when the two irons, both marked by the same
08239: private cypher, have been taken from the body. In the instance where
08240: three years intervened between the flinging of the two harpoons; and I
08241: think it may have been something more than that; the man who darted
08242: them happening, in the interval, to go in a trading ship on a voyage to
08243: Africa, went ashore there, joined a discovery party, and penetrated far
08244: into the interior, where he travelled for a period of nearly two years,
08245: often endangered by serpents, savages, tigers, poisonous miasmas, with
08246: all the other common perils incident to wandering in the heart of
08247: unknown regions. Meanwhile, the whale he had struck must also have been
08248: on its travels; no doubt it had thrice circumnavigated the globe,
08249: brushing with its flanks all the coasts of Africa; but to no purpose.
08250: This man and this whale again came together, and the one vanquished the
08251: other. I say I, myself, have known three instances similar to this;
08252: that is in two of them I saw the whales struck; and, upon the second
08253: attack, saw the two irons with the respective marks cut in them,
08254: afterwards taken from the dead fish. In the three-year instance, it so
08255: fell out that I was in the boat both times, first and last, and the
08256: last time distinctly recognised a peculiar sort of huge mole under the
08257: whale’s eye, which I had observed there three years previous. I say
08258: three years, but I am pretty sure it was more than that. Here are three
08259: instances, then, which I personally know the truth of; but I have heard
08260: of many other instances from persons whose veracity in the matter there
08261: is no good ground to impeach.
08262: 
08263: Secondly: It is well known in the Sperm Whale Fishery, however ignorant
08264: the world ashore may be of it, that there have been several memorable
08265: historical instances where a particular whale in the ocean has been at
08266: distant times and places popularly cognisable. Why such a whale became
08267: thus marked was not altogether and originally owing to his bodily
08268: peculiarities as distinguished from other whales; for however peculiar
08269: in that respect any chance whale may be, they soon put an end to his
08270: peculiarities by killing him, and boiling him down into a peculiarly
08271: valuable oil. No: the reason was this: that from the fatal experiences
08272: of the fishery there hung a terrible prestige of perilousness about
08273: such a whale as there did about Rinaldo Rinaldini, insomuch that most
08274: fishermen were content to recognise him by merely touching their
08275: tarpaulins when he would be discovered lounging by them on the sea,
08276: without seeking to cultivate a more intimate acquaintance. Like some
08277: poor devils ashore that happen to know an irascible great man, they
08278: make distant unobtrusive salutations to him in the street, lest if they
08279: pursued the acquaintance further, they might receive a summary thump
08280: for their presumption.
08281: 
08282: But not only did each of these famous whales enjoy great individual
08283: celebrity—Nay, you may call it an ocean-wide renown; not only was he
08284: famous in life and now is immortal in forecastle stories after death,
08285: but he was admitted into all the rights, privileges, and distinctions
08286: of a name; had as much a name indeed as Cambyses or Cæsar. Was it not
08287: so, O Timor Tom! thou famed leviathan, scarred like an iceberg, who so
08288: long did’st lurk in the Oriental straits of that name, whose spout was
08289: oft seen from the palmy beach of Ombay? Was it not so, O New Zealand
08290: Jack! thou terror of all cruisers that crossed their wakes in the
08291: vicinity of the Tattoo Land? Was it not so, O Morquan! King of Japan,
08292: whose lofty jet they say at times assumed the semblance of a snow-white
08293: cross against the sky? Was it not so, O Don Miguel! thou Chilian whale,
08294: marked like an old tortoise with mystic hieroglyphics upon the back! In
08295: plain prose, here are four whales as well known to the students of
08296: Cetacean History as Marius or Sylla to the classic scholar.
08297: 
08298: But this is not all. New Zealand Tom and Don Miguel, after at various
08299: times creating great havoc among the boats of different vessels, were
08300: finally gone in quest of, systematically hunted out, chased and killed
08301: by valiant whaling captains, who heaved up their anchors with that
08302: express object as much in view, as in setting out through the
08303: Narragansett Woods, Captain Butler of old had it in his mind to capture
08304: that notorious murderous savage Annawon, the headmost warrior of the
08305: Indian King Philip.
08306: 
08307: I do not know where I can find a better place than just here, to make
08308: mention of one or two other things, which to me seem important, as in
08309: printed form establishing in all respects the reasonableness of the
08310: whole story of the White Whale, more especially the catastrophe. For
08311: this is one of those disheartening instances where truth requires full
08312: as much bolstering as error. So ignorant are most landsmen of some of
08313: the plainest and most palpable wonders of the world, that without some
08314: hints touching the plain facts, historical and otherwise, of the
08315: fishery, they might scout at Moby Dick as a monstrous fable, or still
08316: worse and more detestable, a hideous and intolerable allegory.
08317: 
08318: First: Though most men have some vague flitting ideas of the general
08319: perils of the grand fishery, yet they have nothing like a fixed, vivid
08320: conception of those perils, and the frequency with which they recur.
08321: One reason perhaps is, that not one in fifty of the actual disasters
08322: and deaths by casualties in the fishery, ever finds a public record at
08323: home, however transient and immediately forgotten that record. Do you
08324: suppose that that poor fellow there, who this moment perhaps caught by
08325: the whale-line off the coast of New Guinea, is being carried down to
08326: the bottom of the sea by the sounding leviathan—do you suppose that
08327: that poor fellow’s name will appear in the newspaper obituary you will
08328: read to-morrow at your breakfast? No: because the mails are very
08329: irregular between here and New Guinea. In fact, did you ever hear what
08330: might be called regular news direct or indirect from New Guinea? Yet I
08331: tell you that upon one particular voyage which I made to the Pacific,
08332: among many others we spoke thirty different ships, every one of which
08333: had had a death by a whale, some of them more than one, and three that
08334: had each lost a boat’s crew. For God’s sake, be economical with your
08335: lamps and candles! not a gallon you burn, but at least one drop of
08336: man’s blood was spilled for it.
08337: 
08338: Secondly: People ashore have indeed some indefinite idea that a whale
08339: is an enormous creature of enormous power; but I have ever found that
08340: when narrating to them some specific example of this two-fold
08341: enormousness, they have significantly complimented me upon my
08342: facetiousness; when, I declare upon my soul, I had no more idea of
08343: being facetious than Moses, when he wrote the history of the plagues of
08344: Egypt.
08345: 
08346: But fortunately the special point I here seek can be established upon
08347: testimony entirely independent of my own. That point is this: The Sperm
08348: Whale is in some cases sufficiently powerful, knowing, and judiciously
08349: malicious, as with direct aforethought to stave in, utterly destroy,
08350: and sink a large ship; and what is more, the Sperm Whale _has_ done it.
08351: 
08352: First: In the year 1820 the ship Essex, Captain Pollard, of Nantucket,
08353: was cruising in the Pacific Ocean. One day she saw spouts, lowered her
08354: boats, and gave chase to a shoal of sperm whales. Ere long, several of
08355: the whales were wounded; when, suddenly, a very large whale escaping
08356: from the boats, issued from the shoal, and bore directly down upon the
08357: ship. Dashing his forehead against her hull, he so stove her in, that
08358: in less than “ten minutes” she settled down and fell over. Not a
08359: surviving plank of her has been seen since. After the severest
08360: exposure, part of the crew reached the land in their boats. Being
08361: returned home at last, Captain Pollard once more sailed for the Pacific
08362: in command of another ship, but the gods shipwrecked him again upon
08363: unknown rocks and breakers; for the second time his ship was utterly
08364: lost, and forthwith forswearing the sea, he has never tempted it since.
08365: At this day Captain Pollard is a resident of Nantucket. I have seen
08366: Owen Chace, who was chief mate of the Essex at the time of the tragedy;
08367: I have read his plain and faithful narrative; I have conversed with his
08368: son; and all this within a few miles of the scene of the catastrophe.*
08369: 
08370: *The following are extracts from Chace’s narrative: “Every fact seemed
08371: to warrant me in concluding that it was anything but chance which
08372: directed his operations; he made two several attacks upon the ship, at
08373: a short interval between them, both of which, according to their
08374: direction, were calculated to do us the most injury, by being made
08375: ahead, and thereby combining the speed of the two objects for the
08376: shock; to effect which, the exact manœuvres which he made were
08377: necessary. His aspect was most horrible, and such as indicated
08378: resentment and fury. He came directly from the shoal which we had just
08379: before entered, and in which we had struck three of his companions, as
08380: if fired with revenge for their sufferings.” Again: “At all events, the
08381: whole circumstances taken together, all happening before my own eyes,
08382: and producing, at the time, impressions in my mind of decided,
08383: calculating mischief, on the part of the whale (many of which
08384: impressions I cannot now recall), induce me to be satisfied that I am
08385: correct in my opinion.”
08386: 
08387: Here are his reflections some time after quitting the ship, during a
08388: black night in an open boat, when almost despairing of reaching any
08389: hospitable shore. “The dark ocean and swelling waters were nothing; the
08390: fears of being swallowed up by some dreadful tempest, or dashed upon
08391: hidden rocks, with all the other ordinary subjects of fearful
08392: contemplation, seemed scarcely entitled to a moment’s thought; the
08393: dismal looking wreck, and _the horrid aspect and revenge of the whale_,
08394: wholly engrossed my reflections, until day again made its appearance.”
08395: 
08396: In another place—p. 45,—he speaks of “_the mysterious and mortal attack
08397: of the animal_.”
08398: 
08399: Secondly: The ship Union, also of Nantucket, was in the year 1807
08400: totally lost off the Azores by a similar onset, but the authentic
08401: particulars of this catastrophe I have never chanced to encounter,
08402: though from the whale hunters I have now and then heard casual
08403: allusions to it.
08404: 
08405: Thirdly: Some eighteen or twenty years ago Commodore J——, then
08406: commanding an American sloop-of-war of the first class, happened to be
08407: dining with a party of whaling captains, on board a Nantucket ship in
08408: the harbor of Oahu, Sandwich Islands. Conversation turning upon whales,
08409: the Commodore was pleased to be sceptical touching the amazing strength
08410: ascribed to them by the professional gentlemen present. He peremptorily
08411: denied for example, that any whale could so smite his stout
08412: sloop-of-war as to cause her to leak so much as a thimbleful. Very
08413: good; but there is more coming. Some weeks after, the Commodore set
08414: sail in this impregnable craft for Valparaiso. But he was stopped on
08415: the way by a portly sperm whale, that begged a few moments’
08416: confidential business with him. That business consisted in fetching the
08417: Commodore’s craft such a thwack, that with all his pumps going he made
08418: straight for the nearest port to heave down and repair. I am not
08419: superstitious, but I consider the Commodore’s interview with that whale
08420: as providential. Was not Saul of Tarsus converted from unbelief by a
08421: similar fright? I tell you, the sperm whale will stand no nonsense.
08422: 
08423: I will now refer you to Langsdorff’s Voyages for a little circumstance
08424: in point, peculiarly interesting to the writer hereof. Langsdorff, you
08425: must know by the way, was attached to the Russian Admiral Krusenstern’s
08426: famous Discovery Expedition in the beginning of the present century.
08427: Captain Langsdorff thus begins his seventeenth chapter:
08428: 
08429: “By the thirteenth of May our ship was ready to sail, and the next day
08430: we were out in the open sea, on our way to Ochotsh. The weather was
08431: very clear and fine, but so intolerably cold that we were obliged to
08432: keep on our fur clothing. For some days we had very little wind; it was
08433: not till the nineteenth that a brisk gale from the northwest sprang up.
08434: An uncommon large whale, the body of which was larger than the ship
08435: itself, lay almost at the surface of the water, but was not perceived
08436: by any one on board till the moment when the ship, which was in full
08437: sail, was almost upon him, so that it was impossible to prevent its
08438: striking against him. We were thus placed in the most imminent danger,
08439: as this gigantic creature, setting up its back, raised the ship three
08440: feet at least out of the water. The masts reeled, and the sails fell
08441: altogether, while we who were below all sprang instantly upon the deck,
08442: concluding that we had struck upon some rock; instead of this we saw
08443: the monster sailing off with the utmost gravity and solemnity. Captain
08444: D’Wolf applied immediately to the pumps to examine whether or not the
08445: vessel had received any damage from the shock, but we found that very
08446: happily it had escaped entirely uninjured.”
08447: 
08448: Now, the Captain D’Wolf here alluded to as commanding the ship in
08449: question, is a New Englander, who, after a long life of unusual
08450: adventures as a sea-captain, this day resides in the village of
08451: Dorchester near Boston. I have the honor of being a nephew of his. I
08452: have particularly questioned him concerning this passage in Langsdorff.
08453: He substantiates every word. The ship, however, was by no means a large
08454: one: a Russian craft built on the Siberian coast, and purchased by my
08455: uncle after bartering away the vessel in which he sailed from home.
08456: 
08457: In that up and down manly book of old-fashioned adventure, so full,
08458: too, of honest wonders—the voyage of Lionel Wafer, one of ancient
08459: Dampier’s old chums—I found a little matter set down so like that just
08460: quoted from Langsdorff, that I cannot forbear inserting it here for a
08461: corroborative example, if such be needed.
08462: 
08463: Lionel, it seems, was on his way to “John Ferdinando,” as he calls the
08464: modern Juan Fernandes. “In our way thither,” he says, “about four
08465: o’clock in the morning, when we were about one hundred and fifty
08466: leagues from the Main of America, our ship felt a terrible shock, which
08467: put our men in such consternation that they could hardly tell where
08468: they were or what to think; but every one began to prepare for death.
08469: And, indeed, the shock was so sudden and violent, that we took it for
08470: granted the ship had struck against a rock; but when the amazement was
08471: a little over, we cast the lead, and sounded, but found no ground. * *
08472: * * * The suddenness of the shock made the guns leap in their
08473: carriages, and several of the men were shaken out of their hammocks.
08474: Captain Davis, who lay with his head on a gun, was thrown out of his
08475: cabin!” Lionel then goes on to impute the shock to an earthquake, and
08476: seems to substantiate the imputation by stating that a great
08477: earthquake, somewhere about that time, did actually do great mischief
08478: along the Spanish land. But I should not much wonder if, in the
08479: darkness of that early hour of the morning, the shock was after all
08480: caused by an unseen whale vertically bumping the hull from beneath.
08481: 
08482: I might proceed with several more examples, one way or another known to
08483: me, of the great power and malice at times of the sperm whale. In more
08484: than one instance, he has been known, not only to chase the assailing
08485: boats back to their ships, but to pursue the ship itself, and long
08486: withstand all the lances hurled at him from its decks. The English ship
08487: Pusie Hall can tell a story on that head; and, as for his strength, let
08488: me say, that there have been examples where the lines attached to a
08489: running sperm whale have, in a calm, been transferred to the ship, and
08490: secured there; the whale towing her great hull through the water, as a
08491: horse walks off with a cart. Again, it is very often observed that, if
08492: the sperm whale, once struck, is allowed time to rally, he then acts,
08493: not so often with blind rage, as with wilful, deliberate designs of
08494: destruction to his pursuers; nor is it without conveying some eloquent
08495: indication of his character, that upon being attacked he will
08496: frequently open his mouth, and retain it in that dread expansion for
08497: several consecutive minutes. But I must be content with only one more
08498: and a concluding illustration; a remarkable and most significant one,
08499: by which you will not fail to see, that not only is the most marvellous
08500: event in this book corroborated by plain facts of the present day, but
08501: that these marvels (like all marvels) are mere repetitions of the ages;
08502: so that for the millionth time we say amen with Solomon—Verily there is
08503: nothing new under the sun.
08504: 
08505: In the sixth Christian century lived Procopius, a Christian magistrate
08506: of Constantinople, in the days when Justinian was Emperor and
08507: Belisarius general. As many know, he wrote the history of his own
08508: times, a work every way of uncommon value. By the best authorities, he
08509: has always been considered a most trustworthy and unexaggerating
08510: historian, except in some one or two particulars, not at all affecting
08511: the matter presently to be mentioned.
08512: 
08513: Now, in this history of his, Procopius mentions that, during the term
08514: of his prefecture at Constantinople, a great sea-monster was captured
08515: in the neighboring Propontis, or Sea of Marmora, after having destroyed
08516: vessels at intervals in those waters for a period of more than fifty
08517: years. A fact thus set down in substantial history cannot easily be
08518: gainsaid. Nor is there any reason it should be. Of what precise species
08519: this sea-monster was, is not mentioned. But as he destroyed ships, as
08520: well as for other reasons, he must have been a whale; and I am strongly
08521: inclined to think a sperm whale. And I will tell you why. For a long
08522: time I fancied that the sperm whale had been always unknown in the
08523: Mediterranean and the deep waters connecting with it. Even now I am
08524: certain that those seas are not, and perhaps never can be, in the
08525: present constitution of things, a place for his habitual gregarious
08526: resort. But further investigations have recently proved to me, that in
08527: modern times there have been isolated instances of the presence of the
08528: sperm whale in the Mediterranean. I am told, on good authority, that on
08529: the Barbary coast, a Commodore Davis of the British navy found the
08530: skeleton of a sperm whale. Now, as a vessel of war readily passes
08531: through the Dardanelles, hence a sperm whale could, by the same route,
08532: pass out of the Mediterranean into the Propontis.
08533: 
08534: In the Propontis, as far as I can learn, none of that peculiar
08535: substance called _brit_ is to be found, the aliment of the right whale.
08536: But I have every reason to believe that the food of the sperm
08537: whale—squid or cuttle-fish—lurks at the bottom of that sea, because
08538: large creatures, but by no means the largest of that sort, have been
08539: found at its surface. If, then, you properly put these statements
08540: together, and reason upon them a bit, you will clearly perceive that,
08541: according to all human reasoning, Procopius’s sea-monster, that for
08542: half a century stove the ships of a Roman Emperor, must in all
08543: probability have been a sperm whale.
08544: 
08545: 
08546: CHAPTER 46. Surmises.
08547: 
08548: Though, consumed with the hot fire of his purpose, Ahab in all his
08549: thoughts and actions ever had in view the ultimate capture of Moby
08550: Dick; though he seemed ready to sacrifice all mortal interests to that
08551: one passion; nevertheless it may have been that he was by nature and
08552: long habituation far too wedded to a fiery whaleman’s ways, altogether
08553: to abandon the collateral prosecution of the voyage. Or at least if
08554: this were otherwise, there were not wanting other motives much more
08555: influential with him. It would be refining too much, perhaps, even
08556: considering his monomania, to hint that his vindictiveness towards the
08557: White Whale might have possibly extended itself in some degree to all
08558: sperm whales, and that the more monsters he slew by so much the more he
08559: multiplied the chances that each subsequently encountered whale would
08560: prove to be the hated one he hunted. But if such an hypothesis be
08561: indeed exceptionable, there were still additional considerations which,
08562: though not so strictly according with the wildness of his ruling
08563: passion, yet were by no means incapable of swaying him.
08564: 
08565: To accomplish his object Ahab must use tools; and of all tools used in
08566: the shadow of the moon, men are most apt to get out of order. He knew,
08567: for example, that however magnetic his ascendency in some respects was
08568: over Starbuck, yet that ascendency did not cover the complete spiritual
08569: man any more than mere corporeal superiority involves intellectual
08570: mastership; for to the purely spiritual, the intellectual but stand in
08571: a sort of corporeal relation. Starbuck’s body and Starbuck’s coerced
08572: will were Ahab’s, so long as Ahab kept his magnet at Starbuck’s brain;
08573: still he knew that for all this the chief mate, in his soul, abhorred
08574: his captain’s quest, and could he, would joyfully disintegrate himself
08575: from it, or even frustrate it. It might be that a long interval would
08576: elapse ere the White Whale was seen. During that long interval Starbuck
08577: would ever be apt to fall into open relapses of rebellion against his
08578: captain’s leadership, unless some ordinary, prudential, circumstantial
08579: influences were brought to bear upon him. Not only that, but the subtle
08580: insanity of Ahab respecting Moby Dick was noways more significantly
08581: manifested than in his superlative sense and shrewdness in foreseeing
08582: that, for the present, the hunt should in some way be stripped of that
08583: strange imaginative impiousness which naturally invested it; that the
08584: full terror of the voyage must be kept withdrawn into the obscure
08585: background (for few men’s courage is proof against protracted
08586: meditation unrelieved by action); that when they stood their long night
08587: watches, his officers and men must have some nearer things to think of
08588: than Moby Dick. For however eagerly and impetuously the savage crew had
08589: hailed the announcement of his quest; yet all sailors of all sorts are
08590: more or less capricious and unreliable—they live in the varying outer
08591: weather, and they inhale its fickleness—and when retained for any
08592: object remote and blank in the pursuit, however promissory of life and
08593: passion in the end, it is above all things requisite that temporary
08594: interests and employments should intervene and hold them healthily
08595: suspended for the final dash.
08596: 
08597: Nor was Ahab unmindful of another thing. In times of strong emotion
08598: mankind disdain all base considerations; but such times are evanescent.
08599: The permanent constitutional condition of the manufactured man, thought
08600: Ahab, is sordidness. Granting that the White Whale fully incites the
08601: hearts of this my savage crew, and playing round their savageness even
08602: breeds a certain generous knight-errantism in them, still, while for
08603: the love of it they give chase to Moby Dick, they must also have food
08604: for their more common, daily appetites. For even the high lifted and
08605: chivalric Crusaders of old times were not content to traverse two
08606: thousand miles of land to fight for their holy sepulchre, without
08607: committing burglaries, picking pockets, and gaining other pious
08608: perquisites by the way. Had they been strictly held to their one final
08609: and romantic object—that final and romantic object, too many would have
08610: turned from in disgust. I will not strip these men, thought Ahab, of
08611: all hopes of cash—aye, cash. They may scorn cash now; but let some
08612: months go by, and no perspective promise of it to them, and then this
08613: same quiescent cash all at once mutinying in them, this same cash would
08614: soon cashier Ahab.
08615: 
08616: Nor was there wanting still another precautionary motive more related
08617: to Ahab personally. Having impulsively, it is probable, and perhaps
08618: somewhat prematurely revealed the prime but private purpose of the
08619: Pequod’s voyage, Ahab was now entirely conscious that, in so doing, he
08620: had indirectly laid himself open to the unanswerable charge of
08621: usurpation; and with perfect impunity, both moral and legal, his crew
08622: if so disposed, and to that end competent, could refuse all further
08623: obedience to him, and even violently wrest from him the command. From
08624: even the barely hinted imputation of usurpation, and the possible
08625: consequences of such a suppressed impression gaining ground, Ahab must
08626: of course have been most anxious to protect himself. That protection
08627: could only consist in his own predominating brain and heart and hand,
08628: backed by a heedful, closely calculating attention to every minute
08629: atmospheric influence which it was possible for his crew to be
08630: subjected to.
08631: 
08632: For all these reasons then, and others perhaps too analytic to be
08633: verbally developed here, Ahab plainly saw that he must still in a good
08634: degree continue true to the natural, nominal purpose of the Pequod’s
08635: voyage; observe all customary usages; and not only that, but force
08636: himself to evince all his well known passionate interest in the general
08637: pursuit of his profession.
08638: 
08639: Be all this as it may, his voice was now often heard hailing the three
08640: mast-heads and admonishing them to keep a bright look-out, and not omit
08641: reporting even a porpoise. This vigilance was not long without reward.
08642: 
08643: 
08644: CHAPTER 47. The Mat-Maker.
08645: 
08646: It was a cloudy, sultry afternoon; the seamen were lazily lounging
08647: about the decks, or vacantly gazing over into the lead-coloured waters.
08648: Queequeg and I were mildly employed weaving what is called a sword-mat,
08649: for an additional lashing to our boat. So still and subdued and yet
08650: somehow preluding was all the scene, and such an incantation of reverie
08651: lurked in the air, that each silent sailor seemed resolved into his own
08652: invisible self.
08653: 
08654: I was the attendant or page of Queequeg, while busy at the mat. As I
08655: kept passing and repassing the filling or woof of marline between the
08656: long yarns of the warp, using my own hand for the shuttle, and as
08657: Queequeg, standing sideways, ever and anon slid his heavy oaken sword
08658: between the threads, and idly looking off upon the water, carelessly
08659: and unthinkingly drove home every yarn: I say so strange a dreaminess
08660: did there then reign all over the ship and all over the sea, only
08661: broken by the intermitting dull sound of the sword, that it seemed as
08662: if this were the Loom of Time, and I myself were a shuttle mechanically
08663: weaving and weaving away at the Fates. There lay the fixed threads of
08664: the warp subject to but one single, ever returning, unchanging
08665: vibration, and that vibration merely enough to admit of the crosswise
08666: interblending of other threads with its own. This warp seemed
08667: necessity; and here, thought I, with my own hand I ply my own shuttle
08668: and weave my own destiny into these unalterable threads. Meantime,
08669: Queequeg’s impulsive, indifferent sword, sometimes hitting the woof
08670: slantingly, or crookedly, or strongly, or weakly, as the case might be;
08671: and by this difference in the concluding blow producing a corresponding
08672: contrast in the final aspect of the completed fabric; this savage’s
08673: sword, thought I, which thus finally shapes and fashions both warp and
08674: woof; this easy, indifferent sword must be chance—aye, chance, free
08675: will, and necessity—nowise incompatible—all interweavingly working
08676: together. The straight warp of necessity, not to be swerved from its
08677: ultimate course—its every alternating vibration, indeed, only tending
08678: to that; free will still free to ply her shuttle between given threads;
08679: and chance, though restrained in its play within the right lines of
08680: necessity, and sideways in its motions directed by free will, though
08681: thus prescribed to by both, chance by turns rules either, and has the
08682: last featuring blow at events.
08683: 
08684: Thus we were weaving and weaving away when I started at a sound so
08685: strange, long drawn, and musically wild and unearthly, that the ball of
08686: free will dropped from my hand, and I stood gazing up at the clouds
08687: whence that voice dropped like a wing. High aloft in the cross-trees
08688: was that mad Gay-Header, Tashtego. His body was reaching eagerly
08689: forward, his hand stretched out like a wand, and at brief sudden
08690: intervals he continued his cries. To be sure the same sound was that
08691: very moment perhaps being heard all over the seas, from hundreds of
08692: whalemen’s look-outs perched as high in the air; but from few of those
08693: lungs could that accustomed old cry have derived such a marvellous
08694: cadence as from Tashtego the Indian’s.
08695: 
08696: As he stood hovering over you half suspended in air, so wildly and
08697: eagerly peering towards the horizon, you would have thought him some
08698: prophet or seer beholding the shadows of Fate, and by those wild cries
08699: announcing their coming.
08700: 
08701: “There she blows! there! there! there! she blows! she blows!”
08702: 
08703: “Where-away?”
08704: 
08705: “On the lee-beam, about two miles off! a school of them!”
08706: 
08707: Instantly all was commotion.
08708: 
08709: The Sperm Whale blows as a clock ticks, with the same undeviating and
08710: reliable uniformity. And thereby whalemen distinguish this fish from
08711: other tribes of his genus.
08712: 
08713: “There go flukes!” was now the cry from Tashtego; and the whales
08714: disappeared.
08715: 
08716: “Quick, steward!” cried Ahab. “Time! time!”
08717: 
08718: Dough-Boy hurried below, glanced at the watch, and reported the exact
08719: minute to Ahab.
08720: 
08721: The ship was now kept away from the wind, and she went gently rolling
08722: before it. Tashtego reporting that the whales had gone down heading to
08723: leeward, we confidently looked to see them again directly in advance of
08724: our bows. For that singular craft at times evinced by the Sperm Whale
08725: when, sounding with his head in one direction, he nevertheless, while
08726: concealed beneath the surface, mills round, and swiftly swims off in
08727: the opposite quarter—this deceitfulness of his could not now be in
08728: action; for there was no reason to suppose that the fish seen by
08729: Tashtego had been in any way alarmed, or indeed knew at all of our
08730: vicinity. One of the men selected for shipkeepers—that is, those not
08731: appointed to the boats, by this time relieved the Indian at the
08732: main-mast head. The sailors at the fore and mizzen had come down; the
08733: line tubs were fixed in their places; the cranes were thrust out; the
08734: mainyard was backed, and the three boats swung over the sea like three
08735: samphire baskets over high cliffs. Outside of the bulwarks their eager
08736: crews with one hand clung to the rail, while one foot was expectantly
08737: poised on the gunwale. So look the long line of man-of-war’s men about
08738: to throw themselves on board an enemy’s ship.
08739: 
08740: But at this critical instant a sudden exclamation was heard that took
08741: every eye from the whale. With a start all glared at dark Ahab, who was
08742: surrounded by five dusky phantoms that seemed fresh formed out of air.
08743: 
08744: 
08745: CHAPTER 48. The First Lowering.
08746: 
08747: The phantoms, for so they then seemed, were flitting on the other side
08748: of the deck, and, with a noiseless celerity, were casting loose the
08749: tackles and bands of the boat which swung there. This boat had always
08750: been deemed one of the spare boats, though technically called the
08751: captain’s, on account of its hanging from the starboard quarter. The
08752: figure that now stood by its bows was tall and swart, with one white
08753: tooth evilly protruding from its steel-like lips. A rumpled Chinese
08754: jacket of black cotton funereally invested him, with wide black
08755: trowsers of the same dark stuff. But strangely crowning this ebonness
08756: was a glistening white plaited turban, the living hair braided and
08757: coiled round and round upon his head. Less swart in aspect, the
08758: companions of this figure were of that vivid, tiger-yellow complexion
08759: peculiar to some of the aboriginal natives of the Manillas;—a race
08760: notorious for a certain diabolism of subtilty, and by some honest white
08761: mariners supposed to be the paid spies and secret confidential agents
08762: on the water of the devil, their lord, whose counting-room they suppose
08763: to be elsewhere.
08764: 
08765: While yet the wondering ship’s company were gazing upon these
08766: strangers, Ahab cried out to the white-turbaned old man at their head,
08767: “All ready there, Fedallah?”
08768: 
08769: “Ready,” was the half-hissed reply.
08770: 
08771: “Lower away then; d’ye hear?” shouting across the deck. “Lower away
08772: there, I say.”
08773: 
08774: Such was the thunder of his voice, that spite of their amazement the
08775: men sprang over the rail; the sheaves whirled round in the blocks; with
08776: a wallow, the three boats dropped into the sea; while, with a
08777: dexterous, off-handed daring, unknown in any other vocation, the
08778: sailors, goat-like, leaped down the rolling ship’s side into the tossed
08779: boats below.
08780: 
08781: Hardly had they pulled out from under the ship’s lee, when a fourth
08782: keel, coming from the windward side, pulled round under the stern, and
08783: showed the five strangers rowing Ahab, who, standing erect in the
08784: stern, loudly hailed Starbuck, Stubb, and Flask, to spread themselves
08785: widely, so as to cover a large expanse of water. But with all their
08786: eyes again riveted upon the swart Fedallah and his crew, the inmates of
08787: the other boats obeyed not the command.
08788: 
08789: “Captain Ahab?—” said Starbuck.
08790: 
08791: “Spread yourselves,” cried Ahab; “give way, all four boats. Thou,
08792: Flask, pull out more to leeward!”
08793: 
08794: “Aye, aye, sir,” cheerily cried little King-Post, sweeping round his
08795: great steering oar. “Lay back!” addressing his crew.
08796: “There!—there!—there again! There she blows right ahead, boys!—lay
08797: back!”
08798: 
08799: “Never heed yonder yellow boys, Archy.”
08800: 
08801: “Oh, I don’t mind ’em, sir,” said Archy; “I knew it all before now.
08802: Didn’t I hear ’em in the hold? And didn’t I tell Cabaco here of it?
08803: What say ye, Cabaco? They are stowaways, Mr. Flask.”
08804: 
08805: “Pull, pull, my fine hearts-alive; pull, my children; pull, my little
08806: ones,” drawlingly and soothingly sighed Stubb to his crew, some of whom
08807: still showed signs of uneasiness. “Why don’t you break your backbones,
08808: my boys? What is it you stare at? Those chaps in yonder boat? Tut! They
08809: are only five more hands come to help us—never mind from where—the more
08810: the merrier. Pull, then, do pull; never mind the brimstone—devils are
08811: good fellows enough. So, so; there you are now; that’s the stroke for a
08812: thousand pounds; that’s the stroke to sweep the stakes! Hurrah for the
08813: gold cup of sperm oil, my heroes! Three cheers, men—all hearts alive!
08814: Easy, easy; don’t be in a hurry—don’t be in a hurry. Why don’t you snap
08815: your oars, you rascals? Bite something, you dogs! So, so, so,
08816: then:—softly, softly! That’s it—that’s it! long and strong. Give way
08817: there, give way! The devil fetch ye, ye ragamuffin rapscallions; ye are
08818: all asleep. Stop snoring, ye sleepers, and pull. Pull, will ye? pull,
08819: can’t ye? pull, won’t ye? Why in the name of gudgeons and ginger-cakes
08820: don’t ye pull?—pull and break something! pull, and start your eyes out!
08821: Here!” whipping out the sharp knife from his girdle; “every mother’s
08822: son of ye draw his knife, and pull with the blade between his teeth.
08823: That’s it—that’s it. Now ye do something; that looks like it, my
08824: steel-bits. Start her—start her, my silver-spoons! Start her,
08825: marling-spikes!”
08826: 
08827: Stubb’s exordium to his crew is given here at large, because he had
08828: rather a peculiar way of talking to them in general, and especially in
08829: inculcating the religion of rowing. But you must not suppose from this
08830: specimen of his sermonizings that he ever flew into downright passions
08831: with his congregation. Not at all; and therein consisted his chief
08832: peculiarity. He would say the most terrific things to his crew, in a
08833: tone so strangely compounded of fun and fury, and the fury seemed so
08834: calculated merely as a spice to the fun, that no oarsman could hear
08835: such queer invocations without pulling for dear life, and yet pulling
08836: for the mere joke of the thing. Besides he all the time looked so easy
08837: and indolent himself, so loungingly managed his steering-oar, and so
08838: broadly gaped—open-mouthed at times—that the mere sight of such a
08839: yawning commander, by sheer force of contrast, acted like a charm upon
08840: the crew. Then again, Stubb was one of those odd sort of humorists,
08841: whose jollity is sometimes so curiously ambiguous, as to put all
08842: inferiors on their guard in the matter of obeying them.
08843: 
08844: In obedience to a sign from Ahab, Starbuck was now pulling obliquely
08845: across Stubb’s bow; and when for a minute or so the two boats were
08846: pretty near to each other, Stubb hailed the mate.
08847: 
08848: “Mr. Starbuck! larboard boat there, ahoy! a word with ye, sir, if ye
08849: please!”
08850: 
08851: “Halloa!” returned Starbuck, turning round not a single inch as he
08852: spoke; still earnestly but whisperingly urging his crew; his face set
08853: like a flint from Stubb’s.
08854: 
08855: “What think ye of those yellow boys, sir!”
08856: 
08857: “Smuggled on board, somehow, before the ship sailed. (Strong, strong,
08858: boys!)” in a whisper to his crew, then speaking out loud again: “A sad
08859: business, Mr. Stubb! (seethe her, seethe her, my lads!) but never mind,
08860: Mr. Stubb, all for the best. Let all your crew pull strong, come what
08861: will. (Spring, my men, spring!) There’s hogsheads of sperm ahead, Mr.
08862: Stubb, and that’s what ye came for. (Pull, my boys!) Sperm, sperm’s the
08863: play! This at least is duty; duty and profit hand in hand.”
08864: 
08865: “Aye, aye, I thought as much,” soliloquized Stubb, when the boats
08866: diverged, “as soon as I clapt eye on ’em, I thought so. Aye, and that’s
08867: what he went into the after hold for, so often, as Dough-Boy long
08868: suspected. They were hidden down there. The White Whale’s at the bottom
08869: of it. Well, well, so be it! Can’t be helped! All right! Give way, men!
08870: It ain’t the White Whale to-day! Give way!”
08871: 
08872: Now the advent of these outlandish strangers at such a critical instant
08873: as the lowering of the boats from the deck, this had not unreasonably
08874: awakened a sort of superstitious amazement in some of the ship’s
08875: company; but Archy’s fancied discovery having some time previous got
08876: abroad among them, though indeed not credited then, this had in some
08877: small measure prepared them for the event. It took off the extreme edge
08878: of their wonder; and so what with all this and Stubb’s confident way of
08879: accounting for their appearance, they were for the time freed from
08880: superstitious surmisings; though the affair still left abundant room
08881: for all manner of wild conjectures as to dark Ahab’s precise agency in
08882: the matter from the beginning. For me, I silently recalled the
08883: mysterious shadows I had seen creeping on board the Pequod during the
08884: dim Nantucket dawn, as well as the enigmatical hintings of the
08885: unaccountable Elijah.
08886: 
08887: Meantime, Ahab, out of hearing of his officers, having sided the
08888: furthest to windward, was still ranging ahead of the other boats; a
08889: circumstance bespeaking how potent a crew was pulling him. Those tiger
08890: yellow creatures of his seemed all steel and whalebone; like five
08891: trip-hammers they rose and fell with regular strokes of strength, which
08892: periodically started the boat along the water like a horizontal burst
08893: boiler out of a Mississippi steamer. As for Fedallah, who was seen
08894: pulling the harpooneer oar, he had thrown aside his black jacket, and
08895: displayed his naked chest with the whole part of his body above the
08896: gunwale, clearly cut against the alternating depressions of the watery
08897: horizon; while at the other end of the boat Ahab, with one arm, like a
08898: fencer’s, thrown half backward into the air, as if to counterbalance
08899: any tendency to trip; Ahab was seen steadily managing his steering oar
08900: as in a thousand boat lowerings ere the White Whale had torn him. All
08901: at once the outstretched arm gave a peculiar motion and then remained
08902: fixed, while the boat’s five oars were seen simultaneously peaked. Boat
08903: and crew sat motionless on the sea. Instantly the three spread boats in
08904: the rear paused on their way. The whales had irregularly settled bodily
08905: down into the blue, thus giving no distantly discernible token of the
08906: movement, though from his closer vicinity Ahab had observed it.
08907: 
08908: “Every man look out along his oars!” cried Starbuck. “Thou, Queequeg,
08909: stand up!”
08910: 
08911: Nimbly springing up on the triangular raised box in the bow, the savage
08912: stood erect there, and with intensely eager eyes gazed off towards the
08913: spot where the chase had last been descried. Likewise upon the extreme
08914: stern of the boat where it was also triangularly platformed level with
08915: the gunwale, Starbuck himself was seen coolly and adroitly balancing
08916: himself to the jerking tossings of his chip of a craft, and silently
08917: eyeing the vast blue eye of the sea.
08918: 
08919: Not very far distant Flask’s boat was also lying breathlessly still;
08920: its commander recklessly standing upon the top of the loggerhead, a
08921: stout sort of post rooted in the keel, and rising some two feet above
08922: the level of the stern platform. It is used for catching turns with the
08923: whale line. Its top is not more spacious than the palm of a man’s hand,
08924: and standing upon such a base as that, Flask seemed perched at the
08925: mast-head of some ship which had sunk to all but her trucks. But little
08926: King-Post was small and short, and at the same time little King-Post
08927: was full of a large and tall ambition, so that this loggerhead
08928: stand-point of his did by no means satisfy King-Post.
08929: 
08930: “I can’t see three seas off; tip us up an oar there, and let me on to
08931: that.”
08932: 
08933: Upon this, Daggoo, with either hand upon the gunwale to steady his way,
08934: swiftly slid aft, and then erecting himself volunteered his lofty
08935: shoulders for a pedestal.
08936: 
08937: “Good a mast-head as any, sir. Will you mount?”
08938: 
08939: “That I will, and thank ye very much, my fine fellow; only I wish you
08940: fifty feet taller.”
08941: 
08942: Whereupon planting his feet firmly against two opposite planks of the
08943: boat, the gigantic negro, stooping a little, presented his flat palm to
08944: Flask’s foot, and then putting Flask’s hand on his hearse-plumed head
08945: and bidding him spring as he himself should toss, with one dexterous
08946: fling landed the little man high and dry on his shoulders. And here was
08947: Flask now standing, Daggoo with one lifted arm furnishing him with a
08948: breastband to lean against and steady himself by.
08949: 
08950: At any time it is a strange sight to the tyro to see with what wondrous
08951: habitude of unconscious skill the whaleman will maintain an erect
08952: posture in his boat, even when pitched about by the most riotously
08953: perverse and cross-running seas. Still more strange to see him giddily
08954: perched upon the loggerhead itself, under such circumstances. But the
08955: sight of little Flask mounted upon gigantic Daggoo was yet more
08956: curious; for sustaining himself with a cool, indifferent, easy,
08957: unthought of, barbaric majesty, the noble negro to every roll of the
08958: sea harmoniously rolled his fine form. On his broad back, flaxen-haired
08959: Flask seemed a snow-flake. The bearer looked nobler than the rider.
08960: Though truly vivacious, tumultuous, ostentatious little Flask would now
08961: and then stamp with impatience; but not one added heave did he thereby
08962: give to the negro’s lordly chest. So have I seen Passion and Vanity
08963: stamping the living magnanimous earth, but the earth did not alter her
08964: tides and her seasons for that.
08965: 
08966: Meanwhile Stubb, the third mate, betrayed no such far-gazing
08967: solicitudes. The whales might have made one of their regular soundings,
08968: not a temporary dive from mere fright; and if that were the case,
08969: Stubb, as his wont in such cases, it seems, was resolved to solace the
08970: languishing interval with his pipe. He withdrew it from his hatband,
08971: where he always wore it aslant like a feather. He loaded it, and rammed
08972: home the loading with his thumb-end; but hardly had he ignited his
08973: match across the rough sandpaper of his hand, when Tashtego, his
08974: harpooneer, whose eyes had been setting to windward like two fixed
08975: stars, suddenly dropped like light from his erect attitude to his seat,
08976: crying out in a quick phrensy of hurry, “Down, down all, and give
08977: way!—there they are!”
08978: 
08979: To a landsman, no whale, nor any sign of a herring, would have been
08980: visible at that moment; nothing but a troubled bit of greenish white
08981: water, and thin scattered puffs of vapor hovering over it, and
08982: suffusingly blowing off to leeward, like the confused scud from white
08983: rolling billows. The air around suddenly vibrated and tingled, as it
08984: were, like the air over intensely heated plates of iron. Beneath this
08985: atmospheric waving and curling, and partially beneath a thin layer of
08986: water, also, the whales were swimming. Seen in advance of all the other
08987: indications, the puffs of vapor they spouted, seemed their forerunning
08988: couriers and detached flying outriders.
08989: 
08990: All four boats were now in keen pursuit of that one spot of troubled
08991: water and air. But it bade fair to outstrip them; it flew on and on, as
08992: a mass of interblending bubbles borne down a rapid stream from the
08993: hills.
08994: 
08995: “Pull, pull, my good boys,” said Starbuck, in the lowest possible but
08996: intensest concentrated whisper to his men; while the sharp fixed glance
08997: from his eyes darted straight ahead of the bow, almost seemed as two
08998: visible needles in two unerring binnacle compasses. He did not say much
08999: to his crew, though, nor did his crew say anything to him. Only the
09000: silence of the boat was at intervals startlingly pierced by one of his
09001: peculiar whispers, now harsh with command, now soft with entreaty.
09002: 
09003: How different the loud little King-Post. “Sing out and say something,
09004: my hearties. Roar and pull, my thunderbolts! Beach me, beach me on
09005: their black backs, boys; only do that for me, and I’ll sign over to you
09006: my Martha’s Vineyard plantation, boys; including wife and children,
09007: boys. Lay me on—lay me on! O Lord, Lord! but I shall go stark, staring
09008: mad! See! see that white water!” And so shouting, he pulled his hat
09009: from his head, and stamped up and down on it; then picking it up,
09010: flirted it far off upon the sea; and finally fell to rearing and
09011: plunging in the boat’s stern like a crazed colt from the prairie.
09012: 
09013: “Look at that chap now,” philosophically drawled Stubb, who, with his
09014: unlighted short pipe, mechanically retained between his teeth, at a
09015: short distance, followed after—“He’s got fits, that Flask has. Fits?
09016: yes, give him fits—that’s the very word—pitch fits into ’em. Merrily,
09017: merrily, hearts-alive. Pudding for supper, you know;—merry’s the word.
09018: Pull, babes—pull, sucklings—pull, all. But what the devil are you
09019: hurrying about? Softly, softly, and steadily, my men. Only pull, and
09020: keep pulling; nothing more. Crack all your backbones, and bite your
09021: knives in two—that’s all. Take it easy—why don’t ye take it easy, I
09022: say, and burst all your livers and lungs!”
09023: 
09024: But what it was that inscrutable Ahab said to that tiger-yellow crew of
09025: his—these were words best omitted here; for you live under the blessed
09026: light of the evangelical land. Only the infidel sharks in the audacious
09027: seas may give ear to such words, when, with tornado brow, and eyes of
09028: red murder, and foam-glued lips, Ahab leaped after his prey.
09029: 
09030: Meanwhile, all the boats tore on. The repeated specific allusions of
09031: Flask to “that whale,” as he called the fictitious monster which he
09032: declared to be incessantly tantalizing his boat’s bow with its
09033: tail—these allusions of his were at times so vivid and life-like, that
09034: they would cause some one or two of his men to snatch a fearful look
09035: over the shoulder. But this was against all rule; for the oarsmen must
09036: put out their eyes, and ram a skewer through their necks; usage
09037: pronouncing that they must have no organs but ears, and no limbs but
09038: arms, in these critical moments.
09039: 
09040: It was a sight full of quick wonder and awe! The vast swells of the
09041: omnipotent sea; the surging, hollow roar they made, as they rolled
09042: along the eight gunwales, like gigantic bowls in a boundless
09043: bowling-green; the brief suspended agony of the boat, as it would tip
09044: for an instant on the knife-like edge of the sharper waves, that almost
09045: seemed threatening to cut it in two; the sudden profound dip into the
09046: watery glens and hollows; the keen spurrings and goadings to gain the
09047: top of the opposite hill; the headlong, sled-like slide down its other
09048: side;—all these, with the cries of the headsmen and harpooneers, and
09049: the shuddering gasps of the oarsmen, with the wondrous sight of the
09050: ivory Pequod bearing down upon her boats with outstretched sails, like
09051: a wild hen after her screaming brood;—all this was thrilling.
09052: 
09053: Not the raw recruit, marching from the bosom of his wife into the fever
09054: heat of his first battle; not the dead man’s ghost encountering the
09055: first unknown phantom in the other world;—neither of these can feel
09056: stranger and stronger emotions than that man does, who for the first
09057: time finds himself pulling into the charmed, churned circle of the
09058: hunted sperm whale.
09059: 
09060: The dancing white water made by the chase was now becoming more and
09061: more visible, owing to the increasing darkness of the dun cloud-shadows
09062: flung upon the sea. The jets of vapor no longer blended, but tilted
09063: everywhere to right and left; the whales seemed separating their wakes.
09064: The boats were pulled more apart; Starbuck giving chase to three whales
09065: running dead to leeward. Our sail was now set, and, with the still
09066: rising wind, we rushed along; the boat going with such madness through
09067: the water, that the lee oars could scarcely be worked rapidly enough to
09068: escape being torn from the row-locks.
09069: 
09070: Soon we were running through a suffusing wide veil of mist; neither
09071: ship nor boat to be seen.
09072: 
09073: “Give way, men,” whispered Starbuck, drawing still further aft the
09074: sheet of his sail; “there is time to kill a fish yet before the squall
09075: comes. There’s white water again!—close to! Spring!”
09076: 
09077: Soon after, two cries in quick succession on each side of us denoted
09078: that the other boats had got fast; but hardly were they overheard, when
09079: with a lightning-like hurtling whisper Starbuck said: “Stand up!” and
09080: Queequeg, harpoon in hand, sprang to his feet.
09081: 
09082: Though not one of the oarsmen was then facing the life and death peril
09083: so close to them ahead, yet with their eyes on the intense countenance
09084: of the mate in the stern of the boat, they knew that the imminent
09085: instant had come; they heard, too, an enormous wallowing sound as of
09086: fifty elephants stirring in their litter. Meanwhile the boat was still
09087: booming through the mist, the waves curling and hissing around us like
09088: the erected crests of enraged serpents.
09089: 
09090: “That’s his hump. _There_, _there_, give it to him!” whispered
09091: Starbuck.
09092: 
09093: A short rushing sound leaped out of the boat; it was the darted iron of
09094: Queequeg. Then all in one welded commotion came an invisible push from
09095: astern, while forward the boat seemed striking on a ledge; the sail
09096: collapsed and exploded; a gush of scalding vapor shot up near by;
09097: something rolled and tumbled like an earthquake beneath us. The whole
09098: crew were half suffocated as they were tossed helter-skelter into the
09099: white curdling cream of the squall. Squall, whale, and harpoon had all
09100: blended together; and the whale, merely grazed by the iron, escaped.
09101: 
09102: Though completely swamped, the boat was nearly unharmed. Swimming round
09103: it we picked up the floating oars, and lashing them across the gunwale,
09104: tumbled back to our places. There we sat up to our knees in the sea,
09105: the water covering every rib and plank, so that to our downward gazing
09106: eyes the suspended craft seemed a coral boat grown up to us from the
09107: bottom of the ocean.
09108: 
09109: The wind increased to a howl; the waves dashed their bucklers together;
09110: the whole squall roared, forked, and crackled around us like a white
09111: fire upon the prairie, in which, unconsumed, we were burning; immortal
09112: in these jaws of death! In vain we hailed the other boats; as well roar
09113: to the live coals down the chimney of a flaming furnace as hail those
09114: boats in that storm. Meanwhile the driving scud, rack, and mist, grew
09115: darker with the shadows of night; no sign of the ship could be seen.
09116: The rising sea forbade all attempts to bale out the boat. The oars were
09117: useless as propellers, performing now the office of life-preservers.
09118: So, cutting the lashing of the waterproof match keg, after many
09119: failures Starbuck contrived to ignite the lamp in the lantern; then
09120: stretching it on a waif pole, handed it to Queequeg as the
09121: standard-bearer of this forlorn hope. There, then, he sat, holding up
09122: that imbecile candle in the heart of that almighty forlornness. There,
09123: then, he sat, the sign and symbol of a man without faith, hopelessly
09124: holding up hope in the midst of despair.
09125: 
09126: Wet, drenched through, and shivering cold, despairing of ship or boat,
09127: we lifted up our eyes as the dawn came on. The mist still spread over
09128: the sea, the empty lantern lay crushed in the bottom of the boat.
09129: Suddenly Queequeg started to his feet, hollowing his hand to his ear.
09130: We all heard a faint creaking, as of ropes and yards hitherto muffled
09131: by the storm. The sound came nearer and nearer; the thick mists were
09132: dimly parted by a huge, vague form. Affrighted, we all sprang into the
09133: sea as the ship at last loomed into view, bearing right down upon us
09134: within a distance of not much more than its length.
09135: 
09136: Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, as for one instant it
09137: tossed and gaped beneath the ship’s bows like a chip at the base of a
09138: cataract; and then the vast hull rolled over it, and it was seen no
09139: more till it came up weltering astern. Again we swam for it, were
09140: dashed against it by the seas, and were at last taken up and safely
09141: landed on board. Ere the squall came close to, the other boats had cut
09142: loose from their fish and returned to the ship in good time. The ship
09143: had given us up, but was still cruising, if haply it might light upon
09144: some token of our perishing,—an oar or a lance pole.
09145: 
09146: 
09147: CHAPTER 49. The Hyena.
09148: 
09149: There are certain queer times and occasions in this strange mixed
09150: affair we call life when a man takes this whole universe for a vast
09151: practical joke, though the wit thereof he but dimly discerns, and more
09152: than suspects that the joke is at nobody’s expense but his own.
09153: However, nothing dispirits, and nothing seems worth while disputing. He
09154: bolts down all events, all creeds, and beliefs, and persuasions, all
09155: hard things visible and invisible, never mind how knobby; as an ostrich
09156: of potent digestion gobbles down bullets and gun flints. And as for
09157: small difficulties and worryings, prospects of sudden disaster, peril
09158: of life and limb; all these, and death itself, seem to him only sly,
09159: good-natured hits, and jolly punches in the side bestowed by the unseen
09160: and unaccountable old joker. That odd sort of wayward mood I am
09161: speaking of, comes over a man only in some time of extreme tribulation;
09162: it comes in the very midst of his earnestness, so that what just before
09163: might have seemed to him a thing most momentous, now seems but a part
09164: of the general joke. There is nothing like the perils of whaling to
09165: breed this free and easy sort of genial, desperado philosophy; and with
09166: it I now regarded this whole voyage of the Pequod, and the great White
09167: Whale its object.
09168: 
09169: “Queequeg,” said I, when they had dragged me, the last man, to the
09170: deck, and I was still shaking myself in my jacket to fling off the
09171: water; “Queequeg, my fine friend, does this sort of thing often
09172: happen?” Without much emotion, though soaked through just like me, he
09173: gave me to understand that such things did often happen.
09174: 
09175: “Mr. Stubb,” said I, turning to that worthy, who, buttoned up in his
09176: oil-jacket, was now calmly smoking his pipe in the rain; “Mr. Stubb, I
09177: think I have heard you say that of all whalemen you ever met, our chief
09178: mate, Mr. Starbuck, is by far the most careful and prudent. I suppose
09179: then, that going plump on a flying whale with your sail set in a foggy
09180: squall is the height of a whaleman’s discretion?”
09181: 
09182: “Certain. I’ve lowered for whales from a leaking ship in a gale off
09183: Cape Horn.”
09184: 
09185: “Mr. Flask,” said I, turning to little King-Post, who was standing
09186: close by; “you are experienced in these things, and I am not. Will you
09187: tell me whether it is an unalterable law in this fishery, Mr. Flask,
09188: for an oarsman to break his own back pulling himself back-foremost into
09189: death’s jaws?”
09190: 
09191: “Can’t you twist that smaller?” said Flask. “Yes, that’s the law. I
09192: should like to see a boat’s crew backing water up to a whale face
09193: foremost. Ha, ha! the whale would give them squint for squint, mind
09194: that!”
09195: 
09196: Here then, from three impartial witnesses, I had a deliberate statement
09197: of the entire case. Considering, therefore, that squalls and capsizings
09198: in the water and consequent bivouacks on the deep, were matters of
09199: common occurrence in this kind of life; considering that at the
09200: superlatively critical instant of going on to the whale I must resign
09201: my life into the hands of him who steered the boat—oftentimes a fellow
09202: who at that very moment is in his impetuousness upon the point of
09203: scuttling the craft with his own frantic stampings; considering that
09204: the particular disaster to our own particular boat was chiefly to be
09205: imputed to Starbuck’s driving on to his whale almost in the teeth of a
09206: squall, and considering that Starbuck, notwithstanding, was famous for
09207: his great heedfulness in the fishery; considering that I belonged to
09208: this uncommonly prudent Starbuck’s boat; and finally considering in
09209: what a devil’s chase I was implicated, touching the White Whale: taking
09210: all things together, I say, I thought I might as well go below and make
09211: a rough draft of my will. “Queequeg,” said I, “come along, you shall be
09212: my lawyer, executor, and legatee.”
09213: 
09214: It may seem strange that of all men sailors should be tinkering at
09215: their last wills and testaments, but there are no people in the world
09216: more fond of that diversion. This was the fourth time in my nautical
09217: life that I had done the same thing. After the ceremony was concluded
09218: upon the present occasion, I felt all the easier; a stone was rolled
09219: away from my heart. Besides, all the days I should now live would be as
09220: good as the days that Lazarus lived after his resurrection; a
09221: supplementary clean gain of so many months or weeks as the case might
09222: be. I survived myself; my death and burial were locked up in my chest.
09223: I looked round me tranquilly and contentedly, like a quiet ghost with a
09224: clean conscience sitting inside the bars of a snug family vault.
09225: 
09226: Now then, thought I, unconsciously rolling up the sleeves of my frock,
09227: here goes for a cool, collected dive at death and destruction, and the
09228: devil fetch the hindmost.
09229: 
09230: 
09231: CHAPTER 50. Ahab’s Boat and Crew. Fedallah.
09232: 
09233: “Who would have thought it, Flask!” cried Stubb; “if I had but one leg
09234: you would not catch me in a boat, unless maybe to stop the plug-hole
09235: with my timber toe. Oh! he’s a wonderful old man!”
09236: 
09237: “I don’t think it so strange, after all, on that account,” said Flask.
09238: “If his leg were off at the hip, now, it would be a different thing.
