09239: That would disable him; but he has one knee, and good part of the other
09240: left, you know.”
09241: 
09242: “I don’t know that, my little man; I never yet saw him kneel.”
09243: 
09244: Among whale-wise people it has often been argued whether, considering
09245: the paramount importance of his life to the success of the voyage, it
09246: is right for a whaling captain to jeopardize that life in the active
09247: perils of the chase. So Tamerlane’s soldiers often argued with tears in
09248: their eyes, whether that invaluable life of his ought to be carried
09249: into the thickest of the fight.
09250: 
09251: But with Ahab the question assumed a modified aspect. Considering that
09252: with two legs man is but a hobbling wight in all times of danger;
09253: considering that the pursuit of whales is always under great and
09254: extraordinary difficulties; that every individual moment, indeed, then
09255: comprises a peril; under these circumstances is it wise for any maimed
09256: man to enter a whale-boat in the hunt? As a general thing, the
09257: joint-owners of the Pequod must have plainly thought not.
09258: 
09259: Ahab well knew that although his friends at home would think little of
09260: his entering a boat in certain comparatively harmless vicissitudes of
09261: the chase, for the sake of being near the scene of action and giving
09262: his orders in person, yet for Captain Ahab to have a boat actually
09263: apportioned to him as a regular headsman in the hunt—above all for
09264: Captain Ahab to be supplied with five extra men, as that same boat’s
09265: crew, he well knew that such generous conceits never entered the heads
09266: of the owners of the Pequod. Therefore he had not solicited a boat’s
09267: crew from them, nor had he in any way hinted his desires on that head.
09268: Nevertheless he had taken private measures of his own touching all that
09269: matter. Until Cabaco’s published discovery, the sailors had little
09270: foreseen it, though to be sure when, after being a little while out of
09271: port, all hands had concluded the customary business of fitting the
09272: whaleboats for service; when some time after this Ahab was now and then
09273: found bestirring himself in the matter of making thole-pins with his
09274: own hands for what was thought to be one of the spare boats, and even
09275: solicitously cutting the small wooden skewers, which when the line is
09276: running out are pinned over the groove in the bow: when all this was
09277: observed in him, and particularly his solicitude in having an extra
09278: coat of sheathing in the bottom of the boat, as if to make it better
09279: withstand the pointed pressure of his ivory limb; and also the anxiety
09280: he evinced in exactly shaping the thigh board, or clumsy cleat, as it
09281: is sometimes called, the horizontal piece in the boat’s bow for bracing
09282: the knee against in darting or stabbing at the whale; when it was
09283: observed how often he stood up in that boat with his solitary knee
09284: fixed in the semi-circular depression in the cleat, and with the
09285: carpenter’s chisel gouged out a little here and straightened it a
09286: little there; all these things, I say, had awakened much interest and
09287: curiosity at the time. But almost everybody supposed that this
09288: particular preparative heedfulness in Ahab must only be with a view to
09289: the ultimate chase of Moby Dick; for he had already revealed his
09290: intention to hunt that mortal monster in person. But such a supposition
09291: did by no means involve the remotest suspicion as to any boat’s crew
09292: being assigned to that boat.
09293: 
09294: Now, with the subordinate phantoms, what wonder remained soon waned
09295: away; for in a whaler wonders soon wane. Besides, now and then such
09296: unaccountable odds and ends of strange nations come up from the unknown
09297: nooks and ash-holes of the earth to man these floating outlaws of
09298: whalers; and the ships themselves often pick up such queer castaway
09299: creatures found tossing about the open sea on planks, bits of wreck,
09300: oars, whaleboats, canoes, blown-off Japanese junks, and what not; that
09301: Beelzebub himself might climb up the side and step down into the cabin
09302: to chat with the captain, and it would not create any unsubduable
09303: excitement in the forecastle.
09304: 
09305: But be all this as it may, certain it is that while the subordinate
09306: phantoms soon found their place among the crew, though still as it were
09307: somehow distinct from them, yet that hair-turbaned Fedallah remained a
09308: muffled mystery to the last. Whence he came in a mannerly world like
09309: this, by what sort of unaccountable tie he soon evinced himself to be
09310: linked with Ahab’s peculiar fortunes; nay, so far as to have some sort
09311: of a half-hinted influence; Heaven knows, but it might have been even
09312: authority over him; all this none knew. But one cannot sustain an
09313: indifferent air concerning Fedallah. He was such a creature as
09314: civilized, domestic people in the temperate zone only see in their
09315: dreams, and that but dimly; but the like of whom now and then glide
09316: among the unchanging Asiatic communities, especially the Oriental isles
09317: to the east of the continent—those insulated, immemorial, unalterable
09318: countries, which even in these modern days still preserve much of the
09319: ghostly aboriginalness of earth’s primal generations, when the memory
09320: of the first man was a distinct recollection, and all men his
09321: descendants, unknowing whence he came, eyed each other as real
09322: phantoms, and asked of the sun and the moon why they were created and
09323: to what end; when though, according to Genesis, the angels indeed
09324: consorted with the daughters of men, the devils also, add the
09325: uncanonical Rabbins, indulged in mundane amours.
09326: 
09327: 
09328: CHAPTER 51. The Spirit-Spout.
09329: 
09330: Days, weeks passed, and under easy sail, the ivory Pequod had slowly
09331: swept across four several cruising-grounds; that off the Azores; off
09332: the Cape de Verdes; on the Plate (so called), being off the mouth of
09333: the Rio de la Plata; and the Carrol Ground, an unstaked, watery
09334: locality, southerly from St. Helena.
09335: 
09336: It was while gliding through these latter waters that one serene and
09337: moonlight night, when all the waves rolled by like scrolls of silver;
09338: and, by their soft, suffusing seethings, made what seemed a silvery
09339: silence, not a solitude; on such a silent night a silvery jet was seen
09340: far in advance of the white bubbles at the bow. Lit up by the moon, it
09341: looked celestial; seemed some plumed and glittering god uprising from
09342: the sea. Fedallah first descried this jet. For of these moonlight
09343: nights, it was his wont to mount to the main-mast head, and stand a
09344: look-out there, with the same precision as if it had been day. And yet,
09345: though herds of whales were seen by night, not one whaleman in a
09346: hundred would venture a lowering for them. You may think with what
09347: emotions, then, the seamen beheld this old Oriental perched aloft at
09348: such unusual hours; his turban and the moon, companions in one sky. But
09349: when, after spending his uniform interval there for several successive
09350: nights without uttering a single sound; when, after all this silence,
09351: his unearthly voice was heard announcing that silvery, moon-lit jet,
09352: every reclining mariner started to his feet as if some winged spirit
09353: had lighted in the rigging, and hailed the mortal crew. “There she
09354: blows!” Had the trump of judgment blown, they could not have quivered
09355: more; yet still they felt no terror; rather pleasure. For though it was
09356: a most unwonted hour, yet so impressive was the cry, and so deliriously
09357: exciting, that almost every soul on board instinctively desired a
09358: lowering.
09359: 
09360: Walking the deck with quick, side-lunging strides, Ahab commanded the
09361: t’gallant sails and royals to be set, and every stunsail spread. The
09362: best man in the ship must take the helm. Then, with every mast-head
09363: manned, the piled-up craft rolled down before the wind. The strange,
09364: upheaving, lifting tendency of the taffrail breeze filling the hollows
09365: of so many sails, made the buoyant, hovering deck to feel like air
09366: beneath the feet; while still she rushed along, as if two antagonistic
09367: influences were struggling in her—one to mount direct to heaven, the
09368: other to drive yawingly to some horizontal goal. And had you watched
09369: Ahab’s face that night, you would have thought that in him also two
09370: different things were warring. While his one live leg made lively
09371: echoes along the deck, every stroke of his dead limb sounded like a
09372: coffin-tap. On life and death this old man walked. But though the ship
09373: so swiftly sped, and though from every eye, like arrows, the eager
09374: glances shot, yet the silvery jet was no more seen that night. Every
09375: sailor swore he saw it once, but not a second time.
09376: 
09377: This midnight-spout had almost grown a forgotten thing, when, some days
09378: after, lo! at the same silent hour, it was again announced: again it
09379: was descried by all; but upon making sail to overtake it, once more it
09380: disappeared as if it had never been. And so it served us night after
09381: night, till no one heeded it but to wonder at it. Mysteriously jetted
09382: into the clear moonlight, or starlight, as the case might be;
09383: disappearing again for one whole day, or two days, or three; and
09384: somehow seeming at every distinct repetition to be advancing still
09385: further and further in our van, this solitary jet seemed for ever
09386: alluring us on.
09387: 
09388: Nor with the immemorial superstition of their race, and in accordance
09389: with the preternaturalness, as it seemed, which in many things invested
09390: the Pequod, were there wanting some of the seamen who swore that
09391: whenever and wherever descried; at however remote times, or in however
09392: far apart latitudes and longitudes, that unnearable spout was cast by
09393: one self-same whale; and that whale, Moby Dick. For a time, there
09394: reigned, too, a sense of peculiar dread at this flitting apparition, as
09395: if it were treacherously beckoning us on and on, in order that the
09396: monster might turn round upon us, and rend us at last in the remotest
09397: and most savage seas.
09398: 
09399: These temporary apprehensions, so vague but so awful, derived a
09400: wondrous potency from the contrasting serenity of the weather, in
09401: which, beneath all its blue blandness, some thought there lurked a
09402: devilish charm, as for days and days we voyaged along, through seas so
09403: wearily, lonesomely mild, that all space, in repugnance to our vengeful
09404: errand, seemed vacating itself of life before our urn-like prow.
09405: 
09406: But, at last, when turning to the eastward, the Cape winds began
09407: howling around us, and we rose and fell upon the long, troubled seas
09408: that are there; when the ivory-tusked Pequod sharply bowed to the
09409: blast, and gored the dark waves in her madness, till, like showers of
09410: silver chips, the foam-flakes flew over her bulwarks; then all this
09411: desolate vacuity of life went away, but gave place to sights more
09412: dismal than before.
09413: 
09414: Close to our bows, strange forms in the water darted hither and thither
09415: before us; while thick in our rear flew the inscrutable sea-ravens. And
09416: every morning, perched on our stays, rows of these birds were seen; and
09417: spite of our hootings, for a long time obstinately clung to the hemp,
09418: as though they deemed our ship some drifting, uninhabited craft; a
09419: thing appointed to desolation, and therefore fit roosting-place for
09420: their homeless selves. And heaved and heaved, still unrestingly heaved
09421: the black sea, as if its vast tides were a conscience; and the great
09422: mundane soul were in anguish and remorse for the long sin and suffering
09423: it had bred.
09424: 
09425: Cape of Good Hope, do they call ye? Rather Cape Tormentoso, as called
09426: of yore; for long allured by the perfidious silences that before had
09427: attended us, we found ourselves launched into this tormented sea, where
09428: guilty beings transformed into those fowls and these fish, seemed
09429: condemned to swim on everlastingly without any haven in store, or beat
09430: that black air without any horizon. But calm, snow-white, and
09431: unvarying; still directing its fountain of feathers to the sky; still
09432: beckoning us on from before, the solitary jet would at times be
09433: descried.
09434: 
09435: During all this blackness of the elements, Ahab, though assuming for
09436: the time the almost continual command of the drenched and dangerous
09437: deck, manifested the gloomiest reserve; and more seldom than ever
09438: addressed his mates. In tempestuous times like these, after everything
09439: above and aloft has been secured, nothing more can be done but
09440: passively to await the issue of the gale. Then Captain and crew become
09441: practical fatalists. So, with his ivory leg inserted into its
09442: accustomed hole, and with one hand firmly grasping a shroud, Ahab for
09443: hours and hours would stand gazing dead to windward, while an
09444: occasional squall of sleet or snow would all but congeal his very
09445: eyelashes together. Meantime, the crew driven from the forward part of
09446: the ship by the perilous seas that burstingly broke over its bows,
09447: stood in a line along the bulwarks in the waist; and the better to
09448: guard against the leaping waves, each man had slipped himself into a
09449: sort of bowline secured to the rail, in which he swung as in a loosened
09450: belt. Few or no words were spoken; and the silent ship, as if manned by
09451: painted sailors in wax, day after day tore on through all the swift
09452: madness and gladness of the demoniac waves. By night the same muteness
09453: of humanity before the shrieks of the ocean prevailed; still in silence
09454: the men swung in the bowlines; still wordless Ahab stood up to the
09455: blast. Even when wearied nature seemed demanding repose he would not
09456: seek that repose in his hammock. Never could Starbuck forget the old
09457: man’s aspect, when one night going down into the cabin to mark how the
09458: barometer stood, he saw him with closed eyes sitting straight in his
09459: floor-screwed chair; the rain and half-melted sleet of the storm from
09460: which he had some time before emerged, still slowly dripping from the
09461: unremoved hat and coat. On the table beside him lay unrolled one of
09462: those charts of tides and currents which have previously been spoken
09463: of. His lantern swung from his tightly clenched hand. Though the body
09464: was erect, the head was thrown back so that the closed eyes were
09465: pointed towards the needle of the tell-tale that swung from a beam in
09466: the ceiling.*
09467: 
09468: *The cabin-compass is called the tell-tale, because without going to
09469: the compass at the helm, the Captain, while below, can inform himself
09470: of the course of the ship.
09471: 
09472: Terrible old man! thought Starbuck with a shudder, sleeping in this
09473: gale, still thou steadfastly eyest thy purpose.
09474: 
09475: 
09476: CHAPTER 52. The Albatross.
09477: 
09478: South-eastward from the Cape, off the distant Crozetts, a good cruising
09479: ground for Right Whalemen, a sail loomed ahead, the Goney (Albatross)
09480: by name. As she slowly drew nigh, from my lofty perch at the
09481: fore-mast-head, I had a good view of that sight so remarkable to a tyro
09482: in the far ocean fisheries—a whaler at sea, and long absent from home.
09483: 
09484: As if the waves had been fullers, this craft was bleached like the
09485: skeleton of a stranded walrus. All down her sides, this spectral
09486: appearance was traced with long channels of reddened rust, while all
09487: her spars and her rigging were like the thick branches of trees furred
09488: over with hoar-frost. Only her lower sails were set. A wild sight it
09489: was to see her long-bearded look-outs at those three mast-heads. They
09490: seemed clad in the skins of beasts, so torn and bepatched the raiment
09491: that had survived nearly four years of cruising. Standing in iron hoops
09492: nailed to the mast, they swayed and swung over a fathomless sea; and
09493: though, when the ship slowly glided close under our stern, we six men
09494: in the air came so nigh to each other that we might almost have leaped
09495: from the mast-heads of one ship to those of the other; yet, those
09496: forlorn-looking fishermen, mildly eyeing us as they passed, said not
09497: one word to our own look-outs, while the quarter-deck hail was being
09498: heard from below.
09499: 
09500: “Ship ahoy! Have ye seen the White Whale?”
09501: 
09502: But as the strange captain, leaning over the pallid bulwarks, was in
09503: the act of putting his trumpet to his mouth, it somehow fell from his
09504: hand into the sea; and the wind now rising amain, he in vain strove to
09505: make himself heard without it. Meantime his ship was still increasing
09506: the distance between. While in various silent ways the seamen of the
09507: Pequod were evincing their observance of this ominous incident at the
09508: first mere mention of the White Whale’s name to another ship, Ahab for
09509: a moment paused; it almost seemed as though he would have lowered a
09510: boat to board the stranger, had not the threatening wind forbade. But
09511: taking advantage of his windward position, he again seized his trumpet,
09512: and knowing by her aspect that the stranger vessel was a Nantucketer
09513: and shortly bound home, he loudly hailed—“Ahoy there! This is the
09514: Pequod, bound round the world! Tell them to address all future letters
09515: to the Pacific ocean! and this time three years, if I am not at home,
09516: tell them to address them to ——”
09517: 
09518: At that moment the two wakes were fairly crossed, and instantly, then,
09519: in accordance with their singular ways, shoals of small harmless fish,
09520: that for some days before had been placidly swimming by our side,
09521: darted away with what seemed shuddering fins, and ranged themselves
09522: fore and aft with the stranger’s flanks. Though in the course of his
09523: continual voyagings Ahab must often before have noticed a similar
09524: sight, yet, to any monomaniac man, the veriest trifles capriciously
09525: carry meanings.
09526: 
09527: “Swim away from me, do ye?” murmured Ahab, gazing over into the water.
09528: There seemed but little in the words, but the tone conveyed more of
09529: deep helpless sadness than the insane old man had ever before evinced.
09530: But turning to the steersman, who thus far had been holding the ship in
09531: the wind to diminish her headway, he cried out in his old lion
09532: voice,—“Up helm! Keep her off round the world!”
09533: 
09534: Round the world! There is much in that sound to inspire proud feelings;
09535: but whereto does all that circumnavigation conduct? Only through
09536: numberless perils to the very point whence we started, where those that
09537: we left behind secure, were all the time before us.
09538: 
09539: Were this world an endless plain, and by sailing eastward we could for
09540: ever reach new distances, and discover sights more sweet and strange
09541: than any Cyclades or Islands of King Solomon, then there were promise
09542: in the voyage. But in pursuit of those far mysteries we dream of, or in
09543: tormented chase of that demon phantom that, some time or other, swims
09544: before all human hearts; while chasing such over this round globe, they
09545: either lead us on in barren mazes or midway leave us whelmed.
09546: 
09547: 
09548: CHAPTER 53. The Gam.
09549: 
09550: The ostensible reason why Ahab did not go on board of the whaler we had
09551: spoken was this: the wind and sea betokened storms. But even had this
09552: not been the case, he would not after all, perhaps, have boarded
09553: her—judging by his subsequent conduct on similar occasions—if so it had
09554: been that, by the process of hailing, he had obtained a negative answer
09555: to the question he put. For, as it eventually turned out, he cared not
09556: to consort, even for five minutes, with any stranger captain, except he
09557: could contribute some of that information he so absorbingly sought. But
09558: all this might remain inadequately estimated, were not something said
09559: here of the peculiar usages of whaling-vessels when meeting each other
09560: in foreign seas, and especially on a common cruising-ground.
09561: 
09562: If two strangers crossing the Pine Barrens in New York State, or the
09563: equally desolate Salisbury Plain in England; if casually encountering
09564: each other in such inhospitable wilds, these twain, for the life of
09565: them, cannot well avoid a mutual salutation; and stopping for a moment
09566: to interchange the news; and, perhaps, sitting down for a while and
09567: resting in concert: then, how much more natural that upon the
09568: illimitable Pine Barrens and Salisbury Plains of the sea, two whaling
09569: vessels descrying each other at the ends of the earth—off lone
09570: Fanning’s Island, or the far away King’s Mills; how much more natural,
09571: I say, that under such circumstances these ships should not only
09572: interchange hails, but come into still closer, more friendly and
09573: sociable contact. And especially would this seem to be a matter of
09574: course, in the case of vessels owned in one seaport, and whose
09575: captains, officers, and not a few of the men are personally known to
09576: each other; and consequently, have all sorts of dear domestic things to
09577: talk about.
09578: 
09579: For the long absent ship, the outward-bounder, perhaps, has letters on
09580: board; at any rate, she will be sure to let her have some papers of a
09581: date a year or two later than the last one on her blurred and
09582: thumb-worn files. And in return for that courtesy, the outward-bound
09583: ship would receive the latest whaling intelligence from the
09584: cruising-ground to which she may be destined, a thing of the utmost
09585: importance to her. And in degree, all this will hold true concerning
09586: whaling vessels crossing each other’s track on the cruising-ground
09587: itself, even though they are equally long absent from home. For one of
09588: them may have received a transfer of letters from some third, and now
09589: far remote vessel; and some of those letters may be for the people of
09590: the ship she now meets. Besides, they would exchange the whaling news,
09591: and have an agreeable chat. For not only would they meet with all the
09592: sympathies of sailors, but likewise with all the peculiar
09593: congenialities arising from a common pursuit and mutually shared
09594: privations and perils.
09595: 
09596: Nor would difference of country make any very essential difference;
09597: that is, so long as both parties speak one language, as is the case
09598: with Americans and English. Though, to be sure, from the small number
09599: of English whalers, such meetings do not very often occur, and when
09600: they do occur there is too apt to be a sort of shyness between them;
09601: for your Englishman is rather reserved, and your Yankee, he does not
09602: fancy that sort of thing in anybody but himself. Besides, the English
09603: whalers sometimes affect a kind of metropolitan superiority over the
09604: American whalers; regarding the long, lean Nantucketer, with his
09605: nondescript provincialisms, as a sort of sea-peasant. But where this
09606: superiority in the English whalemen does really consist, it would be
09607: hard to say, seeing that the Yankees in one day, collectively, kill
09608: more whales than all the English, collectively, in ten years. But this
09609: is a harmless little foible in the English whale-hunters, which the
09610: Nantucketer does not take much to heart; probably, because he knows
09611: that he has a few foibles himself.
09612: 
09613: So, then, we see that of all ships separately sailing the sea, the
09614: whalers have most reason to be sociable—and they are so. Whereas, some
09615: merchant ships crossing each other’s wake in the mid-Atlantic, will
09616: oftentimes pass on without so much as a single word of recognition,
09617: mutually cutting each other on the high seas, like a brace of dandies
09618: in Broadway; and all the time indulging, perhaps, in finical criticism
09619: upon each other’s rig. As for Men-of-War, when they chance to meet at
09620: sea, they first go through such a string of silly bowings and
09621: scrapings, such a ducking of ensigns, that there does not seem to be
09622: much right-down hearty good-will and brotherly love about it at all. As
09623: touching Slave-ships meeting, why, they are in such a prodigious hurry,
09624: they run away from each other as soon as possible. And as for Pirates,
09625: when they chance to cross each other’s cross-bones, the first hail
09626: is—“How many skulls?”—the same way that whalers hail—“How many
09627: barrels?” And that question once answered, pirates straightway steer
09628: apart, for they are infernal villains on both sides, and don’t like to
09629: see overmuch of each other’s villanous likenesses.
09630: 
09631: But look at the godly, honest, unostentatious, hospitable, sociable,
09632: free-and-easy whaler! What does the whaler do when she meets another
09633: whaler in any sort of decent weather? She has a “_Gam_,” a thing so
09634: utterly unknown to all other ships that they never heard of the name
09635: even; and if by chance they should hear of it, they only grin at it,
09636: and repeat gamesome stuff about “spouters” and “blubber-boilers,” and
09637: such like pretty exclamations. Why it is that all Merchant-seamen, and
09638: also all Pirates and Man-of-War’s men, and Slave-ship sailors, cherish
09639: such a scornful feeling towards Whale-ships; this is a question it
09640: would be hard to answer. Because, in the case of pirates, say, I should
09641: like to know whether that profession of theirs has any peculiar glory
09642: about it. It sometimes ends in uncommon elevation, indeed; but only at
09643: the gallows. And besides, when a man is elevated in that odd fashion,
09644: he has no proper foundation for his superior altitude. Hence, I
09645: conclude, that in boasting himself to be high lifted above a whaleman,
09646: in that assertion the pirate has no solid basis to stand on.
09647: 
09648: But what is a _Gam?_ You might wear out your index-finger running up
09649: and down the columns of dictionaries, and never find the word. Dr.
09650: Johnson never attained to that erudition; Noah Webster’s ark does not
09651: hold it. Nevertheless, this same expressive word has now for many years
09652: been in constant use among some fifteen thousand true born Yankees.
09653: Certainly, it needs a definition, and should be incorporated into the
09654: Lexicon. With that view, let me learnedly define it.
09655: 
09656: GAM. NOUN—_A social meeting of two_ (_or more_) _Whaleships, generally
09657: on a cruising-ground; when, after exchanging hails, they exchange
09658: visits by boats’ crews: the two captains remaining, for the time, on
09659: board of one ship, and the two chief mates on the other._
09660: 
09661: There is another little item about Gamming which must not be forgotten
09662: here. All professions have their own little peculiarities of detail; so
09663: has the whale fishery. In a pirate, man-of-war, or slave ship, when the
09664: captain is rowed anywhere in his boat, he always sits in the stern
09665: sheets on a comfortable, sometimes cushioned seat there, and often
09666: steers himself with a pretty little milliner’s tiller decorated with
09667: gay cords and ribbons. But the whale-boat has no seat astern, no sofa
09668: of that sort whatever, and no tiller at all. High times indeed, if
09669: whaling captains were wheeled about the water on castors like gouty old
09670: aldermen in patent chairs. And as for a tiller, the whale-boat never
09671: admits of any such effeminacy; and therefore as in gamming a complete
09672: boat’s crew must leave the ship, and hence as the boat steerer or
09673: harpooneer is of the number, that subordinate is the steersman upon the
09674: occasion, and the captain, having no place to sit in, is pulled off to
09675: his visit all standing like a pine tree. And often you will notice that
09676: being conscious of the eyes of the whole visible world resting on him
09677: from the sides of the two ships, this standing captain is all alive to
09678: the importance of sustaining his dignity by maintaining his legs. Nor
09679: is this any very easy matter; for in his rear is the immense projecting
09680: steering oar hitting him now and then in the small of his back, the
09681: after-oar reciprocating by rapping his knees in front. He is thus
09682: completely wedged before and behind, and can only expand himself
09683: sideways by settling down on his stretched legs; but a sudden, violent
09684: pitch of the boat will often go far to topple him, because length of
09685: foundation is nothing without corresponding breadth. Merely make a
09686: spread angle of two poles, and you cannot stand them up. Then, again,
09687: it would never do in plain sight of the world’s riveted eyes, it would
09688: never do, I say, for this straddling captain to be seen steadying
09689: himself the slightest particle by catching hold of anything with his
09690: hands; indeed, as token of his entire, buoyant self-command, he
09691: generally carries his hands in his trowsers’ pockets; but perhaps being
09692: generally very large, heavy hands, he carries them there for ballast.
09693: Nevertheless there have occurred instances, well authenticated ones
09694: too, where the captain has been known for an uncommonly critical moment
09695: or two, in a sudden squall say—to seize hold of the nearest oarsman’s
09696: hair, and hold on there like grim death.
09697: 
09698: 
09699: CHAPTER 54. The Town-Ho’s Story.
09700: 
09701: (_As told at the Golden Inn._)
09702: 
09703: The Cape of Good Hope, and all the watery region round about there, is
09704: much like some noted four corners of a great highway, where you meet
09705: more travellers than in any other part.
09706: 
09707: It was not very long after speaking the Goney that another
09708: homeward-bound whaleman, the Town-Ho,* was encountered. She was manned
09709: almost wholly by Polynesians. In the short gam that ensued she gave us
09710: strong news of Moby Dick. To some the general interest in the White
09711: Whale was now wildly heightened by a circumstance of the Town-Ho’s
09712: story, which seemed obscurely to involve with the whale a certain
09713: wondrous, inverted visitation of one of those so called judgments of
09714: God which at times are said to overtake some men. This latter
09715: circumstance, with its own particular accompaniments, forming what may
09716: be called the secret part of the tragedy about to be narrated, never
09717: reached the ears of Captain Ahab or his mates. For that secret part of
09718: the story was unknown to the captain of the Town-Ho himself. It was the
09719: private property of three confederate white seamen of that ship, one of
09720: whom, it seems, communicated it to Tashtego with Romish injunctions of
09721: secrecy, but the following night Tashtego rambled in his sleep, and
09722: revealed so much of it in that way, that when he was wakened he could
09723: not well withhold the rest. Nevertheless, so potent an influence did
09724: this thing have on those seamen in the Pequod who came to the full
09725: knowledge of it, and by such a strange delicacy, to call it so, were
09726: they governed in this matter, that they kept the secret among
09727: themselves so that it never transpired abaft the Pequod’s main-mast.
09728: Interweaving in its proper place this darker thread with the story as
09729: publicly narrated on the ship, the whole of this strange affair I now
09730: proceed to put on lasting record.
09731: 
09732: *The ancient whale-cry upon first sighting a whale from the mast-head,
09733: still used by whalemen in hunting the famous Gallipagos terrapin.
09734: 
09735: For my humor’s sake, I shall preserve the style in which I once
09736: narrated it at Lima, to a lounging circle of my Spanish friends, one
09737: saint’s eve, smoking upon the thick-gilt tiled piazza of the Golden
09738: Inn. Of those fine cavaliers, the young Dons, Pedro and Sebastian, were
09739: on the closer terms with me; and hence the interluding questions they
09740: occasionally put, and which are duly answered at the time.
09741: 
09742: “Some two years prior to my first learning the events which I am about
09743: rehearsing to you, gentlemen, the Town-Ho, Sperm Whaler of Nantucket,
09744: was cruising in your Pacific here, not very many days’ sail eastward
09745: from the eaves of this good Golden Inn. She was somewhere to the
09746: northward of the Line. One morning upon handling the pumps, according
09747: to daily usage, it was observed that she made more water in her hold
09748: than common. They supposed a sword-fish had stabbed her, gentlemen. But
09749: the captain, having some unusual reason for believing that rare good
09750: luck awaited him in those latitudes; and therefore being very averse to
09751: quit them, and the leak not being then considered at all dangerous,
09752: though, indeed, they could not find it after searching the hold as low
09753: down as was possible in rather heavy weather, the ship still continued
09754: her cruisings, the mariners working at the pumps at wide and easy
09755: intervals; but no good luck came; more days went by, and not only was
09756: the leak yet undiscovered, but it sensibly increased. So much so, that
09757: now taking some alarm, the captain, making all sail, stood away for the
09758: nearest harbor among the islands, there to have his hull hove out and
09759: repaired.
09760: 
09761: “Though no small passage was before her, yet, if the commonest chance
09762: favoured, he did not at all fear that his ship would founder by the
09763: way, because his pumps were of the best, and being periodically
09764: relieved at them, those six-and-thirty men of his could easily keep the
09765: ship free; never mind if the leak should double on her. In truth, well
09766: nigh the whole of this passage being attended by very prosperous
09767: breezes, the Town-Ho had all but certainly arrived in perfect safety at
09768: her port without the occurrence of the least fatality, had it not been
09769: for the brutal overbearing of Radney, the mate, a Vineyarder, and the
09770: bitterly provoked vengeance of Steelkilt, a Lakeman and desperado from
09771: Buffalo.
09772: 
09773: “‘Lakeman!—Buffalo! Pray, what is a Lakeman, and where is Buffalo?’
09774: said Don Sebastian, rising in his swinging mat of grass.
09775: 
09776: “On the eastern shore of our Lake Erie, Don; but—I crave your
09777: courtesy—may be, you shall soon hear further of all that. Now,
09778: gentlemen, in square-sail brigs and three-masted ships, well-nigh as
09779: large and stout as any that ever sailed out of your old Callao to far
09780: Manilla; this Lakeman, in the land-locked heart of our America, had yet
09781: been nurtured by all those agrarian freebooting impressions popularly
09782: connected with the open ocean. For in their interflowing aggregate,
09783: those grand fresh-water seas of ours,—Erie, and Ontario, and Huron, and
09784: Superior, and Michigan,—possess an ocean-like expansiveness, with many
09785: of the ocean’s noblest traits; with many of its rimmed varieties of
09786: races and of climes. They contain round archipelagoes of romantic
09787: isles, even as the Polynesian waters do; in large part, are shored by
09788: two great contrasting nations, as the Atlantic is; they furnish long
09789: maritime approaches to our numerous territorial colonies from the East,
09790: dotted all round their banks; here and there are frowned upon by
09791: batteries, and by the goat-like craggy guns of lofty Mackinaw; they
09792: have heard the fleet thunderings of naval victories; at intervals, they
09793: yield their beaches to wild barbarians, whose red painted faces flash
09794: from out their peltry wigwams; for leagues and leagues are flanked by
09795: ancient and unentered forests, where the gaunt pines stand like serried
09796: lines of kings in Gothic genealogies; those same woods harboring wild
09797: Afric beasts of prey, and silken creatures whose exported furs give
09798: robes to Tartar Emperors; they mirror the paved capitals of Buffalo and
09799: Cleveland, as well as Winnebago villages; they float alike the
09800: full-rigged merchant ship, the armed cruiser of the State, the steamer,
09801: and the beech canoe; they are swept by Borean and dismasting blasts as
09802: direful as any that lash the salted wave; they know what shipwrecks
09803: are, for out of sight of land, however inland, they have drowned full
09804: many a midnight ship with all its shrieking crew. Thus, gentlemen,
09805: though an inlander, Steelkilt was wild-ocean born, and wild-ocean
09806: nurtured; as much of an audacious mariner as any. And for Radney,
09807: though in his infancy he may have laid him down on the lone Nantucket
09808: beach, to nurse at his maternal sea; though in after life he had long
09809: followed our austere Atlantic and your contemplative Pacific; yet was
09810: he quite as vengeful and full of social quarrel as the backwoods
09811: seaman, fresh from the latitudes of buck-horn handled Bowie-knives. Yet
09812: was this Nantucketer a man with some good-hearted traits; and this
09813: Lakeman, a mariner, who though a sort of devil indeed, might yet by
09814: inflexible firmness, only tempered by that common decency of human
09815: recognition which is the meanest slave’s right; thus treated, this
09816: Steelkilt had long been retained harmless and docile. At all events, he
09817: had proved so thus far; but Radney was doomed and made mad, and
09818: Steelkilt—but, gentlemen, you shall hear.
09819: 
09820: “It was not more than a day or two at the furthest after pointing her
09821: prow for her island haven, that the Town-Ho’s leak seemed again
09822: increasing, but only so as to require an hour or more at the pumps
09823: every day. You must know that in a settled and civilized ocean like our
09824: Atlantic, for example, some skippers think little of pumping their
09825: whole way across it; though of a still, sleepy night, should the
09826: officer of the deck happen to forget his duty in that respect, the
09827: probability would be that he and his shipmates would never again
09828: remember it, on account of all hands gently subsiding to the bottom.
09829: Nor in the solitary and savage seas far from you to the westward,
09830: gentlemen, is it altogether unusual for ships to keep clanging at their
09831: pump-handles in full chorus even for a voyage of considerable length;
09832: that is, if it lie along a tolerably accessible coast, or if any other
09833: reasonable retreat is afforded them. It is only when a leaky vessel is
09834: in some very out of the way part of those waters, some really landless
09835: latitude, that her captain begins to feel a little anxious.
09836: 
09837: “Much this way had it been with the Town-Ho; so when her leak was found
09838: gaining once more, there was in truth some small concern manifested by
09839: several of her company; especially by Radney the mate. He commanded the
09840: upper sails to be well hoisted, sheeted home anew, and every way
09841: expanded to the breeze. Now this Radney, I suppose, was as little of a
09842: coward, and as little inclined to any sort of nervous apprehensiveness
09843: touching his own person as any fearless, unthinking creature on land or
09844: on sea that you can conveniently imagine, gentlemen. Therefore when he
09845: betrayed this solicitude about the safety of the ship, some of the
09846: seamen declared that it was only on account of his being a part owner
09847: in her. So when they were working that evening at the pumps, there was
09848: on this head no small gamesomeness slily going on among them, as they
09849: stood with their feet continually overflowed by the rippling clear
09850: water; clear as any mountain spring, gentlemen—that bubbling from the
09851: pumps ran across the deck, and poured itself out in steady spouts at
09852: the lee scupper-holes.
09853: 
09854: “Now, as you well know, it is not seldom the case in this conventional
09855: world of ours—watery or otherwise; that when a person placed in command
09856: over his fellow-men finds one of them to be very significantly his
09857: superior in general pride of manhood, straightway against that man he
09858: conceives an unconquerable dislike and bitterness; and if he have a
09859: chance he will pull down and pulverize that subaltern’s tower, and make
09860: a little heap of dust of it. Be this conceit of mine as it may,
09861: gentlemen, at all events Steelkilt was a tall and noble animal with a
09862: head like a Roman, and a flowing golden beard like the tasseled
09863: housings of your last viceroy’s snorting charger; and a brain, and a
09864: heart, and a soul in him, gentlemen, which had made Steelkilt
09865: Charlemagne, had he been born son to Charlemagne’s father. But Radney,
09866: the mate, was ugly as a mule; yet as hardy, as stubborn, as malicious.
09867: He did not love Steelkilt, and Steelkilt knew it.
09868: 
09869: “Espying the mate drawing near as he was toiling at the pump with the
09870: rest, the Lakeman affected not to notice him, but unawed, went on with
09871: his gay banterings.
09872: 
09873: “‘Aye, aye, my merry lads, it’s a lively leak this; hold a cannikin,
09874: one of ye, and let’s have a taste. By the Lord, it’s worth bottling! I
09875: tell ye what, men, old Rad’s investment must go for it! he had best cut
09876: away his part of the hull and tow it home. The fact is, boys, that
09877: sword-fish only began the job; he’s come back again with a gang of
09878: ship-carpenters, saw-fish, and file-fish, and what not; and the whole
09879: posse of ’em are now hard at work cutting and slashing at the bottom;
09880: making improvements, I suppose. If old Rad were here now, I’d tell him
09881: to jump overboard and scatter ’em. They’re playing the devil with his
09882: estate, I can tell him. But he’s a simple old soul,—Rad, and a beauty
09883: too. Boys, they say the rest of his property is invested in
09884: looking-glasses. I wonder if he’d give a poor devil like me the model
09885: of his nose.’
09886: 
09887: “‘Damn your eyes! what’s that pump stopping for?’ roared Radney,
09888: pretending not to have heard the sailors’ talk. ‘Thunder away at it!’
09889: 
09890: “‘Aye, aye, sir,’ said Steelkilt, merry as a cricket. ‘Lively, boys,
09891: lively, now!’ And with that the pump clanged like fifty fire-engines;
09892: the men tossed their hats off to it, and ere long that peculiar gasping
09893: of the lungs was heard which denotes the fullest tension of life’s
09894: utmost energies.
09895: 
09896: “Quitting the pump at last, with the rest of his band, the Lakeman went
09897: forward all panting, and sat himself down on the windlass; his face
09898: fiery red, his eyes bloodshot, and wiping the profuse sweat from his
09899: brow. Now what cozening fiend it was, gentlemen, that possessed Radney
09900: to meddle with such a man in that corporeally exasperated state, I know
09901: not; but so it happened. Intolerably striding along the deck, the mate
09902: commanded him to get a broom and sweep down the planks, and also a
09903: shovel, and remove some offensive matters consequent upon allowing a
09904: pig to run at large.
09905: 
09906: “Now, gentlemen, sweeping a ship’s deck at sea is a piece of household
09907: work which in all times but raging gales is regularly attended to every
09908: evening; it has been known to be done in the case of ships actually
09909: foundering at the time. Such, gentlemen, is the inflexibility of
09910: sea-usages and the instinctive love of neatness in seamen; some of whom
09911: would not willingly drown without first washing their faces. But in all
09912: vessels this broom business is the prescriptive province of the boys,
09913: if boys there be aboard. Besides, it was the stronger men in the
09914: Town-Ho that had been divided into gangs, taking turns at the pumps;
09915: and being the most athletic seaman of them all, Steelkilt had been
09916: regularly assigned captain of one of the gangs; consequently he should
09917: have been freed from any trivial business not connected with truly
09918: nautical duties, such being the case with his comrades. I mention all
09919: these particulars so that you may understand exactly how this affair
09920: stood between the two men.
09921: 
09922: “But there was more than this: the order about the shovel was almost as
09923: plainly meant to sting and insult Steelkilt, as though Radney had spat
09924: in his face. Any man who has gone sailor in a whale-ship will
09925: understand this; and all this and doubtless much more, the Lakeman
09926: fully comprehended when the mate uttered his command. But as he sat
09927: still for a moment, and as he steadfastly looked into the mate’s
09928: malignant eye and perceived the stacks of powder-casks heaped up in him
09929: and the slow-match silently burning along towards them; as he
09930: instinctively saw all this, that strange forbearance and unwillingness
09931: to stir up the deeper passionateness in any already ireful being—a
09932: repugnance most felt, when felt at all, by really valiant men even when
09933: aggrieved—this nameless phantom feeling, gentlemen, stole over
09934: Steelkilt.
09935: 
09936: “Therefore, in his ordinary tone, only a little broken by the bodily
09937: exhaustion he was temporarily in, he answered him saying that sweeping
09938: the deck was not his business, and he would not do it. And then,
09939: without at all alluding to the shovel, he pointed to three lads as the
09940: customary sweepers; who, not being billeted at the pumps, had done
09941: little or nothing all day. To this, Radney replied with an oath, in a
09942: most domineering and outrageous manner unconditionally reiterating his
09943: command; meanwhile advancing upon the still seated Lakeman, with an
09944: uplifted cooper’s club hammer which he had snatched from a cask near
09945: by.
09946: 
09947: “Heated and irritated as he was by his spasmodic toil at the pumps, for
09948: all his first nameless feeling of forbearance the sweating Steelkilt
09949: could but ill brook this bearing in the mate; but somehow still
09950: smothering the conflagration within him, without speaking he remained
09951: doggedly rooted to his seat, till at last the incensed Radney shook the
09952: hammer within a few inches of his face, furiously commanding him to do
09953: his bidding.
09954: 
09955: “Steelkilt rose, and slowly retreating round the windlass, steadily
09956: followed by the mate with his menacing hammer, deliberately repeated
09957: his intention not to obey. Seeing, however, that his forbearance had
09958: not the slightest effect, by an awful and unspeakable intimation with
09959: his twisted hand he warned off the foolish and infatuated man; but it
09960: was to no purpose. And in this way the two went once slowly round the
09961: windlass; when, resolved at last no longer to retreat, bethinking him
09962: that he had now forborne as much as comported with his humor, the
09963: Lakeman paused on the hatches and thus spoke to the officer:
09964: 
09965: “‘Mr. Radney, I will not obey you. Take that hammer away, or look to
09966: yourself.’ But the predestinated mate coming still closer to him, where
09967: the Lakeman stood fixed, now shook the heavy hammer within an inch of
09968: his teeth; meanwhile repeating a string of insufferable maledictions.
09969: Retreating not the thousandth part of an inch; stabbing him in the eye
09970: with the unflinching poniard of his glance, Steelkilt, clenching his
09971: right hand behind him and creepingly drawing it back, told his
09972: persecutor that if the hammer but grazed his cheek he (Steelkilt) would
09973: murder him. But, gentlemen, the fool had been branded for the slaughter
09974: by the gods. Immediately the hammer touched the cheek; the next instant
09975: the lower jaw of the mate was stove in his head; he fell on the hatch
09976: spouting blood like a whale.
09977: 
09978: “Ere the cry could go aft Steelkilt was shaking one of the backstays
09979: leading far aloft to where two of his comrades were standing their
09980: mastheads. They were both Canallers.
09981: 
09982: “‘Canallers!’ cried Don Pedro. ‘We have seen many whale-ships in our
09983: harbours, but never heard of your Canallers. Pardon: who and what are
09984: they?’
09985: 
09986: “‘Canallers, Don, are the boatmen belonging to our grand Erie Canal.
09987: You must have heard of it.’
09988: 
09989: “‘Nay, Senor; hereabouts in this dull, warm, most lazy, and hereditary
09990: land, we know but little of your vigorous North.’
09991: 
09992: “‘Aye? Well then, Don, refill my cup. Your chicha’s very fine; and ere
09993: proceeding further I will tell ye what our Canallers are; for such
09994: information may throw side-light upon my story.’
09995: 
09996: “For three hundred and sixty miles, gentlemen, through the entire
09997: breadth of the state of New York; through numerous populous cities and
09998: most thriving villages; through long, dismal, uninhabited swamps, and
09999: affluent, cultivated fields, unrivalled for fertility; by billiard-room
10000: and bar-room; through the holy-of-holies of great forests; on Roman
10001: arches over Indian rivers; through sun and shade; by happy hearts or
10002: broken; through all the wide contrasting scenery of those noble Mohawk
10003: counties; and especially, by rows of snow-white chapels, whose spires
10004: stand almost like milestones, flows one continual stream of Venetianly
10005: corrupt and often lawless life. There’s your true Ashantee, gentlemen;
10006: there howl your pagans; where you ever find them, next door to you;
10007: under the long-flung shadow, and the snug patronising lee of churches.
10008: For by some curious fatality, as it is often noted of your metropolitan
10009: freebooters that they ever encamp around the halls of justice, so
10010: sinners, gentlemen, most abound in holiest vicinities.
10011: 
10012: “‘Is that a friar passing?’ said Don Pedro, looking downwards into the
10013: crowded plazza, with humorous concern.
10014: 
10015: “‘Well for our northern friend, Dame Isabella’s Inquisition wanes in
10016: Lima,’ laughed Don Sebastian. ‘Proceed, Senor.’
10017: 
10018: “‘A moment! Pardon!’ cried another of the company. ‘In the name of all
10019: us Limeese, I but desire to express to you, sir sailor, that we have by
10020: no means overlooked your delicacy in not substituting present Lima for
10021: distant Venice in your corrupt comparison. Oh! do not bow and look
10022: surprised; you know the proverb all along this coast—“Corrupt as Lima.”
10023: It but bears out your saying, too; churches more plentiful than
10024: billiard-tables, and for ever open—and “Corrupt as Lima.” So, too,
10025: Venice; I have been there; the holy city of the blessed evangelist, St.
10026: Mark!—St. Dominic, purge it! Your cup! Thanks: here I refill; now, you
10027: pour out again.’
10028: 
10029: “Freely depicted in his own vocation, gentlemen, the Canaller would
10030: make a fine dramatic hero, so abundantly and picturesquely wicked is
10031: he. Like Mark Antony, for days and days along his green-turfed, flowery
10032: Nile, he indolently floats, openly toying with his red-cheeked
10033: Cleopatra, ripening his apricot thigh upon the sunny deck. But ashore,
10034: all this effeminacy is dashed. The brigandish guise which the Canaller
10035: so proudly sports; his slouched and gaily-ribboned hat betoken his
10036: grand features. A terror to the smiling innocence of the villages
10037: through which he floats; his swart visage and bold swagger are not
10038: unshunned in cities. Once a vagabond on his own canal, I have received
10039: good turns from one of these Canallers; I thank him heartily; would
10040: fain be not ungrateful; but it is often one of the prime redeeming
10041: qualities of your man of violence, that at times he has as stiff an arm
10042: to back a poor stranger in a strait, as to plunder a wealthy one. In
10043: sum, gentlemen, what the wildness of this canal life is, is
10044: emphatically evinced by this; that our wild whale-fishery contains so
10045: many of its most finished graduates, and that scarce any race of
10046: mankind, except Sydney men, are so much distrusted by our whaling
10047: captains. Nor does it at all diminish the curiousness of this matter,
10048: that to many thousands of our rural boys and young men born along its
10049: line, the probationary life of the Grand Canal furnishes the sole
10050: transition between quietly reaping in a Christian corn-field, and
10051: recklessly ploughing the waters of the most barbaric seas.
10052: 
10053: “‘I see! I see!’ impetuously exclaimed Don Pedro, spilling his chicha
10054: upon his silvery ruffles. ‘No need to travel! The world’s one Lima. I
10055: had thought, now, that at your temperate North the generations were
10056: cold and holy as the hills.—But the story.’
10057: 
10058: “I left off, gentlemen, where the Lakeman shook the backstay. Hardly
10059: had he done so, when he was surrounded by the three junior mates and
10060: the four harpooneers, who all crowded him to the deck. But sliding down
10061: the ropes like baleful comets, the two Canallers rushed into the
10062: uproar, and sought to drag their man out of it towards the forecastle.
10063: Others of the sailors joined with them in this attempt, and a twisted
10064: turmoil ensued; while standing out of harm’s way, the valiant captain
10065: danced up and down with a whale-pike, calling upon his officers to
10066: manhandle that atrocious scoundrel, and smoke him along to the
10067: quarter-deck. At intervals, he ran close up to the revolving border of
10068: the confusion, and prying into the heart of it with his pike, sought to
10069: prick out the object of his resentment. But Steelkilt and his
10070: desperadoes were too much for them all; they succeeded in gaining the
10071: forecastle deck, where, hastily slewing about three or four large casks
10072: in a line with the windlass, these sea-Parisians entrenched themselves
10073: behind the barricade.
10074: 
10075: “‘Come out of that, ye pirates!’ roared the captain, now menacing them
10076: with a pistol in each hand, just brought to him by the steward. ‘Come
10077: out of that, ye cut-throats!’
10078: 
10079: “Steelkilt leaped on the barricade, and striding up and down there,
10080: defied the worst the pistols could do; but gave the captain to
10081: understand distinctly, that his (Steelkilt’s) death would be the signal
10082: for a murderous mutiny on the part of all hands. Fearing in his heart
10083: lest this might prove but too true, the captain a little desisted, but
10084: still commanded the insurgents instantly to return to their duty.
10085: 
10086: “‘Will you promise not to touch us, if we do?’ demanded their
10087: ringleader.
10088: 
10089: “‘Turn to! turn to!—I make no promise;—to your duty! Do you want to
10090: sink the ship, by knocking off at a time like this? Turn to!’ and he
10091: once more raised a pistol.
10092: 
10093: “‘Sink the ship?’ cried Steelkilt. ‘Aye, let her sink. Not a man of us
10094: turns to, unless you swear not to raise a rope-yarn against us. What
10095: say ye, men?’ turning to his comrades. A fierce cheer was their
10096: response.
10097: 
10098: “The Lakeman now patrolled the barricade, all the while keeping his eye
10099: on the Captain, and jerking out such sentences as these:—‘It’s not our
10100: fault; we didn’t want it; I told him to take his hammer away; it was
10101: boy’s business; he might have known me before this; I told him not to
10102: prick the buffalo; I believe I have broken a finger here against his
10103: cursed jaw; ain’t those mincing knives down in the forecastle there,
10104: men? look to those handspikes, my hearties. Captain, by God, look to
10105: yourself; say the word; don’t be a fool; forget it all; we are ready to
10106: turn to; treat us decently, and we’re your men; but we won’t be
10107: flogged.’
10108: 
10109: “‘Turn to! I make no promises, turn to, I say!’
10110: 
10111: “‘Look ye, now,’ cried the Lakeman, flinging out his arm towards him,
10112: ‘there are a few of us here (and I am one of them) who have shipped for
10113: the cruise, d’ye see; now as you well know, sir, we can claim our
10114: discharge as soon as the anchor is down; so we don’t want a row; it’s
10115: not our interest; we want to be peaceable; we are ready to work, but we
10116: won’t be flogged.’
10117: 
10118: “‘Turn to!’ roared the Captain.
10119: 
10120: “Steelkilt glanced round him a moment, and then said:—‘I tell you what
10121: it is now, Captain, rather than kill ye, and be hung for such a shabby
10122: rascal, we won’t lift a hand against ye unless ye attack us; but till
10123: you say the word about not flogging us, we don’t do a hand’s turn.’
10124: 
10125: “‘Down into the forecastle then, down with ye, I’ll keep ye there till
10126: ye’re sick of it. Down ye go.’
10127: 
10128: “‘Shall we?’ cried the ringleader to his men. Most of them were against
10129: it; but at length, in obedience to Steelkilt, they preceded him down
10130: into their dark den, growlingly disappearing, like bears into a cave.
10131: 
10132: “As the Lakeman’s bare head was just level with the planks, the Captain
10133: and his posse leaped the barricade, and rapidly drawing over the slide
10134: of the scuttle, planted their group of hands upon it, and loudly called
10135: for the steward to bring the heavy brass padlock belonging to the
10136: companionway. Then opening the slide a little, the Captain whispered
10137: something down the crack, closed it, and turned the key upon them—ten
10138: in number—leaving on deck some twenty or more, who thus far had
10139: remained neutral.
10140: 
10141: “All night a wide-awake watch was kept by all the officers, forward and
10142: aft, especially about the forecastle scuttle and fore hatchway; at
10143: which last place it was feared the insurgents might emerge, after
10144: breaking through the bulkhead below. But the hours of darkness passed
10145: in peace; the men who still remained at their duty toiling hard at the
10146: pumps, whose clinking and clanking at intervals through the dreary
10147: night dismally resounded through the ship.
10148: 
10149: “At sunrise the Captain went forward, and knocking on the deck,
10150: summoned the prisoners to work; but with a yell they refused. Water was
10151: then lowered down to them, and a couple of handfuls of biscuit were
10152: tossed after it; when again turning the key upon them and pocketing it,
10153: the Captain returned to the quarter-deck. Twice every day for three
10154: days this was repeated; but on the fourth morning a confused wrangling,
10155: and then a scuffling was heard, as the customary summons was delivered;
10156: and suddenly four men burst up from the forecastle, saying they were
10157: ready to turn to. The fetid closeness of the air, and a famishing diet,
10158: united perhaps to some fears of ultimate retribution, had constrained
10159: them to surrender at discretion. Emboldened by this, the Captain
10160: reiterated his demand to the rest, but Steelkilt shouted up to him a
10161: terrific hint to stop his babbling and betake himself where he
10162: belonged. On the fifth morning three others of the mutineers bolted up
10163: into the air from the desperate arms below that sought to restrain
10164: them. Only three were left.
10165: 
10166: “‘Better turn to, now?’ said the Captain with a heartless jeer.
10167: 
10168: “‘Shut us up again, will ye!’ cried Steelkilt.
10169: 
10170: “‘Oh certainly,’ said the Captain, and the key clicked.
10171: 
10172: “It was at this point, gentlemen, that enraged by the defection of
10173: seven of his former associates, and stung by the mocking voice that had
10174: last hailed him, and maddened by his long entombment in a place as
10175: black as the bowels of despair; it was then that Steelkilt proposed to
10176: the two Canallers, thus far apparently of one mind with him, to burst
10177: out of their hole at the next summoning of the garrison; and armed with
10178: their keen mincing knives (long, crescentic, heavy implements with a
10179: handle at each end) run amuck from the bowsprit to the taffrail; and if
10180: by any devilishness of desperation possible, seize the ship. For
10181: himself, he would do this, he said, whether they joined him or not.
10182: That was the last night he should spend in that den. But the scheme met
10183: with no opposition on the part of the other two; they swore they were
10184: ready for that, or for any other mad thing, for anything in short but a
10185: surrender. And what was more, they each insisted upon being the first
10186: man on deck, when the time to make the rush should come. But to this
10187: their leader as fiercely objected, reserving that priority for himself;
10188: particularly as his two comrades would not yield, the one to the other,
10189: in the matter; and both of them could not be first, for the ladder
10190: would but admit one man at a time. And here, gentlemen, the foul play
10191: of these miscreants must come out.
10192: 
10193: “Upon hearing the frantic project of their leader, each in his own
10194: separate soul had suddenly lighted, it would seem, upon the same piece
10195: of treachery, namely: to be foremost in breaking out, in order to be
10196: the first of the three, though the last of the ten, to surrender; and
10197: thereby secure whatever small chance of pardon such conduct might
10198: merit. But when Steelkilt made known his determination still to lead
10199: them to the last, they in some way, by some subtle chemistry of
10200: villany, mixed their before secret treacheries together; and when their
10201: leader fell into a doze, verbally opened their souls to each other in
10202: three sentences; and bound the sleeper with cords, and gagged him with
10203: cords; and shrieked out for the Captain at midnight.
10204: 
10205: “Thinking murder at hand, and smelling in the dark for the blood, he
10206: and all his armed mates and harpooneers rushed for the forecastle. In a
10207: few minutes the scuttle was opened, and, bound hand and foot, the still
10208: struggling ringleader was shoved up into the air by his perfidious
10209: allies, who at once claimed the honor of securing a man who had been
10210: fully ripe for murder. But all these were collared, and dragged along
10211: the deck like dead cattle; and, side by side, were seized up into the
10212: mizzen rigging, like three quarters of meat, and there they hung till
10213: morning. ‘Damn ye,’ cried the Captain, pacing to and fro before them,
10214: ‘the vultures would not touch ye, ye villains!’
10215: 
10216: “At sunrise he summoned all hands; and separating those who had
10217: rebelled from those who had taken no part in the mutiny, he told the
10218: former that he had a good mind to flog them all round—thought, upon the
10219: whole, he would do so—he ought to—justice demanded it; but for the
10220: present, considering their timely surrender, he would let them go with
10221: a reprimand, which he accordingly administered in the vernacular.
10222: 
10223: “‘But as for you, ye carrion rogues,’ turning to the three men in the
10224: rigging—‘for you, I mean to mince ye up for the try-pots;’ and, seizing
10225: a rope, he applied it with all his might to the backs of the two
10226: traitors, till they yelled no more, but lifelessly hung their heads
10227: sideways, as the two crucified thieves are drawn.
10228: 
10229: “‘My wrist is sprained with ye!’ he cried, at last; ‘but there is still
10230: rope enough left for you, my fine bantam, that wouldn’t give up. Take
10231: that gag from his mouth, and let us hear what he can say for himself.’
10232: 
10233: “For a moment the exhausted mutineer made a tremulous motion of his
10234: cramped jaws, and then painfully twisting round his head, said in a
10235: sort of hiss, ‘What I say is this—and mind it well—if you flog me, I
10236: murder you!’
10237: 
10238: “‘Say ye so? then see how ye frighten me’—and the Captain drew off with
10239: the rope to strike.
10240: 
10241: “‘Best not,’ hissed the Lakeman.
10242: 
10243: “‘But I must,’—and the rope was once more drawn back for the stroke.
10244: 
10245: “Steelkilt here hissed out something, inaudible to all but the Captain;
10246: who, to the amazement of all hands, started back, paced the deck
10247: rapidly two or three times, and then suddenly throwing down his rope,
10248: said, ‘I won’t do it—let him go—cut him down: d’ye hear?’
10249: 
10250: “But as the junior mates were hurrying to execute the order, a pale
10251: man, with a bandaged head, arrested them—Radney the chief mate. Ever
10252: since the blow, he had lain in his berth; but that morning, hearing the
10253: tumult on the deck, he had crept out, and thus far had watched the
10254: whole scene. Such was the state of his mouth, that he could hardly
10255: speak; but mumbling something about _his_ being willing and able to do
10256: what the captain dared not attempt, he snatched the rope and advanced
10257: to his pinioned foe.
10258: 
10259: “‘You are a coward!’ hissed the Lakeman.
10260: 
10261: “‘So I am, but take that.’ The mate was in the very act of striking,
10262: when another hiss stayed his uplifted arm. He paused: and then pausing
10263: no more, made good his word, spite of Steelkilt’s threat, whatever that
10264: might have been. The three men were then cut down, all hands were
10265: turned to, and, sullenly worked by the moody seamen, the iron pumps
10266: clanged as before.
10267: 
10268: “Just after dark that day, when one watch had retired below, a clamor
10269: was heard in the forecastle; and the two trembling traitors running up,
10270: besieged the cabin door, saying they durst not consort with the crew.
10271: Entreaties, cuffs, and kicks could not drive them back, so at their own
10272: instance they were put down in the ship’s run for salvation. Still, no
10273: sign of mutiny reappeared among the rest. On the contrary, it seemed,
10274: that mainly at Steelkilt’s instigation, they had resolved to maintain
10275: the strictest peacefulness, obey all orders to the last, and, when the
10276: ship reached port, desert her in a body. But in order to insure the
10277: speediest end to the voyage, they all agreed to another thing—namely,
10278: not to sing out for whales, in case any should be discovered. For,
10279: spite of her leak, and spite of all her other perils, the Town-Ho still
10280: maintained her mast-heads, and her captain was just as willing to lower
10281: for a fish that moment, as on the day his craft first struck the
10282: cruising ground; and Radney the mate was quite as ready to change his
10283: berth for a boat, and with his bandaged mouth seek to gag in death the
10284: vital jaw of the whale.
10285: 
10286: “But though the Lakeman had induced the seamen to adopt this sort of
10287: passiveness in their conduct, he kept his own counsel (at least till
10288: all was over) concerning his own proper and private revenge upon the
10289: man who had stung him in the ventricles of his heart. He was in Radney
10290: the chief mate’s watch; and as if the infatuated man sought to run more
10291: than half way to meet his doom, after the scene at the rigging, he
10292: insisted, against the express counsel of the captain, upon resuming the
10293: head of his watch at night. Upon this, and one or two other
10294: circumstances, Steelkilt systematically built the plan of his revenge.
10295: 
10296: “During the night, Radney had an unseamanlike way of sitting on the
10297: bulwarks of the quarter-deck, and leaning his arm upon the gunwale of
10298: the boat which was hoisted up there, a little above the ship’s side. In
10299: this attitude, it was well known, he sometimes dozed. There was a
10300: considerable vacancy between the boat and the ship, and down between
10301: this was the sea. Steelkilt calculated his time, and found that his
10302: next trick at the helm would come round at two o’clock, in the morning
10303: of the third day from that in which he had been betrayed. At his
10304: leisure, he employed the interval in braiding something very carefully
10305: in his watches below.
10306: 
10307: “‘What are you making there?’ said a shipmate.
10308: 
10309: “‘What do you think? what does it look like?’
10310: 
10311: “‘Like a lanyard for your bag; but it’s an odd one, seems to me.’
10312: 
10313: “‘Yes, rather oddish,’ said the Lakeman, holding it at arm’s length
10314: before him; ‘but I think it will answer. Shipmate, I haven’t enough
10315: twine,—have you any?’
10316: 
10317: “But there was none in the forecastle.
10318: 
10319: “‘Then I must get some from old Rad;’ and he rose to go aft.
10320: 
10321: “‘You don’t mean to go a begging to _him!_’ said a sailor.
10322: 
10323: “‘Why not? Do you think he won’t do me a turn, when it’s to help
10324: himself in the end, shipmate?’ and going to the mate, he looked at him
10325: quietly, and asked him for some twine to mend his hammock. It was given
10326: him—neither twine nor lanyard were seen again; but the next night an
10327: iron ball, closely netted, partly rolled from the pocket of the
10328: Lakeman’s monkey jacket, as he was tucking the coat into his hammock
10329: for a pillow. Twenty-four hours after, his trick at the silent
10330: helm—nigh to the man who was apt to doze over the grave always ready
10331: dug to the seaman’s hand—that fatal hour was then to come; and in the
10332: fore-ordaining soul of Steelkilt, the mate was already stark and
10333: stretched as a corpse, with his forehead crushed in.
10334: 
10335: “But, gentlemen, a fool saved the would-be murderer from the bloody
10336: deed he had planned. Yet complete revenge he had, and without being the
10337: avenger. For by a mysterious fatality, Heaven itself seemed to step in
10338: to take out of his hands into its own the damning thing he would have
10339: done.
10340: 
10341: “It was just between daybreak and sunrise of the morning of the second
10342: day, when they were washing down the decks, that a stupid Teneriffe
10343: man, drawing water in the main-chains, all at once shouted out, ‘There
10344: she rolls! there she rolls!’ Jesu, what a whale! It was Moby Dick.
10345: 
10346: “‘Moby Dick!’ cried Don Sebastian; ‘St. Dominic! Sir sailor, but do
10347: whales have christenings? Whom call you Moby Dick?’
10348: 
10349: “‘A very white, and famous, and most deadly immortal monster, Don;—but
10350: that would be too long a story.’
10351: 
10352: “‘How? how?’ cried all the young Spaniards, crowding.
10353: 
10354: “‘Nay, Dons, Dons—nay, nay! I cannot rehearse that now. Let me get more
10355: into the air, Sirs.’
10356: 
10357: “‘The chicha! the chicha!’ cried Don Pedro; ‘our vigorous friend looks
10358: faint;—fill up his empty glass!’
10359: 
10360: “No need, gentlemen; one moment, and I proceed.—Now, gentlemen, so
10361: suddenly perceiving the snowy whale within fifty yards of the
10362: ship—forgetful of the compact among the crew—in the excitement of the
10363: moment, the Teneriffe man had instinctively and involuntarily lifted
10364: his voice for the monster, though for some little time past it had been
10365: plainly beheld from the three sullen mast-heads. All was now a phrensy.
10366: ‘The White Whale—the White Whale!’ was the cry from captain, mates, and
10367: harpooneers, who, undeterred by fearful rumours, were all anxious to
10368: capture so famous and precious a fish; while the dogged crew eyed
10369: askance, and with curses, the appalling beauty of the vast milky mass,
10370: that lit up by a horizontal spangling sun, shifted and glistened like a
10371: living opal in the blue morning sea. Gentlemen, a strange fatality
10372: pervades the whole career of these events, as if verily mapped out
10373: before the world itself was charted. The mutineer was the bowsman of
10374: the mate, and when fast to a fish, it was his duty to sit next him,
10375: while Radney stood up with his lance in the prow, and haul in or
10376: slacken the line, at the word of command. Moreover, when the four boats
10377: were lowered, the mate’s got the start; and none howled more fiercely
10378: with delight than did Steelkilt, as he strained at his oar. After a
10379: stiff pull, their harpooneer got fast, and, spear in hand, Radney
10380: sprang to the bow. He was always a furious man, it seems, in a boat.
10381: And now his bandaged cry was, to beach him on the whale’s topmost back.
10382: Nothing loath, his bowsman hauled him up and up, through a blinding
10383: foam that blent two whitenesses together; till of a sudden the boat
10384: struck as against a sunken ledge, and keeling over, spilled out the
10385: standing mate. That instant, as he fell on the whale’s slippery back,
10386: the boat righted, and was dashed aside by the swell, while Radney was
10387: tossed over into the sea, on the other flank of the whale. He struck
10388: out through the spray, and, for an instant, was dimly seen through that
10389: veil, wildly seeking to remove himself from the eye of Moby Dick. But
10390: the whale rushed round in a sudden maelstrom; seized the swimmer
10391: between his jaws; and rearing high up with him, plunged headlong again,
10392: and went down.
10393: 
10394: “Meantime, at the first tap of the boat’s bottom, the Lakeman had
10395: slackened the line, so as to drop astern from the whirlpool; calmly
10396: looking on, he thought his own thoughts. But a sudden, terrific,
10397: downward jerking of the boat, quickly brought his knife to the line. He
10398: cut it; and the whale was free. But, at some distance, Moby Dick rose
10399: again, with some tatters of Radney’s red woollen shirt, caught in the
10400: teeth that had destroyed him. All four boats gave chase again; but the
10401: whale eluded them, and finally wholly disappeared.
10402: 
10403: “In good time, the Town-Ho reached her port—a savage, solitary
10404: place—where no civilized creature resided. There, headed by the
10405: Lakeman, all but five or six of the foremastmen deliberately deserted
10406: among the palms; eventually, as it turned out, seizing a large double
10407: war-canoe of the savages, and setting sail for some other harbor.
10408: 
10409: “The ship’s company being reduced to but a handful, the captain called
10410: upon the Islanders to assist him in the laborious business of heaving
10411: down the ship to stop the leak. But to such unresting vigilance over
10412: their dangerous allies was this small band of whites necessitated, both
10413: by night and by day, and so extreme was the hard work they underwent,
10414: that upon the vessel being ready again for sea, they were in such a
10415: weakened condition that the captain durst not put off with them in so
10416: heavy a vessel. After taking counsel with his officers, he anchored the
10417: ship as far off shore as possible; loaded and ran out his two cannon
10418: from the bows; stacked his muskets on the poop; and warning the
10419: Islanders not to approach the ship at their peril, took one man with
10420: him, and setting the sail of his best whale-boat, steered straight
10421: before the wind for Tahiti, five hundred miles distant, to procure a
10422: reinforcement to his crew.
10423: 
10424: “On the fourth day of the sail, a large canoe was descried, which
10425: seemed to have touched at a low isle of corals. He steered away from
10426: it; but the savage craft bore down on him; and soon the voice of
10427: Steelkilt hailed him to heave to, or he would run him under water. The
10428: captain presented a pistol. With one foot on each prow of the yoked
10429: war-canoes, the Lakeman laughed him to scorn; assuring him that if the
10430: pistol so much as clicked in the lock, he would bury him in bubbles and
10431: foam.
10432: 
10433: “‘What do you want of me?’ cried the captain.
10434: 
10435: “‘Where are you bound? and for what are you bound?’ demanded Steelkilt;
10436: ‘no lies.’
10437: 
10438: “‘I am bound to Tahiti for more men.’
10439: 
10440: “‘Very good. Let me board you a moment—I come in peace.’ With that he
10441: leaped from the canoe, swam to the boat; and climbing the gunwale,
10442: stood face to face with the captain.
10443: 
10444: “‘Cross your arms, sir; throw back your head. Now, repeat after me. As
10445: soon as Steelkilt leaves me, I swear to beach this boat on yonder
10446: island, and remain there six days. If I do not, may lightnings strike
10447: me!’
10448: 
10449: “‘A pretty scholar,’ laughed the Lakeman. ‘Adios, Senor!’ and leaping
10450: into the sea, he swam back to his comrades.
10451: 
10452: “Watching the boat till it was fairly beached, and drawn up to the
10453: roots of the cocoa-nut trees, Steelkilt made sail again, and in due
10454: time arrived at Tahiti, his own place of destination. There, luck
10455: befriended him; two ships were about to sail for France, and were
10456: providentially in want of precisely that number of men which the sailor
