20439: his hat slouched heavily over his eyes; so that however motionless he
20440: stood, however the days and nights were added on, that he had not swung
20441: in his hammock; yet hidden beneath that slouching hat, they could never
20442: tell unerringly whether, for all this, his eyes were really closed at
20443: times; or whether he was still intently scanning them; no matter,
20444: though he stood so in the scuttle for a whole hour on the stretch, and
20445: the unheeded night-damp gathered in beads of dew upon that stone-carved
20446: coat and hat. The clothes that the night had wet, the next day’s
20447: sunshine dried upon him; and so, day after day, and night after night;
20448: he went no more beneath the planks; whatever he wanted from the cabin
20449: that thing he sent for.
20450: 
20451: He ate in the same open air; that is, his two only meals,—breakfast and
20452: dinner: supper he never touched; nor reaped his beard; which darkly
20453: grew all gnarled, as unearthed roots of trees blown over, which still
20454: grow idly on at naked base, though perished in the upper verdure. But
20455: though his whole life was now become one watch on deck; and though the
20456: Parsee’s mystic watch was without intermission as his own; yet these
20457: two never seemed to speak—one man to the other—unless at long intervals
20458: some passing unmomentous matter made it necessary. Though such a potent
20459: spell seemed secretly to join the twain; openly, and to the awe-struck
20460: crew, they seemed pole-like asunder. If by day they chanced to speak
20461: one word; by night, dumb men were both, so far as concerned the
20462: slightest verbal interchange. At times, for longest hours, without a
20463: single hail, they stood far parted in the starlight; Ahab in his
20464: scuttle, the Parsee by the mainmast; but still fixedly gazing upon each
20465: other; as if in the Parsee Ahab saw his forethrown shadow, in Ahab the
20466: Parsee his abandoned substance.
20467: 
20468: And yet, somehow, did Ahab—in his own proper self, as daily, hourly,
20469: and every instant, commandingly revealed to his subordinates,—Ahab
20470: seemed an independent lord; the Parsee but his slave. Still again both
20471: seemed yoked together, and an unseen tyrant driving them; the lean
20472: shade siding the solid rib. For be this Parsee what he may, all rib and
20473: keel was solid Ahab.
20474: 
20475: At the first faintest glimmering of the dawn, his iron voice was heard
20476: from aft,—“Man the mast-heads!”—and all through the day, till after
20477: sunset and after twilight, the same voice every hour, at the striking
20478: of the helmsman’s bell, was heard—“What d’ye see?—sharp! sharp!”
20479: 
20480: But when three or four days had slided by, after meeting the
20481: children-seeking Rachel; and no spout had yet been seen; the monomaniac
20482: old man seemed distrustful of his crew’s fidelity; at least, of nearly
20483: all except the Pagan harpooneers; he seemed to doubt, even, whether
20484: Stubb and Flask might not willingly overlook the sight he sought. But
20485: if these suspicions were really his, he sagaciously refrained from
20486: verbally expressing them, however his actions might seem to hint them.
20487: 
20488: “I will have the first sight of the whale myself,”—he said. “Aye! Ahab
20489: must have the doubloon!” and with his own hands he rigged a nest of
20490: basketed bowlines; and sending a hand aloft, with a single sheaved
20491: block, to secure to the main-mast head, he received the two ends of the
20492: downward-reeved rope; and attaching one to his basket prepared a pin
20493: for the other end, in order to fasten it at the rail. This done, with
20494: that end yet in his hand and standing beside the pin, he looked round
20495: upon his crew, sweeping from one to the other; pausing his glance long
20496: upon Daggoo, Queequeg, Tashtego; but shunning Fedallah; and then
20497: settling his firm relying eye upon the chief mate, said,—“Take the
20498: rope, sir—I give it into thy hands, Starbuck.” Then arranging his
20499: person in the basket, he gave the word for them to hoist him to his
20500: perch, Starbuck being the one who secured the rope at last; and
20501: afterwards stood near it. And thus, with one hand clinging round the
20502: royal mast, Ahab gazed abroad upon the sea for miles and miles,—ahead,
20503: astern, this side, and that,—within the wide expanded circle commanded
20504: at so great a height.
20505: 
20506: When in working with his hands at some lofty almost isolated place in
20507: the rigging, which chances to afford no foothold, the sailor at sea is
20508: hoisted up to that spot, and sustained there by the rope; under these
20509: circumstances, its fastened end on deck is always given in strict
20510: charge to some one man who has the special watch of it. Because in such
20511: a wilderness of running rigging, whose various different relations
20512: aloft cannot always be infallibly discerned by what is seen of them at
20513: the deck; and when the deck-ends of these ropes are being every few
20514: minutes cast down from the fastenings, it would be but a natural
20515: fatality, if, unprovided with a constant watchman, the hoisted sailor
20516: should by some carelessness of the crew be cast adrift and fall all
20517: swooping to the sea. So Ahab’s proceedings in this matter were not
20518: unusual; the only strange thing about them seemed to be, that Starbuck,
20519: almost the one only man who had ever ventured to oppose him with
20520: anything in the slightest degree approaching to decision—one of those
20521: too, whose faithfulness on the look-out he had seemed to doubt
20522: somewhat;—it was strange, that this was the very man he should select
20523: for his watchman; freely giving his whole life into such an otherwise
20524: distrusted person’s hands.
20525: 
20526: Now, the first time Ahab was perched aloft; ere he had been there ten
20527: minutes; one of those red-billed savage sea-hawks which so often fly
20528: incommodiously close round the manned mast-heads of whalemen in these
20529: latitudes; one of these birds came wheeling and screaming round his
20530: head in a maze of untrackably swift circlings. Then it darted a
20531: thousand feet straight up into the air; then spiralized downwards, and
20532: went eddying again round his head.
20533: 
20534: But with his gaze fixed upon the dim and distant horizon, Ahab seemed
20535: not to mark this wild bird; nor, indeed, would any one else have marked
20536: it much, it being no uncommon circumstance; only now almost the least
20537: heedful eye seemed to see some sort of cunning meaning in almost every
20538: sight.
20539: 
20540: “Your hat, your hat, sir!” suddenly cried the Sicilian seaman, who
20541: being posted at the mizen-mast-head, stood directly behind Ahab, though
20542: somewhat lower than his level, and with a deep gulf of air dividing
20543: them.
20544: 
20545: But already the sable wing was before the old man’s eyes; the long
20546: hooked bill at his head: with a scream, the black hawk darted away with
20547: his prize.
20548: 
20549: An eagle flew thrice round Tarquin’s head, removing his cap to replace
20550: it, and thereupon Tanaquil, his wife, declared that Tarquin would be
20551: king of Rome. But only by the replacing of the cap was that omen
20552: accounted good. Ahab’s hat was never restored; the wild hawk flew on
20553: and on with it; far in advance of the prow: and at last disappeared;
20554: while from the point of that disappearance, a minute black spot was
20555: dimly discerned, falling from that vast height into the sea.
20556: 
20557: 
20558: CHAPTER 131. The Pequod Meets The Delight.
20559: 
20560: The intense Pequod sailed on; the rolling waves and days went by; the
20561: life-buoy-coffin still lightly swung; and another ship, most miserably
20562: misnamed the Delight, was descried. As she drew nigh, all eyes were
20563: fixed upon her broad beams, called shears, which, in some
20564: whaling-ships, cross the quarter-deck at the height of eight or nine
20565: feet; serving to carry the spare, unrigged, or disabled boats.
20566: 
20567: Upon the stranger’s shears were beheld the shattered, white ribs, and
20568: some few splintered planks, of what had once been a whale-boat; but you
20569: now saw through this wreck, as plainly as you see through the peeled,
20570: half-unhinged, and bleaching skeleton of a horse.
20571: 
20572: “Hast seen the White Whale?”
20573: 
20574: “Look!” replied the hollow-cheeked captain from his taffrail; and with
20575: his trumpet he pointed to the wreck.
20576: 
20577: “Hast killed him?”
20578: 
20579: “The harpoon is not yet forged that ever will do that,” answered the
20580: other, sadly glancing upon a rounded hammock on the deck, whose
20581: gathered sides some noiseless sailors were busy in sewing together.
20582: 
20583: “Not forged!” and snatching Perth’s levelled iron from the crotch, Ahab
20584: held it out, exclaiming—“Look ye, Nantucketer; here in this hand I hold
20585: his death! Tempered in blood, and tempered by lightning are these
20586: barbs; and I swear to temper them triply in that hot place behind the
20587: fin, where the White Whale most feels his accursed life!”
20588: 
20589: “Then God keep thee, old man—see’st thou that”—pointing to the
20590: hammock—“I bury but one of five stout men, who were alive only
20591: yesterday; but were dead ere night. Only _that_ one I bury; the rest
20592: were buried before they died; you sail upon their tomb.” Then turning
20593: to his crew—“Are ye ready there? place the plank then on the rail, and
20594: lift the body; so, then—Oh! God”—advancing towards the hammock with
20595: uplifted hands—“may the resurrection and the life——”
20596: 
20597: “Brace forward! Up helm!” cried Ahab like lightning to his men.
20598: 
20599: But the suddenly started Pequod was not quick enough to escape the
20600: sound of the splash that the corpse soon made as it struck the sea; not
20601: so quick, indeed, but that some of the flying bubbles might have
20602: sprinkled her hull with their ghostly baptism.
20603: 
20604: As Ahab now glided from the dejected Delight, the strange life-buoy
20605: hanging at the Pequod’s stern came into conspicuous relief.
20606: 
20607: “Ha! yonder! look yonder, men!” cried a foreboding voice in her wake.
20608: “In vain, oh, ye strangers, ye fly our sad burial; ye but turn us your
20609: taffrail to show us your coffin!”
20610: 
20611: 
20612: CHAPTER 132. The Symphony.
20613: 
20614: It was a clear steel-blue day. The firmaments of air and sea were
20615: hardly separable in that all-pervading azure; only, the pensive air was
20616: transparently pure and soft, with a woman’s look, and the robust and
20617: man-like sea heaved with long, strong, lingering swells, as Samson’s
20618: chest in his sleep.
20619: 
20620: Hither, and thither, on high, glided the snow-white wings of small,
20621: unspeckled birds; these were the gentle thoughts of the feminine air;
20622: but to and fro in the deeps, far down in the bottomless blue, rushed
20623: mighty leviathans, sword-fish, and sharks; and these were the strong,
20624: troubled, murderous thinkings of the masculine sea.
20625: 
20626: But though thus contrasting within, the contrast was only in shades and
20627: shadows without; those two seemed one; it was only the sex, as it were,
20628: that distinguished them.
20629: 
20630: Aloft, like a royal czar and king, the sun seemed giving this gentle
20631: air to this bold and rolling sea; even as bride to groom. And at the
20632: girdling line of the horizon, a soft and tremulous motion—most seen
20633: here at the equator—denoted the fond, throbbing trust, the loving
20634: alarms, with which the poor bride gave her bosom away.
20635: 
20636: Tied up and twisted; gnarled and knotted with wrinkles; haggardly firm
20637: and unyielding; his eyes glowing like coals, that still glow in the
20638: ashes of ruin; untottering Ahab stood forth in the clearness of the
20639: morn; lifting his splintered helmet of a brow to the fair girl’s
20640: forehead of heaven.
20641: 
20642: Oh, immortal infancy, and innocency of the azure! Invisible winged
20643: creatures that frolic all round us! Sweet childhood of air and sky! how
20644: oblivious were ye of old Ahab’s close-coiled woe! But so have I seen
20645: little Miriam and Martha, laughing-eyed elves, heedlessly gambol around
20646: their old sire; sporting with the circle of singed locks which grew on
20647: the marge of that burnt-out crater of his brain.
20648: 
20649: Slowly crossing the deck from the scuttle, Ahab leaned over the side
20650: and watched how his shadow in the water sank and sank to his gaze, the
20651: more and the more that he strove to pierce the profundity. But the
20652: lovely aromas in that enchanted air did at last seem to dispel, for a
20653: moment, the cankerous thing in his soul. That glad, happy air, that
20654: winsome sky, did at last stroke and caress him; the step-mother world,
20655: so long cruel—forbidding—now threw affectionate arms round his stubborn
20656: neck, and did seem to joyously sob over him, as if over one, that
20657: however wilful and erring, she could yet find it in her heart to save
20658: and to bless. From beneath his slouched hat Ahab dropped a tear into
20659: the sea; nor did all the Pacific contain such wealth as that one wee
20660: drop.
20661: 
20662: Starbuck saw the old man; saw him, how he heavily leaned over the side;
20663: and he seemed to hear in his own true heart the measureless sobbing
20664: that stole out of the centre of the serenity around. Careful not to
20665: touch him, or be noticed by him, he yet drew near to him, and stood
20666: there.
20667: 
20668: Ahab turned.
20669: 
20670: “Starbuck!”
20671: 
20672: “Sir.”
20673: 
20674: “Oh, Starbuck! it is a mild, mild wind, and a mild looking sky. On such
20675: a day—very much such a sweetness as this—I struck my first whale—a
20676: boy-harpooneer of eighteen! Forty—forty—forty years ago!—ago! Forty
20677: years of continual whaling! forty years of privation, and peril, and
20678: storm-time! forty years on the pitiless sea! for forty years has Ahab
20679: forsaken the peaceful land, for forty years to make war on the horrors
20680: of the deep! Aye and yes, Starbuck, out of those forty years I have not
20681: spent three ashore. When I think of this life I have led; the
20682: desolation of solitude it has been; the masoned, walled-town of a
20683: Captain’s exclusiveness, which admits but small entrance to any
20684: sympathy from the green country without—oh, weariness! heaviness!
20685: Guinea-coast slavery of solitary command!—when I think of all this;
20686: only half-suspected, not so keenly known to me before—and how for forty
20687: years I have fed upon dry salted fare—fit emblem of the dry nourishment
20688: of my soil!—when the poorest landsman has had fresh fruit to his daily
20689: hand, and broken the world’s fresh bread to my mouldy crusts—away,
20690: whole oceans away, from that young girl-wife I wedded past fifty, and
20691: sailed for Cape Horn the next day, leaving but one dent in my marriage
20692: pillow—wife? wife?—rather a widow with her husband alive! Aye, I
20693: widowed that poor girl when I married her, Starbuck; and then, the
20694: madness, the frenzy, the boiling blood and the smoking brow, with
20695: which, for a thousand lowerings old Ahab has furiously, foamingly
20696: chased his prey—more a demon than a man!—aye, aye! what a forty years’
20697: fool—fool—old fool, has old Ahab been! Why this strife of the chase?
20698: why weary, and palsy the arm at the oar, and the iron, and the lance?
20699: how the richer or better is Ahab now? Behold. Oh, Starbuck! is it not
20700: hard, that with this weary load I bear, one poor leg should have been
20701: snatched from under me? Here, brush this old hair aside; it blinds me,
20702: that I seem to weep. Locks so grey did never grow but from out some
20703: ashes! But do I look very old, so very, very old, Starbuck? I feel
20704: deadly faint, bowed, and humped, as though I were Adam, staggering
20705: beneath the piled centuries since Paradise. God! God! God!—crack my
20706: heart!—stave my brain!—mockery! mockery! bitter, biting mockery of grey
20707: hairs, have I lived enough joy to wear ye; and seem and feel thus
20708: intolerably old? Close! stand close to me, Starbuck; let me look into a
20709: human eye; it is better than to gaze into sea or sky; better than to
20710: gaze upon God. By the green land; by the bright hearth-stone! this is
20711: the magic glass, man; I see my wife and my child in thine eye. No, no;
20712: stay on board, on board!—lower not when I do; when branded Ahab gives
20713: chase to Moby Dick. That hazard shall not be thine. No, no! not with
20714: the far away home I see in that eye!”
20715: 
20716: “Oh, my Captain! my Captain! noble soul! grand old heart, after all!
20717: why should any one give chase to that hated fish! Away with me! let us
20718: fly these deadly waters! let us home! Wife and child, too, are
20719: Starbuck’s—wife and child of his brotherly, sisterly, play-fellow
20720: youth; even as thine, sir, are the wife and child of thy loving,
20721: longing, paternal old age! Away! let us away!—this instant let me alter
20722: the course! How cheerily, how hilariously, O my Captain, would we bowl
20723: on our way to see old Nantucket again! I think, sir, they have some
20724: such mild blue days, even as this, in Nantucket.”
20725: 
20726: “They have, they have. I have seen them—some summer days in the
20727: morning. About this time—yes, it is his noon nap now—the boy
20728: vivaciously wakes; sits up in bed; and his mother tells him of me, of
20729: cannibal old me; how I am abroad upon the deep, but will yet come back
20730: to dance him again.”
20731: 
20732: “’Tis my Mary, my Mary herself! She promised that my boy, every
20733: morning, should be carried to the hill to catch the first glimpse of
20734: his father’s sail! Yes, yes! no more! it is done! we head for
20735: Nantucket! Come, my Captain, study out the course, and let us away!
20736: See, see! the boy’s face from the window! the boy’s hand on the hill!”
20737: 
20738: But Ahab’s glance was averted; like a blighted fruit tree he shook, and
20739: cast his last, cindered apple to the soil.
20740: 
20741: “What is it, what nameless, inscrutable, unearthly thing is it; what
20742: cozening, hidden lord and master, and cruel, remorseless emperor
20743: commands me; that against all natural lovings and longings, I so keep
20744: pushing, and crowding, and jamming myself on all the time; recklessly
20745: making me ready to do what in my own proper, natural heart, I durst not
20746: so much as dare? Is Ahab, Ahab? Is it I, God, or who, that lifts this
20747: arm? But if the great sun move not of himself; but is as an errand-boy
20748: in heaven; nor one single star can revolve, but by some invisible
20749: power; how then can this one small heart beat; this one small brain
20750: think thoughts; unless God does that beating, does that thinking, does
20751: that living, and not I. By heaven, man, we are turned round and round
20752: in this world, like yonder windlass, and Fate is the handspike. And all
20753: the time, lo! that smiling sky, and this unsounded sea! Look! see yon
20754: Albicore! who put it into him to chase and fang that flying-fish? Where
20755: do murderers go, man! Who’s to doom, when the judge himself is dragged
20756: to the bar? But it is a mild, mild wind, and a mild looking sky; and
20757: the air smells now, as if it blew from a far-away meadow; they have
20758: been making hay somewhere under the slopes of the Andes, Starbuck, and
20759: the mowers are sleeping among the new-mown hay. Sleeping? Aye, toil we
20760: how we may, we all sleep at last on the field. Sleep? Aye, and rust
20761: amid greenness; as last year’s scythes flung down, and left in the
20762: half-cut swaths—Starbuck!”
20763: 
20764: But blanched to a corpse’s hue with despair, the Mate had stolen away.
20765: 
20766: Ahab crossed the deck to gaze over on the other side; but started at
20767: two reflected, fixed eyes in the water there. Fedallah was motionlessly
20768: leaning over the same rail.
20769: 
20770: 
20771: CHAPTER 133. The Chase—First Day.
20772: 
20773: That night, in the mid-watch, when the old man—as his wont at
20774: intervals—stepped forth from the scuttle in which he leaned, and went
20775: to his pivot-hole, he suddenly thrust out his face fiercely, snuffing
20776: up the sea air as a sagacious ship’s dog will, in drawing nigh to some
20777: barbarous isle. He declared that a whale must be near. Soon that
20778: peculiar odor, sometimes to a great distance given forth by the living
20779: sperm whale, was palpable to all the watch; nor was any mariner
20780: surprised when, after inspecting the compass, and then the dog-vane,
20781: and then ascertaining the precise bearing of the odor as nearly as
20782: possible, Ahab rapidly ordered the ship’s course to be slightly
20783: altered, and the sail to be shortened.
20784: 
20785: The acute policy dictating these movements was sufficiently vindicated
20786: at daybreak, by the sight of a long sleek on the sea directly and
20787: lengthwise ahead, smooth as oil, and resembling in the pleated watery
20788: wrinkles bordering it, the polished metallic-like marks of some swift
20789: tide-rip, at the mouth of a deep, rapid stream.
20790: 
20791: “Man the mast-heads! Call all hands!”
20792: 
20793: Thundering with the butts of three clubbed handspikes on the forecastle
20794: deck, Daggoo roused the sleepers with such judgment claps that they
20795: seemed to exhale from the scuttle, so instantaneously did they appear
20796: with their clothes in their hands.
20797: 
20798: “What d’ye see?” cried Ahab, flattening his face to the sky.
20799: 
20800: “Nothing, nothing sir!” was the sound hailing down in reply.
20801: 
20802: “T’gallant sails!—stunsails! alow and aloft, and on both sides!”
20803: 
20804: All sail being set, he now cast loose the life-line, reserved for
20805: swaying him to the main royal-mast head; and in a few moments they were
20806: hoisting him thither, when, while but two thirds of the way aloft, and
20807: while peering ahead through the horizontal vacancy between the
20808: main-top-sail and top-gallant-sail, he raised a gull-like cry in the
20809: air. “There she blows!—there she blows! A hump like a snow-hill! It is
20810: Moby Dick!”
20811: 
20812: Fired by the cry which seemed simultaneously taken up by the three
20813: look-outs, the men on deck rushed to the rigging to behold the famous
20814: whale they had so long been pursuing. Ahab had now gained his final
20815: perch, some feet above the other look-outs, Tashtego standing just
20816: beneath him on the cap of the top-gallant-mast, so that the Indian’s
20817: head was almost on a level with Ahab’s heel. From this height the whale
20818: was now seen some mile or so ahead, at every roll of the sea revealing
20819: his high sparkling hump, and regularly jetting his silent spout into
20820: the air. To the credulous mariners it seemed the same silent spout they
20821: had so long ago beheld in the moonlit Atlantic and Indian Oceans.
20822: 
20823: “And did none of ye see it before?” cried Ahab, hailing the perched men
20824: all around him.
20825: 
20826: “I saw him almost that same instant, sir, that Captain Ahab did, and I
20827: cried out,” said Tashtego.
20828: 
20829: “Not the same instant; not the same—no, the doubloon is mine, Fate
20830: reserved the doubloon for me. _I_ only; none of ye could have raised
20831: the White Whale first. There she blows!—there she blows!—there she
20832: blows! There again!—there again!” he cried, in long-drawn, lingering,
20833: methodic tones, attuned to the gradual prolongings of the whale’s
20834: visible jets. “He’s going to sound! In stunsails! Down
20835: top-gallant-sails! Stand by three boats. Mr. Starbuck, remember, stay
20836: on board, and keep the ship. Helm there! Luff, luff a point! So;
20837: steady, man, steady! There go flukes! No, no; only black water! All
20838: ready the boats there? Stand by, stand by! Lower me, Mr. Starbuck;
20839: lower, lower,—quick, quicker!” and he slid through the air to the deck.
20840: 
20841: “He is heading straight to leeward, sir,” cried Stubb, “right away from
20842: us; cannot have seen the ship yet.”
20843: 
20844: “Be dumb, man! Stand by the braces! Hard down the helm!—brace up!
20845: Shiver her!—shiver her!—So; well that! Boats, boats!”
20846: 
20847: Soon all the boats but Starbuck’s were dropped; all the boat-sails
20848: set—all the paddles plying; with rippling swiftness, shooting to
20849: leeward; and Ahab heading the onset. A pale, death-glimmer lit up
20850: Fedallah’s sunken eyes; a hideous motion gnawed his mouth.
20851: 
20852: Like noiseless nautilus shells, their light prows sped through the sea;
20853: but only slowly they neared the foe. As they neared him, the ocean grew
20854: still more smooth; seemed drawing a carpet over its waves; seemed a
20855: noon-meadow, so serenely it spread. At length the breathless hunter
20856: came so nigh his seemingly unsuspecting prey, that his entire dazzling
20857: hump was distinctly visible, sliding along the sea as if an isolated
20858: thing, and continually set in a revolving ring of finest, fleecy,
20859: greenish foam. He saw the vast, involved wrinkles of the slightly
20860: projecting head beyond. Before it, far out on the soft Turkish-rugged
20861: waters, went the glistening white shadow from his broad, milky
20862: forehead, a musical rippling playfully accompanying the shade; and
20863: behind, the blue waters interchangeably flowed over into the moving
20864: valley of his steady wake; and on either hand bright bubbles arose and
20865: danced by his side. But these were broken again by the light toes of
20866: hundreds of gay fowl softly feathering the sea, alternate with their
20867: fitful flight; and like to some flag-staff rising from the painted hull
20868: of an argosy, the tall but shattered pole of a recent lance projected
20869: from the white whale’s back; and at intervals one of the cloud of
20870: soft-toed fowls hovering, and to and fro skimming like a canopy over
20871: the fish, silently perched and rocked on this pole, the long tail
20872: feathers streaming like pennons.
20873: 
20874: A gentle joyousness—a mighty mildness of repose in swiftness, invested
20875: the gliding whale. Not the white bull Jupiter swimming away with
20876: ravished Europa clinging to his graceful horns; his lovely, leering
20877: eyes sideways intent upon the maid; with smooth bewitching fleetness,
20878: rippling straight for the nuptial bower in Crete; not Jove, not that
20879: great majesty Supreme! did surpass the glorified White Whale as he so
20880: divinely swam.
20881: 
20882: On each soft side—coincident with the parted swell, that but once
20883: leaving him, then flowed so wide away—on each bright side, the whale
20884: shed off enticings. No wonder there had been some among the hunters who
20885: namelessly transported and allured by all this serenity, had ventured
20886: to assail it; but had fatally found that quietude but the vesture of
20887: tornadoes. Yet calm, enticing calm, oh, whale! thou glidest on, to all
20888: who for the first time eye thee, no matter how many in that same way
20889: thou may’st have bejuggled and destroyed before.
20890: 
20891: And thus, through the serene tranquillities of the tropical sea, among
20892: waves whose hand-clappings were suspended by exceeding rapture, Moby
20893: Dick moved on, still withholding from sight the full terrors of his
20894: submerged trunk, entirely hiding the wrenched hideousness of his jaw.
20895: But soon the fore part of him slowly rose from the water; for an
20896: instant his whole marbleized body formed a high arch, like Virginia’s
20897: Natural Bridge, and warningly waving his bannered flukes in the air,
20898: the grand god revealed himself, sounded, and went out of sight.
20899: Hoveringly halting, and dipping on the wing, the white sea-fowls
20900: longingly lingered over the agitated pool that he left.
20901: 
20902: With oars apeak, and paddles down, the sheets of their sails adrift,
20903: the three boats now stilly floated, awaiting Moby Dick’s reappearance.
20904: 
20905: “An hour,” said Ahab, standing rooted in his boat’s stern; and he gazed
20906: beyond the whale’s place, towards the dim blue spaces and wide wooing
20907: vacancies to leeward. It was only an instant; for again his eyes seemed
20908: whirling round in his head as he swept the watery circle. The breeze
20909: now freshened; the sea began to swell.
20910: 
20911: “The birds!—the birds!” cried Tashtego.
20912: 
20913: In long Indian file, as when herons take wing, the white birds were now
20914: all flying towards Ahab’s boat; and when within a few yards began
20915: fluttering over the water there, wheeling round and round, with joyous,
20916: expectant cries. Their vision was keener than man’s; Ahab could
20917: discover no sign in the sea. But suddenly as he peered down and down
20918: into its depths, he profoundly saw a white living spot no bigger than a
20919: white weasel, with wonderful celerity uprising, and magnifying as it
20920: rose, till it turned, and then there were plainly revealed two long
20921: crooked rows of white, glistening teeth, floating up from the
20922: undiscoverable bottom. It was Moby Dick’s open mouth and scrolled jaw;
20923: his vast, shadowed bulk still half blending with the blue of the sea.
20924: The glittering mouth yawned beneath the boat like an open-doored marble
20925: tomb; and giving one sidelong sweep with his steering oar, Ahab whirled
20926: the craft aside from this tremendous apparition. Then, calling upon
20927: Fedallah to change places with him, went forward to the bows, and
20928: seizing Perth’s harpoon, commanded his crew to grasp their oars and
20929: stand by to stern.
20930: 
20931: Now, by reason of this timely spinning round the boat upon its axis,
20932: its bow, by anticipation, was made to face the whale’s head while yet
20933: under water. But as if perceiving this stratagem, Moby Dick, with that
20934: malicious intelligence ascribed to him, sidelingly transplanted
20935: himself, as it were, in an instant, shooting his pleated head
20936: lengthwise beneath the boat.
20937: 
20938: Through and through; through every plank and each rib, it thrilled for
20939: an instant, the whale obliquely lying on his back, in the manner of a
20940: biting shark, slowly and feelingly taking its bows full within his
20941: mouth, so that the long, narrow, scrolled lower jaw curled high up into
20942: the open air, and one of the teeth caught in a row-lock. The bluish
20943: pearl-white of the inside of the jaw was within six inches of Ahab’s
20944: head, and reached higher than that. In this attitude the White Whale
20945: now shook the slight cedar as a mildly cruel cat her mouse. With
20946: unastonished eyes Fedallah gazed, and crossed his arms; but the
20947: tiger-yellow crew were tumbling over each other’s heads to gain the
20948: uttermost stern.
20949: 
20950: And now, while both elastic gunwales were springing in and out, as the
20951: whale dallied with the doomed craft in this devilish way; and from his
20952: body being submerged beneath the boat, he could not be darted at from
20953: the bows, for the bows were almost inside of him, as it were; and while
20954: the other boats involuntarily paused, as before a quick crisis
20955: impossible to withstand, then it was that monomaniac Ahab, furious with
20956: this tantalizing vicinity of his foe, which placed him all alive and
20957: helpless in the very jaws he hated; frenzied with all this, he seized
20958: the long bone with his naked hands, and wildly strove to wrench it from
20959: its gripe. As now he thus vainly strove, the jaw slipped from him; the
20960: frail gunwales bent in, collapsed, and snapped, as both jaws, like an
20961: enormous shears, sliding further aft, bit the craft completely in
20962: twain, and locked themselves fast again in the sea, midway between the
20963: two floating wrecks. These floated aside, the broken ends drooping, the
20964: crew at the stern-wreck clinging to the gunwales, and striving to hold
20965: fast to the oars to lash them across.
20966: 
20967: At that preluding moment, ere the boat was yet snapped, Ahab, the first
20968: to perceive the whale’s intent, by the crafty upraising of his head, a
20969: movement that loosed his hold for the time; at that moment his hand had
20970: made one final effort to push the boat out of the bite. But only
20971: slipping further into the whale’s mouth, and tilting over sideways as
20972: it slipped, the boat had shaken off his hold on the jaw; spilled him
20973: out of it, as he leaned to the push; and so he fell flat-faced upon the
20974: sea.
20975: 
20976: Ripplingly withdrawing from his prey, Moby Dick now lay at a little
20977: distance, vertically thrusting his oblong white head up and down in the
20978: billows; and at the same time slowly revolving his whole spindled body;
20979: so that when his vast wrinkled forehead rose—some twenty or more feet
20980: out of the water—the now rising swells, with all their confluent waves,
20981: dazzlingly broke against it; vindictively tossing their shivered spray
20982: still higher into the air.* So, in a gale, the but half baffled Channel
20983: billows only recoil from the base of the Eddystone, triumphantly to
20984: overleap its summit with their scud.
20985: 
20986: *This motion is peculiar to the sperm whale. It receives its
20987: designation (pitchpoling) from its being likened to that preliminary
20988: up-and-down poise of the whale-lance, in the exercise called
20989: pitchpoling, previously described. By this motion the whale must best
20990: and most comprehensively view whatever objects may be encircling him.
20991: 
20992: But soon resuming his horizontal attitude, Moby Dick swam swiftly round
20993: and round the wrecked crew; sideways churning the water in his vengeful
20994: wake, as if lashing himself up to still another and more deadly
20995: assault. The sight of the splintered boat seemed to madden him, as the
20996: blood of grapes and mulberries cast before Antiochus’s elephants in the
20997: book of Maccabees. Meanwhile Ahab half smothered in the foam of the
20998: whale’s insolent tail, and too much of a cripple to swim,—though he
20999: could still keep afloat, even in the heart of such a whirlpool as that;
21000: helpless Ahab’s head was seen, like a tossed bubble which the least
21001: chance shock might burst. From the boat’s fragmentary stern, Fedallah
21002: incuriously and mildly eyed him; the clinging crew, at the other
21003: drifting end, could not succor him; more than enough was it for them to
21004: look to themselves. For so revolvingly appalling was the White Whale’s
21005: aspect, and so planetarily swift the ever-contracting circles he made,
21006: that he seemed horizontally swooping upon them. And though the other
21007: boats, unharmed, still hovered hard by; still they dared not pull into
21008: the eddy to strike, lest that should be the signal for the instant
21009: destruction of the jeopardized castaways, Ahab and all; nor in that
21010: case could they themselves hope to escape. With straining eyes, then,
21011: they remained on the outer edge of the direful zone, whose centre had
21012: now become the old man’s head.
21013: 
21014: Meantime, from the beginning all this had been descried from the ship’s
21015: mast heads; and squaring her yards, she had borne down upon the scene;
21016: and was now so nigh, that Ahab in the water hailed her!—“Sail on
21017: the”—but that moment a breaking sea dashed on him from Moby Dick, and
21018: whelmed him for the time. But struggling out of it again, and chancing
21019: to rise on a towering crest, he shouted,—“Sail on the whale!—Drive him
21020: off!”
21021: 
21022: The Pequod’s prows were pointed; and breaking up the charmed circle,
21023: she effectually parted the white whale from his victim. As he sullenly
21024: swam off, the boats flew to the rescue.
21025: 
21026: Dragged into Stubb’s boat with blood-shot, blinded eyes, the white
21027: brine caking in his wrinkles; the long tension of Ahab’s bodily
21028: strength did crack, and helplessly he yielded to his body’s doom: for a
21029: time, lying all crushed in the bottom of Stubb’s boat, like one trodden
21030: under foot of herds of elephants. Far inland, nameless wails came from
21031: him, as desolate sounds from out ravines.
21032: 
21033: But this intensity of his physical prostration did but so much the more
21034: abbreviate it. In an instant’s compass, great hearts sometimes condense
21035: to one deep pang, the sum total of those shallow pains kindly diffused
21036: through feebler men’s whole lives. And so, such hearts, though summary
21037: in each one suffering; still, if the gods decree it, in their life-time
21038: aggregate a whole age of woe, wholly made up of instantaneous
21039: intensities; for even in their pointless centres, those noble natures
21040: contain the entire circumferences of inferior souls.
21041: 
21042: “The harpoon,” said Ahab, half way rising, and draggingly leaning on
21043: one bended arm—“is it safe?”
21044: 
21045: “Aye, sir, for it was not darted; this is it,” said Stubb, showing it.
21046: 
21047: “Lay it before me;—any missing men?”
21048: 
21049: “One, two, three, four, five;—there were five oars, sir, and here are
21050: five men.”
21051: 
21052: “That’s good.—Help me, man; I wish to stand. So, so, I see him! there!
21053: there! going to leeward still; what a leaping spout!—Hands off from me!
21054: The eternal sap runs up in Ahab’s bones again! Set the sail; out oars;
21055: the helm!”
21056: 
21057: It is often the case that when a boat is stove, its crew, being picked
21058: up by another boat, help to work that second boat; and the chase is
21059: thus continued with what is called double-banked oars. It was thus now.
21060: But the added power of the boat did not equal the added power of the
21061: whale, for he seemed to have treble-banked his every fin; swimming with
21062: a velocity which plainly showed, that if now, under these
21063: circumstances, pushed on, the chase would prove an indefinitely
21064: prolonged, if not a hopeless one; nor could any crew endure for so long
21065: a period, such an unintermitted, intense straining at the oar; a thing
21066: barely tolerable only in some one brief vicissitude. The ship itself,
21067: then, as it sometimes happens, offered the most promising intermediate
21068: means of overtaking the chase. Accordingly, the boats now made for her,
21069: and were soon swayed up to their cranes—the two parts of the wrecked
21070: boat having been previously secured by her—and then hoisting everything
21071: to her side, and stacking her canvas high up, and sideways
21072: outstretching it with stun-sails, like the double-jointed wings of an
21073: albatross; the Pequod bore down in the leeward wake of Moby-Dick. At
21074: the well known, methodic intervals, the whale’s glittering spout was
21075: regularly announced from the manned mast-heads; and when he would be
21076: reported as just gone down, Ahab would take the time, and then pacing
21077: the deck, binnacle-watch in hand, so soon as the last second of the
21078: allotted hour expired, his voice was heard.—“Whose is the doubloon now?
21079: D’ye see him?” and if the reply was, No, sir! straightway he commanded
21080: them to lift him to his perch. In this way the day wore on; Ahab, now
21081: aloft and motionless; anon, unrestingly pacing the planks.
21082: 
21083: As he was thus walking, uttering no sound, except to hail the men
21084: aloft, or to bid them hoist a sail still higher, or to spread one to a
21085: still greater breadth—thus to and fro pacing, beneath his slouched hat,
21086: at every turn he passed his own wrecked boat, which had been dropped
21087: upon the quarter-deck, and lay there reversed; broken bow to shattered
21088: stern. At last he paused before it; and as in an already over-clouded
21089: sky fresh troops of clouds will sometimes sail across, so over the old
21090: man’s face there now stole some such added gloom as this.
21091: 
21092: Stubb saw him pause; and perhaps intending, not vainly, though, to
21093: evince his own unabated fortitude, and thus keep up a valiant place in
21094: his Captain’s mind, he advanced, and eyeing the wreck exclaimed—“The
21095: thistle the ass refused; it pricked his mouth too keenly, sir; ha! ha!”
21096: 
21097: “What soulless thing is this that laughs before a wreck? Man, man! did
21098: I not know thee brave as fearless fire (and as mechanical) I could
21099: swear thou wert a poltroon. Groan nor laugh should be heard before a
21100: wreck.”
21101: 
21102: “Aye, sir,” said Starbuck drawing near, “’tis a solemn sight; an omen,
21103: and an ill one.”
21104: 
21105: “Omen? omen?—the dictionary! If the gods think to speak outright to
21106: man, they will honorably speak outright; not shake their heads, and
21107: give an old wives’ darkling hint.—Begone! Ye two are the opposite poles
21108: of one thing; Starbuck is Stubb reversed, and Stubb is Starbuck; and ye
21109: two are all mankind; and Ahab stands alone among the millions of the
21110: peopled earth, nor gods nor men his neighbors! Cold, cold—I shiver!—How
21111: now? Aloft there! D’ye see him? Sing out for every spout, though he
21112: spout ten times a second!”
21113: 
21114: The day was nearly done; only the hem of his golden robe was rustling.
21115: Soon, it was almost dark, but the look-out men still remained unset.
21116: 
21117: “Can’t see the spout now, sir;—too dark”—cried a voice from the air.
21118: 
21119: “How heading when last seen?”
21120: 
21121: “As before, sir,—straight to leeward.”
21122: 
21123: “Good! he will travel slower now ’tis night. Down royals and
21124: top-gallant stun-sails, Mr. Starbuck. We must not run over him before
21125: morning; he’s making a passage now, and may heave-to a while. Helm
21126: there! keep her full before the wind!—Aloft! come down!—Mr. Stubb, send
21127: a fresh hand to the fore-mast head, and see it manned till
21128: morning.”—Then advancing towards the doubloon in the main-mast—“Men,
21129: this gold is mine, for I earned it; but I shall let it abide here till
21130: the White Whale is dead; and then, whosoever of ye first raises him,
21131: upon the day he shall be killed, this gold is that man’s; and if on
21132: that day I shall again raise him, then, ten times its sum shall be
21133: divided among all of ye! Away now!—the deck is thine, sir!”
21134: 
21135: And so saying, he placed himself half way within the scuttle, and
21136: slouching his hat, stood there till dawn, except when at intervals
21137: rousing himself to see how the night wore on.
21138: 
21139: 
21140: CHAPTER 134. The Chase—Second Day.
21141: 
21142: At day-break, the three mast-heads were punctually manned afresh.
21143: 
21144: “D’ye see him?” cried Ahab after allowing a little space for the light
21145: to spread.
21146: 
21147: “See nothing, sir.”
21148: 
21149: “Turn up all hands and make sail! he travels faster than I thought
21150: for;—the top-gallant sails!—aye, they should have been kept on her all
21151: night. But no matter—’tis but resting for the rush.”
21152: 
21153: Here be it said, that this pertinacious pursuit of one particular
21154: whale, continued through day into night, and through night into day, is
21155: a thing by no means unprecedented in the South sea fishery. For such is
21156: the wonderful skill, prescience of experience, and invincible
21157: confidence acquired by some great natural geniuses among the Nantucket
21158: commanders; that from the simple observation of a whale when last
21159: descried, they will, under certain given circumstances, pretty
21160: accurately foretell both the direction in which he will continue to
21161: swim for a time, while out of sight, as well as his probable rate of
21162: progression during that period. And, in these cases, somewhat as a
21163: pilot, when about losing sight of a coast, whose general trending he
21164: well knows, and which he desires shortly to return to again, but at
21165: some further point; like as this pilot stands by his compass, and takes
21166: the precise bearing of the cape at present visible, in order the more
21167: certainly to hit aright the remote, unseen headland, eventually to be
21168: visited: so does the fisherman, at his compass, with the whale; for
21169: after being chased, and diligently marked, through several hours of
21170: daylight, then, when night obscures the fish, the creature’s future
21171: wake through the darkness is almost as established to the sagacious
21172: mind of the hunter, as the pilot’s coast is to him. So that to this
21173: hunter’s wondrous skill, the proverbial evanescence of a thing writ in
21174: water, a wake, is to all desired purposes well nigh as reliable as the
21175: steadfast land. And as the mighty iron Leviathan of the modern railway
21176: is so familiarly known in its every pace, that, with watches in their
21177: hands, men time his rate as doctors that of a baby’s pulse; and lightly
21178: say of it, the up train or the down train will reach such or such a
21179: spot, at such or such an hour; even so, almost, there are occasions
21180: when these Nantucketers time that other Leviathan of the deep,
21181: according to the observed humor of his speed; and say to themselves, so
21182: many hours hence this whale will have gone two hundred miles, will have
21183: about reached this or that degree of latitude or longitude. But to
21184: render this acuteness at all successful in the end, the wind and the
21185: sea must be the whaleman’s allies; for of what present avail to the
21186: becalmed or windbound mariner is the skill that assures him he is
21187: exactly ninety-three leagues and a quarter from his port? Inferable
21188: from these statements, are many collateral subtile matters touching the
21189: chase of whales.
21190: 
21191: The ship tore on; leaving such a furrow in the sea as when a
21192: cannon-ball, missent, becomes a plough-share and turns up the level
21193: field.
21194: 
21195: “By salt and hemp!” cried Stubb, “but this swift motion of the deck
21196: creeps up one’s legs and tingles at the heart. This ship and I are two
21197: brave fellows!—Ha, ha! Some one take me up, and launch me, spine-wise,
21198: on the sea,—for by live-oaks! my spine’s a keel. Ha, ha! we go the gait
21199: that leaves no dust behind!”
21200: 
21201: “There she blows—she blows!—she blows!—right ahead!” was now the
21202: mast-head cry.
21203: 
21204: “Aye, aye!” cried Stubb, “I knew it—ye can’t escape—blow on and split
21205: your spout, O whale! the mad fiend himself is after ye! blow your
21206: trump—blister your lungs!—Ahab will dam off your blood, as a miller
21207: shuts his watergate upon the stream!”
21208: 
21209: And Stubb did but speak out for well nigh all that crew. The frenzies
21210: of the chase had by this time worked them bubblingly up, like old wine
21211: worked anew. Whatever pale fears and forebodings some of them might
21212: have felt before; these were not only now kept out of sight through the
21213: growing awe of Ahab, but they were broken up, and on all sides routed,
21214: as timid prairie hares that scatter before the bounding bison. The hand
21215: of Fate had snatched all their souls; and by the stirring perils of the
21216: previous day; the rack of the past night’s suspense; the fixed,
21217: unfearing, blind, reckless way in which their wild craft went plunging
21218: towards its flying mark; by all these things, their hearts were bowled
21219: along. The wind that made great bellies of their sails, and rushed the
21220: vessel on by arms invisible as irresistible; this seemed the symbol of
21221: that unseen agency which so enslaved them to the race.
21222: 
21223: They were one man, not thirty. For as the one ship that held them all;
21224: though it was put together of all contrasting things—oak, and maple,
21225: and pine wood; iron, and pitch, and hemp—yet all these ran into each
21226: other in the one concrete hull, which shot on its way, both balanced
21227: and directed by the long central keel; even so, all the individualities
21228: of the crew, this man’s valor, that man’s fear; guilt and guiltiness,
21229: all varieties were welded into oneness, and were all directed to that
21230: fatal goal which Ahab their one lord and keel did point to.
21231: 
21232: The rigging lived. The mast-heads, like the tops of tall palms, were
21233: outspreadingly tufted with arms and legs. Clinging to a spar with one
21234: hand, some reached forth the other with impatient wavings; others,
21235: shading their eyes from the vivid sunlight, sat far out on the rocking
21236: yards; all the spars in full bearing of mortals, ready and ripe for
21237: their fate. Ah! how they still strove through that infinite blueness to
21238: seek out the thing that might destroy them!
21239: 
21240: “Why sing ye not out for him, if ye see him?” cried Ahab, when, after
21241: the lapse of some minutes since the first cry, no more had been heard.
21242: “Sway me up, men; ye have been deceived; not Moby Dick casts one odd
21243: jet that way, and then disappears.”
21244: 
21245: It was even so; in their headlong eagerness, the men had mistaken some
21246: other thing for the whale-spout, as the event itself soon proved; for
21247: hardly had Ahab reached his perch; hardly was the rope belayed to its
21248: pin on deck, when he struck the key-note to an orchestra, that made the
21249: air vibrate as with the combined discharges of rifles. The triumphant
21250: halloo of thirty buckskin lungs was heard, as—much nearer to the ship
21251: than the place of the imaginary jet, less than a mile ahead—Moby Dick
21252: bodily burst into view! For not by any calm and indolent spoutings; not
21253: by the peaceable gush of that mystic fountain in his head, did the
21254: White Whale now reveal his vicinity; but by the far more wondrous
21255: phenomenon of breaching. Rising with his utmost velocity from the
21256: furthest depths, the Sperm Whale thus booms his entire bulk into the
21257: pure element of air, and piling up a mountain of dazzling foam, shows
21258: his place to the distance of seven miles and more. In those moments,
21259: the torn, enraged waves he shakes off, seem his mane; in some cases,
21260: this breaching is his act of defiance.
21261: 
21262: “There she breaches! there she breaches!” was the cry, as in his
21263: immeasurable bravadoes the White Whale tossed himself salmon-like to
21264: Heaven. So suddenly seen in the blue plain of the sea, and relieved
21265: against the still bluer margin of the sky, the spray that he raised,
21266: for the moment, intolerably glittered and glared like a glacier; and
21267: stood there gradually fading and fading away from its first sparkling
21268: intensity, to the dim mistiness of an advancing shower in a vale.
21269: 
21270: “Aye, breach your last to the sun, Moby Dick!” cried Ahab, “thy hour
21271: and thy harpoon are at hand!—Down! down all of ye, but one man at the
21272: fore. The boats!—stand by!”
21273: 
21274: Unmindful of the tedious rope-ladders of the shrouds, the men, like
21275: shooting stars, slid to the deck, by the isolated backstays and
21276: halyards; while Ahab, less dartingly, but still rapidly was dropped
21277: from his perch.
21278: 
21279: “Lower away,” he cried, so soon as he had reached his boat—a spare one,
21280: rigged the afternoon previous. “Mr. Starbuck, the ship is thine—keep
21281: away from the boats, but keep near them. Lower, all!”
21282: 
21283: As if to strike a quick terror into them, by this time being the first
21284: assailant himself, Moby Dick had turned, and was now coming for the
21285: three crews. Ahab’s boat was central; and cheering his men, he told
21286: them he would take the whale head-and-head,—that is, pull straight up
21287: to his forehead,—a not uncommon thing; for when within a certain limit,
21288: such a course excludes the coming onset from the whale’s sidelong
21289: vision. But ere that close limit was gained, and while yet all three
21290: boats were plain as the ship’s three masts to his eye; the White Whale
21291: churning himself into furious speed, almost in an instant as it were,
21292: rushing among the boats with open jaws, and a lashing tail, offered
21293: appalling battle on every side; and heedless of the irons darted at him
21294: from every boat, seemed only intent on annihilating each separate plank
21295: of which those boats were made. But skilfully manœuvred, incessantly
21296: wheeling like trained chargers in the field; the boats for a while
21297: eluded him; though, at times, but by a plank’s breadth; while all the
21298: time, Ahab’s unearthly slogan tore every other cry but his to shreds.
21299: 
21300: But at last in his untraceable evolutions, the White Whale so crossed
21301: and recrossed, and in a thousand ways entangled the slack of the three
21302: lines now fast to him, that they foreshortened, and, of themselves,
21303: warped the devoted boats towards the planted irons in him; though now
21304: for a moment the whale drew aside a little, as if to rally for a more
21305: tremendous charge. Seizing that opportunity, Ahab first paid out more
21306: line: and then was rapidly hauling and jerking in upon it again—hoping
21307: that way to disencumber it of some snarls—when lo!—a sight more savage
21308: than the embattled teeth of sharks!
21309: 
21310: Caught and twisted—corkscrewed in the mazes of the line, loose harpoons
21311: and lances, with all their bristling barbs and points, came flashing
21312: and dripping up to the chocks in the bows of Ahab’s boat. Only one
21313: thing could be done. Seizing the boat-knife, he critically reached
21314: within—through—and then, without—the rays of steel; dragged in the line
21315: beyond, passed it, inboard, to the bowsman, and then, twice sundering
21316: the rope near the chocks—dropped the intercepted fagot of steel into
21317: the sea; and was all fast again. That instant, the White Whale made a
21318: sudden rush among the remaining tangles of the other lines; by so
21319: doing, irresistibly dragged the more involved boats of Stubb and Flask
21320: towards his flukes; dashed them together like two rolling husks on a
21321: surf-beaten beach, and then, diving down into the sea, disappeared in a
21322: boiling maelstrom, in which, for a space, the odorous cedar chips of
21323: the wrecks danced round and round, like the grated nutmeg in a swiftly
21324: stirred bowl of punch.
21325: 
21326: While the two crews were yet circling in the waters, reaching out after
21327: the revolving line-tubs, oars, and other floating furniture, while
21328: aslope little Flask bobbed up and down like an empty vial, twitching
21329: his legs upwards to escape the dreaded jaws of sharks; and Stubb was
21330: lustily singing out for some one to ladle him up; and while the old
21331: man’s line—now parting—admitted of his pulling into the creamy pool to
21332: rescue whom he could;—in that wild simultaneousness of a thousand
21333: concreted perils,—Ahab’s yet unstricken boat seemed drawn up towards
21334: Heaven by invisible wires,—as, arrow-like, shooting perpendicularly
21335: from the sea, the White Whale dashed his broad forehead against its
21336: bottom, and sent it, turning over and over, into the air; till it fell
21337: again—gunwale downwards—and Ahab and his men struggled out from under
21338: it, like seals from a sea-side cave.
21339: 
21340: The first uprising momentum of the whale—modifying its direction as he
21341: struck the surface—involuntarily launched him along it, to a little
21342: distance from the centre of the destruction he had made; and with his
21343: back to it, he now lay for a moment slowly feeling with his flukes from
21344: side to side; and whenever a stray oar, bit of plank, the least chip or
21345: crumb of the boats touched his skin, his tail swiftly drew back, and
21346: came sideways smiting the sea. But soon, as if satisfied that his work
21347: for that time was done, he pushed his pleated forehead through the
21348: ocean, and trailing after him the intertangled lines, continued his
21349: leeward way at a traveller’s methodic pace.
21350: 
21351: As before, the attentive ship having descried the whole fight, again
21352: came bearing down to the rescue, and dropping a boat, picked up the
21353: floating mariners, tubs, oars, and whatever else could be caught at,
21354: and safely landed them on her decks. Some sprained shoulders, wrists,
21355: and ankles; livid contusions; wrenched harpoons and lances;
21356: inextricable intricacies of rope; shattered oars and planks; all these
21357: were there; but no fatal or even serious ill seemed to have befallen
21358: any one. As with Fedallah the day before, so Ahab was now found grimly
21359: clinging to his boat’s broken half, which afforded a comparatively easy
21360: float; nor did it so exhaust him as the previous day’s mishap.
21361: 
21362: But when he was helped to the deck, all eyes were fastened upon him; as
21363: instead of standing by himself he still half-hung upon the shoulder of
21364: Starbuck, who had thus far been the foremost to assist him. His ivory
21365: leg had been snapped off, leaving but one short sharp splinter.
21366: 
21367: “Aye, aye, Starbuck, ’tis sweet to lean sometimes, be the leaner who he
21368: will; and would old Ahab had leaned oftener than he has.”
21369: 
21370: “The ferrule has not stood, sir,” said the carpenter, now coming up; “I
21371: put good work into that leg.”
21372: 
21373: “But no bones broken, sir, I hope,” said Stubb with true concern.
21374: 
21375: “Aye! and all splintered to pieces, Stubb!—d’ye see it.—But even with a
21376: broken bone, old Ahab is untouched; and I account no living bone of
21377: mine one jot more me, than this dead one that’s lost. Nor white whale,
21378: nor man, nor fiend, can so much as graze old Ahab in his own proper and
21379: inaccessible being. Can any lead touch yonder floor, any mast scrape
21380: yonder roof?—Aloft there! which way?”
21381: 
21382: “Dead to leeward, sir.”
21383: 
21384: “Up helm, then; pile on the sail again, ship keepers! down the rest of
21385: the spare boats and rig them—Mr. Starbuck away, and muster the boat’s
21386: crews.”
21387: 
21388: “Let me first help thee towards the bulwarks, sir.”
21389: 
21390: “Oh, oh, oh! how this splinter gores me now! Accursed fate! that the
21391: unconquerable captain in the soul should have such a craven mate!”
21392: 
21393: “Sir?”
21394: 
21395: “My body, man, not thee. Give me something for a cane—there, that
21396: shivered lance will do. Muster the men. Surely I have not seen him yet.
21397: By heaven it cannot be!—missing?—quick! call them all.”
21398: 
21399: The old man’s hinted thought was true. Upon mustering the company, the
21400: Parsee was not there.
21401: 
21402: “The Parsee!” cried Stubb—“he must have been caught in——”
21403: 
21404: “The black vomit wrench thee!—run all of ye above, alow, cabin,
21405: forecastle—find him—not gone—not gone!”
21406: 
21407: But quickly they returned to him with the tidings that the Parsee was
21408: nowhere to be found.
21409: 
21410: “Aye, sir,” said Stubb—“caught among the tangles of your line—I thought
21411: I saw him dragging under.”
21412: 
21413: “_My_ line! _my_ line? Gone?—gone? What means that little word?—What
21414: death-knell rings in it, that old Ahab shakes as if he were the belfry.
21415: The harpoon, too!—toss over the litter there,—d’ye see it?—the forged
21416: iron, men, the white whale’s—no, no, no,—blistered fool! this hand did
21417: dart it!—’tis in the fish!—Aloft there! Keep him nailed—Quick!—all
21418: hands to the rigging of the boats—collect the oars—harpooneers! the
21419: irons, the irons!—hoist the royals higher—a pull on all the
21420: sheets!—helm there! steady, steady for your life! I’ll ten times girdle
21421: the unmeasured globe; yea and dive straight through it, but I’ll slay
21422: him yet!”
21423: 
21424: “Great God! but for one single instant show thyself,” cried Starbuck;
21425: “never, never wilt thou capture him, old man—In Jesus’ name no more of
21426: this, that’s worse than devil’s madness. Two days chased; twice stove
21427: to splinters; thy very leg once more snatched from under thee; thy evil
21428: shadow gone—all good angels mobbing thee with warnings:—what more
21429: wouldst thou have?—Shall we keep chasing this murderous fish till he
21430: swamps the last man? Shall we be dragged by him to the bottom of the
21431: sea? Shall we be towed by him to the infernal world? Oh, oh,—Impiety
21432: and blasphemy to hunt him more!”
21433: 
21434: “Starbuck, of late I’ve felt strangely moved to thee; ever since that
21435: hour we both saw—thou know’st what, in one another’s eyes. But in this
21436: matter of the whale, be the front of thy face to me as the palm of this
21437: hand—a lipless, unfeatured blank. Ahab is for ever Ahab, man. This
21438: whole act’s immutably decreed. ’Twas rehearsed by thee and me a billion
21439: years before this ocean rolled. Fool! I am the Fates’ lieutenant; I act
21440: under orders. Look thou, underling! that thou obeyest mine.—Stand round
21441: me, men. Ye see an old man cut down to the stump; leaning on a shivered
21442: lance; propped up on a lonely foot. ’Tis Ahab—his body’s part; but
21443: Ahab’s soul’s a centipede, that moves upon a hundred legs. I feel
21444: strained, half stranded, as ropes that tow dismasted frigates in a
21445: gale; and I may look so. But ere I break, ye’ll hear me crack; and till
21446: ye hear _that_, know that Ahab’s hawser tows his purpose yet. Believe
21447: ye, men, in the things called omens? Then laugh aloud, and cry encore!
21448: For ere they drown, drowning things will twice rise to the surface;
21449: then rise again, to sink for evermore. So with Moby Dick—two days he’s
21450: floated—tomorrow will be the third. Aye, men, he’ll rise once more,—but
21451: only to spout his last! D’ye feel brave men, brave?”
21452: 
21453: “As fearless fire,” cried Stubb.
21454: 
21455: “And as mechanical,” muttered Ahab. Then as the men went forward, he
21456: muttered on: “The things called omens! And yesterday I talked the same
21457: to Starbuck there, concerning my broken boat. Oh! how valiantly I seek
21458: to drive out of others’ hearts what’s clinched so fast in mine!—The
21459: Parsee—the Parsee!—gone, gone? and he was to go before:—but still was
21460: to be seen again ere I could perish—How’s that?—There’s a riddle now
21461: might baffle all the lawyers backed by the ghosts of the whole line of
21462: judges:—like a hawk’s beak it pecks my brain. _I’ll_, _I’ll_ solve it,
21463: though!”
21464: 
21465: When dusk descended, the whale was still in sight to leeward.
21466: 
21467: So once more the sail was shortened, and everything passed nearly as on
21468: the previous night; only, the sound of hammers, and the hum of the
21469: grindstone was heard till nearly daylight, as the men toiled by
21470: lanterns in the complete and careful rigging of the spare boats and
21471: sharpening their fresh weapons for the morrow. Meantime, of the broken
21472: keel of Ahab’s wrecked craft the carpenter made him another leg; while
21473: still as on the night before, slouched Ahab stood fixed within his
21474: scuttle; his hid, heliotrope glance anticipatingly gone backward on its
21475: dial; sat due eastward for the earliest sun.
21476: 
21477: 
21478: CHAPTER 135. The Chase.—Third Day.
21479: 
21480: The morning of the third day dawned fair and fresh, and once more the
21481: solitary night-man at the fore-mast-head was relieved by crowds of the
21482: daylight look-outs, who dotted every mast and almost every spar.
21483: 
21484: “D’ye see him?” cried Ahab; but the whale was not yet in sight.
21485: 
21486: “In his infallible wake, though; but follow that wake, that’s all. Helm
21487: there; steady, as thou goest, and hast been going. What a lovely day
21488: again! were it a new-made world, and made for a summer-house to the
21489: angels, and this morning the first of its throwing open to them, a
21490: fairer day could not dawn upon that world. Here’s food for thought, had
21491: Ahab time to think; but Ahab never thinks; he only feels, feels, feels;
21492: _that’s_ tingling enough for mortal man! to think’s audacity. God only
21493: has that right and privilege. Thinking is, or ought to be, a coolness
21494: and a calmness; and our poor hearts throb, and our poor brains beat too
21495: much for that. And yet, I’ve sometimes thought my brain was very
21496: calm—frozen calm, this old skull cracks so, like a glass in which the
21497: contents turned to ice, and shiver it. And still this hair is growing
21498: now; this moment growing, and heat must breed it; but no, it’s like
21499: that sort of common grass that will grow anywhere, between the earthy
21500: clefts of Greenland ice or in Vesuvius lava. How the wild winds blow
21501: it; they whip it about me as the torn shreds of split sails lash the
21502: tossed ship they cling to. A vile wind that has no doubt blown ere this
21503: through prison corridors and cells, and wards of hospitals, and
21504: ventilated them, and now comes blowing hither as innocent as fleeces.
21505: Out upon it!—it’s tainted. Were I the wind, I’d blow no more on such a
21506: wicked, miserable world. I’d crawl somewhere to a cave, and slink
21507: there. And yet, ’tis a noble and heroic thing, the wind! who ever
21508: conquered it? In every fight it has the last and bitterest blow. Run
21509: tilting at it, and you but run through it. Ha! a coward wind that
21510: strikes stark naked men, but will not stand to receive a single blow.
21511: Even Ahab is a braver thing—a nobler thing than _that_. Would now the
21512: wind but had a body; but all the things that most exasperate and
21513: outrage mortal man, all these things are bodiless, but only bodiless as
21514: objects, not as agents. There’s a most special, a most cunning, oh, a
21515: most malicious difference! And yet, I say again, and swear it now, that
21516: there’s something all glorious and gracious in the wind. These warm
21517: Trade Winds, at least, that in the clear heavens blow straight on, in
21518: strong and steadfast, vigorous mildness; and veer not from their mark,
21519: however the baser currents of the sea may turn and tack, and mightiest
21520: Mississippies of the land swift and swerve about, uncertain where to go
21521: at last. And by the eternal Poles! these same Trades that so directly
21522: blow my good ship on; these Trades, or something like them—something so
21523: unchangeable, and full as strong, blow my keeled soul along! To it!
21524: Aloft there! What d’ye see?”
21525: 
21526: “Nothing, sir.”
21527: 
21528: “Nothing! and noon at hand! The doubloon goes a-begging! See the sun!
21529: Aye, aye, it must be so. I’ve oversailed him. How, got the start? Aye,
21530: he’s chasing _me_ now; not I, _him_—that’s bad; I might have known it,
21531: too. Fool! the lines—the harpoons he’s towing. Aye, aye, I have run him
21532: by last night. About! about! Come down, all of ye, but the regular look
21533: outs! Man the braces!”
21534: 
21535: Steering as she had done, the wind had been somewhat on the Pequod’s
21536: quarter, so that now being pointed in the reverse direction, the braced
21537: ship sailed hard upon the breeze as she rechurned the cream in her own
21538: white wake.
21539: 
21540: “Against the wind he now steers for the open jaw,” murmured Starbuck to
21541: himself, as he coiled the new-hauled main-brace upon the rail. “God
21542: keep us, but already my bones feel damp within me, and from the inside
21543: wet my flesh. I misdoubt me that I disobey my God in obeying him!”
21544: 
21545: “Stand by to sway me up!” cried Ahab, advancing to the hempen basket.
21546: “We should meet him soon.”
21547: 
21548: “Aye, aye, sir,” and straightway Starbuck did Ahab’s bidding, and once
21549: more Ahab swung on high.
21550: 
21551: A whole hour now passed; gold-beaten out to ages. Time itself now held
21552: long breaths with keen suspense. But at last, some three points off the
21553: weather bow, Ahab descried the spout again, and instantly from the
21554: three mast-heads three shrieks went up as if the tongues of fire had
21555: voiced it.
21556: 
21557: “Forehead to forehead I meet thee, this third time, Moby Dick! On deck
21558: there!—brace sharper up; crowd her into the wind’s eye. He’s too far
21559: off to lower yet, Mr. Starbuck. The sails shake! Stand over that
21560: helmsman with a top-maul! So, so; he travels fast, and I must down. But
21561: let me have one more good round look aloft here at the sea; there’s
21562: time for that. An old, old sight, and yet somehow so young; aye, and
21563: not changed a wink since I first saw it, a boy, from the sand-hills of
21564: Nantucket! The same!—the same!—the same to Noah as to me. There’s a
21565: soft shower to leeward. Such lovely leewardings! They must lead
21566: somewhere—to something else than common land, more palmy than the
21567: palms. Leeward! the white whale goes that way; look to windward, then;
21568: the better if the bitterer quarter. But good bye, good bye, old
21569: mast-head! What’s this?—green? aye, tiny mosses in these warped cracks.
21570: No such green weather stains on Ahab’s head! There’s the difference now
21571: between man’s old age and matter’s. But aye, old mast, we both grow old
21572: together; sound in our hulls, though, are we not, my ship? Aye, minus a
21573: leg, that’s all. By heaven this dead wood has the better of my live
21574: flesh every way. I can’t compare with it; and I’ve known some ships
21575: made of dead trees outlast the lives of men made of the most vital
21576: stuff of vital fathers. What’s that he said? he should still go before
21577: me, my pilot; and yet to be seen again? But where? Will I have eyes at
21578: the bottom of the sea, supposing I descend those endless stairs? and
21579: all night I’ve been sailing from him, wherever he did sink to. Aye,
21580: aye, like many more thou told’st direful truth as touching thyself, O
21581: Parsee; but, Ahab, there thy shot fell short. Good-bye, mast-head—keep
21582: a good eye upon the whale, the while I’m gone. We’ll talk to-morrow,
21583: nay, to-night, when the white whale lies down there, tied by head and
21584: tail.”
21585: 
21586: He gave the word; and still gazing round him, was steadily lowered
21587: through the cloven blue air to the deck.
21588: 
21589: In due time the boats were lowered; but as standing in his shallop’s
21590: stern, Ahab just hovered upon the point of the descent, he waved to the
21591: mate,—who held one of the tackle-ropes on deck—and bade him pause.
21592: 
21593: “Starbuck!”
21594: 
21595: “Sir?”
21596: 
21597: “For the third time my soul’s ship starts upon this voyage, Starbuck.”
21598: 
21599: “Aye, sir, thou wilt have it so.”
21600: 
21601: “Some ships sail from their ports, and ever afterwards are missing,
21602: Starbuck!”
21603: 
21604: “Truth, sir: saddest truth.”
21605: 
21606: “Some men die at ebb tide; some at low water; some at the full of the
21607: flood;—and I feel now like a billow that’s all one crested comb,
21608: Starbuck. I am old;—shake hands with me, man.”
21609: 
21610: Their hands met; their eyes fastened; Starbuck’s tears the glue.
21611: 
21612: “Oh, my captain, my captain!—noble heart—go not—go not!—see, it’s a
21613: brave man that weeps; how great the agony of the persuasion then!”
21614: 
21615: “Lower away!”—cried Ahab, tossing the mate’s arm from him. “Stand by
21616: the crew!”
21617: 
21618: In an instant the boat was pulling round close under the stern.
21619: 
21620: “The sharks! the sharks!” cried a voice from the low cabin-window
21621: there; “O master, my master, come back!”
21622: 
21623: But Ahab heard nothing; for his own voice was high-lifted then; and the
21624: boat leaped on.
21625: 
21626: Yet the voice spake true; for scarce had he pushed from the ship, when
21627: numbers of sharks, seemingly rising from out the dark waters beneath
21628: the hull, maliciously snapped at the blades of the oars, every time
21629: they dipped in the water; and in this way accompanied the boat with
21630: their bites. It is a thing not uncommonly happening to the whale-boats
21631: in those swarming seas; the sharks at times apparently following them
21632: in the same prescient way that vultures hover over the banners of
21633: marching regiments in the east. But these were the first sharks that
21634: had been observed by the Pequod since the White Whale had been first
21635: descried; and whether it was that Ahab’s crew were all such
21636: tiger-yellow barbarians, and therefore their flesh more musky to the
21637: senses of the sharks—a matter sometimes well known to affect
21638: them,—however it was, they seemed to follow that one boat without
21639: molesting the others.
21640: 
21641: “Heart of wrought steel!” murmured Starbuck gazing over the side, and
21642: following with his eyes the receding boat—“canst thou yet ring boldly
21643: to that sight?—lowering thy keel among ravening sharks, and followed by
21644: them, open-mouthed to the chase; and this the critical third day?—For
21645: when three days flow together in one continuous intense pursuit; be
21646: sure the first is the morning, the second the noon, and the third the
21647: evening and the end of that thing—be that end what it may. Oh! my God!
21648: what is this that shoots through me, and leaves me so deadly calm, yet
21649: expectant,—fixed at the top of a shudder! Future things swim before me,
21650: as in empty outlines and skeletons; all the past is somehow grown dim.
21651: Mary, girl! thou fadest in pale glories behind me; boy! I seem to see
21652: but thy eyes grown wondrous blue. Strangest problems of life seem
21653: clearing; but clouds sweep between—Is my journey’s end coming? My legs
21654: feel faint; like his who has footed it all day. Feel thy heart,—beats
21655: it yet? Stir thyself, Starbuck!—stave it off—move, move! speak
21656: aloud!—Mast-head there! See ye my boy’s hand on the hill?—Crazed;—aloft
21657: there!—keep thy keenest eye upon the boats:—mark well the whale!—Ho!
21658: again!—drive off that hawk! see! he pecks—he tears the vane”—pointing
21659: to the red flag flying at the main-truck—“Ha! he soars away with
21660: it!—Where’s the old man now? see’st thou that sight, oh Ahab!—shudder,
21661: shudder!”
21662: 
21663: The boats had not gone very far, when by a signal from the mast-heads—a
21664: downward pointed arm, Ahab knew that the whale had sounded; but
21665: intending to be near him at the next rising, he held on his way a
21666: little sideways from the vessel; the becharmed crew maintaining the
21667: profoundest silence, as the head-beat waves hammered and hammered
21668: against the opposing bow.
21669: 
21670: “Drive, drive in your nails, oh ye waves! to their uttermost heads
21671: drive them in! ye but strike a thing without a lid; and no coffin and
21672: no hearse can be mine:—and hemp only can kill me! Ha! ha!”
21673: 
21674: Suddenly the waters around them slowly swelled in broad circles; then
21675: quickly upheaved, as if sideways sliding from a submerged berg of ice,
21676: swiftly rising to the surface. A low rumbling sound was heard; a
21677: subterraneous hum; and then all held their breaths; as bedraggled with
21678: trailing ropes, and harpoons, and lances, a vast form shot lengthwise,
21679: but obliquely from the sea. Shrouded in a thin drooping veil of mist,
21680: it hovered for a moment in the rainbowed air; and then fell swamping
21681: back into the deep. Crushed thirty feet upwards, the waters flashed for
21682: an instant like heaps of fountains, then brokenly sank in a shower of
21683: flakes, leaving the circling surface creamed like new milk round the
21684: marble trunk of the whale.
21685: 
21686: “Give way!” cried Ahab to the oarsmen, and the boats darted forward to
21687: the attack; but maddened by yesterday’s fresh irons that corroded in
21688: him, Moby Dick seemed combinedly possessed by all the angels that fell
21689: from heaven. The wide tiers of welded tendons overspreading his broad
21690: white forehead, beneath the transparent skin, looked knitted together;
21691: as head on, he came churning his tail among the boats; and once more
21692: flailed them apart; spilling out the irons and lances from the two
21693: mates’ boats, and dashing in one side of the upper part of their bows,
21694: but leaving Ahab’s almost without a scar.
21695: 
21696: While Daggoo and Queequeg were stopping the strained planks; and as the
21697: whale swimming out from them, turned, and showed one entire flank as he
21698: shot by them again; at that moment a quick cry went up. Lashed round
21699: and round to the fish’s back; pinioned in the turns upon turns in
21700: which, during the past night, the whale had reeled the involutions of
21701: the lines around him, the half torn body of the Parsee was seen; his
21702: sable raiment frayed to shreds; his distended eyes turned full upon old
21703: Ahab.
21704: 
21705: The harpoon dropped from his hand.
21706: 
21707: “Befooled, befooled!”—drawing in a long lean breath—“Aye, Parsee! I see
21708: thee again.—Aye, and thou goest before; and this, _this_ then is the
21709: hearse that thou didst promise. But I hold thee to the last letter of
21710: thy word. Where is the second hearse? Away, mates, to the ship! those
21711: boats are useless now; repair them if ye can in time, and return to me;
