21712: if not, Ahab is enough to die—Down, men! the first thing that but
21713: offers to jump from this boat I stand in, that thing I harpoon. Ye are
21714: not other men, but my arms and my legs; and so obey me.—Where’s the
21715: whale? gone down again?”
21716: 
21717: But he looked too nigh the boat; for as if bent upon escaping with the
21718: corpse he bore, and as if the particular place of the last encounter
21719: had been but a stage in his leeward voyage, Moby Dick was now again
21720: steadily swimming forward; and had almost passed the ship,—which thus
21721: far had been sailing in the contrary direction to him, though for the
21722: present her headway had been stopped. He seemed swimming with his
21723: utmost velocity, and now only intent upon pursuing his own straight
21724: path in the sea.
21725: 
21726: “Oh! Ahab,” cried Starbuck, “not too late is it, even now, the third
21727: day, to desist. See! Moby Dick seeks thee not. It is thou, thou, that
21728: madly seekest him!”
21729: 
21730: Setting sail to the rising wind, the lonely boat was swiftly impelled
21731: to leeward, by both oars and canvas. And at last when Ahab was sliding
21732: by the vessel, so near as plainly to distinguish Starbuck’s face as he
21733: leaned over the rail, he hailed him to turn the vessel about, and
21734: follow him, not too swiftly, at a judicious interval. Glancing upwards,
21735: he saw Tashtego, Queequeg, and Daggoo, eagerly mounting to the three
21736: mast-heads; while the oarsmen were rocking in the two staved boats
21737: which had but just been hoisted to the side, and were busily at work in
21738: repairing them. One after the other, through the port-holes, as he
21739: sped, he also caught flying glimpses of Stubb and Flask, busying
21740: themselves on deck among bundles of new irons and lances. As he saw all
21741: this; as he heard the hammers in the broken boats; far other hammers
21742: seemed driving a nail into his heart. But he rallied. And now marking
21743: that the vane or flag was gone from the main-mast-head, he shouted to
21744: Tashtego, who had just gained that perch, to descend again for another
21745: flag, and a hammer and nails, and so nail it to the mast.
21746: 
21747: Whether fagged by the three days’ running chase, and the resistance to
21748: his swimming in the knotted hamper he bore; or whether it was some
21749: latent deceitfulness and malice in him: whichever was true, the White
21750: Whale’s way now began to abate, as it seemed, from the boat so rapidly
21751: nearing him once more; though indeed the whale’s last start had not
21752: been so long a one as before. And still as Ahab glided over the waves
21753: the unpitying sharks accompanied him; and so pertinaciously stuck to
21754: the boat; and so continually bit at the plying oars, that the blades
21755: became jagged and crunched, and left small splinters in the sea, at
21756: almost every dip.
21757: 
21758: “Heed them not! those teeth but give new rowlocks to your oars. Pull
21759: on! ’tis the better rest, the shark’s jaw than the yielding water.”
21760: 
21761: “But at every bite, sir, the thin blades grow smaller and smaller!”
21762: 
21763: “They will last long enough! pull on!—But who can tell”—he
21764: muttered—“whether these sharks swim to feast on the whale or on
21765: Ahab?—But pull on! Aye, all alive, now—we near him. The helm! take the
21766: helm! let me pass,”—and so saying two of the oarsmen helped him forward
21767: to the bows of the still flying boat.
21768: 
21769: At length as the craft was cast to one side, and ran ranging along with
21770: the White Whale’s flank, he seemed strangely oblivious of its
21771: advance—as the whale sometimes will—and Ahab was fairly within the
21772: smoky mountain mist, which, thrown off from the whale’s spout, curled
21773: round his great, Monadnock hump; he was even thus close to him; when,
21774: with body arched back, and both arms lengthwise high-lifted to the
21775: poise, he darted his fierce iron, and his far fiercer curse into the
21776: hated whale. As both steel and curse sank to the socket, as if sucked
21777: into a morass, Moby Dick sideways writhed; spasmodically rolled his
21778: nigh flank against the bow, and, without staving a hole in it, so
21779: suddenly canted the boat over, that had it not been for the elevated
21780: part of the gunwale to which he then clung, Ahab would once more have
21781: been tossed into the sea. As it was, three of the oarsmen—who foreknew
21782: not the precise instant of the dart, and were therefore unprepared for
21783: its effects—these were flung out; but so fell, that, in an instant two
21784: of them clutched the gunwale again, and rising to its level on a
21785: combing wave, hurled themselves bodily inboard again; the third man
21786: helplessly dropping astern, but still afloat and swimming.
21787: 
21788: Almost simultaneously, with a mighty volition of ungraduated,
21789: instantaneous swiftness, the White Whale darted through the weltering
21790: sea. But when Ahab cried out to the steersman to take new turns with
21791: the line, and hold it so; and commanded the crew to turn round on their
21792: seats, and tow the boat up to the mark; the moment the treacherous line
21793: felt that double strain and tug, it snapped in the empty air!
21794: 
21795: “What breaks in me? Some sinew cracks!—’tis whole again; oars! oars!
21796: Burst in upon him!”
21797: 
21798: Hearing the tremendous rush of the sea-crashing boat, the whale wheeled
21799: round to present his blank forehead at bay; but in that evolution,
21800: catching sight of the nearing black hull of the ship; seemingly seeing
21801: in it the source of all his persecutions; bethinking it—it may be—a
21802: larger and nobler foe; of a sudden, he bore down upon its advancing
21803: prow, smiting his jaws amid fiery showers of foam.
21804: 
21805: Ahab staggered; his hand smote his forehead. “I grow blind; hands!
21806: stretch out before me that I may yet grope my way. Is’t night?”
21807: 
21808: “The whale! The ship!” cried the cringing oarsmen.
21809: 
21810: “Oars! oars! Slope downwards to thy depths, O sea, that ere it be for
21811: ever too late, Ahab may slide this last, last time upon his mark! I
21812: see: the ship! the ship! Dash on, my men! Will ye not save my ship?”
21813: 
21814: But as the oarsmen violently forced their boat through the
21815: sledge-hammering seas, the before whale-smitten bow-ends of two planks
21816: burst through, and in an instant almost, the temporarily disabled boat
21817: lay nearly level with the waves; its half-wading, splashing crew,
21818: trying hard to stop the gap and bale out the pouring water.
21819: 
21820: Meantime, for that one beholding instant, Tashtego’s mast-head hammer
21821: remained suspended in his hand; and the red flag, half-wrapping him as
21822: with a plaid, then streamed itself straight out from him, as his own
21823: forward-flowing heart; while Starbuck and Stubb, standing upon the
21824: bowsprit beneath, caught sight of the down-coming monster just as soon
21825: as he.
21826: 
21827: “The whale, the whale! Up helm, up helm! Oh, all ye sweet powers of
21828: air, now hug me close! Let not Starbuck die, if die he must, in a
21829: woman’s fainting fit. Up helm, I say—ye fools, the jaw! the jaw! Is
21830: this the end of all my bursting prayers? all my life-long fidelities?
21831: Oh, Ahab, Ahab, lo, thy work. Steady! helmsman, steady. Nay, nay! Up
21832: helm again! He turns to meet us! Oh, his unappeasable brow drives on
21833: towards one, whose duty tells him he cannot depart. My God, stand by me
21834: now!”
21835: 
21836: “Stand not by me, but stand under me, whoever you are that will now
21837: help Stubb; for Stubb, too, sticks here. I grin at thee, thou grinning
21838: whale! Who ever helped Stubb, or kept Stubb awake, but Stubb’s own
21839: unwinking eye? And now poor Stubb goes to bed upon a mattrass that is
21840: all too soft; would it were stuffed with brushwood! I grin at thee,
21841: thou grinning whale! Look ye, sun, moon, and stars! I call ye assassins
21842: of as good a fellow as ever spouted up his ghost. For all that, I would
21843: yet ring glasses with ye, would ye but hand the cup! Oh, oh! oh, oh!
21844: thou grinning whale, but there’ll be plenty of gulping soon! Why fly ye
21845: not, O Ahab! For me, off shoes and jacket to it; let Stubb die in his
21846: drawers! A most mouldy and over salted death, though;—cherries!
21847: cherries! cherries! Oh, Flask, for one red cherry ere we die!”
21848: 
21849: “Cherries? I only wish that we were where they grow. Oh, Stubb, I hope
21850: my poor mother’s drawn my part-pay ere this; if not, few coppers will
21851: now come to her, for the voyage is up.”
21852: 
21853: From the ship’s bows, nearly all the seamen now hung inactive; hammers,
21854: bits of plank, lances, and harpoons, mechanically retained in their
21855: hands, just as they had darted from their various employments; all
21856: their enchanted eyes intent upon the whale, which from side to side
21857: strangely vibrating his predestinating head, sent a broad band of
21858: overspreading semicircular foam before him as he rushed. Retribution,
21859: swift vengeance, eternal malice were in his whole aspect, and spite of
21860: all that mortal man could do, the solid white buttress of his forehead
21861: smote the ship’s starboard bow, till men and timbers reeled. Some fell
21862: flat upon their faces. Like dislodged trucks, the heads of the
21863: harpooneers aloft shook on their bull-like necks. Through the breach,
21864: they heard the waters pour, as mountain torrents down a flume.
21865: 
21866: “The ship! The hearse!—the second hearse!” cried Ahab from the boat;
21867: “its wood could only be American!”
21868: 
21869: Diving beneath the settling ship, the whale ran quivering along its
21870: keel; but turning under water, swiftly shot to the surface again, far
21871: off the other bow, but within a few yards of Ahab’s boat, where, for a
21872: time, he lay quiescent.
21873: 
21874: “I turn my body from the sun. What ho, Tashtego! let me hear thy
21875: hammer. Oh! ye three unsurrendered spires of mine; thou uncracked keel;
21876: and only god-bullied hull; thou firm deck, and haughty helm, and
21877: Pole-pointed prow,—death-glorious ship! must ye then perish, and
21878: without me? Am I cut off from the last fond pride of meanest
21879: shipwrecked captains? Oh, lonely death on lonely life! Oh, now I feel
21880: my topmost greatness lies in my topmost grief. Ho, ho! from all your
21881: furthest bounds, pour ye now in, ye bold billows of my whole foregone
21882: life, and top this one piled comber of my death! Towards thee I roll,
21883: thou all-destroying but unconquering whale; to the last I grapple with
21884: thee; from hell’s heart I stab at thee; for hate’s sake I spit my last
21885: breath at thee. Sink all coffins and all hearses to one common pool!
21886: and since neither can be mine, let me then tow to pieces, while still
21887: chasing thee, though tied to thee, thou damned whale! _Thus_, I give up
21888: the spear!”
21889: 
21890: The harpoon was darted; the stricken whale flew forward; with igniting
21891: velocity the line ran through the grooves;—ran foul. Ahab stooped to
21892: clear it; he did clear it; but the flying turn caught him round the
21893: neck, and voicelessly as Turkish mutes bowstring their victim, he was
21894: shot out of the boat, ere the crew knew he was gone. Next instant, the
21895: heavy eye-splice in the rope’s final end flew out of the stark-empty
21896: tub, knocked down an oarsman, and smiting the sea, disappeared in its
21897: depths.
21898: 
21899: For an instant, the tranced boat’s crew stood still; then turned. “The
21900: ship? Great God, where is the ship?” Soon they through dim, bewildering
21901: mediums saw her sidelong fading phantom, as in the gaseous Fata
21902: Morgana; only the uppermost masts out of water; while fixed by
21903: infatuation, or fidelity, or fate, to their once lofty perches, the
21904: pagan harpooneers still maintained their sinking lookouts on the sea.
21905: And now, concentric circles seized the lone boat itself, and all its
21906: crew, and each floating oar, and every lance-pole, and spinning,
21907: animate and inanimate, all round and round in one vortex, carried the
21908: smallest chip of the Pequod out of sight.
21909: 
21910: But as the last whelmings intermixingly poured themselves over the
21911: sunken head of the Indian at the mainmast, leaving a few inches of the
21912: erect spar yet visible, together with long streaming yards of the flag,
21913: which calmly undulated, with ironical coincidings, over the destroying
21914: billows they almost touched;—at that instant, a red arm and a hammer
21915: hovered backwardly uplifted in the open air, in the act of nailing the
21916: flag faster and yet faster to the subsiding spar. A sky-hawk that
21917: tauntingly had followed the main-truck downwards from its natural home
21918: among the stars, pecking at the flag, and incommoding Tashtego there;
21919: this bird now chanced to intercept its broad fluttering wing between
21920: the hammer and the wood; and simultaneously feeling that etherial
21921: thrill, the submerged savage beneath, in his death-gasp, kept his
21922: hammer frozen there; and so the bird of heaven, with archangelic
21923: shrieks, and his imperial beak thrust upwards, and his whole captive
21924: form folded in the flag of Ahab, went down with his ship, which, like
21925: Satan, would not sink to hell till she had dragged a living part of
21926: heaven along with her, and helmeted herself with it.
21927: 
21928: Now small fowls flew screaming over the yet yawning gulf; a sullen
21929: white surf beat against its steep sides; then all collapsed, and the
21930: great shroud of the sea rolled on as it rolled five thousand years ago.
21931: 
21932: 
21933: Epilogue
21934: 
21935: “AND I ONLY AM ESCAPED ALONE TO TELL THEE” Job.
21936: 
21937: The drama’s done. Why then here does any one step forth?—Because one
21938: did survive the wreck.
21939: 
21940: It so chanced, that after the Parsee’s disappearance, I was he whom the
21941: Fates ordained to take the place of Ahab’s bowsman, when that bowsman
21942: assumed the vacant post; the same, who, when on the last day the three
21943: men were tossed from out of the rocking boat, was dropped astern. So,
21944: floating on the margin of the ensuing scene, and in full sight of it,
21945: when the halfspent suction of the sunk ship reached me, I was then, but
21946: slowly, drawn towards the closing vortex. When I reached it, it had
21947: subsided to a creamy pool. Round and round, then, and ever contracting
21948: towards the button-like black bubble at the axis of that slowly
21949: wheeling circle, like another Ixion I did revolve. Till, gaining that
21950: vital centre, the black bubble upward burst; and now, liberated by
21951: reason of its cunning spring, and, owing to its great buoyancy, rising
21952: with great force, the coffin life-buoy shot lengthwise from the sea,
21953: fell over, and floated by my side. Buoyed up by that coffin, for almost
21954: one whole day and night, I floated on a soft and dirgelike main. The
21955: unharming sharks, they glided by as if with padlocks on their mouths;
21956: the savage sea-hawks sailed with sheathed beaks. On the second day, a
21957: sail drew near, nearer, and picked me up at last. It was the
21958: devious-cruising Rachel, that in her retracing search after her missing
21959: children, only found another orphan.
21960: 
21961: 
21962: 
21963:
